text: Juan hosted me and my husband twice. He was so warm and helpfull, always able to share with us. We enjoyed so much your music, your dog, your generosity. Hope to see you again man! In Europe or in South America :)  Goodluck with your studies (including the guitar!)

I was a pleasure to host Flavio : nice guy, friendly and polite. He slept at my home 3 nights, and we had no problems in to reconcile our schedule, resulting in spending some time together; plus, he was very available helping me keeping the House clean. I spent wonderful time with him,  surely would host him again!

Ciao Flavio! I'm writing this in English for a sort of CS standard... even though you and your friends (new & old) spent only a night at my place, we actually spent most of the time together, and that was very nice! I had the feeling of a nice, polite and funny guy who is trying to have fun in what he does, but also to understand what's around. I think our time together flew very well, and you all were flexible enough to accommodate four people in my house (plus me!) and still let the girl have her own room! 
sentiamoci prossimamente per altri concerti interessanti o altre occasioni conviviali! Big hugs!!

Ultimately, Falvio stayed at mine for one night thanks to misunderstandings, a shared lack of communication skills and cosmic coinsedence :) he is a very interesting guy, I have a lot to learn from and on top one can sense his beautiful soul. Though he will make you laugh, he is definitely not funny ;) see you soon!
Responded to my last minuet request within minuets. Was knowledgeable and made a nice pasta. Thanks again Flavio! :)

Fooood. I am sorry, had to write it :) I had a really nice time with Flavio. I had some appointments and he had work over the day, but we spend the evenings together and talked a lot over everything. Flavio is really friendly, uncomplicated and helpful. I recommend him as a host with all my heart.

Flavio was a great host and he has a real CS spirit - happy to share his knowledge, time and home. I did my tourist sightseeing during the day on my own and spend time with Flavio and his brother in the evenings, he even invited me to join for his friend's birthday party at pizzeria so I got to enjoy Italian people company and food. He is very thoughtful and helpful person who will do anything to make you feel comfortable and help you to get around the city and not to miss the highlights it has to offer as he knows a lot of hidden gems.
Thank you and probably see you in Geneva one day!

text: Stanislaw is a great host, I felt like home.   I only had a day in Rome and the rain didn't make me fell in love of the city, but polish know how to make you feel warm only with a smile. Thank Stanislaw, I have a great evening!

Me and my friend Alina had a chance of a lifetime to visit beautiful Rome and this trip would not be so amazing if it wasn't for Stanislaw. That's why we love Couchsurfing, because of such people as he is. We stayed at his place for 3 days and the conditions were great with very kind ad welcoming hospitality. We were feeling comfortable and fun! Thank you very much Stanislaw for sharing your place, great stories, delicious pasta, useful recommendations and the best pizza place! We had so much fun and we wish you all the best in life, be happy and take care of Viktor, he is a precious boy! We would definitely recommend Stanislaw as a host to everyone and we are extremely grateful that we were lucky to be accepted even though it's not easy in Rome. Thanks one more time, take care and all the best!

It s great to see that CS spirit is still alive thanks to people like Stanislaw.
Rome and Italy are a tough place for surfers and we were really like to find his profile.
Kind and helpful and ready to get a beer and provide quality time when he s free.
I am sure his profile will shine soon among CS rome..so be ready for the tons of request my man hehehe
You definetly want to host this guy 100%
Thanks dude and hopefully see you again soon !

Liliana is the perfect couchsurfer!  She is friendly, helpful and is always smiling. She cooked an amazing meal and was very generous. My daughters thought she was great and we hoot to see her in London or Rome again soon!

Liliana was absolutely amazing. From the very beginning to the end, she was more than accommodating. I got picked up and dropped off at my station for my flights. She packed me a sandwich everyday before going to the city, I woke up to coffee and biscuits and had her lovely fur friends to keep company also.

Liliana was able to help me find certain spots I wanted to visit, recommended local restaurants, and helped me figure out my train schedule. I cannot thank Liliana and her wonderful family enough for allowing me to stay with them. Wonderful family. Liliana if you ever need a place to stay in Seattle, I'm your girl. Allow me to return the favor one day.

Liliana is one of those people that I would call an Angel. It's still amazing to realize that there are such good people on this planet. The heart as big as it can be. Thank you Liliana for your great kindness

Liliana loves treating her guests as if they were family. I was lucky enough to be apart of hers for a short while. Her home is beautiful and I especially enjoyed the company of all her pets. She invited me to dinner with her husband and two sons and made sure I knew my way around from Roma Termini to Ciampino, including picking me up at the station. Overall, a very thoughtful and kind host!

My experience with Liliana is the reason why i Joined couch surfing. It's not as easy to find authentic and genuine couch surfers who expect nothing from you but the sheer joy of hosting a stranger and gaining from the experience of sharing stories and cultures and insight.  She picked me up from the airport, how amazing is that! I met her family, who treated me very well. Her pets took a liking to me as well which i found interesting because most people's pets hate me. Haha. 
I hope Liliana comes to Uganda someday so that I can return the favour. It's been my best couch surfing experience so far. 
<3 <3

text: It was the best couchsurfing experience so far! Luana is so lovely, kind, thoughtful and helpful! She even picked us up from the bus station and drove back when we had to leave. She gave us great pieces of advice regarding what to visit and where to shop. She is very energised, positive and generous. I already miss her. Hope to see her again üòä

Emanuele is a super host, he was the precise and perfect person who could make my stay in Rome wonderful, unforgettable!
¬†I was very fortunate to write him to be my host because I do not take me to the typical places that tourists usually go, I explain with a lot of patience about the history of the city and with much passion about what he knows about art.
Emauele is a very intense, fun, interesting, generous person, a little crazy and very energetic. I completely surpassed my expectations. thanks again

If you're looking for a perfect host, you've found one! 
Emanuele was just amazing. He has such a sweet and cozy flat so you can feel yourself freely like at your best friend's home. He's very polite and friendly. After we came to his place, he met us and made breakfast (with Nutella! *_*). Emanuele told us where and how we can go out during the day and in the evening he made us a tour around an old Rome. We've heard a lot of stories about the city and it was very interesting! We were watching an Italian comedy and it also was fun (before I fall asleep, of course :D).
It was one of my best experiences in Couchsurfing and I hope to see you soon in Kyiv, Emanuele!
P. S. You made us the best pasta we've tried in Italy!

Me and my friend stayed at Emanuele's apartment for 3 nights and it was awesome. He is so open-minded and friendly, he gave us very useful tip strips about Rome and we even got small presents. It was unforgettable! He is an amazing guide who can tell you the history of Rome so that you will remember for years to come !He knows so many interesting local places and can tell you something about them all.

So if you want real Rome and great vocation , you  know who to write to!)

Also Gianluigi shared his food with me when I couldn't decide what to order haha, tough decisionsüòÅ i can truly recommend to stay with him.  I hope we'll see each other again in the future.
He is very a nice and fun guy. I didn‚Äôt feel uncomfortable in his house. It was very good experience!

Luigi was a very kind host: he picked us up, cooked for us, gave us good advice, showed us around, introduce us his neighbours...
We felt so comfortable and relaxed with him, and at that moment it was 5 of us and just him!! Such a big patience...
See you soon Luigi!!

:)
Just perfect. Staying in Luigi's home was just perfect. I stayed with a friend for few nights. He's very interesting person with a most hilarious sense of humor. At least for me. He's easy to talk to, friendly and very fun. We spend good time together, we walked a lot around Rome, had conversations about everything, I taught him how to walk backwards,we played table football, ate a lot of pasta and other things (we forgot to eat ice cream that night), played staring in the eyes game, swinging on swings and so on and on. It was more than just a stay, cause he's the person with who you just can't stay and not do anything. 
You're welcome in Vilnius, you know. I think I'm starting to trust you, so you can stay at my home. Of course I would wake you up with some cold water, but you're used to be scared of that. ;)
See you and thank you. üê∏

Gianluigi is the perfect host. He's intelligent, talkative and he makes sure you feel like home as soon as you enter his apartment. His roomates are also quite funny and interesting. 
We had good conversations and his apartment has everything you can need. 

I'm positive I'll see this guy again pretty soon, wish you the best in life Luigi !

My stay with Gianluigi was just great!!! I had such a good time with him!!!

I feel so thanksful to have met him, and I absolutely recomend him to anyone who wants to meet an easygoing Italian boy to spend, for sure, some good time together. 
Gracie mille Gianluigi!!! Ci vediamo presto a Barcelona!!! Hasta pronto! :)

Nazru is such a good soul! I really enjoyed his company a lot. He¬¥s independently, really funny, smart and respectful. I felt comfortable since the first second. I highly recommend Nazru to the community. Travel safe, bro! Hope to see you in forte prenestino or India ;)

People, seriously, if you are lucky and you meet Nazru someday, take a walk with him and together you will change the worldüòÄ Grazie tante per l'esperienza, ci vediamo a Roma e prima o poi in Indiaüòä love youüòÉ

Host, take the chance if Nazru is knocking at your door! Not kidding!:D

Nazru, thanks for the great time dude! Next time Rome or India?:D

This was my first experience as a host and Nazru was the ideal surfer! He's very friendly, we got along great with common interests and enthusiasm about travel, he loves to explore which we did lots of visiting Pienza, Petroio, bagni San fillipo, Montepulciano, and Siena, but is also happy relaxing and taking time to appreciate these places and all their beauty! My first experience as a host and I couldn't wish for a better guest :) Even though Nazru stayed for only one night I can tell he's is a perfect couchsurfer and a great person! text: Nazru was a really considerate and thoughtful person. We had a lot of conversations related to a variety of topics. We did not hanged out together, but we did play FIFA, and he is really good at it. Best of luck for the rest of your Euro trip :-)

I had a great experience meeting this fun loving guy, who is friendly, caring, very thoughtful about the comfort for me regarding the stay.  I spent 4 days which was really amazing and the place I stayed in is very clean and cosy. My trip to Rome was a hit because of Nazru, though it was only one night and I wanted to cover all major touristic places and he made it happen, we walked around the city and chatted continuously. He is very decent, learned and very mature for his age, also he was so punctual and man of his words.

Nazru is not just a great host, but an even greater person. Though he was busy with studies he spend a lot of time with me showing around the city . I also enjoyed every conversation with Nazru. By the time my Roman adventure was done, I can't help but be a little sad because I'd be leaving behind an awesome person who's like a long-time friend and a close brother.

Thanks again, Nazru! Hope to see you soon!

Ruben is a very interesting person and kind host. He took me around the streets of Orvieto by night, sharing countless travel and CS experiences along the way. He hosted me in an apartment underneath his parents' house, which I had all for myself and which was very clean and comfortable. It's just outside Orvieto, in an old town with a very picturesque walk to Orvieto. Ruben picked me up in Orvieto by car, and then took me to the start of the highway so I could hitchhike. In all it was a very pleasant couple of days spent in good company, and I would recommend Ruben to everyone. Good luck with the travels and hope to meet again soon!

He was very welcoming, picked me up from the train station and showed me around the beautiful city of Orvieto. He also offered the entire basement for me to sleep on my own which was nice in his part. He also made tea for me since I caught a cold but I just did not feel comfortable all the time.

Ruben is this kind of people with whom you need to talk , at least, one in your life. He is a treasure himself. Let him be and staying with him will be an amazing experience. 

Thank you so much for doing our 24h in Orvieto really special! 

Hope see you soon!
We had a really  great time with Ruben and his friends! He show us good places in Roma, and going out with us! It was perfect! I really recommaned it

Ruben was my first CS host and it was great. He cooked some pasta for me and gave me some advice and recomendations. He is a friendly guy and a fantastic guitar player. His house was good and comfortable. Only good thing with this experience.

Staying at Ruben was very nice. His localisation is well connected to the city center. We didn‚Äôt spend much time together, but we had time to talk a little bit, and he shown me and my friend how he plays the guitar, which was very nice. I really recommend staying at his place!

Ruben is a great person, very kind, open-minded and very friendly. I enjoyed all the exits we did. He also introduced me to his friends and we had a great day in the park with music played by them. He is a great musician! Even though my English is terrible, he always tried to understand what I was trying to tell him. My days in Rome with him were very special. I recommend it.

Ruben is so nice and friendly! I stayed two nights with him. We went to the concert, talk a lots, drunk beer together. Also he could play guitar very well. I have amazing journey in Rome! Thank you so much man, always welcome you come Taiwan! See you soon:)

Ruben was a great host! He helped me a lot with my plan of doing non touristic strolls. We went to a park and he played the guitar (he is an excelent musician) Also we went for some drinks and we met great people. Ruben's flatmates are very kind too. Definitively I recomend him!

Our stay at Ruben's was really all we had hoped for, an amazing first experience as a guest! He was kind and chill, cooked us a meal and we jammed together. The appartment was nice and clean, nothing to complain about there :)

Ruben was great host. I and my friend stayed 4 nights on him flat. He is very kind person. He always try to help to us. He cooked very delicious foods. I had the chance to stay¬† 2 nights by Ruben in Roma, I totally recommand him! He is a very nice, kind and helpful person, we spent the time cooking italian dishes together (he is a very good cooker), and at the same time he was playing guitar ( also a very good musician!), was really a great experience, and we talked also a lot about everything, life etc, specially after 3 tequilas ;)¬† I really enjoyed my time there ! and his place is very comfortable and nice, I could not expect better :)
Thank you very much for everything, and you are more than welcome in Paris at my place if you want to visit it once again :)

Carmelo is a smart kind boy, a philosopher willing to help you in wha tletever you need, he is a respectful man, we took a walk through the trastevere was very nice, we ate the best tiramisu in the city, we shared some music, definitely if you stay in your apartment you will feel at home, I left Rome missing your house and your company.

Although Carmelo seemed like a nice host, I had an unfortunate incident of being locked in the bathroom for about 15-20min because the lock was broken and despite my panic episode, he replied with, "why would you lock the door if you were alone?" And claimed he couldn't do anything after troubleshooting. 

In addition to this incident, I think there was much miscommunication despite his efforts to create welcoming gestures (walk in the neighborhood, trips to markets, homemade expresso).

I simply felt the couchsurfing experience was awkward and had to trust my intuition. I had brought gifts and treated my host to dinner but every outing proved to me that he was incredibly introverted. I am appreciative for his time and space as I stayed five out of my eight requested days. However, I suggest that he should set a list of expectations and boundaries, as a result from my stay, I hold the perception that he wanted specific female company.

Carmelo is a great host with a kind soul, he is a smart and calm person, his home is impeccable, and the room it's a cutest whit a lovely view and near to the subway station, he helped me with my bad English and we spent time talking about each other. I hope some say  return to Rome and greet him again.

Carmelo is a very quiet and knowledgeable person, He will never judge you, always open at the point of listening to You in any moments, and he will help You and rescue if You need to find home, he's patient and liveable.I suggest staying in his house and enjoy his lifestyle, but not to arrive too late cause in Rome then it's difficult to come back at a certain hours when the metro is closed. I will always remember our evening out to find a perfect gluten free slice of Pizza and his beer , a perfect welcoming introduction to his life. Grazie Carmelo per tanta pazienza, spero di rivederti presto!
Carmelo let me feel home. He gave me good advice about Rome and since I‚Äôm looking for an apartment he helped me as well. He was really nice and welcoming. I‚Äôd definitely recommend him!

Carmelo is a great host with a golden heart. He always reply to my messages promptly. He picked me up at the train station when I arrived and helped me with my heavy luggage. We took a night stroll on the first night and on the second night I had to be at a friend's house for the night and he was very accommodating and allowed me to keep my luggage at his place. We made a really nice dinner together on my last night. I had to leave really early next morning at 5:30AM and he was already up to say goodbyes to me. A kind soul with a compassionate heart. That is Carmelo! You made my stay in Rome an easy and memorable one. Thank you a million times!!

text: Great person and interesting mind ! It was nice to know Alex we have shared good moments: talk about art,   drinking and eating and he is curious about life, so many subjects to talk with him. Very cool guy!

I wish you the best Alex and Martina and hopefully we will see you soon. You will always have a home in Stockholm or whenever destiny will take us..

We had a wonderful stay at Alessio‚Äôs home, he was super friendly and we always felt welcome.  The first night he introduced us to his friends and we had a dinner party with delicious pasta and wine. The rest of our stay he was able to show us the beach in Ostia (which is only a 5 minute walk from his house) and gave great suggestions of  all the best places to visit in the city center of Rome. If you get the chance to stay with Alessio I would totally recommend it!

Alessio is a nice and intelligent person. We had not much time to communicate, but anyway it was very nice to meet that kind person who definitely has a big heart.  Ostia is very cosy and beautiful place. We loved it. It was cool experience!

Staying at Ale's place was the best Couchsurfing experience I had so far. I'm happy that our initial host cancelled and we had to look for another one. Though Alessio was working on the weekdays, we still had a lot of time for nice walks in Ostia (the best place in the whole world) and Rome, enjoyable conversations and delicious drinks. Ale is an intelligent, caring and understanding person with good sense of humour and unforgettable smile! He cooked a perfect risotto for us, showed the beauty of night Rome, told a lot of funny stories and introduced us to lots of his friends. Their home is a real harbor for many friendly people, you'll never feel lonely there. We were supposed to move to another host after 4 nights but Alessio suggested us to stay with him and we didn't regret for a second! The last night was especially beautiful 'cause we spent it at a beach party with live music played by Ale and his friends. I do hope to see you and your super team once again! Ciao!

I had a great CS experience with Michele and Allessio agian. I stayed 5 years ago in there place. When I come to there place I always feel like coming home. I spent a great time wicht them. Michele and Alessio are really great persons.

Alessio and his roommate are very friendly and positive people. We have nice memories after staying with them. They are living by the sea so the views were great. We can confidently recommend them to anyone.

He lives in the same house, Villa Arzilla in Ostia, as the official host that accepted me, Michele. Also was superfriendly and warm since the first moment and helped for planning my visit in Rome. We spent a night drinking wine with his friend and it was awesome, was good to feel that mediterranean connection, I loved hearing their stories and seeing them speak Italian each other was a nice feeling, being inmersed in real and close people, that is exactly the opossite of a dumb tourist trip. The "magic" of Couchsurfing experiences never ceases to amaze me.  Alessio, amigo, me debes una visita por Andaluc√≠a!

text: Francesco was a great host! He was very friendly and made me and my three friends feel comfortable at his place! We had a nice time with him drinking wine and having dinner! We were able to talk about all sorts of topics and had a good laugh! i would definitely recommend staying with Francesco!

Started with Marco picking me up from the station,  to endless eating journey of the day, drinking beer in front of the fruit market, followed with the amazing Roman dinner prepared by Marco,  then with a nobody-had-a-clue movie,  until passing out on the couch with another movie. What possibly can one have another better Rome experience than this. Marco knows exactly where to go for what, with passion and patient. I have been to Rome before but Marco showed me a complete different side of Rome! (Need to try screaming next time xP).  Strongly recommend if this is what you are looking forward!  Grazieeee Tanto!

text: Marco is an amazing Italian guy. He picked me and best friend Marlena from the metro station and gave us a very warm welcome. He showed us the whole Rome, we had a nice pizza together and he cooked for us a delicious real spaghetti carbonara! His apartment is beautiful, chatting with him was a pleasure and he taught us a lot of Italian words! We had a really nice time and we can't wait to see you again Marco! üòä
fromPublicAddressDescription: Witham, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Marco is a really good person, friendly, and he wanted to go out!

I will stay with Marco again! he is very caring and kind! I stopped at him with my girlfriend. Marco was very friendly and helped us in everything. Thank you very much for your kind reception! We are waiting for you to visit Russia! hugs and kisses üòò ‚ô•Ô∏è

Marco is a super host! My travel buddy and I realized we under booked our airbnb by one night, so we looked for couchsurfing hosts last minute. Marco replied promptly and we got so lucky. He picked us up from the metro and made us feel at home. After we were settled in he took us out for some authentic Italian food and then showed us around the city center. He let us check out when we wanted so the next day we stayed most of the day and he even cooked pasta for us! (Still the best pasta I had in Italy). Then to top it all off he drove us to our airbnb which was about an hour in the outskirts. Let me tell you, once we got to our airbnb we absolutely regretted not having couchsurfed the entire time. Marco was so kind, helpful, and informative. I am so grateful, I have nothing but good things to say about him! Anyone would be lucky to be hosted by him üòä

It was s really good couchsurfing experience.  Marco picked us from the metrostation and also dropped us of. We had a really nice time while he showed us some special places. He cooked with us traditional Spaghetti. We enjoyed to hang out with him. We really recommend to stay with Marco!

We spent only one evening and a night at Marco, but it was a great experience. He hosted me and my friend even though we arrived to Rome very late. We had a dinner at a very nice place and he took us to Colosseo at night, so we had a chance to see it without crowds of tourists :) Marco is a good, thoughtful man, he made us feel really good and comfortable at his place. Marco, we look forward to seeing you again! Grazie!

Marco is a great host. Firstly he waited for us on the station where he also droped us off the next morning. He is very friendly, kind, taughtfull and fun. He made sure we had everything and he even cooked us spaghetti. Thanks again for everything and hope to see you again!

Marco was a very good host who made sure I had everything I could need. He picked me up in the station, made me feel like at home in his beautiful apartment and drove me around with his car. We spend a good night out meeting my friends and the next day we went to Vatican which was an amazing visit. He‚Äôs such a sweet and friendly man I‚Äôm very glad I got to meet. Thank you Marco, hope to see you again in Finland one day!

Marco is very nice guy! Despite that we both (I and my friend) was tired, we spend really good time together with him. It was really comfortable and we had a lot to discuss :) Marco, hope to see you in Saint-Petersburg!! üòå
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Marco is an amazing guy. We really enjoyed time with him. He is funny, considerate and helpful. He showed us how prepare some italian meals and offered his nice and clean flat. When he had day off, he showed us some nice place in Rome and took us to the beach. Really thank you!!!!!

Marco was an amazing host! He opened his home for us with such a positive, friendly and extra flexible attitude. He hang out with us as much as he could, showed the city around and cooked amazing spaghetti with his homemade pesto! He‚Äôs really smart, nice and extra fun person who became our friend during such a short time. 
Thank you so much Marco and hope to see you in Vilnius soon!

Marco was literally our savior. He accepted us in very last moment, in spite of the fact he was working at night. He met us at the metro station, cooked a delicious dinner. Also he respects privacy, which is really important.

He was a perfect host !, he even received a friend of mine more the same night, is a very nice person and makes you feel confident, I will always be grateful for everything he gave us (pizza, pasta, accommodation and everything we need) I hope to see you again !
Un abrazo ü§ó grazie mille!

It was the best couchsurfing experience! Marco is the very kind and friendly. Marco was doing everything in order for us to feel as at home. And organized for us the best tour of Rome. Flat is not in the city center, but nevertheless he organized a car and took us to the center so we didnt felt living away from center. Even more - the flat is in calm and nice area.  
One more thing - Marco is a good cook! :) 
Highly reccomand!

Say Yes if you get offered to stay with Marco. Had a really good experience staying here. I arrived late and didn't know exactely what time I would be in Rome who ended up like 1 am, Marco met we when I got there and drove me to his place to sleep. Next day he made me breakfast, toke me to the City where he showed me some popular attraction before we went back to his place where he made me pasta for lunsh before he took me to the City so I could get to my flight and he had to work! He is such a Wonderfull man, easy going, fun, and got some good stories to share. I only had one night and some hours in Rome, and this was such a good experience! Thank you Marco!

Marco is the best host you can imagine. I arrived late at night into the train station and he met me there so I didn't have to navigate in the dark with all my luggage. His apartment is adorable and clean and he is as nice as can be. He showed me the best places in Rome by night and gave me delicious breakfast that included his Aunt's homemade apricot marmelade. His sofa bed is very comfortable and he made me feel very comfortable in his home.

I happened to be the first surfer of Marco and was incredibly lucky to meet him during the holidays. Time with him was my perfect Roma experience! We cooked pasta for lunch, hang out around the city, visited the best place for an ice-cream, arranchini and pizza, had a nice cocktail in the bar. And all of this within just one day accompanied with good rock music! 
I absolutely recommend him as host and surfer. He is caring, sweet, punctual, flexible and at the same time gives you personal space. 
Also, the place is incredible - nice view, everything neat and clean. And my favorite - armchair hanged to the sailing on the balcony!
Be aware that he has crazy working schedule so you should be lucky to get him as a host ;)

Thank you very much for that incredible Sunday, Marco! Hope to see you again :)

text:
Ignazio is simply and purely a great guy. If you're looking for a cozy, relaxed "home away from home" I highly recommend staying at Ignazio's. There you can find a friend to talk with about anything and hang out. You'll never feel just like a "guest" but more like a long-time friend. 
For Ignazio:
Thank you so much for those days! You'll always have a house in Bruxelles. I wish you all the best (you deserve it!). Un bacione üòò

Ignazio made me and my two cousin feel so at home, he gave us his room and refused to let us stay on his sofabed. He bought us food for breakfast, offered to wash our clothes, picked us up from the metro station closest to him, gave us ideas of where to visit in Rome - and he hosted us during a week when he had to work everyday. Ignazio was very considerate and spent the little free time he had taking us to have lunch in his favourite local restaurant. My cousins agreed that we never imagined feeling so at home in a city where we know so few people. His hosting skills set the bar high for people on couchsurfing in Rome, we are extremely grateful for his hospitality and hope we can give a good experience like the one he gave us in return.

Thank you for your time and care nacho! Hopefully see you in Colombia.

I have to say that Iggy completed our tour in Rome! The first day, he even bought the first umbrella of his life to save me and my friendüòÇ Iggy also brought us to the local restaurants and we had a great time with delicious food and funny chatüòÑ I‚Äôll never forget something stupid happened on the way we get down from the hillüòâ Also we cooked at Iggy‚Äôs house and share our stories together~ There are still a lot of things to say but words cannot explain how great Iggy was! He is definitely the best host in Rome!!üôå Hope to see you soon in France, or Taiwanüòä We really missed you a lot! Ciao ciao! Ci vediamo prestoüôãüèª

Iggy ! Just the most wonderful host, the best among all. We spent my sister and I a real good time with him even if he was working he found time for us to visit Roma by night ‚ù§Ô∏è 
A real italian gentleman ! Just stay as you are cause you‚Äôre perfect üëåüèª Grazie mille again and hope we‚Äôll meet again very very soon ü§ó

Iggy was the most amazing host! He came to pick me up at the train station when I arrived, took time to show my around Rome and brought me to the less touristy places to see the genuine Rome that I would've never experienced without him. His home is beautiful and he made me feel so welcome and comfortable. I felt as if I was staying with family. He is a true gentleman and I feel so lucky to have met him! I would highly recommend Ignazio as a host.

It was awesome to stay with Ignazio!!! I was staying in his house with 2 of my girl friends , we totally loved himm! He was so nice, welcoming, kind, helpful, funny. He cooked for us, we hang out and talked about everything. We were crying because of laugh at the end of the night. He opened wine, and it was my birthday , he bought me a surprise cake! Daniel has been an amazing host. He showed my friend and I around the city telling us the history of the great landmarks.

Daniel is an amazing guy, really friendly, kind and awesome chef! He teach me the best carbonara that ever had in Rome. If you have the chance to meet him do it! :)

Daniel is a really really really great guy, he‚Äòs openminded, friendly, very interested in cultures and history and a lot of fun to hang out with.
We stayed with him for 4 nights. He picked us up at the metro station, which is right next to his appartment. We spent 4 amazing days with him, he took all his time for us, showed us the most beautiful places in Rome and told us a lot of interesting facts - you can ask him literally anything ;) He even introduced us to his friends who we also spent a lot of time with.
Summing up we really recommend staying with Daniel as he makes you feel like a local in Rome! üòä

Daniel, thank you so much for hosting us!

We also met his friends and party with them!
Conclusion: Daniel made our stay in Rome more special and memorable! Thank you for everything! We highly recommend this host ‚ò∫Ô∏è

He is nice and interested person. He walked with me around the city and told many interesting historical things.

Que teng√°is buenas vacaciones, saludos de Yasmina y mi y quiz√°s hasta una pr√≥xima vez. Y mucho √©xito por tus estudios.

text:

text: Martina stayed one night at my place. We went out to meet some friends which was a good opportunity to show her Belleville and tell her a little bit about its history. We had a good time and I really enjoyed talking with Martina. Feel free to come back! Good luck with your year in France :)

It was such a pleasure to meet Martina. She came to Pembroke to finally visit the location of one of her favourite films. She was very friendly and I had a great time showing here the surroundings of Pembrokeshire. I wish you a safe trip back to Italy. Ciao!

We hosted Martina and her friend for three days and we have to say that they are such a lovely girls.They are friendly ,cheerful and polite.

They brang us a delicioussss typical dessert from Walles!They are really thankful and cute.

If you get the chance don't hesitate to host them!!

We hope you had a nice trip!
Come back any time :) !
Even though I couldn't hang around much due to my studies, Martina was a thoughtful person who was a joy to host! Hopefully next time around I'll get to hang out more :)

Martina and her travel companion, Oliver, were great guests.
They accepted my challenge of eating "unidentified" Norwegian food and they loved it!

Having them in the house felt like living with flat mates. We enjoyed great meals, exploring the city and relaxing in the sofa eating Norwegian candy and watching great movies.

I have no problem having them over anytime :)

We had a really welcoming stay, we exchanged knowledge in food science, and had a really nice experience in general. We felt totally integrated in the community of Alex Martina and their little third flatmate, the cat Fergus. I hope we will see each other again! Greeting also to Alex!

Martina and Alex are two of the nicest people I‚Äôve met! Very welcoming and generous. They were also very understanding when I arrived a bit late. They‚Äôve got a lot of good info about the city and were good fun to chat with. It‚Äôs a shame we didn‚Äôt get to hang out a bit more. Alex makes a mean gelato too!
Martina, Alex and little Fergus were wonderful hosts. They were caring, friendly and funny and we would definitely like to come back and recommend them to anyone. We were enchanted to meet you :*

So where should I start... Martina is just a wonderful person. I only stayed there one night, but she recommended me some palaces to visit and here boyfriend made a very delicious dinner. They also showed me a really nice spot in the evening, where we had a nice view over the city. So they are both just funny, relaxed open mindend and wonderful persons. Thankyou so much again I really felt myself comfort at your flat. So if you go to Rome I would totally recommend Martina and Alex.

two absolutely beautiful, warm, nice, lovely and friendly people. And a very cute, young little cat. I felt instantly welcomed and comfortable with all three Marti, Alex e Fergus! They were busy working and studying, but we nonetheless shared the nights with CATAN, some delicious food and a crazy cat jumping around! 
Would love to see them again anytime, great great time! 

Much love xo

Martina and Alex were amazing hosts! Firstly, the house: beautiful new dining room table, adorable kitten, wifi, towel, big pull out bed, right near a main train station. Martina and Alex themselves are fun, patient, kind people with witty senses of humour and fantastic direction giving skills. One night they cooked me a feast, the other night we went to an incredible restaurant packed with Romans, not tourists...it was such a highlight of Italy. Im so grateful to meet them and I hope they come WOOF for me on our farm in the future. Thanks you guys!

Martina and her boyfriend were wonderful hosts! They had many experiences to share and were very kind !! Thank you so much for hosting me, I hope to see you soon in France or in whatever country you will be living the next time !
fromPublicAddressDescription: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France

He arrived at ours in the evening, first house he stopped after traveling with his bicycle for a good 1600km. It was his first bike tour, with another 1500+ km to go all the way to the North Cape and he doesnt even like cycling! He is super easy going and helpful too. We promised him dinner but this is a slow household and we werent even started by the time he was here. Mattia was super cool about it, happy to share a conversation and balcony smokes with us. After that we all spent an enjoyable time cooking lots of tasty homemade goodies. It was all a very relaxed and pleasant joint effort :) 

Good luck in all your travels that are yet to come, Mattia! And hope you liked the swedish soup-in-a-tube, if you tried it in the end :)

text:
Ciao great Mattia üëãüòä
I hope to see u soon in Italy

Mattia is the best host you could dream, he shared with me his (many and wonderful) experiences but also took me into his everyday life and made me discover an all other way of life in Roma ! We only met for three days but I would call him a friend  üòä  
Hope to see you again Mattia !

Francesco is a very charming man! Very italian like a pizza! We‚Äôve been talking a lot the night I stayed at his house. He is lovely and friendly. Hope to see again! Here in Rome or in Buenos Aires. üòâüòÄ

Francesco is amazing guy, cheerful, funny, smart but, it's a pity, a very-very hard-working )))  He was so kind to meet me at the train station, cooked deliciuos dinner with wine, spaghetti and shellfish. Omnomnom! ))) Francesco, thank you for trusting me, for my own bedroom and bathroom and for Italian lessons. I felt absolutely safe and comfortable in your pretty house. Your Russian is very good! It was a nice surprise for me )) Welcome to Russia! Take care yourself! And don't work so much :) I hope we'll spend more hours together at the next time.
Grazie mille per tutto! Ciao-ciao!

It was a shame that I had to rush off to catch my flight the last day ... - Francesco and I we had good conversations until the last minute of my stay in Rome. Thanks to a well planned schedule  we were  able to see Rome on scooter by night  - what an experience (!) and having delicious pizze. Thank you :) Francesco appreciates the company and presence of his guests  with mutual exchange of cultural knowledge. Exactly the idea of CS I‚Äôd say ! I wish you all the best F. and many more positive, respectful clean and tidy guests. Hope to see you soon.
I have to tell, that Francesco is really good person and he is a great host! He tell all his rules in the beginning and stay with him is really simple and nice!

Francesco is kind, friendly, enthusiastic and conversational on a multitude of subjects. He is very clear and direct about what works and doesn‚Äôt work in his home so it makes things easy. His place is in a  secure  older building with some lovely  old fashioned details  that I don‚Äôt usually see as a couch surfer. I loved the old style  elevator, marble floors and beautiful (etched?) glass. It was also convenient to the metro and pretty easy to find my way around especially with Francesco‚Äôs good directions. He is a busy (and respectful) bachelor and keeps a clean, spartan home which he shares with a big heart.

It was great being hosted by Francesco! He was very friendly, welcoming and helped me figure out what to see in Rome. He even took me on a motorcycle ride around the city at night and dropped me off at the station on time for my train! His apartment is very clean and very well located, I'd recommend anyone to stay with Francesco :)

Francesco is great host. He accepted our last time request. He is very funny, friendly and we had great time with him eventough we didn't spend there lot of time. As he is very busy you have to arrange everything really preciously. His flat is big and with ventilator you can survive there even when in Rome is 40¬∞C.

I stayed with Francesco for three days. The first two days we didn't see that much. He was working all the time. At the evening of the 3. day we were talking a lot. He is a very funny and nice guy. His appartment is clean and O got a key. So I was able to go inside whenever I liked. 

Thanks for hosting me. It was very nice to stay with you!

Francesco was so kind to me. Even if he was so busy, he accepted me to stay at his home. We couldn‚Äôt spend time together but i can understand that. I had my own room and bed. His place was so clean. He was so flexible. He gave me a copy of his house‚Äôs keys  and i can go out and back to home whenever i want.  Thank you Francesco for everything! :)
I've met a great person who I could talk with, who kindly hosted me and was very friendly. I loved to stay at Francesco's place and highly recommend it to everyone. Thanks again!
Francesco is a nice man, collaborator and very reliable! please read his profile well! He does not have time to lose!

He is a good guy. Very funny. 
And He takes care of his guests.

text: Francesco really looked after us, he is considerate, helpful and has excellent English. I feel that we are friends now and expect that he will reciprocate our visit and stay with us some time in the future. He gave us the use of a lovely room with a very comfortable bed.

Francesco is a wonderful person. Even being very busy he found a way of being friendly and was very thoughtful! We talked, we laughed, it was like being with a friend. Staying in his house was marvelous experience.

text: Responsible, punctual, friendly, honest person. A secure place to stay.

Francesco you have very nice house and thanks for this opportunity. We had a very nice meal. I really liked your dish and a big thank you for being a good cooking critic :D, as you  gave me ideas, and now I know how to enhance the taste of my dish!!!

Francesco was very busy but he took time out of his day to be home when we arrived. He showed us around his apartment and gave us some advice of where we could go for the day. We booked for two nights but he was kind enough to let us stay one more. He is very busy with work so we barely saw him. However I can say he's really friendly. His apartment is close to the metro and a supermarket which is great.

Francesco is a really nice host. Really easy going, warm and disposed to help with everythimg we needed. His flat is really confortable. Next time i will defintely contact him, recomended for everyone ! Thanks francesco!!!!

I liked to stay with Francesco,,,,
his home very comfortable,, and his very friendly and fun,, and very safety !!!! and he also willingness to help me,,,
I recomended him if u want to stay with him,,  I would come back to Rome again with more longer time !!!! 
 ü§ó

Francesco were a very nice host, always kind and funny although he were so busy (really). But when he had some time he prepared a delicious dinner and shared that moment with me! He gave me recommendations about the places to visit and he were available when I needed something.
Also he took me to and from the station the two times, when I arrived and when I went.
By last, he always were honest and clear.
Thank you for all, Francesco!!!

I stayed two nights in Francesco's house. He is really flexible and thoughtful. He picked me up from metro station. He also gave the key. I really feel flexible in his home. I highly recommend Francesco. Thank you for everything and see you in Turkey :)

Our stay in Francesco's house was fantastic ! He is really friendly and funny ! He picked up us from metro station and drove us to his flat and founded time to spend with us even if he's working a lot.
Thank you for everything :D We spend good time over there, dansing, playing guitar or doing sport in your living-room x)
Hope to see you again (in Toulouse, Strasbourg or Italy) Ciao :D

I wanna say thank youuuuu very much  for Francesco again and again!!! Staying in his home was reallyyyy comfortable!!! He picked up me from station after waiting  for me half an hours (so sorry), explain clearly about home and city, give food and keys))  He has a big heart and great smile)) He also help me with my stuff and one more day extra staying))) So, it seems he is robot, working 7 on 7, very very very busyyyyyy. As for me, I respect such type of guys!!! It is the most wonderful time in Rome!!!  I believe, no I know that one day kindness of Francesco will return him and his family!!! I am so proud of being your friend!!! Welcome to Kazakhstan anytime!!!
Thank you for taking the time and energy to host us :)

Francesco is a fantastic CS host.
He is super friendly and easygoing.  He readily opened his cosy large home for us and made us feel welcome. He also went out of his way to help fulfill our wishes ie using the washing machine. We emphasised to Francesco that we expect to return the favour once he comes to Denmark. We will warmly recommend Francesco to other CS.  We will never forget his hospitality and hope we have made a friend for life.
Lots of love Lotte & Ann :)

Thank you very much Francesco !! Me and my friend could not wish for a better host ! Francesco picked up us from metro station and drove us to his flat ! We had so much fun hanging out together. In the fact he works 16 hours a day, always managed to find time for a chat. Accepting our request last minute and let us stay for four nights !! Very lucky ! Hopefully we will see you soon ( England, Slovakia or Czech ) Arrivederci :) Andrea and Lenka :)

Stay with Francesco was really nice. We felt like at home, really spacefull apartment and room! He has a lot of work and we spent all day visiting places of Rome,  but anyway we had a great time together :)

First of all it was a last-minute stay but Francesco accepted my request. He hosted me with my best friend like we were his old friends. Although he is a very busy man he found time for us. It felt like home . Unfortunately we hadn't enough time to hang out and didn't try his famous pasta. Also, we were not punctual at all and had to wake him up late at night but Francesco wasn't mad at us! 
Thank you so much! Hope to met you again!

I highly recommend you to stay with this couchsurfer. Althought this was a last-minute-stay and I came too late and at the wrong place, he was not angry at all - he even cooked the best pasta and gave the best recommendations on what to visit in the area (e.g. Villa Borghese). Francesco works crazy hours, but he still manages to make you feel at home in Roma and is a thoughtful, generous, ambitious, kind and fun person. Thank you for keeping up with the double-nicole-craziness hahaha
Best Wishes!
Pietro was comfortable, organized and gentile guest; made me feel as at home...The way how he came and left left impression as well. Wish you success in your further biking tour to Lisboa.
Pietro is a very nice, quiet and sweet person. We had a good time together. I recommend.
Pietro is a great guy, he has a lot to teach you about and is a really easy going person ! I totally recommend him.

First second we meet with Luca we immediately started to joke (sometimes in a sarcastic way) and laugh as a old-old-old friends. Luca is interesting and easy going person, and I definitely recommend to meet him. Luca showed me best view spots in Roma, shared fun stories and took me for nice frozen coffee (forgot how it calls, but it was sooooooo yummy, Luca!) I wish you luck, and I think I'll see you somewhere in the world!

I could not have wished a better host in Rome! 
Not only did he come to pick me up at 2am at the airport due to flight delay, but he welcomed me with open arms into his home. Luca showed me Rome on his scooter, took the time  to make me discover the best panorama views i have ever seen and were very patient. 
He is a very smart man and we had very great conversations! I honestly had one of the best time of my life and I was extremely enchanted to meet him and spend time with him. 

You are one of kind Luca!

I am so happy for having the opportunity to met Luca! 
He made my days in Rome really enjoyable. 
He drove me around Roma with his super cool Scooter! 
We had nice and thoughtful conversations, we had pizza, pasta, ice cream! So, be prepared to have as much carbo as possible, haha
Besides that, he knows everything about his city and its best sights.
I had a great time hanging out with Luca!
I wish you have the chance to meet him:)

Luca! I'll always be thankful for everything you did!!

Un bacio,
Eve

Luca made my stay in Rome the best I could have. Of hosts i've ever met, he was the best of all. Took me in your scooter to know the city and showed me the best pizzeria of Rome. Super gentle and lovely. Felt super comfortable in your home. I loved!

text:
Luca hosted me for 3 days in his apartment and it was amazing!
He took me at the metro and gave me all the information that I needed to walk trough Rome. He also took me on his scooter to explore Rome and cook delicious italian dishes.
He's very polite, funny and super attentive person. 
He can speak english and spanish very well too.
It was a wonderful experience for me! :D
Thank you so much and I hope to see you soon! ;)

Luca is a nice man.  He has a clean house and made me a couple meals as well as dropped me off in the city both days I was there.  I probably wouldn't stay with him again because he was a bit controlling for my taste.  For instance, I needed to sleep in my first day but he woke me and when I said I needed more sleep he wouldn't let me.  He insisted I get up at 9am because "there's too much to see."  He ended up being right because I had to pack a lot into 2 days but I still found him to be too paternalistic and domineering over my time.  He did get up at 5am to see me off at the airport though.  I appreciate you Luca.

Luca is such a nice guy, so funny and easy going, he really took his time to show me around the awesome and beautiful Rome... im so in love with this city. if u have the chance, you should definitely go meet him. El italiano mas chevere, y habla espa√±ol muy bien. :) grazie mille Luca. :)
Very friendly and polite guy! Easy going and nice to talk with and he knows good trattorias too! He took me to some amazing view points of the city üòÑ

Luca is one of the most loving and giving hosts I've ever met. He is such a wonderful person and such a gentleman. He communicated very well with me and was flexible with my dates. He picked me up from the station when I got there. During the week he was like my own personal tour guide and took me everywhere on his scooter. Very grateful for that. He introduced  me to his friends and took me to a very cool wedding-dress modeling party. He also accompanied me to Napoli for 2 days. I had a great time with him and his friends there too. At the end of my trip in Rome, he dropped me off at the airport for Spain.  I could have not asked for a better host in Rome. He made my last days in Italy so great. I hope too see him again in USA or South America.

Luca is a sadist! He took me to the Eataly mall full of italian delicacies when I was starving - just to watch! :-D 
Just kidding. Luca has been a great company to me (despite the torture above :-D) Helped me out when I was looking for a host.  He is a trustworthy and reliable person, open minded, intellingent and a very experienced traveller. Always patient and helpful, he accompanied me when he was free and showed me around. There is absolutely nothing I could complain about. Thank you once more, Luca, I hope we keep in touch. Besos!
Hope no one stopped reading after the first sentence :-)))

text:
It's with such ease that I describe what surfing with Luca is; Splendid!! Luca defines hosting. text:
Luca was super kind to host me 4 days in Rome. Even though he hadn't got any references or CS friends in here, he was reccomended to me by his friend (experinced CouchSurfer), thanks to Andrea :) 
Luca even met me and my friends at the airport with his car :) But the most impressive thing was to see Rome from his motorino!!! :) Which is a real Rome :) We ate roman pizza and drank roman bear, he cooked tagliatelli for me :))) He showed me parks and places i've never seen before and everything was just awesome! I would highly reccomend Luca as host and as surfer! Cause he is a real traveller and couchsurfer :) Hope to see you in Kaliningrad :) You're always invited :)
inverseReference: {'id': '13024829', 'text': 'I hosted, for my first time on CS, Anka for four nights here in Rome..and i have to underline that it was a very pleasant experience..Anka is a well-educated, friendly, ironic and funny person, and it was a pleasure to share my time and my scooter ( motorino, in italian..)with her...-)...and, most of all, it was so delicious looking at her face, almost hypnotized when we took place in a pizzeria...yes, Anka, real pizza is made in that way!..-))..of course, you are invited for your next time in Roma..-)', 'createdDate': '2013-05-11T11:09:21Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2056633'}, 'from': {'id': '1000293102', 'publicName': 'Luca  Lattari', 'publicAddress': {'id': '8488177', 'description': 'Rome, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/5GWISH0QU/24686840_l_5a92664389665c0923ceda0d4ea71595.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Gianluigi accepted our (almost) last minute request! He was really helpful with us. He helped us how to get the house of him and also he waited for us on the train station! Unfortunately we didn't have too much time for meet each other because of the work but, even this, Gianluigi is a really good person, that's always ready for help you when you need.  Also he has a cute dog! :) We are so grateful for your trust on us. Thank you!

Me and my friend stayed at Gianluigi‚Äôs house for 4days, and he‚Äôs been so kind and friendly to us. we made many precious memories with him in Rome.
I can‚Äôt write all of his kindness that he have done,but here is some example. He always tried to have time to talk with us at night even after his work, he told us the beautiful place where not many tourist don‚Äôt know, took us the gelato shop and gave gelato to us, and drove us to the party at night. What surprised us the best, was that he let us use his bed, let 2 American girls use his couches( they stayed on the same dates with us) and he slept on the floor! That explains his kindness so much.
I don‚Äôt think his house is very close to the central Rome, but it‚Äôs really worth staying with him and his cute dog baloo. I totally would like to stay at him again!

thank you so much „Ç∏„Çß„Éï( I still don‚Äôt get how to spell your nickname so in Japanese), we‚Äôll see you in Japan someday, you have 2 homes there!

Gianiluigi is an amazing host! If you have the opportunity to stay with him, do not hesitate to do so. He showed us around town, and even gave us a ride when we got lost. Gian is a talented musician and has great conversations. He is the best host and a great friend. I hope to see him again soon! xx

Gianluigi is a really friendly and wonderful host. He hosted me last minute and was ok to host also my friend. Unfortunately she couldn't so I stayed alone. 
He has a little wonderful house with a big green garden and a little dog Balou. 
Gianluigi helped me a lot. He showed me Rome by night and recommended a lot of great places. 
He is really spontaneous and a spiritual person!

Gian is a very easy-going, thoughtful, gentle, kind and generous person.( It would probably take me a whole year to use all the good words)
As you can read from other comments, Gian would give his bed to you and instead, he sleeps on a couch becuz usually he works very late and he doesn't wanna disturb the couchsurfers.
Girls would be totally safe and comfortable with him. Me and my friend's luggages were delayed when we arrived Rome and Gian drove me to the airport to retrieve our luggages and communicated with the local staff. As he said, he is raised in the way of helping others.
Seriously, it's never enough to just write a positive reference and I'm sure and I genuinely hope we'll meet each other in the future.

We stayed a night in his place with his beautiful dog.Even he works a lot he tried to do the best for us ,gave his keys and checked  if everything is okay which was really thoughtful behaviour for us. Gianluigi thank all you did , hope to see you soon maybe in Turkey.
Btw sorry for the ketchupüòÄ

I had a lovely time with ginaluigi! He is one of the kindest and most generous hosts I've ever had! He insisted that I  sleep on his bed while he and his lovely pooch slept on the couch. His home is beautiful and it was a joy to visit. He offered me all of the food he had and was overall and extremely open and giving. We couldn't meet until late the first night because he had to work, but that was not a problem at all! I met up with some people and got drinks in the city center before riding a convenient bus ride straight to his home! Thanks for everything!! Until next time!

Me and my friend spent two nights at Gianluigi‚Äôs home. He is a really nice guy, he let us feel ourselves at home. He has an adorable little dog too! :) We didn‚Äôt really had time to get to know eachother more, but we could feel that he is a precious person, and he is always smiling and wants to share what he has! :) 
Thank you for having us, I hope to see you in the future!

Gianluigi was our first host on couchsurfing and we were a bit afraid how it would be, but when we met all bad  feelings were gone. He was so kind, gave us the key to his house and was open for talks. We had breakfast together at our last morning and we talked a lot. Unfortunately he had to work most of the time so we could not spent much time together. Gianluigi is such a nice Person and I can recommend anyone to meet him. Thank you so much. You are very welcome in germany !

Gianluigi is amazing! It was my first Couchsurfing experience and I didn't expect it to be this good. Gianluigi is very caring and more than kind. After our actual host didn't show up, he hosted me and my friend last minute. He is very cute together with his dog Maya :)
Gianluigi even moved to the couch so that we could sleep in his bed and had our privacy and he even gave us the keys to his house. We really felt like we were at home! 
Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to spend a lot of time together because either he was working or we were in the city for sightseeing. 
I'm so thankful for everything he did for us and I hope there will be a chance to see him again in the future. He is always welcome in Germany :) 
And by the way, he makes a really good Sorbet üòÅ thank you so much for everything!

Dear Gianluigi! I can't even describe how thankful we are. 
He was the only one who didn't let us sleep in 24 hours McDonald's when our previous host was forced to leave the city. Gianluigi entrusted us with a very important mission and I hope we coped with it all :)
He was so nice to us, very clever and easygoing. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to spend with him because it was our last day in Rome, but I'm sure we will be back to this beautiful city soon. 
I can highly recommend Gianluigi to everyone!

Gianluigi is a great host. He is very friendly and warmhearted. He even gave us an accomodation before we arrived because he wasn't home at that time. We felt really save and he trusted us from the beginning on. He gave us the keys and we could come and go whenever we wanted to. Even if we haven't spent a lot of time with each other because of his long work days we were very happy to stay with Gianluigi and would come back for sure!

Gianluigi, this is one of the kindest and interesting people I have ever met in my life. He is very hospitable, caring and polite. His house is filled with light, I don't feel that I was in guests, I felt like I was at home. It has a very sweet dog, I fell in love with it), Gianluigi a very deep person, we found many common interests and topics for discussion. Unfortunately, we are unable to spend a lot of time together, but in 2 days this guy became a real friend to me) I hope that we will have the opportunity to meet again. Thank you for everything, you have a big heart and beautiful eyes)

text: Me and my friend were staying with Gianluigi for 4 nights.¬† He's great guy, with romantic soul, full of¬† kindness, very open-minded, funny and are passionate about his work. Gianluigi was a great host for the few days we stayed with him! He made sure we had everything we needed, and was always quick to respond if we needed anything or had any questions. He was a really thoughtful guy, too, and went out of his way to make sure we had a place to stay and were safe!

Gian is an extremely generous host. He was really nice to us. Inspite of getting late for his work, he picked us from the station  and made us really comfortable at his place. Rome is a beautiful place and we really enjoyed our stay at Rome, thanks to Gian :)

Gianluigi is a very kind person. He made me feel like at home and gave his huge bed, while he was sleeping on the sofa. He has beautiful place with garden, which I even didn't have time to enjoy. I'm really looking forward meeting him again.

I really like that CS asked you what is memorable about the person, but is also really complicated...

I took my time because I wanted to write something really good for a great person but there are no words to describe the awesome weekend I spend in Rome and the amazing friend I made. 
I thank you from the bottom of my heart your kindness and sweetness, I was a bit terrified about my first yep on my own but  you help me a lot and I would always treasure in my heart the memories of the Rome you showed me. 

Any time you want to come to Mexico you are more than welcome, the doors of my home would always be open for you and your family, thank you so much for everything. 

Yoa

Gianlugi is an incredibly generous and caring host with heart of gold! I stayed in Rome just for one night on my way to Naples. Even though he had to work that evening and he had another surfer, Sylvia, at his place, he took me in saying, "I cannot leave you without accommodation! " He's made an arrangement for me so that Sylvia could let me in to his place, and he even let us sleep on his bed while he's slept on the couch. Since we were already sleeping when he returned from work, and I left early the following morning, I didn't have a chance to get to know him, but I truly appreciate his hospitality and hope we'll get to see each other when I return to Rome :) Grazie molte!!

This was my first couchsurfing experience and it couldn't have been better! Gianluigi was very helpful and offered us all we needed. For example food, towels, hairdryer, etc. He also replied to our request very quick and took us in in such a short notice (like three days before our arrival). We got our own keys so we could go as we wanted while he was working during the night and sleeping in the day. Unfortunately we stayed only one night and didn't have really much time to hang out together. Anyway, my friend is going to Rome again in the next month and she will probably stay there again.

We spent two days in Roma at Gianluigi's place and it was definitely too short ! He is very welcoming and friendly,  we immediatly felt at home ! He lives in a very nice area, and his home has a beautiful garden ! He took the time to welcome us even if he had a lot of work and exams ! He shared his travel experiences with us and he is very interesting ! We truly recommend to stay at his place !

text:
I have to say thanks to Maurizio for letting me stay 6(!) days/nights! The whole period was accompanied by amazing music either in the appartment or in his car.  I added a lot of songs to my play list! He also revealed couple of good old movies I have not seen before. 
He is a good cook and I so much enjoyed the pasta he prepared for me at home. 
SPECIAL thanks for not-usual-big cup of coffee.  Italians drinks coffee in a really-really small cups. Every morning after he found out that small cup was not enough for me I was gotten my BIG one :-)
The Saturday night Maurizio spent with me in the club and it was a marvelous time. It is been a long time I have not got such a pleasure dancing on the house music they played there!!! And that "early breakfast" after the club in a non-touristic pizza place was sooo delicious.
Maurizio is a very friendly, positive, polite, well-travelled and patient person. It was a pleasure to get to know him. He shared some useful information conserning travelling with me.
It was my first CS experience and I felt grateful to Maurizio for the feedback concerning my personality and my personal customs.
The difficult things for me were to wake up in the morning to leave the appartment with Maurizio and to follow the schedule.  I am a during-vacation-need-to-sleep-enough-person (and blondie), so was a bit sad about, but the rules were  known before I came there,  no complain :-) 
Thank you
fromPublicAddressDescription: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russian Federation

text: Patrick is an amazing person, very easy going, kind and intelligent. He came from Monte Compatri to Rome to pick us up from the bus station very early in the morning. He gave us very useful suggestions about hanging around Rome in much better way. We cooked some Indian food at night and were so surprised to see that he could bear with the spices without any trouble. We then watched an Indian movie and had an amazing discussion. The other night we were in Rome and there was a Metro strike, Patrick came again to pick us up, which was really kind of him. If you are in Rome ever, don't throw your chance away of meeting this great person who is so passionate about what he's doing. Highly motivated and hard working. Best of luck for future Patrick.

Staying with Patrick was a bliss! I don't know where to start describing about him. He is an extremely smart, caring and enthusiastic person. He has this amazing zest for life and is ready to explore anything and everything! We had some amazing conversations with him about life and he really enlightened us on how to manage our work life better. Right from the first moment when we met him at the FCO airport till the last goodbye at the train station, it feels like we have known him since ages. He has a very cozy home (which he has built himself - which is amazing!) with a rooftop garden. He gave us a very comfortable private room and the view from his home is breathtaking. We cherished every moment we spent with him. He has been a friend and family member for us, guiding us every day (even when we used to get lost at times). He makes the best smoothies and prefers organic food. He even took us to a beautiful lake near his beautiful town. Thanks for everything Patrick! Lots of love! :)

Patrick is a good man with a good dream and interesting life. It was nice to stay in his appartments, which are comfortable and rather clean even during the construction. There is an incredible wiew on Rome and suburbs from the flat! Patrick was nice to us and we had interesting conversations and healthy tasty food :)

No trip to Rome would be complete without seeing Montecompatri. Patrick was the greatest host ever. His apartment is an adventure itself and he's got the nicest view on Rome from his rooftop. We could talk about everything with him and he invited us to come along wherever he went. His friends are super nice to be around, even though we didn't understand a word and they also make quite good food. Patrick gave us rides and is helpful in every way you can imagine. If you want to get a tattoo, he'll hold your hand üòÇüòÇ. He didn't mind us staying longer than we were supposed to. We could experience the real Italian life and we would love to stay with him again!!

It was really nice to stay with Patrick. Although his home is far away from Rome (about 1 hour and a half in bus and train to the center), it had a incredible view that really made it special. He picked us from the airport and gave us good recommendations about what to do. We had a very very good time thanks again for everything!

Staying with Patrick was really good! He picked us up at the airport, showed us some local winery or groocery. Because his flat isn¬¥t in Rome, he gave us the timetables for bus, once he drove us to the train station and once he picked us up from Rome :) He also introduced us to his friends :) 
Me and my friend  were lucky because in Monte Compatri there was St. Antonio feast with procesion, Patrick explained the reason of the feast to us and also took us to the market. 
We also shared some food, wine and spent some evenings together. 
Patrick is really kind, friendly, intelligent guy, who wants to live healthy (we were running together - that was also so cool) and to make his flat very eco-efficient - that¬¥s the reason why the flat is still under construction (unfinished house - so be prepare on it).  But I can recommend staying in this flat despite the construciton, because the view is breathtaking.
Hope to stay with Patrick again one day :)

Patrick is a very interesting man living in a flat under construction. He's making his place eco-efficient. Recycling, fireplace, garden on the roof top. He has a library about eco lifestyle including health and uses organic food. He is a library itself full of knowledge about world, body and technologies. Patrick's place is away from Rome but this was the reason we could feel a real Italian life with a bunch of his local friends singing songs and drinking wine in front of some lady's window. The view  from a flat is awesome: you can see all Rome. Patrick is a great host: careful and attentive. You'd enjoy his company and he is full of ideas to spend a good time. Thank you for everything and wish you to move on with the flat!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Patrick helped my friend and I out when we were on a five day trip to Rome. Patrick offered his place even though it is outside of the city, with hope that he could help. The travel to and from from Patrick's house was not bad at all, & it was totally worth it. Patrick was a great, & interesting host. Definitely was one of my favorite couch surfing experiences & I will continue to tell everyone about his wonderful roof view!

My boyfriend and I stayed at Patric place for 4 days. He is a very kind person with passion for tango. We have enjoyed spending time with him, share personal experiences and a breakfast with colombo-italian style arepas. Thank you very much for your hospitality and good luck with your house renovation. Abrazos

A friend and I stayed with Patrick in his home in Rome for 4 nights about a week ago. He was so welcoming to us and I had a really great time getting to know him. A few of the nights we stayed up talking and he shared drinks and some delicious homemade food with us, including guacamole and cappuccinos. It looks like I'm not the first person to stay with Patrick to highly recommend him. He lives in a beautiful hilly area outside of Rome...it was almost 90 min. of traveling each way to get to the central part of the city (which was probably the only downside), but I found I actually kind of enjoyed getting away at night and in the mornings to the little town he was in. Patrick is a great guy and I really enjoyed my time in Rome...thanks again for everything!

Patrick is such a great host. A friend and i were in desperate need of a place to stay, he accepted us the night before we arrived in Rome (within an hour or two of me contacting him). Really saved us. We stayed with him 4 nights, while he had other guests also, he found space to put us all. 
While we where there he made us a couple meals, drove us into the city one evening, and engaged in some really interesting conversations. Even though his house is still a work-in-progress, Patrick makes one feel so comfortable and at home in his space. 
The chance to meet and stay with Patrick is truly worth the time to get out to his place. 
Thank you again Patrick for saving Annie and I from homelessness, and for everything else. It was such a blessing to meet and hang out with you a few days. I hope our paths cross down the road. You are the coolest person i've met through CS so far!!
God bless.

Patrick is an amazing host and a sweet person. I still remember the view from his balcony at all over the ROme. I stayed there with my cousin, and the fact she didn't speak english she felt very comfortable as well. Such a shame for us that we couldn't cook a proper Kazakh food :( but i really hope to see you, Patrick, again in future! you are always welcome at my place at any time!!!! 

Assel

I stayed in Patrick's house 2 days and enjoyed every moment of it! He makes sure you're comfortable and treats you very well. Good taste in mexican food and avid runner...boy that was a good run on the hills of Monte Compatri!
Patrick is really nice, he give excellent advises about life in general. It was nice to seat with him and talk.

Mother of god this was an awesome experience. Patrick is really kind, helpful. He is really intelligent, with a lot of innovative ideas and fun to discuss with. His ambitions about the complete renovation of his apartment is really admireable and inspiring. Thank you for hosting us my friend, and I really hope to visit you again and see the progression of the apartment!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China

text:
It was great to meet Patrick!! He is so wise, smart, creative and you can always feel the positive energy he has!! My boyfriend and I had really good time staying in his home and the British beans are perfect.:) The way he lives, the way he thinks and the way he acts are really comfortable, free and inspiring. Had a really great time staying in his place and we will visit him again for sure later:)

text: What I like about Patrick the most is his youthfulness and his ability to communicate at different levels: from a small talk around breakfast table to philosophical discussions near a fireplace. time spent together was relaxing even though I met him for the first time and spent 8 (!) days under the same roof in beautiful Monte Compatri. Thank you! BTW, how's the flower doing?

text: Patrick has a great heart, he's a nice guy, good-looking and good-natured. He was a fun host, and although his house is still a work-in-progress we enjoyed fixing it up together and cooking good food each evening. We also had some late-night talks sharing thoughts and secrets. Thanks, Patrick! Come to visit us in Israel, you hear?
Patrick not only let us see the real Italian people, but also made us feel like at home. Love your kitchen, car, hat and scarf, music and... windows ;)
inverseReference: {'id': '12387368', 'text': 'Lina and Rokas are wonderful people and were the perfect guests for a great couchsurfing experience.
