text: I visited Patrick in April with my friend Benita. We are both speechless when it comes to describe how wonderful host we had. Patrick, thank you for your wisdom, warmth & generosity. Please be our guest in Poland so we can continue our inspiring conversations and I'll have a chance to explain why I am posting my reference here with a few months delay:)

Patrick is a good and deep guy. We had nice chat about anything: love,world, life. Hope you have bought the Christmas gift eventually:). Keep in touch and see you soon. I am sure you will have a very new apt.!

it was a great time in Rome... we always had very interestings discussions:D the moments I remember most are the drving on your vespa and our running trip in the morning:) you definitley changed my life... (exspecially my way of eating) and I will buy vibrams!!xD

Patrick is a nice and very hospitable person but at the same time - weird and annoying. I'm sure that some people love him but for others he's ghastly. It's very diffucult to describe what I mean but for example, he loves asking you about very personal details and behaving as your personal confessor. I didn't like it. 
On the other hand, he lives in impossibly beautiful town but at the same time - in completely unfinished house. You must be prepared on it;) one thing is absolutely sure - you won't bore with Patrick :) staying in his house is a big adventure ;)

Patric hosted us for three nights in his flat with a million dollar view to Rome. Since the flat is under construction, comfort is not top notch, but was good enough for us. One can't miss the chance to sleep in terrace in the open air with Rome twinkling below and stars above. All this was enriched with some nice conversations about how this world goes and how one finds his place in it. Overal it was a good experience, thank you, Patric!

Patric is unique. Authentic, highly intelligent, generous and warm person. Staying at his house he will surprise you more than once, with a great vegetarian friendly cappuccino or putting on some beautiful music, with adventurous stories or reading your horoscope. It was an amazing experience to discover roman countryside, enchanting Monte Compatri, and to meet him who‚Äôs my birthday twin. You‚Äôre inspiring! Thanks again and wish you all the best!

text: Patrick gave us the most authentic small town Italian welcome we could ever ask for! We attended a festival with real Italian grandma cooking and local music. His house is piece of art in the works with a killer view. He is a happy individual we were glas to have stayed with.

Patrick is someone really nice, he gave me the opportunity to participate at his village party where i met really nice locals and share a really good time. It was really nice to share a renovation flat experience with him. He 's got a lot lot great ideas for it. Thanks to him and wish that his dream came true ;-)

text:
Patrick was very kind enough to host me and my friend in his apartment which he is renovating. 
He is a really great person and I am really happy to have met him. It was very interesting to talk to him about topics like astrology, business, patents, and life in general! Best of luck with your renovations!! :D

The place where we took Patrick an amazing and perfect, we liked it better in his house, than in Rome. I wish you your dreams come true faster than you to have all happened and you got a patent. All the best))

I used to think that I was the most perfectionnist person on this planet but Patrick has definitely beaten the record :-)
It was nice meeting and staying at Patrick's. A lot of fun helping out and getting the roof plant installed !
Hope to have the chance to come back and have a look ;-)

We are grateful to Patrick for extending his hospitality and comfort zones, clear and dedicated communication, commitment. We missed the visit this time, but this leaves the space to live more and meet next time in LT, Italy or UK? Thanks a lots for all and see you next time - come to visit us in LT (direct ryanair flight away).

On the second occasion Patrick saved Martynas and myself as we got stuck in the freezing mountains with our bicycles. Thanks a lot!

text:
Patrick let me and Philipp stay at his place for three days and let us explore his house, his town and the towns around. We went out for dinner and Ferragosto procession with his friends and had lots of fun.
He's a very nice guy with a creative mind, especially when it comes to his house - hope you'll finish it soon! :)

Patrick is really positive, friendly guy who has a lot of interesting ideas in his head. He helped us with buses time schedules and showed where to buy locally made vine. 
Patrick I wish you best of luck with ALL your projects and ideas. Hope one day you will be able to glide from the roof of your finished home. Time spent with you was wonderful. 
Ciao, Tomas.

The man with Idea :) Patrick is very interesting guy, very friendly and creative. We had very good time with him, the best part of our stay was taking a vespa ride up on the top of moutain, the view from his apartment's window is tremendous. We had nice chat with tea and snacks and he took us out for dinner, He got some great ideas and we wish him best of luck

we share 2 evenings with Patrick, talking about everything.. he is really a good person and a dreamer...his house is under-construction but is the best! and with an inredible scenery of rome..
good luck with your project!!
un abrazo!!

Patric is a wonderful person. He has surrounded us with care and attention. Helped us to solve organizational problems. Treated a delicious breakfast and wonderful cappuccino. We wish him a speedy and favorable solution of all his plans.
Best wishes.
Irin & Vlad

text: Patrick is the absolute BEST. He's so nice and so helpful with everything. He told me the best places in Rome and even took me and my friend to some of the best places outside of Rome, Frascati and Monte Compatri should definitely be on your list of places to see when visiting the area. Everything was great, his view is amazing and I can't wait until he finishes his apartment. He's a really great guy, the nicest host (and makes excellent coffee), and just an overall interesting person, making Rome an even more interesting place in the end.

text: You won¬¥t get the chance to meet 2 Patricks, he¬¥s the one and only! Definitely a very special person, he can just bring positive things to your life, and you will see that from minute one. Inspiring, authentic, generous, kind, warm, encouraging, supportive, tirelessly creative, what else could I say? I run out of adjectives. Impressive views, great music, tea, tortellini! etc etc etc. Glad if I could contribute in any way in that would-be splendid house, which already is so beautiful for many other intangible reasons. So honoured, overwhelmed and thankful our paths crossed, best of lucks with the house y todo lo dem√°s, good vibes and positive thoughts.. and thanks for everything once again. Liqui!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Buenos Aires, Autonomous City of Buenos Aires, Argentina

text: We are so glad we stayed with Patrick in his house above the clouds. Staying with Patrick is not for the faint of heart, but totally worth it. He is an extremely hospitable and genuine guy. He showed us around to some very small-town, down to earth places which is exactly what we wanted to get out of our trip to Italy. We were planning to stay only three nights, but ended up staying for six. He is an extremely knowledgeable, laid back, open individual who doesn't accept a set way of thinking. We wish we had more time to spend with him and learn from him. Maybe we can meet up in the UK later? Can't wait to see your finished house. We definately need to be there for that! Thanks for everything Patrick!

text: Patrick is a special soul. He carries around the world a degree of trust you'll rarely encounter and with that comes what one may call 'a heart of gold'. Very open to life and its wide possibility of experience, he may strike you as someone who seemingly miraculously seems able to maintain a totally innocent and untainted way of being in his core experience and outlook of life.

text: Guiseppe is a really kind and nice person. We spent 3 evenings together, one with his good friend Bart, he cooked carbonara for us and it was really delicious! Thanks for the nice welcome and beeing so helpful and good to me! It was really nice to stay at your place! Wish you the best!

Giuseppe is one of the best Couchsurfing hosts I have ever been lucky enough to meet. He lives in a cozy flat in Trastevere ‚Äì my favorite area of Rome. His place is clean, central, and very comfortable. But what really made the experience great was Giuseppe himself! Even though he was sick, he picked me up from the station and drove me all around the city. We went to dinner with his friends and he made me breakfast/lunch/dinner the next day. Great chef! He is so welcoming and generous, he made me feel really comfortable. He also let me stay an extra day at the last minute. He showed me the local life of Italy which I think is the meaning of Couchsurfing. Grazie mille for everything Giuseppe! You made my time in Rome amazing!!! See you in California

Guiseppe is a really helpful, open minded, ¬†warm-hearted person. He picked me up at the station after midnight and showed me some nice places. He is a great host and share all his things. I can recommended him to host or meet and spend time together.

Giuseppe is a very silent and calm host. He is very helpful. He picked me from the train station and dropped me to the train station. I slept in a very comfortable couch. He also made sure that I am really comfortable during the stay. He suggested me good places to eat and also visit in Rome..

Highly recommend him.

My stay with Giuseppe was really nice! He is super friendly, reliable and generous and will truly always do his best to make you feel comfortable!! I was just there for one night, but I felt so at home and taken cared of. We enjoyed the most delicious homemade pizza, pasta and bread, he took me to beautiful places with his car in the evening and the whole next day, and I took in the sun and awesome view on his terrace! No wishes left!!
Thank you so much Giuseppe, I hope what you do for people will always come back to you! See you again one day, Leonie
Giuseppe is a great host. We slept on his couch one night. He invited me and my friend to dinner the day we arrivel together with his friends. It was a great Italian evening and we enjoyed :-)

Giuseppe is a very good host!
He is a nice and kind person and he was a great company during my stay in Rome.
Also, he makes a perfect pasta!
Thank you, Giuseppe!

Guiseppe was a really sweet low-key person. We had a good talk about our travels and he was very welcoming and kind hearted. I only stayed one night so we did not have time to do things but he was very clear on wanting to show me around the next time i was there. Thank you for all Guiseppe!!

Without a doubt an excellent couchsurfing, is a very attentive, friendly, respectful person! We stayed for 3 nights at his house, he picked us up at the terminal and took us to the airport, prepared delicious dinners and desserts for us and slept on a comfortable sofa bed! I recommend it a thousand times without a doubt the best! Not to mention that it lives in front of the train station and 2 minutes from the Vatican! Thanks Giuseppe

I was hosting Andrea for four days in Warsaw. Before I met him in Rome and we have been together to Naples. Amazing trip :) He is a very nice and sociable person, really good friend, that you can rely on.

text: Andrea and Francesca were so kind to I couldn't have asked for a better host especially my first time couch surfing. They are the nicest people! Really sweet And funny. I actually didn't stay on a couch I had my own room! They are in ciampino are which about 13 min walk to the station. They work quite a bit so you are mostly on your own but in their free time you can count on them asking if you want to join them for dinner. I really enjoyed there home and there hospitality and I would absolutely stay again if they allowed me!
Andrea is a good host! He and his girlfriend met me in Rome before they go to the suburbs, where they live. He is hospitable, polite and very cute with cats :)

Andrea is a kind and knowledgable person. He picked me in the train station and showed me several places in Rome. We had great time talking about life and cultures. 
Andrea and his girlfriend took good care of me. Despite they were working, they managed to spend more time with me.
I couldn't have asked for a more enjoyable time than I had with you guys.
Thank you for your great hospitality  :) I hope to see you again

Andrea was a warm host. He and his girlfriend gave a tour of the city despite being busy and tired. They're amazing couple and have three nice cats. Andrea is also passionate about mountaineering and other outdoor sports. It was fun to talk about a lot of things including politics, living in Rome, life etc. We also went to Sforno, which has delicious pizza. And finally both of them were kind to drop me off at the station.

We started talking even before I started my trip, and as soon as I knew him personally I realized we have many things in common!

I spent lovely days with him and his two beautiful cats. We had great times together talking about life and he still played the piano and cooked a delicious pasta for me!

He is a wonderful guy, with a good heart and he‚Äôs a really gentleman too (what become rare nowadays). Thank you Andrea for everything, I really hope to see you again one day! And of course, you can visit me someday in Brasil hehe.

Ps. I miss you toooooo :)

text: Andrea is one of the most amazing guys I have met on my trip to Europe. He is extremely sweet, kind and generous and intriguing person who has many interests from sports to music and photography. He also makes his own furniture! On my first day in Rome, he picked me up at the Main Station, took me to his wonderful home and prepared wonderful authentic Italian dinner with wine! We had some great conversations and fun and his roommates are also awesome! Later, we went to see the Colosseum by night and he even spoke with my other host in Italian (who did not speak english) and even showed me where my host's place was for the next 2 days. He got me acquainted to Rome, the sights and roads and how to navigate the public transportation. He gave me deep insight into life in Rome and Italy and we also shared some deep conversations and perspectives. He made my experience in Rome absolutely amazing! Though we spent less than 24 hours, I feel like I already know him so well! See you soon!

text:
Fabio is a very nice and open-minded person with a good sense of humour.  The first my CS guest that didn't want to see just city centre of Warsaw, but was also interested in Wola district. It was a challenge for me to show to him this rather not touristic part of Warsaw :-)
Furthermore, he is keen on playing board games and catches on to the rules of more complicated games really quickly. 
Fabio is a talkative person that smiles a lot. It was a real pleasure for me to host him :-)

I was happy to host Fabio. He's a really friendly and social guy. The communication was also very good! And although I didn't spend much time with him, I enjoyed our small talks. Hope to see you again in Rome!

I hosted Fabio for two nights. He's an open and warm person who likes board games. We had a lot of things in common and talked a lot. I wish I had had the opportunity to show Fabio around during daytime but sadly I had to work. Hopefully the harsh weather and unfortunate circumstances did not put Fabio permanently off Finland and I will get to show him the sights during better season. Otherwise I will see you in Rome sometime!

Fabio stayed at our place for 3 nights before he could move into his student residency in Luxembourg. We offered him a matress in our living room him even though we had two surfers already in the guest room and it turned out fine. It was a bit tight in the flat for those days, but everyone managed to sleep and eat and have some good conversations. He is a friendly person and a lot of fun to hang out with and even joined us to a Couchsurfing meet-up :) 

When he forgot to take off his shoes in the flat, I asked him to so  and it was no big deal or any problem and he followed the rule afterwards. Communication is the key for living together in peace ;) As he will be in Luxembourg for 6 months, we surely meet again for some drinks or even another Couchsurfing meet-up!

Fabio is a cool, trustworthy, young man with lots of interesting stories to share with You. 
I hosted him for three days in Warsaw. We spent some some time together over a glass of wine, but mostly he had to manage his trip himself, due to my busy schedule, which makes me not the best host ever... but he was perfectly fine with that!  ;)

Fabio is a really good surfer! He is fun and adopted to my VIP casa really quickly! I feel bad for not spending much time with him but hey world is not over yet! Looking forward to meet in Rome this time or maybe Buda? ;)

I hosted Fabio for 3 nights. You can trust me that you won't get bored with this such a friendly Italian! Great person with a positive attitude to life. He was curious about my city and wanted to visit a lot of places there. Despite sightseeing we also enjoyed some board games together. I can truly recommend hosting Fabio :)
You are welcomed at my place again!

Fabio is a great guest and highly recommendable! He adapted perfectly into our little world, took part in our activities (even a Trial competition), joined some CS meetings, met up with friends and was not afraid to eat Frankonian food ;).
He is a smart guy and has goals in life and I hope to meet him again when he works in Germany one day, or before when I can make it to Rome ;) 
Thanks for fixing my Laptop!!!
See you soon, all the best!
inverseReference:
{'id': '18226945', 'text': "Rosi has saved my life actually!
Another couchsurfer that I have hosted this summer invited me in Nurember for a week, but she cancelled me last minute, it wasn't possible have a refound on my plane's ticket, but I didn't have any place where to stay but most important it has suddenly turned into a solo trip.
I was very lucky to contact Rosi, she was very generous to host me for 4 nights in her place in the same room of his son Robin.
She is very funny e polite, and always ready to help and give great tips about the city.
We had a great time, talking and going out during the evenings with other cs, we went to the volkfest, to try peruvian food and she brings me to eat  very delicious meat.  :) 
She also introduced me to hear friends and I was lucky to watch a Trial competition where her son was driving, I had the job to keep track of the points!  :D :D
I suggest to everyone to spend time with Rosi for any activities!
And don't forget about Robin! One of the best cs player!! good luck with trial!
Hope to see you and your son in Rome soon! :D", 'createdDate': '2015-09-19T21:26:11Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '735082'}, 'from': {'id': '1000493532', 'publicName': 'Fabio Raschini', 'publicAddress': {'id': '8622688', 'description': 'Rome, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1000493532/b3259832-6855-41b6-9076-09489ddcbaf7', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: I really enjoyed my time spent with Fabio.  We were able to chat about everything like we'd known each other for some time. We played some of Fabio's board games as well - really appreciate it :)
Fabio is a great host! I really enjoyed the time spent with him. He is really kind and helpful, always ready to help me when I didn't know where to go in the city. Hope to see him again!
Mmm don't let me forget that I have to give you back an umbrella someday! You saved me, you saved me a lot! üòä

Cookies & Cannolos
I stayed three nights and five relaxing days with Fabio. It was such a refreshing and funny time! We walked through the streets, ate really good local food and went out for a drink in the evening. One day we just stayed at his very comfortable and big flat listening to music, reading and hanging around. He is very smart and talkative so believe me that you can talk with him about deep things and stupid stuff in the same time. Laugh-attacks included! 
He's a master-cook at all and the best wine-bottle-opener you'll have ever seen!
At all I had a perfect stay and ate all the cookies he had... thanks so much for the time!

Fabio was a great host. He took time out of his summer holiday to hang out with me and we passed two chilled, low-key days in Rome. We struggled to find activities in the hot weather, but he happily let me drag him around town in the heat and we compensated with naps. :) He also took me to a great spot for a drink my last night and we took a beautiful walk near the Roman forum under the full moon. His spot was also in a great location, easy to find and with easy metro access anywhere in town. Thanks for hosting me and accompanying me my last days in Italy Fabio!¬†

Fabio hosted me for three nights in his home in Rome, although he had to study.
He is a fun guy and took me to one of the best ice cream places in Rome and showed me a lot of other nice spots. We cooked together and I could join him and his friends for Ferragosto to a lake, which was really nice. Thank you very much for that!

text:
Fabio is a great person, a very cool nerd, a very funny host and a very knowledgeable tour guide. I had a blast at laser tag with him and a wonderful time walking around ancient Rome. 
When my other host had a busy working schedule, he kindly offered to host me and took me to the beach and to meet some of his friends. We cooked together and generally had an amazing time. 
Fabio, if you ever want to surf my couch, you're welcome!

text: A friendly guy. We became friends easily

So Roberto and I started chatting a few months before I stayed, and he helped me so much along the way, giving advice about locations, hotels and my itinerary (for cities even outside of Rome). He even took time out of his life to help me book all of my train tickets for my 2 weeks in Italy!!!

His place is spotless, large, so nicely decorated, and welcoming! I even got to be in his guest bedroom and not a "couch" .  Guest bedroom is so clean, and COMFORTABLE, even though I was on vacation I did not want to leave that room.

text:
Couchsurfing Host Of The Year!!! Without a doubt! Roberto picked me up at the airport with the most amazing croissant In hand! He drove me to the city center and walked all the famous tourist sites with me, making sure I was drinking enough water along the way. Roberto‚Äôs place is exactly what he says it is. Close to the beach and to an amazing retail outlet! He dropped me off to shop and picked me up when I was done! Cooked an amazing pasta dish and introduced me to some Italian cuisine always making sure of what I eat and don‚Äôt eat! 

He is such a sweet humble soul, genuinely keen to know about my country and my people. He is well travelled and so we never ran out of things to talk about. He is polite, and super generous. Roberto takes the role of host to another level! You would be lucky to get hosted by him! 

Roberto thank you so much for everything. I look forward to welcoming you to South Africa. Grazie, no Grazie! üòä‚ò∫Ô∏è

When I went definitely to Rome, he picked me up at airport with a delicious sweet croissant smelting with üçØ hope one world with more gentlemen as him! His apartment is a dream with a indescribable decor with accessories he brings back from travel, he has a good taste! He shows me the best views and spots from Rome, that save me money and time, it was such wonderful because Rome is very big, probably one normal tourist without a special guide like Roberto would waste the double time to visit same places that I have been visited with his guide. Roberto was generous enough to let me stay in his beautiful house with my own room and a very beautiful balcony. He is so sensitive to whatever I might need -- always asking for what would make me feel comfortable. I felt super safe with him. Staying in his house was a complete treat for me. 5 star accommodation! :) 

Thank you so much Roberto. You have no idea how happy I was to have stayed at your place.

Roberto is a great person! He was such a good host and so kind and careful. He came to pick me up in the very early morning in Rome and we visited all together. He always drove me where I needed to go and we had a splendid time together.

text: My BEST host ever!! And he is SuperHOT too! (Lol) Roberto lives in an impeccably clean and tastefully decorated home, 25minutes by car from Metro Station Laurentina. He is amazingly kindhearted and drive me to and fro from the metro everyday during my 3 days in his home. On our first night, he prepared an authentic dish Saltimbocca. Delicious!! Second day, he made a light dinner with tomatoes on top of a crusty bread with the BEST buffalo mozzarella. Before I left on the last day, he drove me to a beautiful beach Torvaianica without the crowd of tourists and bought some sweets desserts for me to sample. He's great beyond words could describe. AND yes his bed was firm and comfy and bedsheets smell great! I slept like a baby. 101% safe, happy to stay with Roberto! I'll miss the fun and laughter we shared these 3 days. THEY ARE priceless! We have a date to see each other again yeah! Don't forget :) I'm definitely coming back to Rome to stay with you again. PS: Couchsurfing hosts are not obligated to cook you meals or drive you around. So if they did (Like Roberto) please do not take it for granted and appreciate from the bottom of your heart. Cheers!

text: Roberto was AMAZING! I was originally going to be in Rome for 2 days but I ended up coming to Rome for 1 night (and that too at 10pm and was flying out in the morning at 9am).. I told him I will probably hang out at the airport... but noooo he was SUCH A GOOD HUMAN BEING/FRIEND.. that he actually came to pick me up from the airport, showed me Rome city at night until 2-3am... provided me with a guest room to rest for 3 hours, woke me up at 6am, took me for breakfast and dropped me off at the airport.  Honestly this was such a blessing in disguise to meet Roberto. He is honestly the most nicest, caring and friendly person.. he did not have to do any of that but he did.. out of the goodness of his heart, and I am so thankful for this awesome experience. A true gentleman! We talked a lot, laughed a lot and got along very well. Thank you so much Roberto, hopefully our paths cross again in the future!!!

Roberto made us think twice about leaving Italy... if we could have, we would have changed our flight and spent more time with him. We learned many things about Italy with him: food (very yummy) wine, soccer, places, ideas, traveling, souvenirs, Italian language, life... I strongly recommend Roberto as a host/guest. If there was an award for the best Host ever, he would definitely get it ü•á.

How I should start to talk about Mr. Conflitti? Well, I can start saying that Roberto really knows the purpose of Couch surfing , always interested about traveling, asking his guests about their culture and countries, good listener and someone who has a good conversation with ( we didn‚Äôt want to go to bed). Also, he has a very clean and comfy apartment ( full of interesting souvenirs from different parts of world) . He as chef prepares a delicious Italian pasta and has a good selection of sweet liquors. Definitely a gentleman and hopefully a new friend, Ciao!!!

Roberto excepted me last minute. He is a really nice and friendly guy and a perfect host. His house is super nice , clean and you can see the sea out of his apartment. He picked me up at the metro station and also dropped me off at the airport the other day. We watched soccer together and had a huge delicious pizza. I can definitely recommend staying with Robert and thanks again for everything! Maybe we will see us again somewhere in the world :)

Roberto is a true gentleman, he is  fun and incredibly generous.  his house is spotless and shows his good decoration skills.  I can write down almost a million of adjectives regarding him as a true human being -  still I would not be able to describe him as well as I would like to - I will always feel that I did not described him as good as he is. particularly his generosity and kindness - adjectives are not enough to describe his good nature.
If you ever have a/the  chance to host him please do - you will be amazed with his personality, care and his generosity.  He was so kind towards me and did so much for me in everyway that he could possibly - I will always feel in debt with him.  If you are a lady do not miss the incredible chance to host him, he is a true gentleman with whom you will have fun and at the same time be respected. 
Nothing is a problem for him.  My flight was extremely late - no problem for him - I was feeling absolutely embarrassed to accept to go to his house so late - no problem at all for Roberto he came and collected me in the airport.
As soon as I entered his dwelling he did not know what to do to keep me comfortable and welcomed.  Although we arrived  so late still he wanted to prepare me something for eating.  Afer insisting so much I requested one toast oh my good he offered everything that you can possibly think about - his generosity should be stressed.
Thank you for everything you have done for me: Roberto  collected me in the airport and returned me to the airport. I never accepted this from any of my hosts, but with Roberto, you can never say no don't do it - he is an amazing creature.
You will always be welcomed in my house.  
Thank you once again from the botton of my heart.
Julia Ruiz

Ale is passionate about life and happy to meet people which made him host me and my friend in emergency even though he was busy renovationg his flat. This was a pure evidence of his great sypathy and ready to help attitude. Despite his tense day schedule he found time to tell us about the city and give hints for visiting as a professional guide! He had even free maps at home designated for the surfers. We dined together and had wanderful chats. He is definitely a great person to spend time with!

Staying with Alessandro was amazing!! He is the best host ever, very nice man, he explained me everything I needed to know about how to move in the city and we also shared one day watching the Giro de Italia final! He even picked me up in the station! I was able to use the kitchen which I love because I was already missing homemade food, and of course he taught me to make pesto from scratch ! Thank you Alessandro! Hope to see you in Colombia soon!

Alessandro is very frendly person. We stayed at his home in Rome together with my son Wiktor. We felt so good as at our own home. Alessandro prepared us a typical Italian dinner. He gave me later the recipe and now after returning home, I can cook an Italian dinner for my friends in Poland :) We really liked the Alessandro`s cat Clea. The cordial and warm atmosphere made me feel sorry to leave. I hope that this new knowledge will survive and we meet again. Maybe in Poland.

Ale  was such a great host! If u get the chance to meet him please dont miss it! Buena vida buenas vibras Grazie mile!!!!

text:
Ale has already 54 positive references and I am sure they all are true. text:
Ale you are awesome! Sophie and I really enjoyed staying with you in Rome and we hope that we can meet again someday. You were so considerate to take us around Rome even-though you had to work a lot, and that olive oil that you shared with us was an experience of taste that may never be repeated in my future. I could have drunken that straight out of the bottle, I swear it was so good. I liked how you had brought your construction experience into your own house with nice little additions like that cool double sink in the bathroom, it inspired me to think differently in terms of what can be done in interior design. We just really appreciate how you made an extra effort to make us feel welcome to your great city. I dont know if Rome would have been the same without you man. Good luck to you in the future and send me an email if you are ever in southern california: pendragonforest@gmail.com
-Ian

text: I¬¥m still overwhelmed that Alessandro had the time, the commitment and the level of hospitality to welcome me to Rome and his home. I would recommend Alessandro, his cat and couch to everyone who¬¥s travelling to Rome and recommend him to every host who gets a couchrequest from him on CS. text:
I, together with my girlfriend, was hosted by Alessandro for one night in Rome. Even despite the fact that we spent together a little time, it was very nice experience to meet him. Alessandro is very, very hospitable, he gave us some useful tips about Rome (especially Trastevere district, which looks in some way similar to the Old Town in Warsaw), we also had a supper and a breakfast together. He knows Poland very well for a foreigneer and it was a pleasure for us that we could compare our thought about this country. He also has marvellous cat - it was such a fun to play with her... I could highly reccommend Alessandro to everyone who is going to visit Rome. 
Thank you very much for your help. We wish to keep in touch and meet you once again someday - perhaps this time in Warsaw?

text: Alessandro was a very nice host! We had good conversation with him, he cooked us a delicious dinner, and he was very generous and hospitable. We had a very comfortable and nice stay in his place, and he has the most beautiful cat. He also gave us some good advice about places to visit and eat in Rome, and how to get around. Unfortunately he was sick when we stayed, so he couldn't go out with us, but we had a good time nonetheless and really appreciated his hospitality, even more so since he wasn't feeling well. Thanks for everything, Alessandro!

text:
Giordano will always be my CS HERO! This wonderful person was my very first couchsurfer experience, I was stupid enough to buy tickets to Rome arriving at midnight, with no one to host me and no public transport to move around because of the hour, but Giordano talked to me himself when I was in need, offered to host me and even went to pick me up at the airport, giving me the warmest welcome to beautiful Rome with delicious italian wine and cheese at his lovely apartment.  We ended up talking all night long about our lifes, projects and dreams and it was a treat. He's a passionate guy, creative, easy going, open minded, funny, easy to talk to, ready to hang out with you and take you to meet his funny friends for beers and pizzas enjoying the local night life, but also totally aware and respectful of your own space and independence. He's the sweetest person and a keen traveller himself, so you can talk for hours with him about countries you've both visited and it will be a blast. I felt absolutely safe with him from the very first moment -even from before meeting him, when we talked through Whatsapp- and it only took a couple of hours to feel I was with a long time best friend. Honestly, I absolutely fell in love with Rome and Giordano was probably one of the main reasons why. 
If you ever have the chance of meeting him or staying at his place, don't lose it, 'cause he's the nicer italian you'll meet. I must warn you tho that he's an aries, so might be stuck to his truth hahaha. Sorry man, it was just a too kind reference, it looked fake!! You must admit it was good tho ;)

Aaaanyways... Giordano, you'll always have a place in my heart and I'm really looking forward to see you again, wether is in Chile, Per√∫, Italy, Portugal, anywhere :)

P.S: Manuelita est√° aqu√≠!

It was a pleasure to stay with Jerry. Though I was not new to the city, we had a good time. He was so considerate about everything and just the perfect host. We talked so much about so many different things..I can assure you, there can be not a single dull moment around him. Would surely recommend to meet, host or be hosted by him. Thanks for having me..
Hope to see you somewhere in the world
Jerry is a great host. He's very kind, friendly and generous. When I was in Rome he showed me around the city which was so beautiful to see. I'd recommend him to other couchsurfers most definitely.

text: Jerry was a great host! His place is very comfortable and well located. We went out to see the city and I also saw his performance in Rome (he is a great musician). On Saturday he showed me a very nice and traditional Italy spot and also beautiful parts of the city. I had a fantastic time in Rome and I'm very grateful that Jerry was my host, he is kind and patient and I would totally recommend staying in his place! He was also very helpful and took me to the airport. Thanks, Jerry :)

Where do I even begin?! Jerry was the most wonderful person I could have ever asked for. He was waiting for me when I arrived and didn't take two seconds to treat me as if we had known each other for ever! He was eager to show me around and tell me all about his beautiful home. I had almost no time and was afraid I wouldn't be able to see much of Rome, but jerry provided the best 8 hour tour anyone could ever imagine! I couldn't be more thankful and would recommend him for your stay! His house is so close to the train station that goes to the airport and very easily accessed. I had a very early flight and was on time with no problem what so ever. Thank you again Jerry for your wonderful hospitality, knowledge, and friendship!! I hope to cross paths with you again!

At his place we felt like at home. Nice, kind, ready to help

Totally absorbed by his music interests. And he really has good taste in music.

Thank you!

text: Jerry responded to my emergency couch request and hosted me for two nights at his place. On my first night he gave me a tour of Rome, took me to a great gelato shop and we had a real italian dinner in one of his friends' restaurant. He's a talented musician and a kind person. Thank you for everything!

Jerry was amazing!!! He was the first person I met in Rome and he made everything easier. As a tourist you don't know anything, but he told me where I needed to go, how to get there and in the evenings we would meet up at a bar where he would be playing and had dinner together. I had a really good time staying at his place, he told me a lot about his life and I met a lot of friends of him. Thanks to him I know several places to get a drink and I can always call him if I want to know something or there's something wrong. Thank you so much for everything!

text: Jerry hosted me over Easter & it was really nice experience :) Since I have arrived he took care of me & I could feel safe & comfortable with him around. text: Jerry was a great host! He is very nice - almost too nice at times, haha, he can't say no to a couchsurfer in need! He lives a bit far from the city but he showed me how to use the trains and everything. He showed me around Rome at night, and we (he, another couchsurfer, and I) ate a fantastic dinner at his friend's restaurant. He gave me everything I needed - a comfy couch, a laundry machine (which sort of worked haha), a key to the apartment, a cell phone to use since mine was expensive, and a map (which I accidentally stole - sorry!). Highly recommended, very nice and trustworthy guy.

{'id': '10548533', 'text': 'A very smart and positive young girl...And a very well organized traveller! I generally don't leave keys to surfers but I did with her cause I could see in her a very trustful person.

Overall a positive experience, so I highly recommend her as "couchsurfer"!!', 'createdDate': '2012-07-01T12:25:21Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '3474345'}, 'from': {'id': '3408984', 'publicName': 'JERRYVASI', 'publicAddress': {'id': '6114105', 'description': 'Fiumicino, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/MV98U6K/17443806_l_899d1f7280d07b4a84e1fffc97af8837.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: I surfed with Jerry for three days while I visited Rome and I feel so so so so lucky that he was my host. He's a bit out from rome in fiumincino by the airport, but it really wasnt any problem. He explained exactly how to get to all of the sites, which ones i should go to and made plenty of great recommendations. I went and saw him play in a bar and in his friends restaurant and he¬∫s a great musician and they were very fun nights. he is an extremely kind, generous guy and a truly amazing host. At night after his shows he toured me around the city and I got to see some sites that i would not have seen otherwise. when I didnt have a host for the last night and he was leaving town he kindly set me up to stay at one of his friends places, who was also incredibly nice. I actually didnt end up staying there because she had me set up in her friends bed and breakfast in the center of rome! seriously jerry and his friends are some of the nicest most generous people i have ever met!
inverseReference: {'id': '10538597', 'text': "I can easily say that hosting Molly has been really an interesting and pleasant experience...Only two days, but enough to appreciate Molly's great personality...Positive, respectful, open minded, she showed big curiosity about all I was able to tell her about my country and my city...she loved the restaurants I suggested her and some Rome beautiful not touristic spot that I showed her.\r\nI strongly recommend anyone to host Molly, you won't regret it...and please be nice with her!\r\nI really hope to meet you again one day!!", 'createdDate': '2012-06-30T03:33:01Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2568075'}, 'from': {'id': '3408984', 'publicName': 'JERRYVASI', 'publicAddress': {'id': '6114105', 'description': 'Fiumicino, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/MV98U6K/17443806_l_899d1f7280d07b4a84e1fffc97af8837.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Jerry answered our last minute couch request and my best friend and I were very thankful. I stayed in Pier's house 2 nights with my two friends. He was really nice guy, he came to pick us up at train station and tried to spend his free time with us. He is running bar close to his flat, must try!! So many good beers (craft)! Thank you Pier, take care :)

Pier agreed to host me and 2 of my friends for 2 nights. Unfortunately we had to leave Rome 1 day earlier and we stayed with him for only one night. But we had the best experience with him. He and his roommate Adriano are very kind and funny. The day we arrive to Rome there was some public transport strike and Pier gave us advises on how to rich his home the best way and he even arrived at some piazza and picked us up there even though he had a lot of work at his own bar. Pier is very carrying and interesting. I would totally recommend staying with him to everybody! üòäüòäüòä

Pier and Adriano are the best hosts ever! I stayed with a friend at their house for two nights. We hang out at their pub which was amazing and shared a lot of stories. We are really looking forward to meet again! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Pier and his flatmate hosted me and my friend, and it was really nice! They are respectful and friendly and the house is amazing with a nice view!!

Thanks, xoxo

Pier and his roommate Adriano are super cool guys. From the moment our trip hasn't started yet, they kept an arrangement very well organased, were in touch and answered all the questions. There should be some other guests at the same time, so Pier warned us about that (so nice and politely). Guys are funny, helpful, friendly. They have an awesome bar called Drake (feels like home). We were lucky to try their home-made beer and the most delicious sandwich I have ever ate. The place is amazing, the view in the mornings is inspiring. They grow some plants, so take care of tomatoes :D I really enjoyed staying with them. Sleeping on the balcony due the hot weather in summer is highly recommended :D 
Wish you guys luck with all the things you do. Keep growing. 
Hugs from bus to Venice.

Pier and his flatmate are amazing hosts. He has picked us up at train station, has showed Coloseum at night to us or has driven us to airport :) The stay with them was great, they are so kind and helpful. It was so nice to meet them and I can only recommend them :)

Me and my friend Idun had the best experience at staying at Pier's! He is very cool, chilled, nice and fun guy. His roommate is super cool as well. We arrived (way later then expected) and were super tired after our travel and he didn't mind us go to sleep at his home although he was going out. His couch is super comfy and he gave us blankets. 
We felt very welcome and I can't imagine someone could have a bad time if staying with Pier!

Pier was an awesome host! It was my first couch surfing experience and it couldn't have gone better. He made sure we arrived safely and arranged a walk on the beach, then tried my first real Espresso. The craft beer at his pub is crazy good. I did go out for a concert and met his friends, but we were always encouraged to do whatever in the city, no pressure. Also, his place is interesting and comfy and I'm happy I met him, a really fun, open-minded but responsible guy!

Pier helped us so much!That was an emergency request and he hosted me and 2 of my friends same day for one night. Pier is so friendly,kind,open minded and awesome person. We spent such a nice evening together. 
Pier,im really happy to meet you.Thank you so much for your kindness and patience.Waiting you in Russia)

Me and my brother spent Pier's apertment six night! When we arrived at the station he came and pick us by car then we went to his home, he cooked pasta and it was really delicious. Pier has been great host to us. He has his own pub near to house and he makes craft beer! Really so cool. Thanks for everything. Hope to see you. It was pleasure to meet you Pier! :)

Am happy being the 1st surfer he hosted!He is running a bar where only 20 meter away from his home.I spent 2 nights at the bar for drinking couple of craft beers which is insanely tasty.Although he has been busy during the day,he dedicated me so much.And I sincerely appreciate it!‚ò∫
I can strongly recommend you to text him.Ciaoüòà

Domenico was very amazing !!! (And he still is, of course ! ‚ò∫Ô∏è) I‚Äôm very sad I didn‚Äôt stay more there ! Haha ! His roommate is also very nice ! We had a really great moment all together and I will always remember that !! He was really understanding and accommodating and we get along very well I think ! Thanks a lot for everything my friend, I hope to see both of you again ! Very welcome to Canada anytime you want !! Hihihi!! üòõüôÇ

Domenico and his flatmate Luigi are really nice, easygoing, helpful and friendly guys :) They cared about me very well from the beginning of my stay. When I arrived Domenico picked me up from the metro station, prepared delicious dinner and shared with me very good wine and coffee on the balcony of his house. He found  a lot of time to spend it together: we went for a concert of his friend to the conservatory and for a dinner with his friends, so I could try roman carbonara and italian coctails ;) I had such a great time! We also went for a great places in Roma with a beautiful views of the city and had interesting conversations abot our countries. Domenico is also big music lover, plays the guitar, sings and dances very well!
Thank you for everything and wish you the best :) See you in Poland!

Domenico is super friendly! Got us at the station by car an took us to the apartment, made us feel at home. He also took us out to see Rome at night and had a wonderful meal! Gave us lots of tips and places to visit. We stayed at Dominico‚Äôs house for two nights and certainly made a new friend along our trip! You and Luigui have a house in Portugal whenever you want!!

Domenico helped us so much in Rome. He picked us up late from the train station and took us on a tour of the city. The next day he packed all our belongings for us while we were out and met us near the train statio  with them so we would not miss our train.

Besides that he was hospitable and informative, giving us lots of advice and making is feel completely at home in his lovely apartment. He is an interesting guy with a great perspective on the world, and it would be a pleasure to stay with him again. Thank you for everything Domenico!
Domenico is a Doctor with a big and kindfull heart!He has always delicious coffee and makes you feel like home.You can absolutelly trust him! We will be glad to meet him again.
Domenici was an amazing host, very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my stay with him very much.

text:
Besides being completely kind all times, Fabrizio showed himself to be a little disorganized with his mattress and messy in the bathroom. Also he didn't show much initiative to help with housekeeping, as we live in a family house and it's not easy to keep things clean all the time with one more person among us. 

But he's not a bad person, not at all, the only thing is that he didn't show much CS spirit, and was more like in a hostel rather than in my house. I have to say I didn't tell him any have-to-do list of things, expecting him to know the least he could do to help maintain the house. Also it wasn't so bad because I was sick and home all the time. 

This is not supposed to be a destructive letter, but something to help both Fabrizio and the community in general get better. I hope we can still be friends.

Gracias por compartir conmigo,  compartimos poco,! se nos cruzaron los planes debido a mis estudios, pero a√∫n as√≠ compartimos, gracias por esas platicas te env√≠o un fuerte abrazo, buen viento y buena mar! S√∫per recomendado !

Thanks to share with me, we share a little for my studies , but we share, thanks for all conversations, hugs and good trip, greetings üôÉ! Very recommended üëãüèª

text:
Giulio was a great host! Even though he was very busy when I visited, he did his best to make me confortable. He gave me rides to the city centre or the metro on his way to and from work and he cooked the tradicional Lazio carbonara and delicious salmon for me. It was a shame I didn't visit during the weekend, when he would have had time to show me the city. 

So Giulio, you are more than welcomed if you want to visit Madrid!

Giulio is a great host and a kind person! He is very welcoming and friendly and it's a safe place for women traveling alone. Giulio introduced me to cannelloni and true Roman carbonara! He is indeed very nice and I can genuinly recommend him.

They say the first choice is the right one, and I may say it was definitely true in my case !! :-D Giulio was an amazing host and a lovely man. He is a great conversationalist and is very knowledgeable about a wide variety of fields. Among other things, he showed me Rome in its best light, and I genuinely enjoyed the few days spent with him. I‚Äôm extremely grateful for his time. He really made my stay as pleasant as posible, I‚Äôm really grateful to him for that and I‚Äôd be happy to return you the favor by welcoming him here in Nizza. Well, I thing that might be the basis of an enduring friendship. Grazie ancora per tutto e a presto ! Un abbraccio anche a loulou ;-)
Did not have a chance to meet with Giulio although he  kindly helped me. Hope to see you .
Gulio is perfect. Really nice and friendly. Everything was perfect :)

Giulio!!!!!

One of the best couchsurfing experience and wonderful to could have time together with him for last stay of my whole trip in 6months!!!!!

How he is calm, generous and took care of me soooo much!!!

i believe that we could have a really great time in Tivoli and walking around the park, each time he cooked for me pasta for dinner was soooo amazing!!!!

He is so curious and keen to know the person well.
His attitude is not as the host, as the friend from the beggining.
I feel so happy about it!!

I'm so appreciate for everything!!!
He always tried to me to be comfortable, to showing culture, history, thinking, people in Italy.
We talked a lot in these 3days!!!
He gave me a lot of great gifts of human being with warm-hearted!!!!!

If you have a chance to see him, just don't miss it!
It'll be so worth of your stay in Rome!!!

Thank you very very much Giulio!!!!!

I'm so so so impressed all what you gave me and im sure to come back to Italy thanks to you!!!!

Grazie mille!!!!!!

text: Giulio is a very nice and helpful host, he wanted to spend time together and he showed me the city. His home is very cosy and nice place not far from the center. I had very good time in Rome and I recommend staying with Giulio ;)

Francesco was so kind and flexible!! I was lucky to have him host me. He accommodated my last minute request and I am very grateful for that! I wish we had more time to chat, but am grateful we got to meet! Thank you again - I really appreciate it!!

I‚Äôm really happy I‚Äôve met with Francesco!
He is great person, with very kind heart and noble character. 
Staying at his apartment was nice, Francesco is great host, very polite and helpful. He is a type of person easy to speak with like with old friend. Most of all in apartment I enjoyed very spacious balcony with hammock! 
So thanks so much for inviting me your place and spending time together!

Francesco was very kind and nice with us, he showed us the city and made sure we are comfortable in his home. Unfortunately we just stay one day at his place so we didn't have time to try his pasta but I am sure it is great. I would recommend him totally, he is a person worth of knowing.
Francesco is one of my best friends and a great man, generous and knowledgeable. I definitely recommend him as a special person. Patrick

Francesco is a great host! I asked him for accomodation the same day I needed. I was in a kind of an emergency situation. My original host (Luca Conti) cancelled me just right before meet me late the night I arrived to Rome. So, I asked Fran and quieckly replied yes! He is very polite, respectful, kind and smart, not talkative at the beginning but then he really talk!  We had a great dinner with two of his friends, he cooked pasta and I enjoyed a lot chatting with them! He left me at the airport and gave me a lot of space and felt very comfortable in his lovely new apartment with a great and big terrace with a hammock. Grazie mille per tutti Fran!!! I hope see you again maybe in Patagonia (?). Hugs!!

If you could see my face right now, you‚Äôd see a look of sincere gratitude and appreciation. Andrea has an authentic personality, very warm and genuine. His place was clean and very well located. I‚Äôm touched beyond words. Thank you for having me, it was a great pleasure to meet you! Ciao x
fromPublicAddressDescription: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Andrea is a nice kind person. We had late arrival in Rome. He was waiting for us in spite of he had to wake up early to work next day. He was busy with work, so we didn‚Äôt have much time to spend together, but we had nice dinners together at his home. He cooked tasty pasta for us and he was very polite and intellectual. We liked to stay at Andrea. Thank you!

Me and my friend spent with Andrea only 1 day.  After our communication experience can surely say that he's smart, intelligent a little bit introvert, but really polite human being. It was Sunday so we were able to hanging out together the whole day and he's done absolutely all his best to make us feel comfortable and having fun. 
He showed us the city, we drank beer at park with one of his friend who also joint us. It was a pleasure to meet a guy like him.
Thanks again.

My best friend and me stayed for three nights at Andreas place and we really felt like home in this time. Andrea is a very friendly and helpful guy, who has to work a lot, but who always inquired if we were alright. 
His flat is very central, close to the main station. He offered us a large bed in a separate room and clean bathroom! During the day he gave us his keys, so that we could go and come whenever we wanted.
Thank you so much for everything, Andrea ü§ó

Giorgio hosted me in a last minute request when I was in a very difficult situation in Rome. He was very friendly and helpful. He also made a donation of clothes and shoes to the refugees I'm working with, what makes me think he has a good heart. Thanks, Giorgio, I wish the best for you.

I arrived in Rome and met an excellent person who stayed for 4 nights, took me to see the city on a motorcycle, invited me to have a pizza, and the first night I had a delicious charcoal pasta. We enjoyed and laughed a lot together and without To think about it I would stay with it and recommend it

Giorgio is calm, open minded, friendly and willing to share and learn. He welcomed me with a warm pasta dinner and picked me up at the train station regardless of the ridiculous delay of my train.

He shared with me his life in Rome and the beauty of Rome at night with a bike tour. I'd have to say the bike ride was the highlight of my visit in Rome! I took the bike to Appia park which was another mind blowing experience of my stay at Trastevere.

His home is amazingly clean, tidy, cool and modern. It's strategically located next to Rome city centre which makes it a fantastic experience walking to the Vatican city and the main attractions in Rome. After some period of traveling in my journey, I felt home staying there and it was very cosy and comfortable.¬†

He taught me how to make Italian coffee and gave me pointers on where to go around in the city. He's patient, sensible and well educated, a true gentleman who is genuine in sharing what he has to offer.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Kuala Lumpur, Kuala Lumpur Federal Territory, Malaysia

text: Giorgio is one of the best host that I've had, super respectful, happy, honest, friendly and he cares that you have a good experience in this amazing city. I experimented peace with his presence, we went around with his bikes and cooked a delicious pasta. If you have the opportunity to meet him take it!! It was so great to meet you Giorgio! I hope to see you again maybe in Mexico if you go to travel there. Thanks so much again for everything! I wish you the best always ‚úåüèªüòä

I enjoyed  to stay 3 night at Giorgio's home with my friend Senem. I found him really friendly and flexible. He knows very well eternal city, we walked around together, talked about our lives, seen the open cinema festival the Saturday night 20 October which I loved so much, went to a good ambiance Pub together and have danced all night. Sunday noon we had a really interesting discussion.. and i'm wandering if Rome is more magic or Paris (or Florance).. for knowing that I have to torno di nuovo :)
Grazie Griorgio

amazing guy, he met me on the wat home and by the way show me the main places of Rome. He has very interesting modern apartment almost in the heart of city! We had conversations about all our life! I had enough my own time, all the same time we spent some evning and day together, riding by bicycles and walking by the city.
 And it was wonderful when he cooked different pasta on dinner, discribing which one special today

George very kind and nice person, he hosted all people with very good attitude, seemed like we old nice family)

Thank you! And Wish you have a wonderful your own traveling by couchsurfing too

Giorgio is a wonderful host - welcoming, hospitable, respectful, kind, and a good conversationalist. He took the time to tell me which places to see, and which churches held the best artworks, or where to go for shopping. We spent an evening walking around town and seeing the sites by night, eating gelato; and sharing a couple of meals. He even translated for me when I was trying to buy some wine to take home! His house is comfortable, clean, and super easy to get to and from. Thanks Giorgio for a great stay in Rome - you helped to make it the high-light of my trip! See you in Australia soon

Giorgio is the kind of person with whom you can immediately have conversations about a million topics, feel at home and have a good time like with an old friend. He is very friendly and attentive to the traveller‚Äôs needs, and makes sure that his home is perfectly comfortable for you. I had a great experience with Giorgio in the true spirit of the CS community! See you next time :)

Giorgio kindly approved my request to host me after night bicycle ride as I'm staying out of Rome during my vacation. He has left only good impressions! My recommendations! 
And many thanks to you man for organizing that bike ride. Rome in the night it beautiful!

My first expeience, with having an Iranian hostÿå was very good. I was lucky that Ramin welcomed me at his place. Such a kind person. His girl friend, Fahime made my stay more pleasant by her cares and attentions. I had a nice conversation with her at our long breakfast times. They kindly offered me a nice dinner. The cook seemed more tasty by the well prepared cocktail, made by Ramin. Thank you both. Hope to meet you soon again, with Iran or NL.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Tehran, Tehran Province, Iran (Islamic Republic of)

text:
my best couple is Ramin and Fahim! :)  they are fun, friendly and open mind person... I stayed 3 night their home and we had gread time and they shared me everything! 

you are beautiful guys! I love you! üòç

I promise you, we will meet again!

Ramin and his girlfriend were very attentive and hospitable hosts. Ramin throughout the entire trip was always in touch, always answered our questions and requests. We really enjoyed staying with them and It was amazing to know new about new culture and different perspective of life from different angel ! Among other things, they also fed us and gave us food for our next trip! these are amazing people! We are glad to meet with them.

My boyfriend and I stayed with Ramin and his girlfriend for three nights and they were absolutely incredible hosts. Ramin showed us how to make amazing cocktails and we had a couple great meals together. Their flat was also clean and comfortable and we felt very at home. I would highly recommend staying with this lovely couple, it was an awesome time and they made us feel very welcome.

We want to say thank you Ramin and Hahim for hosting us for 2 nights. They‚Äôre amazing, funny and friendly. We had a dinner together with Italian pizza and wine ;) Ramin made very tasty cocktails. They helped us and to make our trip and to visit all the beautiful places in Rome. Home is very clean and nice, there is a bus station in 5 minutes walking. Hope to meet you again! Courageous guy hitchhiking and biking all over. He is friendly, smart and has some interesting tales to tell. Davide, I hope your journey continue as good as it has been so far. Cheers

Davide is a really great guest. He cooked for us and it was delicious !
Thank you again.

It was a delight to host Davide. He's a very nice, respectful and easy going guy.
We wish him all the best for his journey
 and will welcome again any time!
Davide is very sympathetic and has a lot to share. A perfect guest.

I lent a room to Davide in Burgos and everything was OK. He left all as well as he found ir or even better and behaved as we planned. I wish you a very good journey to Italy and I hope that you live great experiences along the way and know a lot of couchsurfers. Have fun!
He is a very nice guy! Kind and friendly! I didnt have so much time to be with him but it was a pleasure to host him! Have a nice trip!

Davide and Oti were fenomenal guests. Friendly, kind, really smart, well traveled... The kind of people that you should't miss the opportunity to get to know - they are amazing.
They cooked delicious vegan meals!
At some point I got a cold, and they were always checking on me, preparing various teas, and making sure I was alright.
I am glad I hosted both of you - Oti and Davide - good luck on your travels and hope our lives cross together (at least) once more.

I hosted this wonderful couple david and Oti 2 nights after receiving their last minute request and i didn't regret it ... i felt bad i couldn't spend more time with them ... so thoughtful and fun clean and energetic...responsible and respectful... very experienced in life ... you can learn a lot from them and never get enough... if you have the chance to host or meet them do not hesitate... you'll love being around them... thank you for the amazing time spent together
Stay safe... cheers
beautiful experience with nice poeple david  and oti you welcome in fez again

Davide and Otilia are two wonderful people. We spent three days together and we had the chance to talk about many topics: travels, lifestyle, food... Spending time with them is very interesting, their many travels and experiences gave me the chance to learn new things and to discover maybe something about myself as well. I would recommend them as surfers, they are very respectful and clean. And I fell in love with Otilia's aubergine salad (don't remember the Romanian name ;-P).

Davide and his girlfriend Oti were very nice and friendly, we had had a wonderful time!, we cook for them and they cook for us a delicious meal too , we made good friendship, and I really hope they also felt the same way about us.

Karem and Thom from Dover, England üòä

Davide and Oti..thank you so much for visiting me. you are very respectful and peaceful guest and i hope you felt welcome anytime.  i am glad to meet you guys. take care and enjoy life. best wishes from germany 
sebastian

I hosted Davide and Oti for two days. Despite of I had not much time, we still managed to spend some together in the city and also at my place :-) They are really inspiring long term travelers, that manage to travel years with not much possessions or money. So we had plenty cool stories to share and they motivated me to follow my dream of living as a kind of digital nomad. If you ever get the chance to host them - do it! Good luck for all your way and see you somewhere in this beautiful small world soon :-)
If you ever go back to Nuremberg - feel invited to my place again ;-)
Hosting Davide and his girlfriend was a pleasure, they are very friendly and happy to share their knowledge. Their lifestyle was very inspiring to me, thank you guys!

I figured David and her girlfriend needed some well deserved rest so I tried to be as nice as possible :). I expected them to arrive around 18.00 but they ended up having a 3 hour delay. We stil managed to have a fun but short evening with alot of interesting talks :)

Davide vs Singapore. Davide 10, Singapore 10. There was no contest to begin with in my book. I must remain impartial and call it like it is. Davide likes to make his own adventures and it certainly shows in his stories. He may have escaped halfway around the world to avoid his fans but he is still famous in Indonesia. Everywhere you go, Hey Mister, don't forget to relax and go with the flow.
inverseReference: {'id': '18311903', 'text': "After an year spent in Indonesia, our stay at Jake's place, was a great way to recharge our batteries in clean organized Singapore! He was superbusy, but despite this he accepted to host us and gave us all the comfort we could imagine and even more. We didn't manage to spend a lot of time together but we can say that he is a good and generous guy, we wish for more people like him to exist!", 'createdDate': '2015-10-06T13:37:24Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '3461956'}, 'from': {'id': '399154', 'publicName': "Davide Vadala'", 'publicAddress': {'id': '3104302', 'description': 'Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/399154/d5f2b7e8-994b-4edc-8e4b-7a9594761f74', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
It was a really pleasure hosting Davide and his girlfriend Oti, Were my first Italian-Romanian Couple. Davide even asked me about my interest in learning Italian and even gave me some pronunciation lessons which was really really awesome. I only felt bad they couldn‚Äôt stay longer. I really enjoyed their company. They gelled really really well with all the other couchsurfers who I hosted that particular week. Where suddenly I had 10 surfers in my hands. But they were really really understanding about the situation. 

When you are in food trail enthusiast you need to ensure that no one is left out hungry, everyone must be fed well. That‚Äôs the game. Really enjoyed singing with Oti. Davide is a superb photographer and a sculptor, carver and creator and I became an instant fan of his work. It was really really awesome. 

Thank you for staying with me and hope you come again.
inverseReference: {'id': '18316373', 'text': "It might look banal to say that we had a great time at Ziggy's, but that's actually the truth!\r\nWe were catapulted quite fast into Iron-Ziggy world, he came to pick us up and we didn't have to worry about anything, everything was already planned! Let's go for dinner with other couchsurfers, ah ok you are vegetarian, I'll take care of that, now let's go  back home, it's Karaoke time! etc. etc. And he does this every day, that's why he deserve his title of Iron-Ziggy! That's even more impressive considering that during the week he works at night.\r\nWhile we were at his place there were always other nice couchsurfers around, sometimes as many as 10! Ziggy was always up to interact with everybody, helping and giving rides when needed and he loves singing. He is a funny guy that likes to speak and make the other laugh. Your experience won't be the same in Georgetown without staying with Iron-Ziggy!", 'createdDate': '2015-10-07T10:02:17Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1876920'}, 'from': {'id': '399154', 'publicName': "Davide Vadala'", 'publicAddress': {'id': '3104302', 'description': 'Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/399154/d5f2b7e8-994b-4edc-8e4b-7a9594761f74', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: One of the best people I met is Davide, he is kindly , polite , wise . He and his GF stayed in my home for several days and there were great days we spent together. Hopefully I can meet him again, may be in Italy. :)

text:

thanks for visiting our hometown..

regard

text:
Davide and Otty (his girlfriend).. They come to Samarinda and explore some areas in East Kalimantan by hitchhiked,, and I think it's a best way,, because in East Kalimantan there is no public transportation in many areas,, They are tolerant surfers (every traveller, backpacker or whatever must have this character),, One of evidenced  is when they not too much complain about transportation, weather, host, food, bed, etc.. 

As long as they are in Samarinda I was very busy so I can only help them at night .. 
They are in Samarinda in short period and we didn't have too much chance to talk..

I hope you have a memorable & unforgetable journey in East Kalimantan..
(^_^)
inverseReference: {'id': '17063128', 'text': "If you want to have an amazing experience in Kaltim, just contact Brili and she will take care of you not only in Samarinda, but also anywhere her network can reach! text: david and otti are very kind and polite couple from jogja, its so nice to have them spending a night with me and my friends at home, having dinner together, talking about borneo trip, also learning bahasa. hopefully we can met again in other time and places.
inverseReference: {'id': '17062978', 'text': 'We had a great time with Puteri and her friends, but unfortunately we could stay only one night. text:
Hosting Davide and Oti is a pleasure for my family especially my mom. She loves if any foreign traveller who can speak bahasa Indonesia. They are a ideal example for couchsurfer. They are easy going person and don't expect anything from their host. You can talk easily all themes with them, and they love share their experiences too. I'm totally agree if we talk like old friend, because they are student in Yogyakarta and the same city where I have been studied my Bachelor. 

Don't forget, they are vegetarian, so I hope the next host can show and introduce other Indonesian vegetarian dishes other than Gado-gado, lotek, tahu tek, or cap cay. lol

Brili and me hope that we can meet in other time in Yogyakarta.
inverseReference: {'id': '17063161', 'text': "Indra is a calm, nice and generous guy that will make you feel like old friends since the first moment. We were happy to meet him and his girlfriend Brili earlier, a great couple!", 'createdDate': '2015-02-02T13:02:03Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1006376347'}, 'from': {'id': '399154', 'publicName': "Davide Vadala'", 'publicAddress': {'id': '3104302', 'description': 'Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/399154/d5f2b7e8-994b-4edc-8e4b-7a9594761f74', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: I am sorry because I couldnt host Davide and girlfriend. My local couchsurfing friend helped them to provide hosts. They are really passionate person and care for environment values. I learn a lof of things about understanding the way of living clean without harming animal with different point of view. Anyway, we spent one days strolling around in the city convention and had nice chat., Thank you for reference.
inverseReference: {'id': '17063062', 'text': 'Me and my girlfriend stayed for 2 nights with Qori. Since  we are an unmarried couple he managed to find us a solution for us to stay together with his friend Agung, and he also slept with us sharing the floor space after talking till late night and playing video games. inverseReference: {'id': '16284851', 'text': "We had a great experience with Akos, Kata and their baby (the sweetest, cutest we have ever met!), and one of the few to choose herself her name :)\r\nUnfortunetely the first night we weren't able to synchronize, so we ended up staying at their place only one day, but it was enough to taste their hospitality and share our life stories and making us wish to go back in the future!", 'createdDate': '2014-09-13T19:27:53Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2088243'}, 'from': {'id': '399154', 'publicName': "Davide Vadala'", 'publicAddress': {'id': '3104302', 'description': 'Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/399154/d5f2b7e8-994b-4edc-8e4b-7a9594761f74', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
Davide is quiet and relaxed, all his power is inside of him. You think that he just sits in the corner and thinks like a normal person, but he already plans ahead his trips for the next 3-4 months. 
Following him in the net, he had a looot of unlucky things happened, but i wish him the best in his adventures! 

PS: Migel came again a week ago and he is still here. Haaaappyyyy!!!
inverseReference: {'id': '16284958', 'text': 'Julian is a great guy, that according to the situation can be a funny clown, a romantic guy or an old friend. text: Davide and Oti both stayed at my place in Thessaloniki ; even though I was really tired and stated that I wouldn't be social during they stay, they showed a lot of respect for my intimity (and laziness), invited me to eat with them when they cooked their own dinner, and brought cakes (:D). inverseReference: {'id': '15383094', 'text': 'Melody welcomed us in her place in Thessaloniki, helping us with our first impact with Greece and giving us nice tips and suggestions on local food. text: Very positive guy! I enjoyed his company and his stories! We met during the celebration of Veliko Tarnovo and we get a little bit lost in the crowd, but anyway - godspeed and see you around the world :D
inverseReference: {'id': '14973676', 'text': 'Hristo hosted me and my girlfriend at his place even if he moved to a new location just a few days earlier!
