text:
Simone was so cool host! I came to his place with one friend. Unfortunately he needed to work during this time but we spent all evenings together with him and his roommates, drinking and having fun. I hope we wasn't too loud? :p He cooked for us delicious vegetarian food (I'm a meat lover but it was tasty - trust me!), showed us cool Italian music and I was laughing a lot. They helped us to plan our trip, recommended places to eat, we went for a good bye dinner even <3 (and place with coffee and croissants next to his place is so nice!). And I really like a drawing next to your bed :)
Simone, you and guys are always welcome in Poland in mine or Aga's place! Hope see you again! <3

I know we will see each other one day again. He has no choice of course ü§™ His friends are very cool, friendly and funny also. Took good care of me and my friend. THANK YOU SIMONE!!!

text:
I was very happy simone is sociable,nice person in your place was comfortable...!! He has 2 good friends I was a special Day 
Thanks Simone

Simone hosted me during weekdays, even though he works a lot those days, and also weekend. His home is super big and there's plenty of space! The day I arrived, Vittorio (his roomate) cooked a typical roman pasta for me and we talked and listened to music during the afternoon. Both of them were really nice and fun guys and you won't regret staying at their place! 
Thank you guys and see you in Madrid!

I had already accepted two hosts in Rome, but I took Simone's number in case of emergency after he responded to my request. It turned out that my friend and I had an emergency and had nowhere to go after a really bad experience with the second host. I messaged Simone very early in the morning, and he immediately responded. He didn't ask for details, just sent us directions how to get to his place and his address. After about 1,5 h we already were at his apartment safe and sound. We are very grateful for that! A really bad experience in Rome turned into a nice one.
Simone welcomed us very warmly and offered us two very comfortable beds. It felt really safe at his apartment. We could have a rest after a tough night. 
He is very friendly, cheerful, smiley, caring and interesting. He ordered for us the best pizza in Rome and shared his life with us, which was awesome :) 
We really loved our short stay with him.
We already miss you, Simone! Again, thank you for everything <3

So, I stayed with Simone and Vittorio after a month-long WWOOFing gig in Abruzzo and my weekend with Vittorio and his wonderful friends was the perfect transition back to civilization.  As soon as I got to their home, right by the subway stop, I felt like I had been adopted.  I had dinner with them and they showed me the proper way to eat buffalo mozzarella and the weekend just went up from there. The second day we explored around the city and went out for an epic lunch, which consisted of several bottles of wine, a lot of really delicious food, more wine, befriending and serenading a group of Australian expats, and improvisational busking on a bridge.  So that was at... 7pm?   It was SUCH a good weekend and I am so grateful to Vittorio (Simone was out of town, but I was able to meet him the last day and he was lovely) and his friends for their incredible generosity and making me feel so so welcome.

I was travelling with a friend and we were perfect at Simone's! His apartment is very close to the metro and bus station and he's very friendly and flexible. We couldn't hang out because he worked, but he was always reachable and thougthful. Recommendable!

Me and my friend, √Ågi stayed two nights at Simone and Vittorio in Rome. They are both really flexible, and kind-hearted guys with good vibes. Unfortunately, Simone was busy with work during our stay, but we went to an open air concert with Vittorio, and had some pasta con pesto for lunch the other day. We had good times in Rome altogether due to the laid-back atmosphere they have at their place, and I would recommend anyone to stay with them once in Rome. Thank you for everything, guys!

text: Pushkar spent here one night only, but we talked a lot, often comparing our respective cultures looking for similarities and differences. He was an easygoing guest, but also puctual and clean, kind and respectful. It was a pleasure to host him and I suggest anybody else to do as well.

Even though he only stayed one night, he was great to have in my home. We enjoyed pizza and tv in the evening. The next morning we had a great conversation up until he left. I would definitely host him again.

I must addmit, I didn't spend as much time with Pushkar as I could have, since these days he was staying at my place I got buried with some family and personal stuff. But the time we spent together, he was kind, respectful and funny. And he instructed me on Indian cousine. And cooked me a meal as well. It was really tasty. Thanks Pushkar :)

Pushkar and Danica are friendly and easygoing. We had a drink in the historic center and the day after a good breakfast with pasticciotto and coffee with ice cubes and almond milk. They are good talkatives and we had nice chats and joked around. It was just a beautiful meeting!

Pushkar is a very interesting person to talk to. He is kind, independent and easy going. We spoke in Italian together, his Italian is perfect!
Good luck with your future life, I'm sure, everything will work out!

text:
He's a person of substance,  conversations were meaningful and he has a great sense of humour. He showed me around Rome and shared his experiences he got in this beautiful city. He took me to a free Limoncello testing store, which we both loved after we got to try every other liquor they sell.
In his room there is more than enough space for two people, if you want some alone time you can use the garden or the rooftop terrace, that Rome is so famous for. All in all I enjoyed my stay at his place, he was always respectfull of my privacy and he was beyond accomodating with his keys when there was some access issue while he's at work. I hope I get the chance to visit him again.

Pushkar is a super cute boy, he received me at the last minute and he had Indian food for me. The next day he showed me incredible views of Rome and a delicious pizza. He is very gentle and funny. I feel was respectful to me and very good vibes.
Thanks for everythingüåµüá≤üáΩ

text: Our stay at ale's house was awesome. He's exactly as they said, welcoming, nice and gently. He understood our times and was very flexible, took me and my friend to the best places to eat (i still miss that gelato!) When we arrived, he came and look for us in the metro station and when we left he even took us to the train terminal,¬† he loves argentinian culture so we could share a lot of points. Also we went with his car to trastevere and a¬† beautiful sightseeing spot, even when he had to work. What an incredible person! Gracias por TODO. Te esperamos en argentina para comer asado :)

text: Me and my friend stayed at Alessandro's house for 3 nights and it was a great experience! We went out to eat pizza, we watched a World Cup game together and we really enjoyed the city of Rome! He was extremely kind in picking us up and taking us to the metro station and adjusting his schedules with ours! We felt at home all the time, and could not wish for a better CS! Thank you for everything Alessandro, Pamela and I hope to see you in Brazil! Cheers üçª

Alessandro was fantastic! He picked me up from the airport and had a very big music collection. He drove me to the metro and made a map of places to see while I was in Rome. We got pizza and a cappuccino and they were both amazing. It was great because he knew the places to go to get the good stuff. His house was very nice and I slept on a pull out couch bed. Alessandro was very nice and really helped me have a wonderful time in Rome.

Alessandro is so fun and thoughful. He even made me a map of the places I should visit while I stayed at Rome. My visit was very fun and I felt welcome... I'll definitely visit him again and I hope he goes to Ecuador so I can receive him at my home as well...

Alessandro helped me a lot during my stay in Rome.
He is very funny and kind.
I really appreciate all what you did for me. 
Hope to see you soon !!

My friend Daniela and I stayed with Alessandro for 4 nights. He was very accommodating and went out of his way to show us a good time. I would recommend him 100%! Alessandro we wait for you in Texas in July! Thanks my friend!

text: Alessandro is the best coucher ever. He is very kind and supportive and he gives a nice perspective on Italian culture. I am very thankful and I hope to visit him again.

text:
I stayed 3 nights with Alessandro. He was a perfect host! He picked me up at the airport, he payed for me at a restaurant, he was really helpful and flexible. We laughed a lot together, and he made me discover good Italian music. Thank you very much Alessandro, and if you want to come to France let me know ;)
Ciao!
Alessandro was so great and nice! He picked us up from the airport and gave us many suggestions on things to do. He will be a life long friend! Took us to his favorite Italian restaurant. Stay here!

fromPublicAddressDescription: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires City, Argentina

text: Alessandro was the sweetest guy! He took us with him to the beach for a day and we also enjoyed a free concert with him and his friend! (Who was also super friendly and fun) We had many good conversations with Alessandro on several different topics and we all made a nice dinner together as well one of our nights there! We will always remember the hospitality Alessandro provided he was always very nice and thoughtful!We hope to return the favor in the future! Thank you so much again for everything! Grazie Mille!

Alessandro was such a great host!! My friend and me stayed with him for 3 days and every day we met after his work and had dinner together. He showed us the best places to eat pizza and pasta and was very friendly and easy to talk to. His apartment is really clean and in the morning he took us to the metro station, from there it is very easy to reach the city center.¬† Thanks for everything, and see you soon in Budapest!:)

Alessandro was the BEST host ever. I traveled with my sister and her colleague and Alessandro was really nice to offer us all a place to stay and amazing experience in Rome. He picked our bags and then drove us home in the evening. His apartment is very smart and comfortable. He lived half an hour away from the center but it was really easy to get there by bus and train. Alessandro is very friendly and polite, he answered us immediately when we had any problems.  We had amazing discussions about Italy, Russia, actors, paintings, sports and music. Alessandro is fond of tennis and plays it in a team. Honestly, by the end of our stay all three of us felt like Alessandro was our family member! We all miss him so much and hope to see him soon in Moscow.

Alessandro met us at the metro station, took us to a place to eat pizza and gave us many sugestions about the city. He also made us a great italian pasta and was always in a good mood. Thank you, Alessandro! See you in Brazil! :)

Alessandro is a super nice person!! Really kind and friendly. 
He has a passion for tennis and football, but also for really good music! 
He taught us some tips for making pasta, as we saw him making it, it was the best pasta of my life! 
Thank you so much for everything Alessandro! Hope to see you again in Portugal üòäüòä
We had a wonderful time in Rome, all thanks to Alessandro! He's very kind and welcoming. We would definitely stay with him again.

Alessandro is an amazing person. Really I dont know what to say in this reference because he couldnt have been a better host. My friend and I stayed 4nights at his place and all 4 of them were made so easy thanks to Alessandro. He picked us up when we arrived in the centre, he went out with us the very first night to eat pizza and all the typical tasty food, he dropped us to the metro whenever he could, he searched for a place to print our tickets, he helped me search for my stuff when I got stolen, he was taking care of everything! But the most important of all is that he is so good-hearted, kind and sweet person. He also showed a lot of understanding when we caused him some trouble by not being able to communicate-due to net connection problems- when away from home. We also spent the last night together..he took us to Trastevere, a beauuutiful place with perfect pizza *yummy* ! Alessandro thank you SO MUCH for everything, you are an exceptionally good person and a very pleasant company! Stay like this! Waiting for you in Athens!!!

My stay with Alessandro was a good one!  His place was clean and he explained the location very well, and often came to pick me up from the subway. His enthusiasm for traveling is evident in his talks and he really makes it a point to sit with the person to understand the place they come from, the culture, the food which not everybody does. He couldn't show me around due to his work timings but we often had dinner together, at home or outside. On my last night in Rome - he treated me with a nice dinner which was very sweet of him. I will be happy to host him when he visits India and show him around and am definitely staying with him again if I visit Rome again.

Alessandro is a kind man, generous, worried about you and your well-being.

But I had to leave his place every morning at around 7 and 7:20 am. There I felt that I had to hide myself 'cause he was so worried about the neighbours' and the doorman's opinion that I had to speak lower and couldn't even listen to my music. And his manners to say a lot of things are kind of rude.

text: I stay with Alessandro 2 night . He help me a lot in the Roma. Alessandro is a very nice and thoughtful person. We cook together and made good conversation. He can be the most sweet host in Roma. Thanks for everything Alessandro :))

Alessandro is so nice!!! he has helped us a lot, offering his help and giving us a place to sleep for one night. Alessandro prepared for us delicious pasta, the best we have eaten (we were starving!)! His apartment is clean and cosy, and with Alessandro you can feel like at home! Aah, and our host took us to Gianicolo and to the best pizzeria in Trastevere. If you plan to go to Rome, don't hesitate to ask Alessandro, he will be a great host! Alessandro is very nice and funny. Me and my boyfriend stay with him 2 night. He helped us a lot. We are in a bad position and he was very helpful. He led us to perfect place for eating pizza first night and we talk about everything, Italian culture, Turkish culture, football etc. Next night he cooked us very delicious pasta. we have just 8 euro for our last day and it was not a problem for him and we are really greatful. All the time we stay with him he was very talkative and he dropped us to metro station with his car. I recommend everybody to stay with him.

Alessandro is such a kind person! He was very generous with his time and sharing his home with us. He was also super helpful! We managed to do most of Rome in two days, thanks to his amazing advice and tips! We had a lot of fun spending time with him. I would totally host him wherever I'm living and my cousin would too!!!! Thanks so much for an amazing experience in Rome!!!!!

Alessandro hosted me for my first couchsurfing experience and he was lovely! He is very kind hearted and was very curious about Texas and improving his English. He picked me up from the airport when I got there and dropped me off at the train station when I left. He is a music enthusiast and loves tennis! We went out for pizza and gelato and coffee and for a view of Gianicolo! Thank you so much Alessandro, it was a pleasure! (:

Well, I got stolen right before getting to Alessandro's place, so it was such a hard time. Alessandro was extremely comprehensive and kind to help me out, and he even handled to make me have lots of fun. He has a beautiful and super comfortable home and he's such an expert host!

text: Alessandro was the best host ever! he picked us up from the station , showed us delicious pasta , we watched football and he showed us the most amazing tirimisu ... the breakfast was great. He is the perfect host and such a nice guy. thanks for everything!! Dani and Alice

Alessandro was so nice picking me up at the airport & offering me a couch in his lovely home :)
Even if I got there pretty late, we shared a great talk at night & around a cappuccino in the morning about his country & mine, cultures.. he was so nice looking for trains for me & giving me advice, he's such a cheerful person, he likes sports a lot so if you're into sport you definitely will get along  :)
I spent just the night at his place in Rome since I was travelling thru Italy & was coming back later to Rome, but he offered to host me again, that's how nice he is :)
thank you Alessandro !

Alessandro was a great host! He was so interested about showing me Rome, and about my country "Ecuador". I hope he will visit me this year in Quito! :) thanks for everything Alessandro! It would be a pleasure for me be your host in Ecuador! :)

Ok, so I didn't actually spend the night, but I did see the apartment. 

This was my first couch surfing experience and I didn't do my due diligence in regards to the actual space. Alessandro was so wonderful and patient with me. I made it known that I needed my own room  (because exhaustion) and he was perfectly nice and took me to the local hotel and still turned down my offer to compensate for the pizza we got. 

The couch you'd sleep on was comfortable and the bathroom was clean, spacious and had instant hot water!

Alessandro was a perfect host, very friendly and always open to resolve my questions, we had dinners together and it was very fun being around him, he work all day but every evening we had time together, he likes sports and I like too so it was fun watching some games like tennis match and football :) I really recommend Alessandro, I hope you had won today !  :)

It was my first time as a guess and it was really good to stay with Alessandro ! We went twice to good restaurants, we share experiences, Alessandro travelled a lot and has many things to tell ! He's really interesting and kind. The last day he offered me the breakfast outside.  Thank you so much Alessandro and see you in Bordeaux as soon as you can ! :)

Alessandro is very kind, helpful and fun. He helped us with everything we needed and even gave us a lift on arrival and departure. In addition to taking us to the typical Italian restaurant for pizza. it is an excellent company. Thanks for everything.

Alessandro was a great host. He was like a brother to us, he took so much care of us and helped us with the dirrections in town. We was one noght in town he shared the pizza with us and we had really nice conversation, Also he decorated his little Christmas tree with us :) I cannot forget the mornings when we had the cornetto and the cappuccino insieme. :)
I really reccommend him to be your next hos as he is soooo happy, really good person and with such a big heart.
Thank you for being so wellcoming and nice to us!!
Hope to see you soon in Romania :)
Big hug,
Gina and Andreea
Was nice staying with Alessandro. He's very happy to host people! It was a nice experience.

Alessandro was so nice, kind, thoughful man. He always considered our situation and gave us useful tips during our stay. text: My friend and me were hosted by Alessandro during 3 days. It was our first experience with couchsurfing and it it was really great choose. Alessandro is wonderful host, he met us on station in our first evening, we went to a cafe and ate real Italian pizza. We lived with Alessandro in very good conditions, his apartment is very clean and comfortable, even Alessandro gave us the keys, so we can at any time to come home and relax. In addition, he talked a lot about Italian culture and traditions, he introduced us a country kitchen. We are very grateful to you for your help, Alessandro, we loved the time spent with you, we hope to see you more, either in Italy or in Ukraine.

text: Mamma mia, what a great time I had in Rome surfing at Alessandro's apartment :)!!! Not only did he make it easy for me and his other surfer to travel too and from the city but he was really helpful and cheerful for the entire 4 days I stayed with him. Luckily, Alessandro was on a break from work while I was in Rome so he had a lot of free time. We spent a day at the beach with his family in Ostia which was really lovely :). Thank you for all the great discussion, especially about the differences between the Italian and English languages. ALWAYS welcome at my place in Australia :).

text:
I had an incredible time with Alessandro. Because of couchsurfing and all of the great things that happened, I finally understand what the expression "when in Rome... " means. 
I wasn't traveling with a cell phone, so for the 4 days, Alessandro and I would set up meeting places and times. He was always on time and was very generous with his time with respect to my plans. By chance, I happened to come to Rome on the perfect weekend. It happened to be his birthday on Saturday. He invited me and another girl couchsurfing to his birthday dinner with his family. They were all very beautiful and kind people. On Sunday, we went to the Olympic Stadium to see Roger Waters, the Wall- absolutely incredible. 
We also exchanged recipes. He taught me how to make a traditional Roman pasta and I showed him how he could use the maple syrup he once received as a gift- we made banana pancakes. Alessandro is so interesting, generous and nice. Thank you for the great experience and hope to see you in LA!

text: Marco was really fun! I stayed only one night at his place and he gave me a ride with his scooter to see his neighborhood! I would stay again with Marco for sure!!

We stayed with Marco for a few days in Rome. He was very kind to me and my friend Adriana. He even picked us up at the metro. He hadn't much free time but make it to have some drinks and just have a good time. Thanks Marco for everything!!
It was our first expirience of couchsurfing. I`m happy that Marco was our host. He always met us at the metro and told us where it was better to go to Rome. He is very caring and friendly.

text: Marco welcomed me and my firiend in a super nice way! He picked us up from the metro station and offered a really nice house conditions. He's an interesting person who travelled a lot around the world and is keen on to share his adventures stories with others! Thank you a lot Marco üòâ

Marco is a really nice host even though we didn‚Äôt spend much time together. He is really busy but we appreciated him hosting us even though his schedule was hectic. We would definitely stay with him again!

I stayed with Marco for two nights. He was extremely kind and accommodating. He picked me up from the city center late at night when I arrived, gave me some pasta and we had good convo over some wine.  Staying with Marco was great because I felt extremely safe and secure (something that's really important for me).  He went out of his way for me and even woke up early to drop me at the metro. He was fine with dropping me at the metro and me doing my own thing (he had work to do) so I really appreciated that! Marco is a sweet gentle guy that makes you feel safe! Thank you so much for hosting me. I look forward to showing you around in Cape Town!

He and their friends were incredible hostes. He let me try tipical food from his country. Very flexible with me. In the first day he gave me a map with the best things to see. I will miss La Maison du Monde

Ziafat is very kind and interesting person ! Me and my girlfriend didn‚Äôt find a place to stay before our visit to Rome and he received our last minute request .  He is very respectful and helpful host with perfect place to stay . He is living in big flat near the center with his friends. This guys are very friendly too and each of them will be for you like your host . 
They gave to us some local food and drinks to try, gave useful tips and told a lot about life in Italy (culture , political situation, economy etc)  . Ziafat‚Äôs friend Alessandro made a perfect map with all necessary sights of Rome . Thanks for all , it was cool time with cool people !:)

Hey ! Ziafat is very friendly host. Before I arrived in Rome, I was constantly talking. He was interested in me. I did not have much time. But I wanted to share something with him. THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!

text:
Staying with Tommaso was my first experience in cs and I can not feel more grateful that I stayed with him. I stayed at his place for 3 nights (thanks again my friend) and it was really great! He picked me up at the metro station, took me out with his friends to have fun at night and also we prepared some Mexican appetizer! I would totally recommend him for future travelers. 
If you can make it to San Francisco you know where to find me!! Thank you so so much!

Tommaso is a nice, and easy-going guy. He gave me a spacious comfortable room to myself, very thoughtful of him and his mom. We did not hang out, due to his busy schedule. He did not mind that I came to his home late (and by late I mean 2200 or 2300), and he allowed me to go about my day.  Definitely, recommend staying again. Thank you so much, Tommaso.

fromPublicAddressDescription: Santa Rosa, La Pampa Province, Argentina

text: Tommaso seriously saved my ass when my other host didn't answer at the last minute.  He took me in and was very kind, didn't mind when I got in late and was always around.  He hung out with me one of the days when we went to a museum and tried to go rock climbing (all places were closed though).  He lives with his mom and gave me a choice of 2 private rooms.  Doesn't live right in the center but it only takes 30 minutes to an hour to get in, depending on where you're going. Would definitely recommend him!

Tommaso was very laid back and easy going. He offered his home to us and gave us the freedom to go about our days. We had our own room in a spacious flat with a laid back host. He even offered to take us to the beach, however we had to catch a train. Thanks again Tommaso!

Tomasso is very reliable and easy-going guy. If you want to have a complete freedom in choosing where and when to go, what to do in Rome at all - you should stay at his place. I spent there four days, also with some Russian girls that he couched at the same time. And it was extremely nice time. All of us had our own plans, and Tomasso was very helpful with his flexibility. We hanged out all together and now those are ones of the most pleasant memories from Rome for me. Hence, I definitely recommend you to stay at his place.  Hope to see you soon, To:)

Tommaso is the sweetest host ever!! He was really really nice. We had a whole room to ourselves, he made us feel like home in Rome. His parents and brother are also very friendly, we even had home cooked Italian dinner with his family. The apartment we stayed is near to Bologna metro station, it was very beautiful and clean. The house was modern with a fusion from the past, he has many books at home, for those of you who love Italian books, I'm sure you will enjoy your stay even more. Tommaso cooked pasta for us and make sure that we are well taken care of during our stay. On our last day, he even went the extra mile and send us off at Rome Tiburtina to take our bus to Venice.  If given the opportunity to visit Rome again, I would love to visit my old friend. Ring me up when you come to Singapore! Thank you so much Tommaso!
Funny young man, very helpful. Nice person. Really hoping to see him again. Me and my friend had a blast to met him. Hope to see you again tommas. Thanks for everything  :)

Tommaso was a really great host! He picked me up from the train station and helped me whenever he could with my trip. :) we were able to spend some time talking and went to the beach together! He's really working hard on improving his english! His family is also super nice and sweet - his mom is an excellent cook! Would definitely stay again and host him in New York! 
See you soon my friend :-)
  
- Imani J.

Tomasso is an amazing guy.  Very polite,clever,interesting. There are a lot of books in his home. I was lucky that he had the time to show me Rome. We spent great 5 days together. He helped me a lot and shown the best place with ice-cream. I arrived like a foreigner but he became me the friend.  Thank you Tomasso. I will wait you in Russia.
Tommy was a really friendly person! Was a pleasure meeting and hanging out with him!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Hong Kong, New Territories, Hong Kong

text: Was good to meet Enrico. He's very easy going and happy to fit in with arrangements.
fromPublicAddressDescription: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Enrico is a great guy. He was the first guy that hosted us on CS. So we had the pleasure of hosting him for a week here in Crete. I'm sure we'll keep in touch. Good luck with your future and maybe one day we'll bump into each other again :-)

I stayed at Enrico's place for one night and he is a very nice host. I sent him a last-minute request since my previous host had cancelled my request. Enrico didn't only accept my request, but also answered it within minutes. 

Enrico picked me up in front of the nike store located in Termini station. Once we arrived to his place, we bought a pizza for dinner and had a good conversation about different topics. 

Thanks Enrico for hosting me and I hope to see you again.

text:
Enrico is very welcoming and generous. He hosted my son and me for 3 nights including an unexpected one. When are flight was cancelled, he graciously allowed us to continue crashing his place another day.
He showed us around his neighborhood, took us to the beach and gave us invaluable advice that helped us get the most out of his fabulous city.
Thanks again.

Update April 2011:
A year after surfing with Enrico I had the pleasure of hosting him for a week in Madrid and discovered that he as great as a guest as he is as a host.

Update Sept 2011:
I had the chance to surf with Enrico again, this time for 5 days. And as always, he is a generous and considerate host.

Erico es una persona muy amable, sociable, servicial, amablemente me brind√≥ una cerveza y papas fritas, su departamento es espectacular, es una persona muy h√°bil en la cocina, me brindo una deliciosa pasta con ch√≠charos lo cual nunca hab√≠a probado antes, y en la ma√±ana me despert√≥ con un delicioso caf√©, en resumen fue una muy buena experiencia, 100% recomendable

Erico is a very kind, sociable, helpful person, kindly gave me a beer and chips, his apartment is amazing, he is a very skilled person in the kitchen, He offers me a delicious pasta with peas which I had never tried before, and in the morning he woke up me with a delicious coffee in summary It was a very good experience, 100% recommended, thanks for your help friend

I am lucky I had this place to stay in Rome! Enrico is easygoing and it was never a problem to meet and travel around this beautiful city. The couch is really comfortable, the terrasse super! We had good drinks and nice dinners talking about life, religions, movies... He made me coffee every morning and play the tour guide one day. :-) Thanks again for sharing your place Enrico!!

Enrico is a kind, easy-going and quiet guy. He hosted me for 4 nights in Rome and was kind enough to pick me up in the station before going to his place.  He was very generous, flexible and considerate, giving me tips for touring, sharing dinner and breakfast with me, letting me use his appliances and putting up with my extreme smoking habits :-P 

Thanks a lot for hosting me and I hope we will meet again either in Rome or in Bilbao!

I was so lucky Enrico hosted me. He was very kind and flexible with my arriving time. Even though my plans changed a lot in the last days, he totally understood.  He cooked pasta for me and we had a long and enjoyable conversation. Hope to see him soon.
He is a very nice guy, very friendly and very welcoming to his home!

Enrico is a CS Veteran I was excited to stay with for 3 nights. He lives in a southern Roma neighborhood, not particularly interesting area. His house is clean and the offered couch was comfortable.
Enrico appeared to be rather a quiet guy, and so was I. We did hang out several times, went to have Pizza, chatted, but didnt interact to deeply, which happens... 
He has been super helpful and easy though, offered me some food and advice and helped to make my stay easy and comfortable. 
I d recommend him as a couchsurfer and hope to meet again. Thank you so much.
Thanks Enrico for hosting me. Sorry, that you were too busy about work, however I‚Äôm very grateful to you that you confirmed my request and shared a dinner in pizzeria!

Enrico is such an amazing host! 
He is kind, attentive and make me feel at home from the first time we met.
I totally recommend him.
Hope to see you in Brazil!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Ribeir√£o Preto, State of S√£o Paulo, Brazil

text:
Enrico is very polite and hospitable. Through all 4 days I've stood with Enrico he always tried to help me and make my journey memorable. He showed me the city, came with me to the beach, attended CS meetings and stood a treat. 
Enrico's apartment is very nice, its light and comfortable and located in good area. Thank you, Enrico!

Staying with Enrico was a really great experience! His home - although about 30 minuets outside the city - is easily accessible by public transportation! His house is in a great location, just around the corner from a cute cafe. 

Enrico was very knowledgeable about Rome and made my visit so much easier. Not only did he meet me at the train station when I arrived but walked with me for about 2 hours showing me the major sights. Afterwards we shared a lovely dinner! 

While I didn‚Äôt get to spend a lot of time with Enrico because of his work schedule and my own busy schedule, it is clear that he is a very caring.  He is a real gem ‚Äî if you get the chance to stay with him, I highly recommend it. 

Until next time Enrico!

Thanks for the accommodation of two pilgrims when we could find nothing else. There was just no gas that day, so we only had a cold dinner and a shower :) but we made a very pleasant conversation. Sleeping was comfortable. In the morning we got excellent biscuits with tea for breakfast. Thanks again for everything!

Enrico is a very friendly person. He invited me delicious cup of coffee for breakfast. He took me to a restaurant where the best pizzas of Rome are made. We visited Rome at night, (spectacular) he knows a lot about history and the city. He borrowed me everything I needed, a map, a raincoat, etc, he was very very kind. If you plan to go to Rome I recommend you to stay at Enrico`s
fromPublicAddressDescription: Mar del Plata, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

text:
Enrico s sense of caring in embracing the newcomer wholeheartedly to a big city made me reflect on my own practice of hospitality. Rarely do I meet my own guests at a station but I was jubilant when Enrico said that he would meet me at Roma Termini.  
From the time we met, he made me feel at ease. Though not the most vocal host, I was impressed how easy it was to get on with Enrico. 
Though our time was short, we understood the the deeply rooted mission behind CS, the connection one makes through this sort of encounters.  They would last forever,, with the flickering flame of camaraderie.  Cheers mate!

Enrico is great person! I stayed at Enrico‚Äôs home for 3 nights. He gave me a map of city and it was very usefull for me. Enrico showed me city around first day. And he cooked a Tiramusu (It was like a suprise for me üòä). Also, Enrico has got a good friend and his friend is really friendly, helpfull and warm-blooded person. Enrico and his friend are really helpfull and thoughtful. I recommend Enrico without problem. Thank you for everything!

Without Enrico i wouldn't have seen Roma, The most i enjoyed the walking In the city at night. He told me lot of facts about Roma and he knows the history of his country so well. 

Unfortunately i stayed in Rome too little to really get to know him and Roma. Enrico accepted my same-day request. I'm so thankful!!
He is very generous and kind host! 

The pasta his friend cooked was deleicious!

You will feel at home with Enrico, definately reccommend!

My stay with Enrico was a great experience. Communication with him was really easy and even though I arrived late in the night, he waited for me at the bus stop. He was also really helpful by giving me a map of the city and highlighting the places I should visit.  Next day, we also had dinner together where we had a good conversation about tv shows, music and everything  we had in common. I would definitely stay with him again! Thanks so much Enrico!

Enrico is a good person and offers to the travelers his time and home so they can have a good time in Rome, always willing to help or share information about Rome and it‚Äôs places. I appreciate everything you have done for me. You are a great host and hope you will be OK!. Cheers!.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Palma de Mallorca, Islas Baleares, Spain

text:
Enrico is an absolute blessing. As soon as I arrived he greeted me at the train station and he led the way back to his apartment. His heart is so large and open. I so enjoyed spending time with him talking at his table, eating pasta, and drinking coffee. Every minute was truly blissful.

During my stay with Enrico I did happen to fall a bit ill, and he was absolutely great at being flexible and helping me to recover. While being sick during travels is difficult, I was so fortunate to have such a caring and loving host who was there for me while I was ill.

Thank you for everything, Enrico! Until we meet again!! My home (wherever it may be) is always open to you üòò xoxo
Enrico is a good person, he tries to help people to have good time in Rome. Thank you !

Enrico is a friendly Italian man. I had the joy to be hosted by him for one night. Even though my plans changed and one of my friends joined me he was so flexible to host him as well. He was friendly and polite, and offered us both dinner and breakfast.
It was a good stay with him :)
Enrico really nice host, and good speaker. We spent to good time. Thanks for everything and sharing ur home :)

Enrico is a great person, he cooked for me, he washed my clothes, he went out to the city center, he picked me up at the station...I'm really really grateful to him, thank you so much for everything!!!

Enrico was really kind. I wrote to him a last minute request and he replied very fast.
Thanks to him, I was able to eat in some good italian restaurants. As well, he was a good guide.

I wish him all the best.

If you‚Äôre going to Rome, I recommend Enrico to be your host. He‚Äôs a very nice guy, friendly, thoughtful and you can have a nice time with him, eating pizzas and talking about a lot of different things. Kind regards, Thomaz.

Great evening together with a long walk through some city attractions and pizza! 
We had fun! Thanks :)
he is a good host. he came to the bus station for take me. he has a cool house. i stayed with him for 5 days, it was really nice. thanks for everything

was a nice and easy stay
enrico was very easy going and mauricio is also very kind

Enrico is great guy! As a host, he made sure I had everything that I needed and was comfortable at his place. The first night, he prepared delicious pasta and gave up two hours just to help me get where I wanted to go! Very helpful! The next day, he gave me a tour of Rome and showed all the important attractions, along with other nice areas that aren't as popular. The last day, he helped me get to the right bus stop before he went to work. Also, he's a really good photographer. I recommend him!
I planned to stay 2 nights in roma but needed one more and Enrico accepted To host me. He picked me up at the train station and made us his delicious tiramisu...grazie Enrico!

Enrico is a very kind and thoughtful host. Upon arrival to Rome, he met me at the train station and showed me to his place.  When we got to his place,  we decided to go out to eat, which was a great idea as I learned much about Enrico, myself and his other surfer. Enrico was extremely generous and paid for our meals (Thank you Enrico!). 

During my stay, we easily worked out the sleeping arrangements and Enrico always asked questions to ensure that I was comfortable. 

His home is perfectly situated (30 mins on tram from Piazza Venezia) and is a perfect size for two people (maybe 1 more). It has an amazing terrace and much charm. Enrico showed pride in sharing his beautiful home me and others.

Enrico is open to hanging out after work hours and is very responsive during the day. I found this helpful because many times I had questions about the transportation system, and Enrico was there to help. 

Enrico is a good, kind hearted guy and I am thankful to have met him.

Ciao,
R

Enrico has saved me indeed when I arrived to Rome! I just can't express how grateful I'm with him because he was the only person who could help me in all Rome and even thought he could understand me when in the last day of my stay there I couldn't find a place and he accepted me a day more. He was just very generous and empathic with me!! That's why I can say that Enrico is very unique in all Rome! I'm really glad I could meet him and for sure if you have the opportunity to meet him, you will find a very reponsible, kind, generous, hard-working, warm and very great person! In the last day I could meet - thanks to him- another CSer from USA who I got very great friendship with! And I think it was a really great experience to share a day with another traveler because It was way fun!

Enrico, Thank you so much for being there when I really needed it! I would have liked to pass more time with you to get to know you better, but if you go to Mexico, for sure you're very welcome at my place!

Enrico is a quiet person. He enjoys company and has a wide knowledge of Rome, he is great if you need advice of public transport or typical places. His house is very nice and he let me use the kitchen and the bathroom (is in his room) whenever I needed it. The location of the place is a little far of the center but the neighborhood is beautiful and very safe. 
It's a nice place to stay if you don't mind waking up early in the morning when he leaves to work.

Thx for everything Enrico!

Santi

Enrico is a really kind person, he trated me very well. He show me some non turistic places of Rome which were really awsome. I enjoyed to stay with him and of course I would stay again.
Thank you very much for your hospitality!!
I had a great time! I was supposed to stay longer, but I had to come back to Turkey a bit earlier. In any case, I had a blast with his hospitality.

I originally requested to stay only one night, but Enrico was kind enough to offer to host me for three nights. I had already made plans for my first two days, so we didn't hang around much, but in my final day he took me to the beach which was really nice. He's a bit in the quiet side, but when you get him to talk about a topic he knows of, you'll be surprised about his knowledgeable and fun he is!
Enrico was a very good host, very friendly and kind. He made me feel very welcome, he was interesting and gave me such great advice about the city. I wish you all the best.

We met front of the Colesseum then went to his home. He is great guy, he cooked and showed all around the Rome. He walked with me about 6-7 kilometers. His home is a little bit far from centrum but you can take a tramway. 
Thanks for everything Enrico.

Enrico is one of those CS professionals you barely found.  In my case, he offered me to stay in his home in Rome on a last minute request. He was flexible with my times, we spent time together around the city and we talked a lot about several topics. He even gave some some italian classes. He is nudist, me not, but it wasn't actually an issue. His place is a little bit out of the city center, but that wasn't a problem for me.
Last but not the less: he cooks a delicious tiramisu!

I spent four days at Enrico's place and I found him very understanding, talkative and a nice person. Yet, The only thing that I will point out is the the guest must leave the house at the same time when he is leaving for working, and that was a big surprise for me because I wasn't told that before hand, besides that, everything was ok.

Enrico is a reliable, generous, warmwelcoming Person. He is very good at listening and he is very interested and opened to new cultures. I had the Impression he works too much, therefore he does not Travel as much as he would like. I wish he would be treated by any any couchsurfers in the same attentive but at the same time easy going way he hosted me.

The experience with Enrico is positive. He is a polite ,open mind and discret. 
If i ll come in rome i ll contact him surely. Thanks enrico
Very nice person. He was waiting in the train station and then he was able to spend some time for tourism and dinner. Very nice appartment. Big. Clean. Safe.

He is an exceptional cook and manages to make his guests feel like more than just a guest. One time we had pizza at a restaurant, showed my the Colosseum at night and took me for drinks at a bar nearby!
He was so fun and charming. I really like Enrico and we had a deep connection. I count him as a true connection.

Enrico is very friendly and caring! He came to central Rome just to pick me up. He's busy on weekdays so we didn't hang out much. He knows Rome inside out so he can guide you to the perfect spots and how to get around Rome. He made my bed, gave me coffee in the morning and made pasta for dinner. Would definitely stay next time I come to Rome again!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Stoke-on-Trent, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Enrico knows a lot about rome and for sure he is going to give you great advice and tips! If you are openminded Enrico is a great host and a very respectful person! Great person! He showed me how to make pizza and pasta to!

It has been a very good CS experience. Enrico is very friendly, easy-going and flexible. I did not feel myself far away from home - I just felt very free and comfortable. He creates very comfy environment for guests. He fully trusts guests, he is trustful as well. He prepared dinner for me also. 
It was my pleasure and see you again soon!
It was a nice and shy guy at first at the end he was very polite and sociable with me.
Enrico was a very nice company. He helped me since I arrived to Rome and he was always thoughtful and respectful. He did his best to show me around and he even cooked.. Very positive experience.
It's not so cleaned but he's so kind

I stayed one night at Enrico's place. We had dinner together. At the beginning he was a bit shy but after some questions we had a nice chat about everything.
The place is a bit outside of Rome but well connected with bus. 
Enrico has an amazingly high number of guests. I really thank him for his hospitality. 

Take care and see you next time.

Enrico offered to host us and we accepted. He is nice and we shared some dinners. 
We arranged two guide tours in Rome, and he joinned us in the afternoon to visit interesting monuments.
His place has a convenient location and although he had another guest at home, we were confortable and everything was nice...the sofa is nice!

Thank you very much, Enrico!
I was very respected and very well treated by him. He is very kind, and I even felt a little bad because he was so worried about me.

text: Enrico is a kind and interesting guy! We had lots of nice and deep conversation about many different topics! Furthermore, he accepted me the very same morning of the day I was coming to Rome! I really recommend him!

I really lucky to meet him! I Appreciate everything about him!  He pick me up at the train station, also bough me the üöå ticket, we have dinner , walk in the city! Show me around , also he gave me map and a book for visitor in Rome, I can't any bad thing about him! For sure I recommend him 100%

I spent a great time in Rome enrico was very nice and respectful he's very flexible he asked me what would I like to do as I was the guest. he's willing to go out with you when you want or let you go to explore the city he actually went to pick me up at the station, we went to eat a delicious pizza near his place and had breakfast together in the morning! We went clubbing although the second night the weather didn't help! 
He can be sometimes very shy and you could spent a while walking around and he didn't say anything but generally he's very kind thanks a lot Enrico!

Enrico is real friendly guy, do maximum he can for you to feel better in his place, know much about the City, it was wery interesting walking with him and listening stories about all this, wanna say thanks, and hope to see hem again! 
Ciao my friend.

I had a great time with Enrico! Besides being an excellent host he is an exceptional person to whom you can talk about everything. He is fun and charming. I would stay with him again for sure. He made me feel at home at all times cooking his pasta or having breakfast together.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Carlos Casares, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

text: I got a lot of fun with Enrico,  it was just one weekend but I really enjoyed.  He is kind,  polite and flexible,  and found time to spend with me at home and hanging out. Hope meet him again,  after all we are new friends. Thanks Enrico.

Was nice experience for me! Enrico is a nice person and also teach me Italian very well and patiently.  He also cooked a good pasta for me,  brought me to a nice bar closer coliseo and a good pizzeria! Thank you Enrico!
Staying with Enrico was nice, he has a small flat  some 20 minutes from the city centre. He is very flexible and knows a lot about the city. Thanks Enrico for letting me stay!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Prague, Hlavn√≠ mƒõsto Praha, Czech Republic

text: Enrico was a good host who was very patient with all the problems that accompanied my visit...I even managed to make him late for work on the last day.  And still he took it all in stride.  My apologies and thanks once again, Enrico...I hope you make it full time out to the Canaries...

Thanks to Enrico for everything! He made all to me so I could enjoy my time in Rome. His flat is very nice and very well located easy to get there with public transportation. We spent time together but also was flexible so I could explore on my own. You definetly should stay with him or host him. Come over to Mexico whenever you want.

I had a highly positive experience staying at Enrico's home. He's very kind and puts all the facilities for your stay. He gave me important information about Rome, we talked a lot and shared good nights by the river. It was a pleasure Enrico! Thank you!!
Enrico was a nice host and i enjoyed my stay with him :)
With +350 + references what is there to ad. Enrico is a friendly, charming, knowledgeable guy ... With a great sofa. Thank you Enrico !

I am really grateful for Enrico's generosity for giving me his sofabed for two nights, which was large and comfortable. His flat is ~30 min from the centre. 

He offered me some advice for the city, we ate at a nearby restaurant for dinner the 1st night and I cooked dinner for the 2nd.

In the interest of complete honesty, I'd like to say that Enrico was not very talkative during my stay and at times I felt a little uncomfortable. I was also offered help to shower, which I found somewhat unsettling even if it were a joke. After I laughed it off, Enrico seemed alot less enthusiastic about my stay and I felt like this unfortunately lasted through the second night. 

Perhaps I arrived at a bad time for Enrico, as my experience seems to contradict most previous references (except a few who seem to have had similar thoughts) - but all my other CS experiences have been a world apart.

Thanks Enrico for hosting and I hope you understand my thoughts.
Enrico is a nice guy. He waited for me on the Termini, and i stayed 1 day at his house. Cheers Enrico!

ENGLISH:  Enrico not only hosted me...I consider him a friend. We met like 7 years ago and the reunion time arrived. We went out...share a dinner with other couchsurfers and he always helps if you need something. Was a pleasure to see you again Enrico!

ESPA√ëOL:La vida nos volvio a juntar luego de 7 a√±os. Era hora de reecontrarme con Roma y Enrico me ayudo en todo. Tambien tuvimos tiempo para salir y conocer a otros couchsurfers. La pase genial. Muchas gracias por todo!

ARGENTINO: de primera...gamba siempre te hace la segunda y nunca te deja en banda. nos vemos por el mundo Enrico!

Enrico hosted me and my boyfriend for 3 days. He was always super friendly, and even met us at the bus station to take us back to his house. He gave us a great tour around the city, and showed us a great Italian place to eat. He was always in contact with us through the day, and made us feel at home :)

Since the beginning Enrico was very kind, respectful and friendly host. He helped me with what was necessary and we had a great time hanging out with another surfer. He's also a excelente dinner haha. Thanks a lot for hosting me, Enrico, hope to see you soon in Brasil, but this time, in the north. :)

We stayed with Enrico for just two short days, but we had a very nice time in Rome. He was nice to accept our request on late notice, and be flexible with the days we were there. His place is well-located, within walking or a bus ride to many great places. His pull-out sofa was comfortable, and he offered us tea and some small cakes he had made in the morning. We also meet up with him for a drink one evening after he was done with work, and he told us a bit about the area. Thank you, Enrico.

Enrico was a good host, nice and he show me the city and he know a lot of details and histories about thats places. Thanks so much for host me :)
And the party on friday ‚ô°
He is a person very respect and friendly.

I had a fantastic stay with Enrico. He kindly met me at the station when I arrived and for the 5 nights I stayed with him I was very well looked after. He was happy to hang out every evening and was a great source of information about what to see & do in Roma. He also offered to show me around - even after a long day at work and being woken up by my early-bird habits - and took me to see a very unusual view of San Pietro. His place is in a quiet residential neighbourhood, but is easy to get to from the centre by public transport, so it was the perfect base for exploring the city. Would definitely recommend staying with him.

Enrico was nice enough to let me stay an extra night in his home. His house is nice and clean, and he offered me my own couch/fold out bed. I really appreciate his hospitality! He had another friend staying with him, a bit crowded but not an issue at all. He helped plan my visit. Another plus is that they offered me breakfast and dinner every night, which was amazing and saved me a ton of money. I fed them the last night, not sure they liked it though lol.

A couple things to note, not negative but maybe others before or after me may have also noticed. Enrico was very nice and talkative in the beginning and did flirt/became friendly (I.e. Touchy) but after I told him I wasn't interested in those things he became distant. I tried to talk to him but not much came out. Maybe he was giving me my space, maybe it was a language barrier, maybe it's a personality thing.

Anyway thank you for everything, stay was great otherwise. He was actually my 1st confirmed couch on here, so thank you!
fromPublicAddressDescription: San Jose, CA, United States of America

text: Enrico is √† great Guy, really open and available. I think he never judge negatively nobody before he met them. He was really attentive to what i wanted or needed, and i'm really thankfull for that. Long story short, he is a great host. Thanks, Enrico!
enrico was really friendly and helpfull. He cooked me a delicious pasta and I met his funny friend !!! thanks a lot

Erico recieved me and a friend for three days, and it was really great. He is really helpfull and was always worried if we were okay (he acctually went too meet us two days so we could go home together). We had dinner together and talked about movies and book. Althoug he was busy and me and my friend wanted to visit the city (so we wasn't able to hang out together), when at home, he was a nice host. I indicate him.
Thanks so much for your help.
Luiz

Enrico is a great guy. Me and my friend were only staying originally for 3 nights but ended up staying 5. He met us at the train station. He showed us all of Rome which we wouldn't have been able to do on our own. He cooked us pasta. He's a very kind and generous person. Had a wonderful 3 days with very kind and friendly man with my friend. Thank u Enrico.

I stayed with Enrico for 1 night. He is a nice, humble and caring host. We didn't talked much probably because of language barrier, but I am obliged and thankful to him for sharing his place, for being generous and for kind behavior. Good Luck!!

Enrico hosted me and Giraud during our stay in Rome. It was a last minute request but he accommodated us. He gave us tips on how to enjoy Rome and even prepared delicious Italian meals for us! Thanks so much Enrico for your hospitality. We appreciate it! Good luck in everything. Till next time! Grazie!

Despite the fact that I told him that I was going to arrive at his place really early in the morning he had no problems with that. Enrico is serious, and incredibly punctual. He even cooked legit risotto for me to try at his place. I have to confess that I thought that he was too quiet, I even thought that I did something wrong, but just that the way he is, so as long as you're fine with that, as I was, you'll have a good time, I well recommend Enrico as a connection to anyone.

text:
Enrico hosted me for two nights; he was very nice to me and the place was in my opinion clean and comfy, and he helped me the best he could with my italian.
Thanks

We had wonderful weekend together. We felt like we know eachother for a long time. Enrico took care of us, cooked pasta, brought to local restaurants, gave some tips and directions. He is very experienced CS. It was a pleasure to meet him.

Enrico was a great host and i was fortunate to be there in Rome when he had some days off and could show me around his most amazing city both in the day and evening. He prepared some great meals, we watched movies together and he was very respectful, helpful and accommodating for my entire 4 dqys. Thank you Enrico
Enrico is a punctual and welcoming host. Helps you whatever you need. Cooks a tasty sauce :).
My short time in Rome was very good, Enrico was a great host and the coach was really comfortable...  Thanks for showing me around...

I met Enrico in Roma during my holidays thanks to CS. He is a nice and kind and interesting person. We talked a lot about a lot of things and we spent a good time. I'm glad to meet you :-). 
I wish you the best Enrico. 
Take care of yourself!

This guy is just amazing! He opened his house for me and my cousin! 
I stayed with him for 4 nights, it was just an amazing experience, actually it was my first time as a guest, I hope I was a good one! 
It was a great stayed, he picked us up at the train station, he gave a lot of tips about where to go and how to save money, he also cooked for us! I could also spend my bday with him! It was great! Rome is just perfect and he made it even more special! Thank you so much for everything you did! üòä

text: There are some things which restore my faith in Couchsurfing and the most important one is the opportunity to meet great souls in it- like Enrico. When my host ditched me at the last moment in this huge city of Rome, I was stranded and helpless. I contacted Enrico and he asked me to come over and hosted me for a couple of nights. How kind of him!!! If not for Enrico, my experience in Rome would have been shallow and miserable. He cooked me a delicious Pasta and we had some good conversations. Just a mere reference won't do any justice to thank him or his greatness. Enrico, thank you so much and  you are always welcome to my place.

text:
Enrico is a really good guy who seems to be unable to ever say no to travellers in need of a place to stay ;)
Thankyou so much for making it possible for us to explore this beautiful city, for cooking for us and providing us with a map and good advice on Rome's sights. I wish we could have spent more time together and got to know you a bit better. But I also understand that with the almost constant hosting you do that you cannot fully open up and become best friends with every single person passing your doorstep. I'm still glad to have met you and hope you know you always have a place in Berlin (or wherever we happen to make a home next)!

text:
I stayed with Enrico for three nights and he is a fantastic host. He is very kind and genuine person.
He met me at the station and knowing that I had a long journey offered me a coffee and shower when we arrived to his place.
Enrico also showed me around a lot of the major points in the city center and showed me where to get some good food. I learned a lot from Enrico about history, culture and food.
It was a great and experience and I look forward to meeting him again in the future.

text:
I stayed with Enrico for two nights in Rome. He's quite shy, but a very friendly and kind guy. :)

His home is a bit far from the city center by foot, but easy by public transportation. He made dinner for me after my very late arrival the first night, and we went out for a drink and walk the second night, after he finished work. 

Staying with Enrico is a smooth, comfortable experience, and he's a true Roman so he can tell you where you to go and where to eat if you don't have a plan!

text: I stayed in Enrico's place for 3 days during a trip with a friend in April/2013. He is a really nice guy, educated, and respectful. He treat us well and gave us tips about the city and where to go. It was a really nice stay. Sorry for the late review, Enrico. Wish you my bests!

I stayed in Enrico's home for 2 days during my Rome trip in November. He was really kind &well educated person. First evening, he cooked pasta for dinner and it was very delicious. Also second evening although he was tired, we went outside for dinner and having fun. Thanks Enrico very much for his hospitality and everything. :)

Enrico hosted us for 1 night and we were very grateful for that because we were sleeping in the park in Rome the previous night. We cooked together a delicious dinner while Enrico prepared super delicious dessert! ;) Enrico also showed us a really nice park near his apartment.  Thank you for your hospitability Enrico and you are always welcomed in Czech republic! :-)

text: Enrico was a key part of an amazing weekend in Rome. He was one of the very few requests I sent because upon reading his profile I was sure I wanted to surf his couch. And I couldn't be more right! He was super attentive and courteous to me and my boyfriend. His place is nice and cozy, his sofa is comfortable and his coffee is warm and comforting. We had lots of fun either running between the bus and the tram or dining in the rain :)

text:
Enrico was the first Roman i ever met, and he stood very well for my expectations. He's nice and polite, meeting me at Termini and taking me to his place, and leaving me at the train station with concise directions to get to my next host the next day. 
His expertise about Roman culture is something to do not miss out. Even if I'm a bit 'overplanner', his suggestions made my trip even better.
Last, but not least, Enrico cooks the best tiramisu I ever tasted!

text:
Enrico is nice guy.Quiet and helpful.He was ready to provide me an umbrella, a map or anything which helped me enjoy my stay.He kept his restroom and bedsheets clean.

Enrico is a veteran couch surfer! It was wonderful to see how his home reflects his CS experience. Lots of umbrella's ,stuff left by other surfers, gifts from around the world,CS diary! He has hosted hundreds of surfers and he is kind enough to have a positive approach towards all surfers. 

He can host multiple surfers, it did make me a bit uncomfortable at first but i ended up making another fun CS friend! I had to adjust but it was easy as both Enrico and other guest were accommodating and nice.

His place is really well connected via bus to all tourist place. You can even walk to coliseum in 20 -25 minutes.Lots of places to eat and a cute coffee place with WIFI across the street!

text: Enrico is a very warm hearted and gentle soul although he grew up in a city like Rome so he reminds me of me and my brethren back home in New York, blase, kvetchy, and laissez faire, LOL. I came during the week and he had to work, of course, but we had a couple of nice evenings together where he cooked and made an amazing homemade tiramisu. I didn't expect to like Rome so much, but thanks to Enrico, I had a nice time and really want to come back! Maybe next time he'll show me where the bears are in Rome.

text:
Enrico hosted us in Roma for couple of nights. I will be always thankful to him to help me maintaining my 100% record of using CS while traveling since I join it. Well, About Enrico... He is very caring and polite host who really knows what is hosting all about. 
He has lot of patience to listen to others and maintain his cool. 
We stayed with him on his Birthday Party night and it give us opportunity to meet with other people as well. In the end it was a great time, eating, chatting and playing cards. 
I think Enrico is the best host in Roma who really Values the proper use of Cs. If possible, I would like to stay with him in future as well. 
Thanks a lot for ur explanation and quenching my curiosity about ur life style. It was a pleasure to listen to u. Always feel welcomed in Tuscany when ever u want. U are the only person from Roma who has a sure host in Tuscany :)

text: My boyfriend and I stayed with Enrico for 3 nights in his lovely apartment. He was a great host, who met us at the train station and offered us a lot of advice/expertise about visiting the city. He took us out one night to an awesome bar and a club, which was a ton of fun! His knowledge about Ancient Rome and the city in general is quite broad, which helped us tourists. Make sure that you know that Enrico is very open physically and enjoys being around his male guests in comfort ;) It was sometimes difficult to communicate in English, but once we all opened up, we had a great time. It is apparent that he has a lot of experience with CS, because he allows you the freedom to choose what you would like to do. I enjoyed my stay with Enrico in Rome overall!

text: Enrico was a most hospitable host whom went out of his way to make sure his surfers (including me) enjoyed the best of Rome. I would describe him as extremely open-minded, respectful and very naturalistic! He immediately accepted my request to stay in Rome, and I was ecstatic since it was difficult finding hosts and he also had no problem with a longer stay. I had the most fantastic Itailian meals just from the nearby restraunts suggested by Enrico. Thanks again Enrico, I had a wonderful time in Roma because of you! Ciao! :)

text:
Enrico was a FANTASTIC host. He's uncomplicated, easy-going, down-to-earth, generous, good-hearted. I'd say as a host, he goes beyond the call of duty. 
He accepted my request, even if he was already hosting 2 other surfers. It's the first time I surfed and felt like I was in my own house!
He even took the time to take us to the beach. Thanks and more thanks for everything. 
He definitely deserves the title of Ambassador!

text: Enrico was a very accomodating host. He met me at the train station on arrival and every day after that at the end of his workday to ensure I got to his place safely. He is very kind. We went out for meals together twice and then one evening he took me to a weekly couch surfer's evening of drink and buffet which I must say was excellent. He was always willing to provide suggestions on how one could spend the day and always helped with directions. I only wish we could have had more time together exploring the sites of Rome but as he worked this was not possible. I would definitely recommend to others a stay with Enrico.
Enrico is a quiet, polite and independent guy. I really liked to see his world in his apartment in a nice spot of Rome. Thanks!

text: Enrico is a really nice and thoughtful guy! I stayed at his home for 4 nights when Roma was snowing! He gave us a big warm welcome and a lot of useful tips! The time we spent together in the bar, or in the Pizzeria was joyful, we get the chance to see the real local life of Roma.He's really a trustful and sweet host, always take good care of the surfers, and if you are coming to Belgium, let me know! Btw, his sofa bed is really warm and comfortable!!!!!! :p

Enrico hosted me for 4 days and I can tell you in a few words...is a very nice person, involved, smart, very polite, very calm, kindness, friendly.
We talk a lot of different and interesting things and I recommend him with all my heart.
I hope we will see again!

text: In the end all these CS references end up looking a little alike and I don't know what to say to make this one different, bit my time with Enrico was really wonderful and I really mean this. He's the most generous guy I've ever know. Every now and them I see someone here on CouchSurfing who seems like too good to be true, really unattached and willing to help others without getting anything from it, always hosting a lot of people whenever they can. I'm sort of new to CouchSurfing, though, and this kind of people always seems to me like the stuff of legends. Well, now I can say I really met one of them. I can't stress this enough, but Enrico is a really great guy. And if being such a genuinely good person weren't enough, he's also really smart, really interesting, great conversation, always have something to add to any subject. Staying at his place was a real pleasure in every sense. I hope we get to meet agai soon.

text:
He hosted me for 3 days in Roma. He was a real saviour for me because it was very difficult for me to realize what was i doing in Italy. He came to station to pick me up. He was very friendly and hospitable.
I was feeling at home.
He was also very good with history of Rome. He gave me a map and tell me what to do. And also when he was free we seen Roma together and it was very nice.
We speak about lots of things and it was really good for me to understand lots of things about Italian culture and community.
Thank you Enrico.

text:
What can i say about Enrico? Seems none of my categories can describe him - maybe i've to create a new one ;-). 

He picked me up at Termini and i found a lot of hospitality and an 'open house' when i arrived at his appartment. During a part of my stay there were also other couchsurfers and we had a lot of fun together chatting about CS and our experinces in Rome. He also showed me nice places where one can have good pizza and gelato ;-)

Enrico is very helpful e.g. supported us with schedules, good tipps and even  cooked some delicious pasta. If you search for a host with a great heart - he is the one!

Mille grazie, Enrico

text:
Enrico was my host in Rome... He was hosting someone else at the time, but arranged things so I could stay with him as well. He picked me up from the station, helped me with my laundry, prepared a great espresso - which I spoilt by adding milk -, gave me a city map, and even gave us a quick improvisdd tour around colosseum at night, after eating at a traditional italian restaurant we could have not discovered without his help.

He is also a very respectful person, and one can see that he likes his guests to feel comfortable at his place.

Thank you Enrico!

Hideki

text:
I surfed Enricos couch while I was in Rome for my birthday. Enrico was very generous and he is one of the most generous CSers I have met. Rico has become an amazing friend over the years, talking and listening to me, even one time he lent me his apartment for international womans day, amazing generous! Later Rico and I went to the theatre!

All the best to you my good friend! I look forward to seeing you soon!

text: My stay with Alessandro was really pleasant! He's kind and friendly, his place is awesome, he offered me one of the best couchsurfing experiences that i've ever had! I wish I could have more time to hang out with him, but he's really cool with that! Take care Alessandro! All the best to your future travels! :)

Alessandro was a wonderful company. He knows a lot about the culture, architeture and curiosities of Rome. We had such great time together, he's very kind and polite man. Everything was perfect! I totally recommend. Grazie mille Alessandro!

I was in Italian road trip with a friend and Alessandro was our first experience in couchsurfing. We were hesitating before we started on this network. For our stay in Rome we asked Alessandro to host us. He quickly accepted and it was gone! Alessandro is a very welcoming person, smiling and funny. For the French, he speaks French very well. He made us discover a great restaurant in Rome with his friend and recommended 2-3 activities. 
He is part of my top 3 of my favorite couchsurfers. I recommend everyone to spend some time with him!
Stop to be arrogant and Vive la France ahaüòò

My dear friend Alessandro, you are amazing! Thank you a lot for this time we spent together. 

We had a fantastic city tour with Alessandro by car at night!!! He is sooooo clever and kind, friendly and funny. Thanks to him we learned a lot about Rome like both architecture and places for dancing. üòÑ He has clean and cozy apartment where we felt ourself like in the paradise.  

Thank you again! 
Send you our kisses and hugs! 
Dariia and Marina

My friend and I stayed at Alessandro‚Äôs house one night and we had a very good time. He recommended us a place to eat close to his house. He was very friendly, responsable and puntual. We didn‚Äôt really have time to know each other a bit more but it was fine!! Hope to see him again :)

Hard to describe these amazing days! Alessandro was really helpful and attentive. He made sure that my stay was perfect, and it was! We hang out and Alessandro showed me all the historical things to see. Not only he was showing these things to me but we was also explaining me everything about this wonderful city. After these 4 days I was even able to speak italian (this is not true :) ). Thanks Alessandro for making my stay so perfect, so many good memories about Rome thanks to you!

Alessandro is such amazing and really nice guy! Always with smile on his face! So positive person. He is very kind and I loved the time spent with him. He showed me secret places in Rome and he told me a lot about history, culture of Rome and Italy...he took me everywhere! He adapted to my time and also he was willing to get up so early for me because of my flight. I hope we will meet again. :) Thank you so much! :)

I was so lucky that Alessandro had time to host me! Truly Roman, always knows where to go and what to see. He is really so in love in his city.  Thank you for sharing it with me, sorry if I seemed not so impressed üòÇ But that perspective view on San Pietro dome is really something special! 
Alessandro is very interesting person to talk with (even in different languages), smart and broad-minded, he is very nice and thoughtful guy. 
Grazie di tutto, one more time :)
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Such positive and funny guy. I like the company of Alessandro. Very clean and  comfortable flat, enjoy time in it. Alessandro help us with our problem, a think he must be in" top 5 best host". Alessandro, u are really cool. Thank you üòä
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Ale was a very very nice guy! We went to the beach and he made an authentic Italian dinner for us.  Such a memorable time!
Alex is a great host, fun and knowledgeable, his flat is in a central location and 1 minute from the tube. highly recommend him.

That was amazing day in Rome with Alessandro!
He knows so much about the city (I believe he knows everything about every stone there) and it's great. Being lost in the old streets with him helped me to feel the real spirit of the place. Thank you for being so nice and hope to see you again, Alessandro :)

text:
Alessandro is one of the best hosts that you can ever meet. We stayed at his place for 2 nights and it was the best way starting to explore Rome like locals. He was so gentleman, he picked us from the train station and after that he took us one of the best Piazzas in Rome, to Monti. We had really fun with him and his friends. He showed us hidden places in Rome. He gave us very good advices, he knows Rome very well. If we speak about his place, just one word: Wonderful! He has very good taste of decoration, it was so clean and comfortable. He even gave us his bed. He made us breakfast in the mornings. 

We are really glad to meet him. We strongly recommend to stay at his place or meet him. 

Thank you for everything, Alessondro! 

Lots of love from Turkish girls. 

Naz&Mirey
Alessandro is very intelligent and nice person. It is absolutely nice to stay with him. Thank you Alessandro!

Alessandro is a very pleasant and easy-going person, I really enjoyed his company. He is an architect and really knows his stuff - I learned so many interesting things about Rome from discussions with him. He was the best tour guide I could imagine ;) The apartment was clean and very nice. Overall, great experience - thank you Alessandro!

Alessandro was a wonderfully spontaneous, atypical cool as cool can be really very sweet guy . His striking ability to remain positive morning, noon and night made me feel very homely in his apartment. Also his fantastical taste in music paired with a little bit of wine makes for very tranquil chats and giggles.

Sirio stayed at my place one night. He's really kind, respectful, polite and great company‚Ä¶ 
It was nice to meet you! Hope you will have a nice time in Ulm and Munich.
He stayed in my house 4 days. We didn't spend too much time together because I was working and also traveled but I found him very kind and friendly. He is very trustful.

Sirio is a great guest and guy! I enjoyed to stay with him. Highly recommended to meet this person! I would like just to spend more time with him, to be closer to his inner quiet and peace. And maybe the best thing that I can to say is "Sirio, my home is open for you whenever you want!" :)
Very friendly person. I often meet him for CS event in Rome.
