text:
some day here will be a "normal" reference, but for now it's just a promise of a reference. i melted into a puddle after reading Siro's ref to me, so it'll take some time to create more or less equal piece of writing. stay tuned

upd: ok, here is it:

Your first impression on Sirio may be deceptive ‚Äì he may seem a bit detached and sarcastic provoker(anyway, u can‚Äôt be all that without being intelligent, right?). besides, imperturbable face he makes all those caustic jokes with will never let u know if he‚Äôs being serious or not. But if u scratch the surface you‚Äôll see a lovely guy with huge warm heart and abyss of empathy‚Ä¶ nah, just kidding. You ‚Äòll see pretty much the same. The point is you gonna love it, I swear.
inverseReference:
{'id': '10877088', 'text': "The first thing I want to say about Maria is that she's the best female driver I've meet in Russia, and if I'm still here to testify it, it must be true

Than, even if she was still devastated by the lost of her true lover Gerald, and tired for so much running and crying, she has tried to be always kind and present with me

She's the classic girl everyone would love to get married with: solid job, good driver, great cook (at least when she handles chicken), nice flat, huge bank account, a bright future in front of her

And, last but not least, she speaks around 8 or 9 languages, italian and old latin included

Looking forward to meet you in Rome, probably quite soon", 'createdDate': '2012-08-01T08:29:55Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '404272'}, 'from': {'id': '825541', 'publicName': 'Sirio X', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3530664', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/825541/abaf8da1-d9e7-4691-8b93-2e77bf6ef4bc', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
Sirio with his friend Gerald were my first CS hosting experience and this experience was perfect!

Sirio immediately found common ground with my cat and they fell in love with each other :)

In the daytime we did some "excurcions" in the city and nearby, my "tourists" were not capricious:)

And in the evening Sirio and Gerald made a big big big portion of tasty pasta for all of us! 

Sirio has cool sense of humour, sometimes he talks very funny things with so serious face)))

It was nice to meet you Sirio, and I`m totally glad that you still remember Yuri Shatunov (silly snowflakes) :)

text: I hosted Sirio and Gerald in Seoul for a few nights. From the moment we met, I knew they were two great guys--considerate, funny, polite, easygoing. Although I was very busy at work, we managed to find time afterwards for a meal and some drinks. I'm always a bit worried about my cats when I have surfers because I don't know how they will react to strangers; however, Sirio was great with my two cats. I was very happy about that! hahah Actually, I think my little boy cat, Taz, has finally met someone who can keep up with his craziness! He really enjoyed Sirio's company, too! I've learned so much about Europe (esp Italy and the food) from these two, so I'll definitely see them again on European soil! :)
inverseReference:
{'id': '10396766', 'text': "Wendy has hosted both my friend Gerald and I while we were travelling in South Korea

text: I stayed with Sirio 3 nights, everything was ok, he suggest me some good places to visit :) a nice and respectful person, see you next year!

I‚Äôm really thankful for the first  experience on CS. He was helpful  and friendly from the beginning we‚Äôve exchanged the contacts. Glad that by this way I had a chance to discover lovely Rome. Grazie mille Sirio! ;)

At first I chickened out and decided to cancel my stay with Sirio because this was my first time Couchsurfing and I didn't know what to expect - I had met up with people before but never stayed. I didn't know if I was expected to spend all my time with my host and was a bit puzzled at how CS portrayed itself to be a non-transactional platform, surely they expect something in return? I worried about being troublesome and booked a hostel when I reached Rome instead. 

We still met up on the day I was meant to "check-in" and it turned out to be a really nice time :) Sirio took me walking around Rome until the wee hours even though I think he was already getting tired (oops) and I felt really lucky to be able to see some wonderful sights in Rome minus the crowds. This also included stopping for delicious original Italian gelato!! I felt safe with Sirio and he agreed to accept me once again as a guest haha, and hosted me for a few days until I left for Florence.

Sirio is a sarcastic and funny person to be around; I initially had a few misconceptions about him :D He looks like some Italian singers so if you don't get to meet them, he's your next best choice. I'm not sure how detailed a CS review is supposed to be but anyway if this had a title maybe I would put "Comfortable stay, would stay again + bonus pet cat". The real reason I enjoyed my time with Sirio was actually hanging out with his adorable step cat, Sunny. Just kidding, partly :)

Thank you Sirio for the many lovely memories, til we meet again.

Ciao & Xxoo,
Alya
Serio offered to host, despite only having a small space he still made space available and he is a respectful host. Serio has a large couchsurfing network and will not hesitate to take you along!

inverseReference: {'id': '6381479', 'text': "My first meeting with Olga has been on internet...not so good...than came a second chance, vis-√†-vis...fairly better...but I've just learnt something of her after 3 days at my flat, and maybe now we can avoid misunderstandings...\r\n\r\nNot easy to describe Olga, as probably I did not understand so much, even staying with her...nice girl, interesting, really a good person to speak with...I've been glad to host her...still some distance among us, but maybe, with 1 or 2 more meetings, we will learn something more about each other", 'createdDate': '2010-12-20T20:38:12Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'other', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1311284'}, 'from': {'id': '825541', 'publicName': 'Sirio X', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3530664', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/825541/abaf8da1-d9e7-4691-8b93-2e77bf6ef4bc', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Sirio is a very interesting person, Maybe your first impression about him will be "he is very serious"..., but you will be surprised in a good way:  he has a very special sense of humour and you will have  refreshing conversations with him and the best suggestions about places in Roma . I enjoy a lot the time that we spent together, the pizza and  the ice cream that we shared. Thanks to those special moments I want come back to Roma

text:
Sirio saved my life on Christmas! Kind of emergency request. Thanks to him I didn't have to spend it alone in the rain. ;p We went together on Christmas CS Meeting where I had a lot of fun.
He's very mature, mindful and amusing and you'll have a lot of fun with him! Great respecter! At his place I was really well cared for. 
Thanks, Sirio, for making my time in Rome so enjoyable and unforgettable. :)

text: We were supposed to meet already before when Sirio visited Varese because of his work...but that time we coudn't meet because I was busy with my work. text: Siria I met in Treviso. He is a very interesting person, love's to travel so much and enjoys exploring new places. I was pleasantly surprised that he was visited  Belgrade / Serbia. Hope he will want to hear me and spend some time with me in my hometown :) In Rome, he hosted me and my two friends a few days. He was very generous and fine. We became friends and I'm happy about that. Sirio is the person that is interested in many things. For him nothing is difficult to do and he is always there to help. Knowing him, makes me feel happy. See you soon Romano :)

We've spent a couple of hours walking around the city-centre,talking and...eating a very good ice-cream...I'm sure he will remember it forever!! :-)) Sirio seems to be a very nice person,rich in his soul and funny.An authentic "romano" ;-)I really hope to meet him again...Good luck for everything,Sirio!
Ci vediamo a Roma!

text:
So, we've stayed for 4 days in Rome and it was a wonderful journey thanks to Eduardo. We explored Italian culture from different sides. I want to say a big big thanks to Eduardo for all: for meeting us at the station, for really good accommodation in lovely district of Monte Mario,  for his unlimited hospitality and advice of what to see and where to eat in Rome and etc. And of course the best thing of Eduardo's host was his personal tour around Rome with such beautiful places u would never discover by yourself. 
You will get acquainted with Italian culture by tasting home cooked dishes and amazing guitar music. Italian songs will occupy ur playlist for months :)

For someone who will read this review: it will be ur best couchsurfing, so don't doubt ‚òùÔ∏è

It was very nice to stay with Marco, very kind and friendly, we had a good time and we got along just in a second, i arrived alone in Rome and he helped myself alot, also he has a super nice apartment!
Cool place to visit) David have big music studio, so we had opportunity listen to ltalian music. Also was so nice to meet again Paola and Handrix) Hug you guys) üôèüèæ

text: Davide is very kind and hospitable. I am really happy, that he hosted me, because he is a really special person if you need to broaden your mind. I've never had visited any music studio before and I've never seen such unusual music instruments. It was a great experience for me ))) I felt free and really like at home at his place. I enjoyed experimental cuisine and sharing music. Davide,  thank you very much for hosting me and good luck in your creative life ))
Davide is the best host in the world! Such a beautiful spirit, great people around his place and such a gooood energy! We hope to come to Rome again - soon :))))

Davide is one of the most interesting people I've met in my life. We stayed with him for several days, during which he showed us his working day, cook a great dinner and especially talked with us and discussed about food, music and life. He inspired me a lot of what he is doing and his approach of life. I hope we stay in touch and that we will met again! :)

I'm not actually sure how to start with this reference - yet I have written like 7 different sentences and deleted them afterwards with a thought, that such special people as a  Davide deserves something equally special and nothing like a typical "oh great open-minded person". Staying with a Davide in his professional recording studio and watching his fundamentaly different way of living (and doing things in general) truly is a PRIVILEGE. Davide who only eats fruits (and potatoes when he gets sad :) ) has been in a working rush nearly all the time (one band recording was always switched by another) and even though he always found a time to share something with us, introduced us to all the people at the studio, cooked us a delicious meal and the phrase"make yourself at home" for the first time in my life was NOT just a phrase. For me this was the first couchsurfing experience and I can't imagine how better it could be. It's very uneasy to express our gratitude for how great it was. I thing I may sincerely agree with a comment I have read below which said "person who could stay with Davide (or just meet him) and didn't do so would make one of the biggest mistakes of his life". Thanks a lot Davide and if you desire to meet traditional czech folklor, you are always invited to our place! :)

P.S. I am sorry for not getting in touch with you yesterday - we have a lack of time due some card allowing us to visit a lot of galleries, but we would really like to see you today and invite you to go with us to the sea tomorrow! We'll get in touch with you.

I feel so lucky to have met Emiliano, let alone have stayed with him in his home. Emiliano met me at the train station and took me to his home and then all around Rome to take pictures. It was like a dream. 

Emiliano is attentive, punctual, and all around charming. His English is very good and he will help you practice Italian. Despite my visit interrupting his work week, he made every effort to insure I had the best time in Roma. 

So happy to have met you Emiliano and I will see you again Friday! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è My home is your home always.

Emiliano is a great host, he lives in a very nice house from which is easy to to get to the centre of Rome. He is a kind and a helpful person, he cooked for me and took me to the bus station. I absolutely recomend him as a host.

Me and my friend stayed 3 night at Roma. We arrived late, but he and his friend took us from the sitation and we went to drink something in a hidden bar which was super cool. He cooked for us, he introduced us with his friends. They were very nice people. 
He is so social, helpful, thoughtful and really kind guy. Also I felt really comfortable at his home. Not like a stranger. And his cat, Kira.. the cutest thing ever! She was playful and funny. 
I would definitely recommend to stay.‚ú®
Thank you sooooo much for everything Emiliano!

Do you want to meet a real Italian? Spend time with Emiliano! It will be impossible to stay 5 minutes without a good laugh and you probably will have an amazing time. He was extremely helpful in accepting my request just one day before I arrived in Rome. He picked me up at the station, took me to eat and meet his friends on a very amazing evening. We had an amazing motorcycle tour, he showed me many parts of the city and stopped to take photos (Ask him to look at his pictures, well worth it!), And I even met one of the coolest hidden bars I've ever been. It was an amazing experience, and now I think I‚Äôm able  to choose a good gelato! :)
Thanks Emiliano and sweet Kira for that lovely  time!

So I decided to hit the road to Rome quite spontaneously to escape the weather in Germany for a few days. Although my request was really short notice, I have been accepted by Emiliano immediately.  He even picked me up at the station and took me out for dinner with one of his friends. Due to personal reasons I had to rush back home the same evening. Thankfully Emiliano made sure I get back to the train station in time, which was really nice of him!

Saying that my stay with Emiliano was nice is not enough! I would have never expected to enjoy more and met someone as nice as him. He showed me places I didn‚Äôt know, recommended and in general the experience was beyond great! You know that u have a friend In Copenhagen whenever you need it and I hope that I‚Äôll see you soon!

text:
Emiliano is described by his friends as a person with a lot of friends, that everyone knows. Emiliano's friends are not wrong when they say it. He is super sociable and makes you feel like a friend as soon as you arrive. He and Kira, his beautiful cat.
Meeting Emiiano was a beautiful experience. I found a couch in every sense of the word. At all times, he shared with me his spaces, his moments, his food, his friends ... his life. Without a doubt, when I write this, I remember it and I get excited. It's beautiful to find people like that because you know that if more people would feel like sharing, the world would be more beautiful.
With Emiliano I shared very interesting talks about life between dinners, motorcycle trips around the city and breakfasts. To the talks they joined, dances on birthdays and pizzas / beers with their friends- who, like him, did not hesitate to open their hearts to me-.
Rome is beautiful, it has a lot of history and places that I will not forget; but, most important, it has warm beings and are open to others like Emiliano, Kira and their friends.
I celebrate the meeting of all of us !! Infinite thanks!!!

Trully couchsurfer in the soul. Easygoing, he uses to include you in his habits and makes you feeling  comfortable. He had the kindness of hosting me even though my last minute request and he gave me many tasks thanks to  his Rome-life experience.  Finally, Kira is very very cute and funny üòç see you soon again

Emiliano is so generous, avalaible and friendly.
His house is little, really confortable and you will love Kira, his sweet cat.
I recommend a stay at his house.
He will not disappoint your expectations!

He is a friendly and kind guy. Speaks Spanish, English and Italian so was no problem to speak with him.
 He went to pick me up to the train station.. And he was worried about little details to make me feel comfortable :)

Heh) this guy real men, which live a normal life. He is not poor and not reach, he is just a student and live so nice. His dog... oh, the best one)
We spoke about life and travel of course) He cooked Italian pasta for dinner, gave me good place for 2 nights and comfort atmospheric.
For sure will recommend for everybody. And wish you only best people on the way. Good luck üòâ

Mario was incredible host.it was late hours and I had some problems with my hostel and he told that I can host you.I went his working place,he gave me a key of his house,even thought he never seen me before.He was so nice to me.Thank you for everything Mario!

Mario was a really nice host! Mario is incredible! It was a great experience to pass this time with him. He is fun, smart and with a huge heart! He makes me feel at home, so confortable and free space. I'm waiting your visit at Brazil!

Mario was great. He showed us some good spots in Rome. I can say that he is a friend now.

Mario! What a champ! My first night in after a long flight from Sydney was so relaxing. We ate pasta Mario made and chilled in his cute little apartment. It‚Äôs on a lovely street and in a fantastic location. I was travelling to Sicily the next day so I only spent a very short time in Rome but having gelato for lunch was fun and Mario insisted on driving me to meet a friend on his scooter. Mario is a wonderful host and a very good person! :) Me and my friend stayed at his apartment for 3 nights. He is very friendly and easy-going, super welcoming and cares about his guests. We had so much fun talking everyday and he cooked for us delicious dinners.  Also he has a very nice friends, with which we spend great evening and they showed us the city at night.
His apartment is in a really great location. There are a wonderful library and Botanical garden :D
I absolutely recomend him as a host! ;)

It was so amazing staying with Mario. Super easy and good vibe, hospitality, and he made me feel home immediately.  Unfortunately we were both quite busy but the last night we had great time with his friends, good funny chats, playing rap beats and chess all night. Mario, thank you sooo much for the very pleasant stay. Feel free to come over to Vienna whenever you like! :)

Mario accepted my request super last minute. Even though I‚Äòve already booked a hostel I decided to stay the night at his place with no regrets! He‚Äòs such a nice and fun guy who‚Äòs really down to earth and easy to talk to. He was quite busy that he lent me his keys right away. Mario is the best! He opened the doors of his house, gave us a key, freedom to move us, took care that we were comfortable and helped us with our tours. Mario is great host! Cooked some very good pasta and I was very happy meeting his super nice family and friends! I had a very nice time and very good conversations! Hope to see you guys again sooooonnnn!

Mario is a super fun guy. He's really easy to talk to and you'll feel right at home at his place.
It felt like Mario is on Couchsurfer for all the right reasons and it was great meeting a local in Rome.
He has a really interesting art-studio at his place and you'd be gripped if you're into art at all.
It was fun riding his scooter on a super chilly morning across Rome.

Unfortunately, I couldn't spend too much time with him because he had to leave town. But I had a great experience and I look forward to hanging out when he visits India!

Thanks to our new friend Mario! It was a big pleasure to stay one night in your house...
Mario cooked us a good plate of pasta, it was really friendly ans lovely! Thanks Again. 
You are of course welcome in our flat in Paris ;)
See you!
Vincent & Alexane

I dont even know how to start to describe my stay at Marios place. 
He had an exam that day so he left me his key and let me in his apartment alone without eaven knowing me, when he came back he was dead tired but we still hanged out, talked and drank some beers. The guy is a legend and I think I couldn't have wished for a better first experience on couch surfing and in Rome and I really hope we meet again during my stay here.
Even though he beat me in FIFA i still liked him, thats the best reference a passionate FIFA player could leave :D

Mario is an amazing host ! Super funny, hospitable and sweet. He accepted my request even though it was last minute and he was busy with uni. He instantly made me feel welcome and at home, cooked some nice pasta for me and we spent a really nice time talking and laughing about many different things. He is very enthusiastic and knows about a lot... He also arranged everything so I could move around and make the most of my day in Rome and lent me his keys.  To sum it up : an amazing host ! If you have the chance I strongly recommend you to meet Mario :-)
Non so come ringraziarti Mario, √© stato davvero ottimo, sei sempre benvenutto a Parigi :-)

Every normal recommendation and description will be too boring to say about Mario. Anyway I'll do my best to describe at least 1%!
 This charming guy answered for my "last minute" request. From first meeting was treating me as his old friend. (Thanks buddy for all of scooter's experience üòÖ was totally cool! Even if I freeze over few times.) Super Mario, my best story teller (lubisz pingwiny? üêßüòÖ), dreamer and music lover! ‚ù§Ô∏è you never be bored with him, but please do me (him) a favor, if you're not flexible, boring, not music lover or you search for someone who will be your guide from morning to evening, don't disturb super Mario, he is lovely but don't waste his time if you come to Rome just to see colosseum üòâ
I'm gonna miss you! But hope so it wasn't our last meeting! Kisses üòò

Mario is a really great guy! He responded to my last minute request and hosted me at his place for one night. I felt very welcome at his place and he even offered me pasta that he cooked after I arrived. Although he was busy studying for an exam we shared pizza and beer and he gave me some information about the city. It was really nice to stay at your place! Whenever your in Holland, give me a call. It would be nice to meet again!

Meeting Super Mario and his friends was one of the highlights of my trip across Italy üòá He's an easy-going, open minded guy with whom you will never be bored. He has many interesting things to tell, and ever more great plans for the future. You can talk to him about various topics. Even though he had to study for his exams he decided to spend time with me, what I really appreciate. He made me feel well and comfortable at his place, as if I was just visiting an old good friend. I enjoyed my stay in Rome so much! Thanks for all Mario, and you're welcome in Berlin! üòä

Francesco is one word: AMAZING.  He came to pick me up at the train station even though I said I would come by myself so as not to disturb him from studies. He lives with his mum and sister, he has 2 dogs (super playful and so sweet). Francesco couldn‚Äôt take me around due to his exams and being a med student like him, I know how much concentration is important. I went around the city on my own but in the evening we went out together and I met some friends of his like Valeria, Antonella, Leonardo who were super nice. We also talked about our interests, most especially photography (he has an incredible talent for the photo camera) and I learnt new German words from him.
I was supposed to stay only one night but I ended up staying two nights and as a thank you, I prepared him dinner on the last night and even though he is vegan, it was easy to adapt to his meal preferences. 
I highly recommend staying or even hosting him; I will definitely host him when he comes to my city. Danke!‚ù§Ô∏è

I altered my entire itinerary just to come to Rome and be hosted by him because he gave me such good vibes while chatting. What a great person with a big heart! He was always considerate and helpful. During my second visit to Rome I was able to experience it through the eyes of Mayor Marco, who knows everyone in the neighborhood. Beautiful views/buildings, local markets, hanging at his restaurant where I threatened to serve only chocolate cake... I must‚Äôve gained a lot of weight those few days but it was worth it haha. To Lucifer, gelato, walks with the legendary Gappel! Now I better watch the guerrieres of the night already. Forza Roma!!! I‚Äôm very bad üòâ

text: There's not enough words to describe how much of an amazing person Marco is ... and Gabber (his cute dog)! If you have the chance to stay with him, you should feel extremely lucky - like we did! My friend and I planned on staying in Rome for three days and winded up staying with Marco for A WEEK, because we loved him that much! He owns an American style street food shop inspired by the classic movie, The Warriors (which we watched together), and cooks the most amazing food! He lives directly in the center, we went out for drinks.. tried pretty much every Bloody Mary in Rome, then bought stuff to make our own at his house! We went to a bunch of cool bars, even a karaoke bar - but nothing compared to just hanging out together at his house talking until 5am! We were there on Mothers Day and even went to lunch with his whole family! We missed him and Gabber the second we left Rome and will 100% see him very soon! Thank you for everything ‚ù§Ô∏è See you in the US!!

text:
Marco is a Great guy !! Very easy going and layback and great in the kitchen , He was my first couch surfing experience and was incredible! he made the best foodie tour ever , and as soon as I got to his restaurant,  I meet  people he hosted before and felt so welcome, even if you do not have the opportunity to stayed with him made the market tour with him, as you will be able to try the best Italian delicatessen!!! Amazing experience if food is your thing you have to meet him ! ! And his location is great just one  block for Vatican City .

Marco immediately made me feel at home upon my arrival in Rome! By the end of my stay, I really felt like I was visiting a friend. I will definitely be in touch with him, will 100% see him again in Rome and would be happy to host him one day wherever I may be!! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay in Rome!!! P.S. if you stay with him, try the Elvis burger! Take care Marco!

Marco was fantastic! Not only did he make me feel completely at home, but he also insisted on cooking for me and taking me to see a wonderful view of Rome and some hidden streets that many people don't know about. I work remotely, and he was super accommodating with letting me work from his home when he wasn't there or offered to let me work from his restaurant (which is fab!). He also has the cutest little dog. Nothing but good intentions and genuine friendship from this guy, and would definitely stay again. If you have the chance to stay with him, do it!
Best couchsurfing ever! Now we have an awesome friendship and I definitely recommend it! Very good spot, close to Vatican and everything else!

It was the best part of my short time in Rome. I felt very welcomed and it was like a second home. He offered me food and cooked for me and showed me the town. We had good conversations and a lot of fun!

Marco was really sweet, genuine, down to earth guy who hosted us at the last minute when our plans changed. We are so glad that we decided to stay another night and have the chance to stay with Marco. He owns an awesome food shop with delicious hot dogs that's in a great location. He has the cutest pup and we had the best time strolling around the Vatican City at night enjoying local favorite gelato and pastries.  Hopefully we can cross paths again soon!

Raffaello is an incredible host! gentleman, a wonderful cook, knows the city like nobody else and made my trip to Rome an even more pleasant experience! got me at the bus station showed me the most important tourist spots in the city, it was a true travel partner! your house is incredible and your cat Ciccio a lovely animal! would certainly recommend Raffaello and would stay with him again!
‚û°Raffa you will be always welcome in Porto Alegre!

text: Max is an awesome host. Kind and thoughtful. He could fill 5 days with only talking about the history of his city and showing you around. It was a pleasure meeting you and listen to your travel stories-specially the one with the spaceship. Believe in your self cause noone will be with you if you don't do the first step. Thank you again and let's eat a milky way bar next time.

I couldn‚Äôt ask for more! Perfect host! I can even say - one of the best hosts I‚Äôve ever had! 
Max has met me in the airport and took me for the awesome dinner in a very local place.
The next day he made full guide tour around the city (look like he is a professional guide, really impressive!)
Thanks to Max I had a chance to see how locals live, where do they eat; I‚Äôve tried the best pizza, pasta, coffee and gelato. 
He also was happy to help me to organize my yoga class. And he went with me to the bus station at midnight when I was leaving.
Thank you Max for the great experience! For the wonderful Rome spirit!!! 
I wish you the best guests!!! Looking forward to seeing you again!!! 
Ciao!

Massimiliano is an amazing host. He kindly took the time to show me around the historical and most interesting spots in the city. He also cooked for me yummy pasta, and helped me navigate my time in the city in many other ways. If you are looking to stay with a wonderful person, look no further, Massimiliano is your guy! He really helped make my time in Rome more fun. Thanks Massimiliano for hosting me!

It was meeting of a friend. I met Max in Kosice and he invited me to the Rome. And that's was the beginning of my trip through Italy. So I can thank to him for this adventurous vacation. Thanks to Max I had wonderful time in Rome. He is spectacular‚Äã guide, he knows his city very well. And no just a city but whole Italy. He has amazing sense of sarcastic humor and he is also very intelligent. You can speak with him about everything. He is generous and kind. His flat is very nice and clean in quiet area. I had a wonderful time with him. Thank you for making my stay in Rome so fabulous. And also for cusine experience :) Ciao. See you again in Kosice.

So .... Massimiliano met me at the airport, which was very valuable for me, as I was in Rome for the first time .... Massimiliano lives near the center, which is very convenient for moving around the city ... a historic house with high ceilings ... the apartment is clean with rare furniture and a beautiful view of the courtyard. Massimiliano was very courteous.He spent with me almost all the time while I was with him .... He showed me all the interesting places in the center that took 8 hours! Despite his fatigue, the next day he again walked with me. ... August 14, I had a birthday. In the morning he gave me a cake with a candle and sang to me a song in Italian ... it was so touching! Then he took me to a picturesque place on the lake where we had a great time! I am very grateful to Massimiliano that he showed me how cordial and hospitable could be I'm happy to take it in my home in St. Petersburg.–°iao,Massimiliano!!üòöüòöüòçüòçüòÄ

text: Massimiliano is definitely one of the best hosts you can find in Rome. He is intelligent, polite and very knowledgeable about his city. He took me to show around Rome and was a perfect guide telling me a lot about the history of Rome and Italy. He also took me to a few Italian restaurants where I got the most delicious pizza I've ever tried in my life. Thank you so much for everything Massimiliano!!! Good luck to you!:)))

Massimiliano is an amazing person. He hosted me and my sister for two nights and all the time he was so friendly and hospitable. A whole first day he stayed with us and introduced us the beauties of Rome while telling us interesting facts about them. We had a great time with him because he has a perfect sense of humor and in his flat we felt as home. We also cooked togehter while sharing Czech and Italien cuisine and tasted the best ice-cream in Rome. We had there lot of fun! Thank you for meeting you!

Andy is a great respectful host and amazing DJ! Enjoyed saying with him in his quite apartment outside of Roma.  He was so kind to pick me up from the station, cook me a dinner, walk around Roma and even wait for me for few hours while I had to finish my work on my laptop. His English is basic but he was so kind to teach me some more Italian, even some Romanian dialects! :D  I will stay with him one more night - really great person!

Andrea is one of those guys when you meet on first seems like 'oh my Gosh ... it's going to be the weirded surfing ever'! But to be honest it was the funniest surfing ever. Andrea is very nice and reliable person, very friendly and disposable! All days he spent with me driving me from his house to the city center even its distance about 30 minutes. He took me to ancient piazza navona and share as much as he could. After all I convinced him to take a vacation for himself as well. No doubt you will be treated well and carried in his home. Caro Andrea rimani cos√¨ dolce e divertente. 
Buona fortuna e buone vacanze. 
Lenka

text: Gianluca is just the nicest and most generous host you can imagine. We stayed at his place for four nights and had an amazing time hanging out with him. I honestly don't even know where to start. He picked us up with his car at the central station and shared some really good red wine with us on the first night. If you're interested in wine a little bit, you will have the greatest time because Gianluca knows a LOT and it's just so enjoyable listening to him talking about his passion. He introduced us to some of his "wine friends" who are also incredibly nice people and we celebrated Easter together at a marvelous house a little outside Rome with tons of Italian food and good wine. Gianluca also gave us a little sightseeing tour with his car and thanks to him, we  found out about so many cool places to eat and drink and party.  If you have a chance to stay with this guy or host him, then do it! You will definitely not regret it. Thanks again for everything! Tobi and Laetitia

It was my first couchsurf experience and I really liked it. Gianluca was very kind to pick us up from the sity and show the main places of interest. Unfortunatelly, we stayed only for one night and didn't have time to communicate a lot.

text:
Me and my boyfriend stayed at Gianluca's place in Rome for 3 days (or nights, because we had some missunderstanding about that :))). He is a really nice guy, even though he's been kind of busy it still felt like home. Picked us up from the city when we arrived to Rome at night! This stay was really nice experience, we wish we had spent more time together.
Thanks again! :))
I ended up not staying with Gianluca, but he was the sweetest person to all the time. He offered his house and was very friendly! I would love to stay with him!

text:
We were so lucky to be hosted by Gianluca. It was our first time surfing, but everything went very smoothly. First of all, the house was very clean and neat reflecting our host:) He is a friendly person who helped us a lot about the city and the culture. He did his best to make us feel home. We laughed and ate a lot together.  We are hoping to host him if he ever visits Istanbul again sometime. Thanks for making our Rome experience even better.  

Aysenur, Didem & Zeliha

G. welcomed us with availability and kindness in its beautiful apartment, our stay at his home was pleasant, peaceful and allowed us to find the peace which we looked for at this moment when we needed rest. He was attentive to the fact that we have a good stay, and to give us advice on his city. We regret only not having much time to exchange with him, because his flat speaks about a cultivated person who has some taste. It was a positive experience in every respect, and his home was a harbor of tranquillity for us. Thank you for the heat of a tea, the benevolence, the relaxed atmosphere, the good music and the kindness. Maybe one day we could benefit of a bike ride together?
Mathilde :)   &   Camille :)

Oh, what to say about Gianluca! It was my first great experience with couchsurfing and I 'll remember him forever. He is so kind and hospitable and always helpfull and I felt more than welcome. I went to his house with my boyfriend and he was so relaxed and he knows how to keep the balances and make you feel comfortable. He cooked for us, he took us a ride with his car, he talked us about wine, we went to a lovely party and when he had time he was ours and we made great things. Oh also he took for us a lovely ice- cream! I m gratefull that he introduce me to Italian songs and now all the day I' m singing "tuca tuca". He is a very interesting person with nice stories to say and share and he is very touching. I hope to see him soon because I count him as a friend. We also waiting for him in Greece! 

pg:thank you for all, I ve already miss the train sound of your phone!
Take care. Hugs&kisses!

Gianluca hosted me and my boyfriend for 3 days.  He was very helpful, he showed us aroud the city and recommended some spots we wouldn't find without him (the best pizza ever!). He is fun to be with, you can easily find a topic to talk about. I would highly recommend him as a host and I'm waiting for him to visit us back in Poland. :)

Gianluca was very generous to open his home to me and my boyfriend. he gave great directions to him home and to other things which is always important. he kept in touch during the day we were out exploring home and we hope to see him soon in Berlin ! thanks for being a great host!

Gianluca hosted me and my boyfriend for 2 nights. He was very friendly, polite, fun and kind host. :) pity we couldn't have dinner together. 
Highly recommended. Thank you, Gianluca!
Gianluca is a very nice guy! He hosted for only one night, but we talked for hours and he showed me a lot ot great italian singers! He cooks really well too! Thank you for your hospitality, Gianluca!

Gianluca was very kind to offer us a place to stay in his beautiful home in Rome! He showed us wonderful hospitality and even made us simple yet awesome homecooked pasta and let us try some Italian wine from his awesome wine collection. We are also really thankful that he helped us out when we were pickpocketed in Rome. We wish we could have had more time with him, he is definitely an interesting guy. Hope to meet you again next time! :)
Yen and Aldric

After having been ignored and declined for the twentieth times, Gianluca hosted me and my partner in Rome for two nights. We had the most wonderful experience: he is a very nice and helpful man, his flat is clean and spacious, and it was very nice chatting with him over a pizza about all kinds of issues of the world. Mille grazie, Gianluca!üòä

text: Gianluca is a great host and experienced guy. It was our first experience with couchsurfing and we really enjoyed it. He advised us best places to go and recommended quick tour through the centre. And finally he has awesome apartment with nice view on fields. Thank you and you are always welcome in Prague ;-)

text:
Gianluca is a very generous and friendly guy! He offered us a nice seperate room with soft beds.
Although we didn't get too much time to spend together, he showed us the local market in the morning, drove us to the bar to buy ticket, and gave us some really useful advice!!! 
I lost my watch at his house and he tried his best to help me with it!
Thank you so much! You are welcome to the Rhein area for some nice wine, the expert!!! :)

Gianluca is a wine lover, it was amazing to share this experience of drinking wine with him, when he invited us to be on the party he organised at his place. We had many nice conversations. Also he hosted me just directly after coming from his travels, which was nice of his part, because he was pretty busy. And the apartment was huge, a bit far from the centre, but nicely put with views on fields and forests.

good luck

I spent only one night with Gianluca and sadly we didn't have time to spend together but in our way home. Gianluca was coming back from his holidays and still he decided to host me for one night when I was desperate for an  accommodation. He was very polite, shred his lovely  and home with  me.
He's a brilliant person and a very good host
Gianluca is a great host, a wine lover, with a lot of travelling experience, a very bright person.

Gianluca shared his home with my partner and I for two nights, and was the most wonderful, friendly and generous guy we could have possibly hoped to have had as a host! Not only did he share his home with us, but he shared his company and friends in a welcome and non-imposing manner. Not to set expectations too high, but I'd be amiss not to say that with Gianluca we drank some of the best wine of our lives. Thank you Gianluca for the wonderful time, we hope one day our paths may cross again!

We stayed with Gianluca for 3 days in Rome and really enjoyed the time spent there. Although he was really busy during the weekend he managed to find some time for us, so we had a great dinner with him and his friends in restaurant with typical Italian food that was yummy and we had a walk and visited some great bar together. He‚Äôs a very intelligent guy, experienced traveler, true expert when it comes to wine and he also knows much about a city! He really made us feel at home during our stay! Thank you so much and really if you had time to visit Poland please, be our guest! :)

Gianluca offered to host us although he had a lot of work those days. So we didn't have much time to spend together but we are very grateful for having us! He is a good host, he explained us how to move around, and he also recommended us to go to a Festival, which was very nice. Thanks Gianluca!

text:
Another great experience in my life! 
I must say that thanks to Gianluca, we travelled the length and breadth of Rome  (almost). We saw much more than we previously planned and that was amazing!
Gianluca recommended us a lot of interesting places and restaurants as well as shared his experience about travelling.
Gianluca is a person of kind heart, very helpful and easy-going. With him we felt comfortable and safe :) 
Thank you for the Sunday's night with your friends, they are amazing!
Thanks as well for recommendation of artichoke, the best crisps we have ever eaten :)
We are waiting for you in Gdansk. So many bike paths to explore! Thank you very much again Gianluca.

A big thank you to you Gianluca. This guy was kind enough to have us over after a weekend away and even had the energy to hangout and chat with us.  He's a big lover of music and is easily able to talk about everything.  Though brief, we had a good time. 

Hope to see you again down the road. Take care!

text: Staying with Gianluca is the most tampering experience I have ever had. He is always resourceful, kind and considerate. Despite his busy work and courses, he still managed to host me and made me feel like home. Thank you Gianluca, and I'll have to demand you that book list. :)

Gianluca hosted me and three more surfers at the same time in Rome. On my point of view it says a lot about someone. He picked us to the city centre and again to his place when it was needed and shared with us lots of information about its history. Actually I think he knows a lot about almost every topic, so he can talk even of the history of your own country. I‚Äôm very grateful for his hospitability.

My friend Nacho and me were lucky to get to know Gianluca. He is a passionate traveller with a great life attitude, he's very open-minded, adventurous and easy-going person. It was an awesome experience chatting with him, having dinner and walking around the city. He is always ready to help his guests and tries to make their stay as convenient as possible.

The best host ever!! I surfed in Gianluca's place for my last trip in Europe and it was the best experience, we hanged out a few nights, Gianluca is very generous and easy going, the first night he invited us dinner! his home is very big and bed is comfortable, he took us to gelatos for quite a few times and it was the best i had. I had my best couch surfing experience in my final stop in Rome, I'm so lucky! and because of him i know where I'm going to travel in my next stop - north pole! thanks for all the experience sharing with me and your help in Rome, I hope one day I go back! you are a really good friend, thank you! :D

I stayed with my boyfriend at gianluca's place and i had a short, but cool time there....he's very open-minded and we talked a lot about not only typical daily-topics...he showed me the best place in town to eat 'cremolata', and cooked delicious pasta for us!! Totally recommendable!

Gianluca hosted us for 4 days and he's been really kind with us from the beginning to the end. We have enjoyed a lot our time together and we'll love to meet him again, hopefully offering him our hospitality this time. People like him make Couchsurfing a wonderful site.
Grazie mille!

text: Gianluca is a the kindest and most hospitable guy I have met in Italy throughout my 1 week trip. While he was so hardly working and tired, he spent much time about my troubles to go back. He told facts and stories about the local and the real history of Rome. We have talked about the local foods, politics, musics, books etc. I have discovered similarities of Meditarrean countries. And he bring me to the 1st of May party which was really fantastic for me. Hope to host u G.

I had a compact but truly delightful CS experience with Gianluca. and everything was perfect. 
we had interesting conversations while eating Roman pizza and drinking tea. though I missed the wine tasting, he shared me of his great wines. 
grazie e ci vediamo

text: Gianluca helped me out a big time! When I was let down by another host in Rome and had to fine a couch just a couple hours before arriving to the city, he answered my last-minute request and generously let me surf his couch (in fact, a separate room) for the next 3 days. Needless to say, I am extremely grateful for that! Besides, Gianluca is a truly interesting person. I enjoyed our late conversations in the kitchen very much. What I truly admired about him is that he has his definite opinion on many things - but remains open-minded and attentive to other people's opinions. Despite being busy with many things, he found time to give me a nice drive-around and show me Rome at night (and also drop by at a wonderful pizza place). Gianluca, I hope you enjoy your time in my city! Any time you want to return, just le t me know ;) And thanks again!

text:
Gianluca was a great host ! We spent 3 nights to his place, sharing good meal and good wine !
Thank you very much !

Gianluca hosted me and my friend for 4 nights in April. He is an intelligent, generous and humorous person who is very interesting to talk to. He is kind enough to offer us a private room with much privacy, which we never have expected that. Though he is busy, he managed to take us to a night-city-ride in his car and tour us around Roma. I would highly recommend him as a host! :D
Please keep in touch!

text:
Gianluca is a great host! 
That was our first surfing experience, and it was amazing!
He offered us a comfortable apartment and as much privacy as we even never expected. Although we were "lucky" to catch the most coldest days in Rome this year, he supported us with ten or even more blankets to keep us warm in his house. He showed us around the first night we arrived... late at night. He even met us on the railway station, which is great, because there was no public transportation at that time. We've spent a great time in a wine bar another evening having some chat over a bottle of wine, meeting his friends... wish we could continue party with them till the very morning, but we were tired after the long day walking around Rome. There was also a quiet and nice evening in his house over another bottle of wine (he is an expert in it, being a sommelier). Gianluca is very generous and a real gentleman. Thank you very much for your hospitality.

Gianluca is a perfect host! He's welcoming, warm and always willing to have some chat with you over a bottle of wine (even if he comes back home a bit sick and late from work. 
Thanks a lot for everything! :)

what an amazing host! thank you so much again for everything. not only did gianluca save our arses when we arrived in the middle of the night after our plane got delayed, he also didn't let being busy and sick put him off spending time with us and looking after us. you're a star! :-)
Gianluca is such a nice person! Really interesting, calm, easygoing and talkative, very open to listen, learn and share. Definitely a person you want to spend time with.

text: Francesco is a marvelous host. He picked us up, offered us all we needed, helped us wherever he could, showed us typical places for having an Italian espresso, tiramis√π and pizza and was always able to reach on the phone whenever we needed his help. Moreover, he was quiet interested in sharing time, we visited the Pantheon together and always kept in touch with us during our stay. Also, Francesco is tremendously flexible: without hesitating he accepted to host us one additional night. So, to sum up, he's simply a lovely guy and I would highly recommend everybody to meet and hang out with him in Rome or, if you get the possibility, to stay in his flat for a while. Grazie mille per tutto, Francesco! Arrivederci!

Francesco is an awesome guy! He hosted me and my friends for a night and a day. We were there for a very short time but he took us to the Vatican and collesium. He made sure we saw what we wanted too. He was very kind to make us breakfast in the morning and also pick us up from the airport when we arrived: he is very hospitable and friendly! We had a great time with him! We hope to see you again Francesco!

ho perso le parole... well, the hospitality of Francesco left me speachless - he hosted us two days before joining Couch Surfing! he agreed to take care of us when our previous host (greetings for Silvio!) had his friend coming. and then - we were supposed to stay just for one night, but it resulted into three. so, once again: thanks for your great help, your company, conversations and dinner at your place. I hope to have the possibility to repay your kindness:) grazie mille!!!take care!!! e saluti per Alfredo!:)

Ciao Francesco!! Me and my friend Monika had been hosted by Francisco that we met by Silvio. How to describe Francisco? In one word : Kindness! He hosted us really nicely and the meeting with his brother Alfredo made our trip much more worth! We talk for hours, went out with their friends , discover a super restaurant, and had a lot of fun for the night life in trastevere and in home party! As for Silvio, I already regret we can't meet regularly for a drink in the center of Roma! So very simply: Francesco and Alfredo are new friends! I hope that you will come to discover Warsaw and that we keep in touch for others meetings! Ciao Francisco ! Thanks again for your hospitality ( and your wonderfull bed!) and a rivederci pronto!!! Salut!

Alberto is not just a good host, he is a friend) very intelligent, interesting in conversation, kind, helped us to see Rome from another side,  gave advices and a looooot of other good things))) it was my first cs experience, and I really glad about it)))) I can recommend to people who need not only to sleep, but to share experience)))

My first reference to Alberto was negative because I expected much from him as a host.
I still have contact with him, now I understood that It was just a bad period for him when I visited Rome, because of weather, because of his job schedule in these days.
I expect that he would give me his apartments key, since he had to stay long at work.. but the truth is no one have to, he didn‚Äôt have to.
In the end I can say that of course I could have had a better experience, but It was not his fault.
I am sure next time would be better, this reference is to make it up for Alberto and to be just.
I would add also, that Alberto is very much fun to talk to and have a conversation with. Good friend, good host.. maybe one day a happy traveler in Sweden.

Alberto, is a kind and respectful host, with a clean apartment but I didn‚Äôt enjoy staying with him, I believe he made it harder for me to enjoy Rome because I was forced to stay outside during his long working hours. He made me confused when he found different reasons to why I should be leaving earlier than agreed. As a guest I didn‚Äôt abuse him or his apartment, but still he wasn‚Äôt comfortable having me around so I had to leave his place, just so he tell me afterwards that I can be back and blame it on language misunderstanding. He didn‚Äôt want to show me the city, and wasn‚Äôt knowledgeable of the city history. It was a negative cs experience.

text: Roberto is a very nice Italian papa with an interesting background of master chefs in his family. text: Staying with Alessandro was amazing. He‚Äôs so knowledgeable about his city and so many other things I feel like I learned more in 4 days than I had in a while. Alessandro was so nice and a great cook and showed me so many things and made my time in Rome so special!

He took me around every night, was so generous, and answered all of my sometimes stupid questions with a smile üòä I really couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience! We went to his village in the country side and explored the less touristy parts of Rome which ended up being my favorite. See you again Alessandro!!! Grazie cento Mille per tutti!!

text:
It was my first experience, it was perfect. I stayed 3 nights and all day rainy, so it might have become worst city for me but thanks to Alessandro, Rome is wonderful city for me. I‚Äôll definitely come again. 
I‚Äôm solo traveler and woman, but it was totally safe and he was really really considerable person. And he cooks well, fist day and last day he cooked for me. It was amazing. Don‚Äôt hesitate to stay with him!

I am so glad to met him! He is so kind and nice! He helped me everything about Rome! And he cooked dinner for me ( IT WAS DELICIOUS) Thank you so much for everything! And have a nice trip in Istanbul in February!! :)

Alessandro met us at the station, thought it was rather late and it was friday;) He was friendly and nice,  but the main thing is that he is a guide, so is passionate about Rome and know lots of interesting things! It was a great pleasure to visit his tour and follow not-touristic path of the Eternal City! I wish we could have more time together, but during the day we had no wi-fi connection so it was diffucult to meet up:( I hope we will meet again! And one advice - if u go to rome, it is strongly recommended to visit his "VENI VIDI VISIT" excursion! One of the most informative i've ever been to! Thank you, Alessandro! Wishing u all the best!

i wouldn't stay with Alessandro. He cancelled my stay last minute leaving me in a difficult situation where I had to find a hostel within a day. He not only forgot that I was coming but he had planned something during the time I was supposed to be there and it also conflicted with what I wanted to do. It was poor communication, poor planning and just not a great experience overall.

Thank you Alessandro for your amazing hospitality! He was super helpful and welcoming to a weary traveler. Even though he was working, he arranged a friend to meet me. On top of that I didn't have a phone at the time, and he still managed to find me. His friends brought me to the best place to experience my first Italian pizza and have interesting conversations about Italian culture and much more. He shared his food and was totally fine with me sleeping in after he went to work, which I desperately needed that particular morning. Unfortunately I was unable to spend much time with Alessandro, but I know his home is a comfortable, multi-cultural place with a cool wall of notes from visitors and friendly roommates! Any travelers or hosts would be lucky to receive the generosity this guy gave me.  :) Grazie Alessandro!

I stayed with Alessandro on my last night in Rome, and only wish we could have spent more time together - he is like a walking encyclopedia about all things Italy (and probably most other places, too). He is friendly and very chatty and I felt comfortable in his home - definitely recommend :)

He is so nice and kind person. We arrived at station nearest his house early morning, he picked us up and took us to the Rome tour. I could know many history of Rome. We had really limited time and I don't have internet so we could not hangout well. Next time I would like to stay his house and hangout more.

Alessandro is probably the best host you can get in Rome. He picked me up from the airport, brought me to his village and the other surrounding it, and even gave me a tour of the city. He's a food enthusiast and history phanatic. I had such a great time with him and learned so much about Rome and the secrets of it. I'll visit you again! üòá

Alessandro is a really cool guy, i met him in a free guided tour, which he did- ( by the way you should join to this tour!! ) he hosted me when he heard that i didnt manage to find a couch for the following night... So i stayed for 2 nights at his apartment. Whe had a really good time together, he showed me and two other surfers around to really cool places ( restaurant, bar, sea... ) so i really can recommend to you to meet Alessandro ;) Grazie per tutto ancora una volta !
Thanks Alessandro for the best guide tour and the best restaurant tips not only in Rome, but even in Palermo and Catania!

text:
Hey Allesandro,
The time on your "couch" is/was very nice and I enjoy a lot the time with you as flatmate. Good cook and guide!

What to say about Alessandro? Happy guy? He is more than that. He has an amazing energy! Made us feel so nice at his home. We really felt great. And he is trully a kind-hearted. text:
Alessandro is definitly worth to get to know. He is able to bring you as much about the city, the life, the impressions as you could even imagine. 

Thank you very much for hosting us and for opening Rome for us as you it see: deep, creative, with rich history, its hidden places, local restaurants, fontaines etc. It's impossible not to fall in love with this city when you see that Alessandro adores it as much as he can, showing again and again something new with burning eyes.
It was one of the most incredible experiences in our life.

We absolutely appreciate everything you've done for us and we apologize if something went wrong.

THANKS A LOT!!!

Alessandro hosted me in Rome, the most wonderful city ever. This guy is a walking encyclopedia, he‚Äôs got a story for every single stone in Rome! Just follow his advice and you will discover some truly amazing parts of the city. He fed me with delicious farmers food, showed me where to get the best coffee ever, guided me through the historical centre, educated me on Roman history, introduced me to his many friends‚Ä¶ I couldn‚Äôt ask for more!

He‚Äôs very straightforward and easy-going but never call him Italian ‚Äòcause he may get offended. Call him Roman!

text:
this guy is UN-BE-LIE-VA-BLE!!!!
courtney and i knew we would share a passion for wine when we couchsearched Alessandro, but we did not expect to meet the ultimate tour guide of his city.
he is an incredible person full of so much knowledge, passion and generosity that i never knew existed. if you are up for learning, and want to see rome in a non-traditional way, work around Alessandro's schedule to stay with him.
sooooo worth it. 

i have been in rome three times, but this time was THE best.
heck yes, we have to be back. your tour is not finished, and we are still up for learning more.

INSAAAAANE
we freakin' love you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

text:

text: As he was in charge of the Erasmus student network, I had plenty of occasions to travel with him all over Italy. He has a huge knowledge of the story of his country, and is able to give you a lot of details about pretty much everything you would want to know. Then he's highly sociable, he likes to party, and likes to exchange ! I do recommend him ! Finally, the most important thing you should know about him, he's the best Roman cook i've met during my erasmus student life !

text:
Alessandro! Come vaaa? I still can't stop watching photos from Rome.. It seems I'm forever there. It would't be so without Your help and good will. Such a perfect beginning of the journey! 
Amazing guide, perfect cook (mm.. the taste of carbonara..), helpful host - all in 1. Alessando can be in several different places at the same time, I bet :)Don't know how he does it.. 
Thank You for the hospitality, for showing us so much, for the pastries the first morning, for pizza, for the dinner and for lunch :)
I can't imagine better experience, we are still amazed by this crazy man :) 
Remember, You are always welcome in our country! We owe You Lithuanian dinner :)

I can't imagine a better host that Alessandro. We were really glad to meet him. Alessandro knows A LOT about Rome, he is very friendly and nice. We felt really welcome. Well, it felt like home :) Alessandro showed us some Rome, suggested places to visit, made some great food, etc. I could tell good things about him for hours. 
Alessandro, you are great. Grazie mille! Hope to see you in Lithuania!

text: Where do I begin... Alessandro is like a walking historybook, in a good way! He knows pretty much everything about Rome, it's history, culture, food etc. He let us stay in his place for three nights and we got to know a bunch of really nice erasmus students as well! Alessandro cooked us amazing food and showed us the "non-turistic" side of Rome too. We highly recommend to meet him, if possible! Looking forward to see you in Finland! Grazie mille! :)

text: I spend one day in Rome with Alessandro and have enjoyed his guiding tour - he knows everything! Very nice open person! Greetings for you! :)

Alessandro is a neverending source of knowledge about Rome and he loves to share it with other people. He seems to feel a mission to show others the most and the best of his city, for certain he fulfills it:)!He is helpful and hospitable. A good, restless soul. Thanks a lot for everything!!
Had a great time with him and his girlfriend. They were very nice and considerate
Nice and friendly

Beautiful people, accepted very well. we were fed and taken to the sea) A quiet area, a comfortable home that is ideal for a break from the city rush. Looking forward to returning again. In general, I recommend to everyone.

Andrea was my first guest experience on couchsurfing. He visited me from friday to sunday. We had breakfast together, cooked dinner with my friends, visited an exhibition and cycled through Berlin. Andrea is a very warm hearted and friendly man with a funny humor and he also leads interesting conversations as well. In the end, we becomed friends and I would be very happy to visit him in his home in Rome. Thank you, Andrea, It was a pleasure to have you as a guest in my home in Berlin! Take care always, Julia

It was a very short over night stay. Considering the shortness I felt comfortable. Andrea is polite, calm and interested in hanging out with his hosts. Unfortunately this didn't work out at that time. I'd host him again and maybe visit him in Rome one day.

Andre has a wonderful family, a big cozy house, he is a wonderful person. I do not speak English well, but it did not stop me from having a wonderful time. Andre was even allowed to stay for another night, although this was not planned. A fine, friendly, kind person. I'm happy with this acquaintance! :)

Andrea is so cute! Really, so kind and helpful, he has a lot of knowledge, he  shows curiosity, and he is so funny. He is a great cook, in his home we ate the best pasta in my lifeüíì. We spent a wonderful evening talking about pesto, mozzarella and tomatos üáÆüáπ. I hope we meet again, maybe this time in Poland.

Me and my friend were guests of Andrea for 1 day. And it was great expirience! We spend cool time, had dinner together and walk in the city. Andrea was alwas ready to help us with everything. He is great kind person. I definitely recommend to know Andrea if you will have a chance :)

We didn't stay with Andrea but we're lucky enough to have a meet up with him over a coffee session. Thank to people like him, we had lots of local advice,suggestions, sharing good laugh and fell like we were very welcome to Rome as travellers,not tourists ! Ciao Andrea, you made the world better!

Andrea was probably one of the best couch I have never met before. Me and a friend were quite in a hurry for a accomodation and he accepted to host us last minute. He took us to a bar
 with friend for an aperitivo. The tomorrow he (again) hosted us even though it was not planned, and spent a great evening and dinner. Later, we did a night tour in bicycle, loved it !! Thanks, really for everything!!!!!!!

I couldn't find a host in Kassel and I was very lucky Andrea invited me to stay with him. He is a very caring host and an interesting person to meet. I stayed longer then intended and I really enjoyed my time and we did so many different things and I met quite a lot of friends if him. Visiting and having dinner at a German friend's place and hanging out in Kassel with his neighbor from India and seeing the city. All this happened mostly random and there were quite a lot going on in Kassel as I was there.
I have quite some experience in Couchsurfing and this was one of the varied experiences I've ever had. 
Thank you Andrea :)

After getting declines from dozens of hosts, Kazi offered to host me. I stayed with him for 1 night.
His hospitality is beyond generous! He received me at 7am, get me breakfast, let me use his bed, gave me his flat keys and he went to work. After leaving, he left me water, apples and food!
During his work he called me once to check on me.
After he finished, he got me dinner and showed me around the city.
He instated that I sleep on his bed and he slept on a mattress.
Before leaving, at last he accepted that I buy him breakfast as a thanks.
He went with me to the metro and said goodbye.

It was really pleasure to stay with him, felt like im at my home or more!
You are most welcome to come to Latvia, as long as I am there, or Egypt when I go back :D

text:
I Stayed in his place for one night but for other 2 nights he helped me and found place to stay with one of his friends.  I had some prpblam with phone and it was really problam to meet  but he was very understandable and nice. 
 His friend Giulietta was  thoughtfull,kind  and  friendly person.  With him and his friends i spend great time i appreciate for them.  Hope to you see again!

Alessio helped me by picking me up at the train station after my first sightseeing day because I had no battery and couldn't find the way to his house. He also offered to pick me up there on my last night.
 I had a problem with my luggage so he said it was okay if I let some stuff at his house and he brought it to me at the train station when I returned.
I appreciate that but I wouldn't stay with him again since I had some surprises that were not so good... 

When I arrived at his place he told me we had to share a bed, because the other room had people from airbnb, it happened for two nights.
He suddenly tried to kiss me without any reason, it was really embarassing and weird (especially because we had to sleep in the same bed).
The room I slept was a bit messy and dirty.

I'm thankful for everything but wouldn't stay again

text:
Alessio is a really great guy.
All the time was available and so nice. He is a really good guy and so friendly.

fromPublicAddressDescription: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: He hosted me for two nights though he didn't feel well at that time. He picked me up in the rain and gave me some pizza and wine when we got home. He was kind enough to  understand my poor English! I'm really glad to meet him. grazie:)
Very polite and friendly person, living in a big house in the center of the city. Me and my friend came late at night, but he met us and showed Rome)

Cesare is really kind, polite and gentlemen. You really feel that he wants to know more about you and have some interest in the person you are. The reason why i would'nt return is because, as other comments mentionned already, he cancelled my second night at 11pm of the first night i spend there for some job purpose. So it's hard to find something else on CS while the wifi is not always accessible during the day. Because of his job, he was really busy so the schedule to come in and out of his house wasn't flexible at all and he wasn't available to hang out. Maybe he should gives an advice of this by itself before but now.. you have been advice. That can happen so prepare a second plan in case. Except that he still a greag person ! Thanks you for the hospitality and the cool drink Cesare :)

Cesare such a nice, kind and decent person, so it was pleasure to spent this time at his place. We‚Äôve stayed at amazing and cozy apartment at the city center of Rome.  We had really delicious pizza together, we‚Äôve been talking about our cultures and future plans. Then he‚Äôve showed to my friend how to dance latina‚Äôs dances. Totally recommend Cesare as a really good host:)Thank you for everything!
My friend and I had been living at Cesare's place for a two days. Cesare is a great host and Cook:) Also the house is very nice and location is very good

Caesar is a communicative, kind and considerate person. I am very grateful that he allowed me to stay with him. the first evening he treated me to real Italian pasta. in the morning we drank coffee in a cozy cafe. on the evening of the second day Caesar spent for me a short tour of the night Rome and treated him to delicious ice cream. I wish you good luck and I hope that your dream will come true. Welcome to Russia!

Cesare offered me hosting for my open request for 2 nights in his big beautiful home in the center of Rome. We met at 22.00 when he returned home. I tasted that famous carbonara which he cooks for his guests, it was really so good!

We talked a lot and shared stories. It was interesting. But I didn't feel comfortable when Cesare told so many times: ‚ÄúYou are so beautiful!‚Äù 

It was 4.00 a.m. when we finished talking. He showed me my room and asked me if he may sleep n the same bed with me! I was shocked. And answered ‚ÄúNo‚Äù.

In 3 hours at 7.00 a.m. he waked me up and told that I must go away and find another place to stay because he just knew he had to go to the business trip the same day. I went away.

It's not so easy to believe that in 3 night hours person may get know that he had to go to the business trip. But I think that's logical decision if female guests refuse to share her bed with host.

Cesare is really interesting person, but I can't recommend him to women who travel alone.
response: {'text': 'It is amazing how a person can say so many lies,You may be upset because he could not host it the second night , I had to travel to Florence for work ,I have 2 years in couchsurfing and i never did such a thing , My references speak for itself\r\n', 'author': {'id': '2004343858', 'publicName': 'Cesare Martini', 'publicAddress': {'id': '154948334', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2004343858/33ae1a5a-a9b1-4cdc-9375-1b5e0bc989ed', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2018-05-19T17:05:02Z'}

text: Cesare is very friendly and good person. He is a pleasant and interesting conversationalist.  He really cooked carbonara and tell  about sights haha I hope we will see each other again
Cesare was a good host. He met us and showed us around in his car and we made a city tour. His house is also located in a very comfortable area and it's very cozy:)

Cesare hosted me two nights in two of his Airbnb-apartments. In the first night, he was so nice to cook  Spaghetti Carbonara and told me what's important if you wanna make Italian Pasta. On day two I met up with another CS and asked Cesare if he wants to join us. Unfortunately, we couldn't meet up at the time we were supposed to (due to his work). We had to wait a bit but had great Pizza afterward.Because of his work he had to go to Milano the next day and couldn't host me anymore. But well, that happens.  All in All, Cesare is a nice guy, who tries to improve his English, wants to make new friends and share the Italian experience. 

I wouldn't stay with him again tho because I didn't feel safe sleeping in a house/apartment by myself. (I was also traveling by myself )Maybe I'm just too scared, that whenever something would have happened like a break in or something else; I would have been alone and since I can't speak Italian or help myself I wasn't feeling comfortable being alone while he was in his apartment somewhere else in the city.  Still, I would ALWAYS meet up with Cesare again and spend time with him. And if you don't have a problem with staying by yourself or if you travel with somebody else, I can recommend him as a host!!  Hope to see you in Germany - Ciao Michi :)

My recent visit to Rome was the first in my life and thanks to Cesare I will remember my stay only positively! He is an enormously interesting and fun person with a huge heart. Cesare hospitably provided me with a spacious and comfy separate apartment which had an oh-so-beautiful view at Vatican (Saint Peter's Basilica), brought me to the nicest pizzeria with true Italian pizza (Da Baffetto) and showed me the night city in a car-tour. He was extremely attentive, trustworthy and kind to me so that another time I come to Rome I'd be happy to see him again!

Thank you, our host, for a great holiday. We arrived in Rome late, but he agreed to accept us without asking questions. The house was very beautiful, cozy, and the host very friendly and attentive. We spend time  together as best friends. Thanks

Our meeting was very short because I haven't much time in Rome this visit, but I hope, next time I could stay more and we can speak a lot, Cesare is very interesting person, I see, that he can be very nice company!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: I stayed at Cesare's place with my cousin for 2 nights. It was the first experience for Cesare as a host. He showed the incredible understanding of the Couchsurfing purpose and made everything to make us feel comfortable. He rents apartments, but when he doesn't have them booked, he kindly offers them to couchsurfer's. Cesare gave us an apartment in 5 mins walking from Vatican. He spent with us two evenings, gave us a cooking lesson on how to make the real Italian Carbonara and made  for us a tour of night Rome on his car. Cesare gave us a very useful map and showed the most important places to visit in Rome. I definitely recommend to stay with Cesare! I hope we will meet again in Italy or in Ukraine!

Andrea remained at my house one night and he arrived late in the evening so we had only a couple of hours together. It was enough to appreciate his outgoing personality. We have the same interest for Latin America so he shared with me his traveling experiences over there. He brought me delicious Italian 'salametto' :-)
For sure you will learn a lot with him and feel at ease right away, true couchsurfing spirit!

Andrea, grazie per i tuoi consigli! Ed anche per i Fonzies ;-)

text: It was my first couchsurfing experience and was very cool!I stayed for two nights, the first day when i arrive Andrea made the dinner for both, he is a very nice hoster! I stayed with Andrea just one night, but I definitely recommend him as a host!
He is extremely nice guy, very cheerful and responsible. There are infinite topics to talk to him - all the travel spots, sports, places to see in Rome...
His house is small but very cozy, you can feel like at home.
And last but not least - he is a very good friend ;)

We met with Andrea for one walk! It was a lot of fun. Thank you!

text:
Andrea hosted me in Rome. Don't miss the chance to meet him if you have one! He's such an easy going, positive and smiling Italian guy! It's definitely comfortable to be around him. I didn't manage to put a coin in Fontana di Trevi but I'm definitely going back to Rome and hope to see you there Andrea! 
A presto!

text: Andrea is a fantastic host! We actually talk a lot on facebook and message before I met him. Originally he couldn't host me because he already had another guest, but anyway he hosted me on my last night there! First time I met him, he's such a typical Italian with his sunglasses and white jeans, and we ate panini together at campo di fiori in Rome :) He then brought me walking around Rome, and we went to this beautiful park overlooking the city with the most magnificient view! It was raining most of the time when I was there, and I fell asleep when we were watching tv! Sorry I was too tired!! The next day it was raining heavily again! so we couldn't meet for lunch and he had to go to work! so we didn't get to spend much time together! But this guy was really easy going, nice to talk to, and will make you feel comfortable the first time you meet him, when I was chatting to him on facebook, I felt as if I knew you forever! You are welcome to come and visit me anytime!!

text:
Andrea is more than a simple host: he's a friend. Since you arrive in his flat you feel like you're at home. 
He's friendly, open mind, big-hearted, spontaneous, smiling, entertaining and very kind!!!
He hosted me and my fiends Gabriella and Francesca for 5 nights, he put his confidence on us since the first time!
We shared interesting times together, and I won't ever forget the polish vodka and the sausage he offered me at 5 am while I was waking up and he was comin' back home!
Sei dolcissimo e morbidosissimo Andre! 
Ti vogliamo bene, e ci vediamo presto, anzi prestissimo!!!
Dani, Gabri, Fra 
<3
