text: Andrea is such a wonderful, unusually hospitable, cheerful and positive guy that it is even hard to describe! He hosted me and my friend for an unexpectedly long time, much longer than we had arranged at the beginning because of many difficulties that we had to outface while we were searching for our own room here, in Rome to stay in for an accademic year. He gave us his bed and was always very friendly and nice, always helpful and comforting in the hardests moments of our flat-searching-depression. He spent with us many lovely evenings, we were talking in english and italian and eating delicious italian food and trying italian drinks with him and his charming friends. The time that we spend with Andrea, his kindness and selflessness were unforgettable, I will always have in mind that time and that hospitality that he showed us. As soon as I return to Poland, I invite you Andrea to come anytime you want,you and your friends are always welcome! Before that, we keep in touch,see you!!:)

text: It's really hard to find someone who can host for 3 people! Andrea is a really friendly guy! He picked us up at the train station at 11:20 pm even though he's tired after his work! He even took us to the very authentic italian restaurant, it was an amazing meal! My sister, friend and I, we all had an awesome trip in Rome! Thanks so much, and we're looking forward to meet you again. You're always welcome to visit Taiwan! Also, let me know if you're visiting San Fransico, I'm sure Sean will happy to host you :)!

text:
Andrea is a truly positive, lively, and cheerful host. He hosted me and my friends for three days in Rome and supplied us not only with a place to stay, but also with a huge amount of joy and laugh. Andrea is a very open and welcoming guy who is easy to get along with. We talked a lot during our stay, and the conversation had always been fun. Also, he came to pick us up with a car from the metro station when we couldn't find the way to his home, which was very nice of him. Moreover, Andrea took us to his friends' to eat pasta (which was absolutely delicious!) and hang out with other couchsurfers, which was great.
My piece of advice: if you are going to host or be hosted by Andrea, get ready for a lot of fun, because he definitely knows how to make people smile!
Hope to meet you again some day. And good luck in Paris and Madrid!

text: Lele hosted me and two of my friends, he picked up us in the bus stop and was very kind and willing to show us Rome. His apartment is very clean and comfortable, we are very thankful with him.  See you in Colombia Lele :)

Emanuelle was a great host. Very kind and generous. He picked me up from the bus station and took me back on the day I left. His home was lovely and  very comfortable. Would recommend. Thank you for a great stay in rome.
Emmanuel is a very Friendly guy. He showed me so many things in Roma. I totally recommend him!

Lele was great! I arrived in Rome and he picked me up and we went to an outside dance spot, where the crowd and music was great. His friends were also halarious. Too bad i was exhausted and we could not party till the sun came up, but the next evening we drank some wine and had a nice chat. He was also pretty cool when i decided to leave 1 day early for naples. 

*****Lele feel free to visit me wherever im at.
Lele was such an amazing host! He gave me and my friend an unforgettable experience in Roma. He and his friends welcomed us in like family and we really did like the romans do. I highly recommend :)

Emanuele was so nice, my friend and me spend one night with him and was so cool.
Thanks for all Emanuelle see you in Peru üáµüá™

text:
Emanuele, is a really good host! It's not even possible to wish more! He is very generous, kind, sociable and tidy person. I definitely advise you to stay in his apartment. 

Thank you, Emanuele!

Emanuele is such an amazing man! He's such a gentleman, refine, fun, and thoughtful. On my first night, he invited me to go out with his friends and I'm glad I joined him. He brought me to this beautiful outdoor chill party with a live band then to a bar with a beautiful rooftop where we were able to talk about life. His house is really beautiful and clean. He let me explore the city on my own and is really thoughtful. I wish I was able to hang out with you more. Visit the Philippines and I promise to take you out in all those clubs and parties I was telling you about! üéâ

Lele!!! He is a very nice, respectful and fun guy who I loved to spend time, he cooked for me twice, showed me beautiful places and we went to his friend‚Äôs birthday party so I could meet his friends and know local party. His house is just amazing, perfectly clean and well located, very easy to get with transportation and very safe. You have to arrange with him the schedules to get home which is fine because is not a hotel but after a exhausting day walking around the city can be hard to wait, maybe it could be easier with keys but even so I understand. Anyway Lele thank you for everything and I own you a dinner hahaha let me know when you go to Argentina. :)

I really enjoyed my time with Emanuele even if the organization was sometimes a bit chaotic (but probably I was more chaotic than he was). His apartment looks really beautiful and the neighbourhood is enjoyable as well. Everything is clean and his hostibility made me feel welcome. So thanks for everything, Emanuele!

Emmanuele is very friendly and nice, since not all the people messagesnyou how to arrive to the meeting point, pick you up at the nearest station,  and want to share their homes... BUT at the same time, he wasn‚Äôt very serious/committed, because at last minute he kick me off of his home, telling me that one of his friends ask him for accommodation. From my point of view, i was respectful, friendly and want to share experiences/stories/food, but he didn‚Äôt want to. Whatever, this is one bad comment in the middle of all the positive comments/experiences that the people has about it, so i think i just were there in a bad moment.
fromPublicAddressDescription: San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico

text:
Emmanuel was such a nice guy, that was my first CS experience and I was so nervous, but he is so relax and attentive that I had a great night in his place.
Thank you so much, Emmanuel.
I'll be glad to receive you if ever go to Mexico.

I highly recommend staying with Emanuele, although I didn't get to spend too much time with him because of his busy work schedule, he was a very helpful and flexible host. His apartment is very nice and clean, he is very knowledgeable and helpful when it comes to public transportation. Very nice guy! Thank you so much for hosting and helping me out in Rome. I am very grateful for your hospitality. I wish you all the best and if I come back I hope I get to spend more time getting to know you. Ciao- Pau

Lele was a wonderful host. His home is very nice, spacious, and clean. There is a separate bedroom for the traveller with a cute light in it. He is a wonderful cook of soups, risotto, salads, and pasta and knows a lot about what tourist sites to visit. His English is very good and he likes to have conversations and learn more English. He also likes to watch scary movies and play Zelda. He even gave me a ride to the bus station when I left. I would definitely stay with him again.

Thanks so much to Emanuele for everything. It's my 1st Couchsurfing. He really helped me a lot by give support during I was having problems with flight delayed and missed flight too. He gave me good company while I'm reach Rome. He really nice and friendly too. We had good time. Very caring person. His accommodations is perfect. Easy to move to center. See you next time...

Emanuele is an excellent host :) his apartment is beautiful! He helped me to prepare my bed, cooked our dinner and we went out to the center that night! Unfortunately he couldn't host me more days cause he had to travel to Sicilia but thanks for all the support Emanuele! :)
Emanuele was very polite to us and showed us some great places in Rome. Everything was good.Thanks!

Had a great experience staying with Emanuele. He's an easy-going person and was cool with hanging out or not hanging out. He is a great couchsurfing host with much references. We had good conversation! On the place: He has a guest room to accommodate. Would work around his timings to be able to head back. It's in the north of the city so note that it takes some time to travel.

Emanuele was like an oasis in the desert after some bad couchsurfing experiences. He was nice, flexible, accommodating, great to talk to, and he made us feel really comfortable. We didn't get much chance to hang out but he was good natured about everything. He was really patient with coordinating with us, since getting around Rome always took way longer than we expected. I would definitely stay with him again. Thank you so much Emanuele.
Emanuele is a wonderful person ,very thoughtful and caring,thank you a lot !!!
This is our first host. All was good. Emanuel–µ is a friendly, sympathetic person.

Emanuele let me stay in his home for 3 nights. We couldn't hang out because I was exploring the city all day and he was at work. He picked me up at the bus station and told me where to go and everything. He was very understanding and helped me a lot. Too bad we didn't hang out more. Thanks for my first experience with couchsurfing :)

Very sweet host. Had the pleasure to stay with him for 4 days. Showed me around the center the first day, had amazing gelato. Wonderful home, interesting shower and you get your very own cute room. Overall such a comfortable stay. Very grateful. Thanks again!

Emmanuelle was so welcoming and his house is beautiful. He is kind and was so patient with me as my Rome trip did not go to plan and I got lost very often. He is a gentleman and very knowledgeable and his English is amazing. If I ever visit Rome again I would stay with emmanuelle and hopefully spend more time with him and have a trip that works out to plan. Thank you and my apologies emmanuelle

Emanuelle has hosted  me for three days . His apartment is very nice and very clean . He is good person , he was very good to me . he has picked me up from bus station and driven to his place . We had fun together and he showed me Rome and took me to party with his friends ) it's my first experience in cs and it was good with Emanuelle!

Emmanuele is very friendly  and kind guy. I made mistake when I booked my accomondations and Emanuele allowed  us to arrive a day early to his place ! Thank you so much for this! Unfortunately we didn't spend time together due to our rich program in Rome.
 He has very clean and stylish white flat, liked it so mush! recommend staying with him! :)

It was nice my days in Rome! The place was clean and i had a private room! Emanuele also accepted to receive my friend that didn't have a place to stay in the last minute! He didn't have a lot of time to hang out with us, but he show us where to go and nice tourists places to visit! :)

ÓòÆ Would Stay Again
I stayed in Emanuele home for 4 days.
Emanuele so easygoing and made me feel at home.
Emanuele took me out for the party with his friends in the local bar. I found that Emanuele is a good dancer and he guided me to dance, which is so interesting and relaxing. 
Thank you for everything and staying with you is memorable!
I highly recommend staying with him!

We very quickly find a common language with Emanuele,  so for me it was really comfortable to stay with him)
We spend all day together and he showed me all famous places, and in evening we visited his favorite  secret place (thanks for this, it was amazing)
Also I want to say that his soup with mushrooms very very very delicious!
So thank you for everything and hope someday we'll meet again! üíú

He's a nice and trustworthy person. He has a very clean flat. And most importantlyÔºåhe loves games of thronesÔºÅÔºÅÔºÅ However, I couldn't hangout with him and his friends because of me feeling illness these daysÔºåand he is very understandable. Highly recommend.
Was my first couch experience and couldn't be better, Emanuele helps me to understand Rome and also in my research about a home. We have great moments sharing brazilian -italian culture :)
fromPublicAddressDescription: Porto Alegre, State of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil

text: Emanuele is a nice, respectful and easy going person! He is one of the hosts you have luck to find! He did everything to make me feel comfortable at his place. His flat is super clean and comfortable. That's a shame we couldn't party in Rome, but the time we could spend togheter were absolutely nice. Thanks so much for making me feel like home in a crowded city like Rome, Emanuele!! Ciao :))

I only stayed with Emanuele for one night but it was enough to make it clear that when it comes to hosting people - he has it all. He took me in despite short notice, helped me to get to his place, offered dinner and a separate room. We had some wine and fun, interesting conversation in the evening and than we took a short walk around his neighbourhood, which was really nice. He also recommended not-so-obvious places for me to visit the next day. In the morning he helped me get on the right bus. Emanuele is very warm and kind, has sweet personality and his home is just lovely - clean, quiet and beautiful. I would definetely recommend staying with him.
Lele, Thank you for having me and all I wish you all the best with your future plans! Ciao!

I guess Emanuele should live on another planet, because such people and individuals almost don't exist in our Earth, I promise. He figured out all our traveling issues, which we faced in Rome, from place where to stay to language problems in conversation with a taxi driver. His pasta is plentiful and treated with imagination. Emanuele opened the curtain of another Roma, which you'll never see from St. Paul Basilica or any observation deck. And his friends company, they are amazing, which confirms the statement: "Show me your friends, and I'll tell who you are".

Me and my friend stayed with Emanuele for three days, he is very kind, friendly, clean, accurate, knows the city very well. While we worked, he explained us how to get the city monuments. Next day he showed us the city by himself, also told the whole history of it, he is very intelligent, and his house is nice and very clean and situated in good location))) he also went clubbing with us positively and chilled us to one building of the city roof, we saw the sundown Rome))) it's really beautiful))) also when our flight was delayed, he kindly accepted to stay for one more day))) he is awesome))
I liked staying with Emanuele. He's friendly, positive guy and always is ready to help)

It is very difficult to find the one best word that describes my stay with Lele in Rome. First of all, I had a  problem to get to Rome since there was the strike in Fiucimino. However, Lele supported remotely and picked me up later. He prepared for me traditional tasty Italian dinner. So far I cannot forget on the beautiful evening walk in the centre of Rome. I have never experienced something as like this, very extraordinary. Thank Lele I could find out truly Italian night's life in the club and their temperament. He tried to answer and solve every my problem and questions. I was going to Rome because I wanted to support my pole dance teacher and Lele picked me up to the theatre and took care about my two all days. Only one bad thing was that time passed so quickly and I am back and miss Lele, city and melodic language that I am learning now. I would like to back here. Of course, that I can recommend Lele as host who are able to make you surprised in even you thought that you are getting to know him :-)) Hope to see you again

I had only positive expirience with Emanuele! He was so kind to pick me up from a bus stop and show the way to his place.  And I need to point out that his flat is very comfortable and situated in a good location.  It was easy to become friends with him, as he is nice and open person. Also, he was very helpful. I would enjoy staying with him again!

Omg Emanuele is a perfect host! Super Clean House, Eager to tell you more about Rome & is very friendly! He gives you enough space yet hospitable at the same time! He brought me to an awesome party in Rome with his friends. He didnt hesistate to host me for an extra 2 days! Grazie mille emanuele! hope to see u soon!!
Emanuele is very welcoming, helpful, friendly and interesting man!)

Super open person who is fine to go out 
To talk about everything 
To show whatever  you want 
We met his nice friends and celebrated our friend's  bday in the best way!! 
Thank you a lot again !

It was my first trip on my own and therefore the first CS experience. 
What I‚Äôd stumbled upon was more than just a couch
Emanuele sheltered me for the whole week. During this time I managed to see places which are not mentioned in guidebooks, to dive in night life of the city and even to try homemade pasta :) 
Lele has good sense of humour and excellent musical taste. He gave me some useful tips and shared entertaining stories
Thank you, I definitely fell in love with Rome!

Me and my friend stayed at Emanuele's house for three nights. His flat is really beautiful and well situated but the problem that we had was a timetable because there was no conveniece in the hours of leaving and coming back to his   place. Plus staying out in the night until  late hours was also problematic. Times  when we came back to his house, he  wasnt there so again after the whole day  we had to wait for him another half an  hour or hour. Emanuele is a very kind  guy. He took us for a one night out with  his friends so that we consider him as an  open and helpfull man but if you want to  stay in his house for more than two days  and want to enjoy the nightlife I would  recommend to think twice.
inverseReference: {'id': '17768317', 'text': "I didn't want to write a reference to Paula after hosted her and her friend because they are two good girls but the problem is their behaviors and I don't like writing a negative or neutral reference...she wrote me a neutral reference first and I want to write this reply only to explain some points...first, I love nightlife and I like to join the nightlife with my guests but it's a serious problem if my guest go clubbing or just go out (without me and without tell me) AND COME BACK HOME AT 5.30 IN THE MORNING when I have to go working and wake up early...(I m a couchsurfer till 2011 and It has never happended a thing like this)...second, my timetable is very simple and it's simple to arrange each other if we can keep in touch (next time I suggest you to call your host or text him)...anyway, I can recommend her to people who don't have problems to wait her till late or people who like their house treated like hotel", 'createdDate': '2015-07-01T14:44:00Z', 'experience': 'neutral', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1004554968'}, 'from': {'id': '2844858', 'publicName': 'Lele Lele', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5549980', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2844858/CECAC4C4-4F79-426F-917F-66CD0E3CE3D4', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Emanuele is a true Italian gentleman! He has a very clean flat and I stayed in his separate bedroom in complete privacy on a very comfortable pull out bed. He even let me stay for one more night than I had originally asked! Great guy, I just wish we spent more time together, he works all day and I really only went out with him once which was a great time. I definitely recommend him and his place to other surfers :) One little thing, he doesn't work near the city center anymore so it takes about 45 minutes to an hour of walking, bus, and tram to get there... but if you plan for that amount of time then it works out great!

text:
Lele was a very welcoming host, he set up my bed for me and provided a towel for me to use. He came to pick me up in his smart car from the Piazzale Ponte Milvio which helped tremendously. Our schedules were very opposite so we barely spent anytime together, which was a shame because he is really fun! At the same time it was a good thing because (as a note to future surfers), he does prefer his guests to come home when he is home - to let them inside. He marked all the "must-see" places on a map for me, so I didn't miss any of Rome! I hope Lele visits me in Australia one day!
Ciao!

text: Emanuele hosted two of my friends and I at his place in Rome. He has a very nice house and is a nice guy. He fit two of us in the trunk of his smart car with our luggage and one friend in the front seat. It was quite funny. He came out on a pub crawl with us two nights even though he had to work in the morning. He is a fun guy and I would recommend staying with him.

text: Hamid is the type of person who will buy an umbrella for himself, but then hold it over your head all day ‚òîÔ∏è(thanks for that üòÖ)  He is an eccentric individual with a quirky sense of humor, who is soft-spoken and incredibly kind. A brilliant host in a brilliant sity.
Or in a nutshell, about staying with Moeh.

I'm incredibly grateful to Universe for the opportunity to meet such a friendly, knowledgeable and charismatic person as Moeh.

He made our trip to Rome unforgettable. Why? I have three reasons.

Firstly, he knows the map of the sity by heart.¬†He can help with planning your trip in details. Where to go, what to see, which¬†food to try.

Secondly, he is really passionate about his home-country so he can give you a full understanding of what's going on in Syria and in Middle East - one of the most problematic region of the whole world.

Thirdly, he is really deep in Italian culture so he can teach you¬†how to cook a¬†real Italian food (I couldn't forget the taste of carbonara that we made together) and tell you a lot about real Italian life.

text:
Fabio agreed to settle one person in his hostel for free and another for paid. But due to misunderstanding situation he told us that can‚Äôt host one for free because another couchsurfer stay in his room and suggest us good discount and we had no power to think about something else. Anyway we enjoyed staying in his hostel because:
When we come he suggested us wine/juice and it was a pleasure to make a conversation with Fabio
We had really good, tasty, not the same lunch and dinner
Hostel has good location and clean
Fabio give us map and suggest us route for 2days
People who stayed there were cool and interesting
Hostel has many needs (laundry, balcony, kitchen, mac‚Äôs, maps and lot of other stuff)
Connection via WhatsApp was pretty okay

I‚Äôd like to write more about Fabio and his hostel but gonna say only one thing - if I had a chance to come in Rome I would definitely write to Fabio:)

PS: thanks Fabio for everything, we really enjoyed staying with you and good luck to you!;)

Fabio is A LOT OF FUN. He's an absolute legend when it comes to knowledge about Rome, be it about any of the tourist attractions or a great night out. His hostels are very nice and laid out in a way that makes sure you will get to know even more fun people. If he offers to host you, you will for sure have a great time!
I liked everything very much.
Very cool and unique place too stay ;) fabio is a realy nice guy who knows everything and can help you allot !! A Must to visit him !!

My trip to Rome was magnificent thanks to Fabio. When I went to fabio‚Äôs house, he helped me with everything. He makes REALLY DELICIOUS pasta. If you meet Fabio, you must surely eat her pasta. If you've met Fabio, you should go to parties with her. Forgive me, I couldn‚Äôt bring you Turkish delights because my backpack was full but I‚Äôll bring lots of Turkish delights when I get back to the Rome. Thanks for everything !

Fabio is great!
This man is absolutely kind,  friendly and open,  he has awesome sense of humour. If you are going to Rome at the first time, Fabio will tell you how to find everything what you need in this city.
He gave us not only host,  but made our 2 nights in Rome just amazing:) 
Grazie Fabio! Grazie mille!
Fabio was the man! Great host and great human! Hope so see you in CA soon!

If you go in Rome - you need to meet Fabio. 
Without it, your experience be not full, believe me. 

Fabio have a small hostel in Rome (btw it‚Äôs best hostel in the world) and he host me there. 
He cooked pasta for everyone in his hostel, and for me too :)
From the beginning I started feel super comfortable in his company. I don‚Äôt feel like am at hostel, I feel like be at home. 

After Fabio finished his work, he show me some hidden places of Rome. Next we visited a few bars :)
We speaking a lot, and it‚Äôs be super good. Fabio are really interesting person, with his own point of view. And he really like to share his experience, and hear your. 

If you have a chance to meet Fabio- do it!

Thanks for everything Fabio, hope to see you again :)

Fabio recieved me in the best way, he even offered champagne. He also cooked dinner for everyone. He is the best person you can meet, very nice and friendly and helpful too. I was so lucky that he offered me a bed. And he has the best hostel in Rome and probably in Italy!

Flavio is mr everywhere, first he is cooking spaghetti for  7 guests , then he is he going crossfit and after he is going out. Hes like flash :-) ausserdem   is he very hospitate funny and helpfull. I am very thankfull for the days with flavio. Grazie ragazzo ;)

Oh maaan, Fabio!

Very good guy. He made my visit to Roma a lot easier!
He showed me everything, we had a very good time!!!

Thank you so much !!! Grazie mille :)
Elchin is an easy-going and flexible person. He helped me a lot whenever i needed anything. I really enjoyed staying at his place.

Elchin is a very friendly, kind and very very funny person. He showed me almost all famous places in 1 day. We was together with his cousin Tengiz. Also very good guy. I had unforgettable time in Rome. Thank you so muchüòÅ
Elchin is a good guy, who helped me a lot in Rome. Funny and friendly!) hope to see again)

Elchin had no opportunity to welcome us. Nevertheless he wanted to help us so much that asked a friend of him Miriam to host me and Nastya. We stayed at her place for 5 days. It was really fantastic time in Rome: pleasant talks during tea-time, tasty food, nice music, a lot of walks and smiles. Elchin always cared about us and helped with all the issues. He gave advice how to orientate in Rome and even secured us when it was necessary. He really became a close friend for us. We‚Äôre thankful for our meeting, Elchin! All the best on your way!!!

Elchin could not be there, but his roommates hosted me and my friend for two days and they were great. Emin and his friend met with us at the train station and took us to the apartment. They were full of hospitality and Emin explained us everything about Rome and gave us some suggestions on where to go and what to visit. They shared informations about their culture as they are from Azerbeijan and made us national dish for dinner which was super tasty and super cool. The greatest thing they did is that they gave us a room and they squeezed in one. Thank you for everything once again and hope to see you in Baku and in Zagreb. :)
Elchin is a very nice guy who is always ready to help you. It was an amazing experience which I will never forget

Elchin, Thank's for everything! It was really good and very comfortable to communication with you! Thank's for the help with public transport. Only positive references. You are a nice and great person:) So, good luck in the future! :)
Finally, u arrived in Ukaine ) I'm was very happy to spend time with u in Ukraine )
Giulio was a great host, I was encouraged to realize that I needed a host urgently for a problem with my flight schedule, always pay attention to me and spend time walking with me, thank you!

Giulio is a nice boy, friendly, punctual, he held a tour of the city for me, suggested as it is better to make a route and what to watch. I recommend him as a host.

I appreciate he invited me to his house because I was only going to be in Rome for 3 days but we didn't go outside his apartment so I lost one day. 
I think he's a nice guy who really wants to meet new people and different cultures. He made me a really good pasta. But he also doesn't like to have a "No" for an answer and that was a bit uncomfortable.

text: Giulio is very nice host, he hosted me for three days. He came to meet me at the bus station when I arrived, it was very kind of him, otherwise ofc i would got lostüòÅ Giulio is a student, and had an examination period at that time, despite of this he was so helpful and attentive to me, he fed me very delicious italian food every day, now i think i've added a few kilosüòÇ  we danced a lot to italian old famous music, and i was taught to juggle, that's funny) he is very smart psychology student,  we had very interesting talks  almost about everything, now I know a bit the history of the psychology, and about Alfa and Beta tests. It was so interesting to spent time with him. Giulio is  strongly recommended host) if you are slim you will add some kilos definitely! Hope to see you again Giulio, ciao!

Giulio was very nice to host me, although I had arrived to Rome very late. He was so nice to show me some cool spots in Rome, including night Colosseum, the Tiber river and some beautiful streets of Rome. And a bar district ;)
Guilio was so friendly to me, he understood me so well! 
Thank you, Guilio, hope to see you again

It was my first time when I decided to stay in somebody's house. And I'm really happy that it was Giulio's house! So, Giuluo can spend a lot of time with you, for example to go with you to Vatican or to explain some interesting things about Italy and Rome. Besides, Julio study psychology at university and he can help to understand your personal values. In general: it was amazing trip to Rome and amazing meeting with Giulio!

I couldn't be more grateful for my wonderful couchsurfing experience with Giulio. I arrived late to his house, but he was incredibly welcoming from the moment we met. 

We hang out together with his friends Antonio and Marina, all of them are so friendly, kind and funny. They showed me a beautiful view on the Garibaldi square, the Tiber river and some beautiful streets of Rome.

I had an incredible time with Giulio, is a great cooker, and he always has something interesting to say or share, I really enjoyed our conversations and it was a pleasure to meet him.

If you gonna visit Colombia, you will be very welcomed in my home. Hope to see you again in the future :)

Is an excellent host and I have had a wonderful time. His food is explendida and he has helped me at all times. The house is spacious and I slept very comfortable. I recommend it to 100% excellent host, company and friend.

Giulio is a nice guy and very flexible. His flat is very central, it is very close to il campo.

Besides that, Giulio is a smart guy and you can have some interesting conversations with him.

we enjoyed with wine at the night first day

if you can meet him you should meet him

Giulio was one of the most flexible, gracious hosts I have ever stayed with. He  is sure to be sensitive to every surfer's needs; I knew this when I arrived at his place to find that he had prepared a lovely vegetarian pasta meal for us to enjoy together that evening, after learning from my profile that I am vegetarian. He lives in an almost unspeakably beautiful and quaint - not to mention central - location in Siena. I will always remember the ease with which I could climb out of his window and onto the rooftop to savor the breeze, and all the sights and sounds of the medieval town. Being in Siena during Palio was, in a word, magical; I'll also always remember falling asleep on July 1 - the night before the annual event - to the singing of the townspeople drifting in through the open window. I know he wants to come to New York City - and when he does, I'll try to make sure I'm available to host him!

The journey un Giulio s place was very nice. He is available, funny , interesting, he can give you advice to visit the city and will show you the siena way of life hanging out with bus friends ! I recommand !

Giulio is a great host who happens to live in the heart of Siena. From the moment I contacted him, it was clear to me how much he likes to host people. He spent a lot of time with me and was willing to help me, even when that meant not going to a party to open me the door at 2:00 AM! I requested a couch for one night but at the end I stayed three nights at his place. He definitely made my stay in Siena. Thanks for everything, sorry for the farfalla and see you soon!

Giulio was very fun to stay with.  He played the flute, and taught me how to juggle! His room mates are also very nice, and fun to hang out with. He is very hospitable, and is a good cook. He definitly made me feel welcome in Siena!

I spent 2 days with Giulio and it was really nice ! He cooked delicious carbonnara pasta and he spend time with me for show me Siena. It was a pleasure to stay at his home ! Grazie mille ! It will be a pleasure to see you again :)

Giulio saw my public trip and kindly offered to host me. He's a nice chap and despite some language difficulties and such, I found him very hospitable and eager to hang out. He's a great cook and his friends were charmers too!

Giulio lives with some students friends, i knew Hertor, a very interesant boy who i help to cut his hair ;-)  Giulio is very frienly and spend a lot of time with me, showing the city and going out at night to a concert, i enjoyed a lot Thanks!!

He is the best host I have ever seen! He was soooo friendly, in the morning we left our bags at his place and then traveled around rome, after we came back in the evening, he cooked us pasta, he gave us wine and beer. He is such an amazing person. I highly recommend to meet with him!

Alessandro was a great host! Really open-minded and generous person, wrote the step-by-step guidelines how to get to his area and picked me up from the subway station. I'd be really glad to host this man at any convenient time in my home.

text: Alessandro is a good host, very relax and knowledgable person. Despite the fact that he had a crazy deadline and so had to work all the time, I really enjoyed meeting him and sharing diner ! Thanks again for your hospitality man, see you around !

We had a pleasant stay at Alessandro's. My friend and I stayed there for a week. The room was all set when we arrived and the living room was also available for us to use.  The place is close to the bus stop and there are a lot of amenities in the area. It is well-located. The few times we spent with Alessandro were enriching. He shared some interesting sights around Rome for us to explore and some of the amazing Italian cuisine for us to try out. All-in-all we could not have asked for a more hospitable host.

Alessandro is, as many others Italians I have met, a great host, very gentile, polite and friendly person. He‚Äôs a good cook who taught me how to make Italian Risotto and we also went to Perugia and enjoyed the town and it‚Äôs food. Thanks for everything Ale!

text: I‚Äôll just have to join in on the praise given to this man - a great host! A great experience for a first time Couch Surfer like myself. Thank you, Alessandro!
Good person
Alessandro is a very nice guy and was very thoughtful to let me stay in his home. I was only there one night, but I enjoyed talking with him.
Alessandro is an awesome host even I didn't stay his house.I didn't stay his house because I have to change my plan.However he picked me up from the metro station twice a time :)

Alessandro is an awesome host! Even though we only stayed 1 night and couldn't spend too much time together i 've seen how wonderful he is. He is really kind and thoughtful. He gave us whole room with pretty comfortable beds. If you have chance to stay with him use it. I hope next time we can spend much more time together.

Just an absolutely fantastic host: kind, thoughtful, knowledgeable, and courteous. My first night, Alessandro took me on a quick tour of downtown Roma and I fell in love with the city from there. I had a blast in Italia and a lot of that is due to Alessandro. If you have the opportunity, stay with him, he's wonderful.

Ale was very kind and helpful. I had a complicated schedule and he reached out to work with me and my time. 
Thank you for the kindness and all the knowledge you shared with me. We went out to a great place to eat for dinner after I settled in and Ale ensured that I felt welcome in his home and in Rome.
Alessandro is very polite and respectful person. He is teacher and intellectual and very interesting to conversate! Highly recommend! Thank you Alessandro for helping me!

Alessandro was a very nice host!  He is an accepting and interesting person.  Alessandro hosted me for two nights and even though he was busy during that time (I was as well as that was my first time in Rome) he was able to tell me a few things to do in Rome and to share a little of his life with me.  Alessandro even helped me to get to his place, picking me up from the subway station three times to make sure I did not get lost on the way to his place.  He is really a really great, unique person that I am happy to have spent some time with.  Thank you for making my time in Rome that much more special Ale!

Alsessandro is a very fun, wise and warm person to be around. His home was lovely and comfortable and he was very welcoming. We had some good conversations, where I realised he has a great outlook on life and a wise perspective on things. I would defiantly recommend Alessandro to other couch surfers and I am grateful for meeting such a lovely, generous and fun guy.  Thanks you üôè and all the best for your future. Your Australian friend, Andrew.

Alessandro was a brilliant host. Taught me how to speak a few italian words, cooked a pasta for me, even gave me a lift from the airport. I had a great time in Rome, thanks to him, and now i am really looking forward for my new-someday tour all over the Italy. I hope, Alessandro, you will acompany me.

Alessandro was very considerate to offer me a place to stay at the last minute. I am forever grateful to him for this. He was very polite, kind, and easy to get along with. I felt at complete ease being around him. His apartment is very large and I had my own room and bathroom. He picked me up from the metro station each night as well. I will certainly stay with him again. I also think it's impressive he wrote a book!

An all round great guy! Alessandro was kind enough to puck me up from the metro station every evening, give me tips and advice on how to get around, what to see and do. He was knowledgeable in all areas and was good to talk too. He is a very busy man but always makes sure everything is fine with you and that you enjoy the beautiful city as much as possible. 
Would highly recommend staying with Alessandro in his comfortable place which makes you feel at home.
Good luck with the book mate and hope to see you again soon and ecplore more of the Italian coast!

This man is incredible ! he offered me a bed when no one in Rome did! Alessandro is a very generous, so smiley, open minded and interesting man !
He opened his house door to me for two amazing nights in his amazing flat !
Beside of being a very good chef, he is so funny, gentle and a lover of life . you never get bored with him!!
I definitely recommend him.
Grazie mille amico :D

We finally didn't stay with Alessandro cause he had some mechanical problem with his car at the mountain. But he was very kind and accepted my request like a month before the date. I hope we met in another moment Alessandro or another city.

Ale is a nice dude. As he wrote on his profile, he is pretty busy, but he will give you a lot of freedom and you'll feel in his place like at home. 

Thank you for everything Ale and good luck with your book!

text:
I stayed with Alessandro for two nights and it was really lovely.
He is an absolute friendly person, and as you could say that he is quite educated it was enriching and a pleasure to have a conversation with him.

He saved the day. When I was in need he rose to the occasion and helped me. A great man indeed. I recommend him from a bottom of my heart. I wish you all the best Alessandro and hope to see you again some day. Live long and prosper.

Thank you for everything again Ale!

Grasie! 
Arrivederci!

I stayed one night with Alessandro. He is so helpful and no polite. He take me from metro station and he told me everyting about transport, how to go to airport etc... He is so tidy and clean and he have too much books everywhere. Such a pleasure to stay with him. Thank you Alessandro!

It was so nice to stay with Alessandro!! He is friendly,  a good person, he like to talk about trips and his culture...His appartment is so nice!! He gave me my own room and my own toilet...I hope see you again someday!! Thanks
Educated agreeable individual, who make my first jorney to Rome more simple and pleasant. Polite and ready to help. I'm glad to have opportunity of acquaintanceship:)

Alessandro was a great host. He picked me up from the station, helped me with directions and his house was clean and very nicely situated. Staying with Alessandro was the perfect couchsurfing experience.

Ale was really friendly and made me feel at home. He seems to be really open-minded and easygoing. This was my first time un couchsurfing so it was great!  He looked for me at the metro station and although he is not in the city center, he doesn't live so far away. Great home and great host!

text: Alessandro was an excelent host. I felt very welcomed to Rome. His risotto is superb. We couldn't hang out that much together because he was busy finishing his book, by the way, congratulations!, but it was a very nice stay.  Thanks for your hospitality!

It was my first trip in CS. Alessandro is a great man with a good sense of humor, his kind and help in all where he can help! Stay at his house was a great! Grazie,Ale!

Alessandro cheers for the time we spent together. I would never like to miss it ;)
Tasty dinner, awesome view on the skyline of Rome, massage and some blues, that's what made me feel kinda being home :)
Stay as you are.

Alessandro was a true gentleman and saved me with a last minute couch surfing request! We didn't spend a great amount of time together but I did enjoy that time thoroughly. Alessandro is a very intelligent and well spoken man who is also generous and has a passion for travel and travel stories. 

Alessandro picked me up from the train station and even cooked me a beautiful dinner which was delicious, truly good chef, and he thought it was dry! would love to catch him on his best days.

text:
Firstly, I want to mention that you will see this reference as I surfed at his couch but I didn't, I couldn't.

We started to get in contact with Allesandro one month before my arrival to Rome and he was going to host me for two days in Rome which were 28.th and 29.th of June and these days are kind of fest called The festival of St Peter and Paul.

But one day before my arrival to Rome, he said I have a pop-up holiday plan with friends and I will not host you and when I see this short mesagge I was in shock because when I arrived Rome, all hotels and hostels were nearly full...

I found a hostel room to stay with a lot of difficulties which costed me for two nights: ‚Ç¨70.

My suggestion for the people who are planning to stay at his place:
Be aware of that, you can face with a situation like me, so don't be trustworthy to him, if he offers you to stay at this house.

(My message is appropriate to the Couchsurfing Values and Reference Rules)

text: Well, you can tell from all the positive references what a sweet hearted person Ale is, but here's one more :) This was my first time in Italy and my first experience surfing. Ale picked me up at the metro and immediately made me feel welcome in his beautiful appartment. He  cooked me several nice dishes and we had some good talks about life and it was a lot of fun comparing cultural differences with him. I hope to see you again one day!

text: We had a great time staying with Alessandro!  He was so helpful and hospitable- answering our many questions with a welcoming smile and a warm way about him.  Even though we were busy running about Rome (avoiding metro strikes, trying to see a gigantic city in 4 days, ect) he took the time to chat with us and helped make our time there special. And we are proud to have introduced him to the wide world of Skype!  Thank you Ale!!

text: Ale is a very intelligent, nice man. Amazing how he makes you feel comfortable. I decided to go to his place for my last night in Rome. I could be elsewhere, but it was a really good decision. Even if we had very short time, we could share our ideas about literature, films etc. I think we are pretty on the same wavelength. Very nice evening together: great dinner, cinema, talk, some special oriental experience :) Thank you Ale! Hope to meet you again!

text:
My stay with Alessandro was surely brief, but very pleasing and warm, he drove me from and to the metro station, took good care of me in his beautiful house and cooked a lovely pasta for me. Alessandro has a a particular generous perspective about couchsurfing, and when discussing you can feel the wise, calm, and experienced person in him.
I'm really looking forward to spending more time with you Ale in the soonest occasion =)

Alex is without doubt a highly intelligent guy and a genuinely kind soul. I know this has been iterated but I feel the need to add in my supporting opinion: he's a great cook. Plus I slept amazingly well on that bed--I kinda sank into it and passed out cold both nights. He also was able to take me around the city a bit and show me parts of Rome that I had missed while walking through, plus he gave me the first professional-grade massage I'd had in years. Great host.

text: Alex is a wonderful individual and I cant explain how perfect this experience has been. This could be the most fitting place for an American in Rome because of his scholarship in cultural studies. Despite my short notice he picked me up from the train station, hosted me in a wonderful flat and told me which areas possible for visit while in his neighborhood. Alex is an amazing individual that I wish everyone could have the opportunity to cross paths. I hope that he will forgive me for my travelers aroma typical of someone walking all day in Rome. ;)

After a number of exchanges, I finally had the chance to surf Alex's beautiful couch in Roma. From the minute you meet him, you can see in his face that Alex is a very warm person. He was exceptionally accomodating, making me some "awesome strawberry-lemon drink", cooking me a wonderful meal, and even giving me a much needed Shiatsu massage. Talk about surfing in luxury! As usual, my only complaint is that I could not stay longer to spend more time with Alex in his beautiful city. Take care and good luck with the book!

text: Alessandro was kind enough to take us in last minute, as well as be an incredibly hospitable and accomodating host, allowing us to cook some pasta, do some laundry and then pointing us to a great area to eat the next day. Alessandro provided a great stay in Rome - especially considering the tight spot we were in! He took us in pretty much last minute and immediately offered a cup of coffee and a spot on the couch. He really provided an enjoyable atmosphere which I would love to return to some day! Thanks again!

text: Alessandro saved me when I was in desperate need of a place to stay in Rome.  We was extremely nice, and was easy to talk to about aspects of philosophy and film.  He is well versed in literature as well, and I enjoyed talking to him about favorite novels. Do not hesitate to stay or host Alessandro.

To write this reference makes me recall special and unforgettable memory about the night of Rome...
Casper was really polite and a little bit calm . We went to a supermarket. We had a talk on his balcony. And then he took me to see the beautiful nightview in the city center. It was a very nice memory. Thank you so much for showing me the city in a special way. I really like it and enjoy it!
-
But as for a reference, I think I should tell other people and you...
other surfers:you need to check with Casper maybe double at what time you should leave his house.
Casper:I think it is better to tell your surfers as early as possible that when they may need to leave your house.
When I accepted your offer and you did not tell me that you already had a guest tomorrow. You told me in the midnight after going back home. For me, it was too rush to find a new host, so I went to a hostel to stay for two nights in the morning. 
All in all,youareaniceperson.Thankyou alotforlettingmestayonenightwith you

text:
It was so lovely to have met and stayed with Casper. I received his message offer to show me around even host me. I ended up stay three night with him.

He is definitely the person he says on his profile, independent, relaxed and experienced man, by the way he acts and talks will just remind me that, haha.  And I found he's respectful, patient, caring, funny as well since we talked almost all night long with good wine/vodka, music and tons of laughter:D.

I like the peaceful place which you can see the beautiful sunset especially with good wine from Sicily even he said the sunset can be more beautiful, and the places he recommended to go are better than the bike tour guide, lol. Then I experienced the nightlife in the centre of Rome as well.  And there is a beach you can easily get to, we enjoy the sun and everything there.

Casper, I miss all the banter we had and your cute laughter already, and thank you for everything!  I hope I didn't cause too much trouble that affects you, so you can still enjoy this CS life~ hahaha :,)
fromPublicAddressDescription: Taichung City, Taiwan, Province of China

text:
Walter is a very steady and quiet person. If you want to chat with him, try give him a beer! He likes beer, and beer can lightup his emotions. 
His home is next to the city center and you need to take a subway or bus to visit the city. but this is a lively block with convenient supermarkets, ice cream shops and local restaurants. You will feel like living in this city.
 He can use his own time to
take  you to Rome Ôºåvisit some places.
 He has hosted  nearly 700 sofas! He has experienced a lot of bad sofas, so everyone one of you come here Ôºå please  respect and cherish him.that is the real couchsurfing„ÄÇ

text:
Lorenzo is a wonderful peson! I was impressed by his hospitality and generosity.
We spent 3 nights at his lovely place in beautiful Rome, and because of him our experience there was incredible! 
He made us feel like at home, we tasted some delicious homemade italian dishes, he have had many adventures and interesting trips, so all the talks with him were very amusing, interesing and exciting.
Not only he picked us up from the station, after the 3 hours delay, not only he hosted us and cooked for us, but he also brought us with his car to so many fantastic places, that we wouldn't be able to see without him. At the same time he gave us the freedom to go out in the evenings and during days, even when he was tired to do the same. And, he was so knid to offer to host also another friend who was there at that time.  
If you have the chance to meet him, stay with him or host him, defenetely do so, as you will meet a friendly, positive, funny and sunny person :)))
A huge thanks once again for all you have done for us! :)
A lot of greetings and hugs from Bulgaria!

text: Lorenzo is a wonderful person. He lives not far from the center and Vatican in a beautiful area and I really felt myself like a local coming back home every time. I never had such a hospitable and caring host like Lorenzo... He picked me up from the airport, made breakfast, he tought me how to have Italian lunch 1, 2 course, coffe and coffe killer :) He also have a huge scooter so it was very nice to explore Rome like this. As for me, Lorenzo is a perfect host, he gives you freedom and at the same time you see he is open for a dialog. I enjoyed swimming in a local swimming pool where he works and really felt myself like I was not alone in Rome and had a friend there. Thank you very much for those 4 happy days in a city that is forever in my heart.
inverseReference: {'id': '17581208', 'text': 'I\'ve had a great time hosting Valery, she is very funny, sweet and respectful girl. We have had so many stories to share about our own countries! I learned about a lot of italian food selling abroad that I\'ve told Valery being absolutely not italian.....ahahah I just remember "Pizza Hawaii" or "Fettuccine Alfredo". I look forward to crossing paths again one day!! text:
You know, I even don't know what to start with. From the very beginning of our week staying with Lorenzo I felt myself like at home. He is the best example of hospitality, person who takes care about you as a member of his family)) cooking for us, showing and suggesting to try the whole viryety of itakin culture ( from the side of its cuisine that is just great!!!) I haven't met before such a generous person as Lorenzo. 
Furthermore he is one of the best guide in Rome.  He will show u some things that is not easy to notice but afterwards it open the new details of Rome's history. And the trick with st. Piter couple!!! 
We had a great honor to meet Lorenzo's family on the lunch) his parents are  very interesting and intelligent people. Father is a Great fun of Roma history and culture with whom u can have  "alive " conversation !) and his mother is so lovely and nice women- we got who gave Lorenzo all his kindness :-)
Separate thank you for showing us Villa de Pomphille! And for the interesting conversation.. One week and we are strangers from some point for you but still have so much what to speak about..)
Lastly.. However, I can continue this list much more..) I don't know what would we do after missing flight... And Lornzo 's answer was just "where u girls and I am waiting for you"   !!))))
Anyhow, now I got a chance to meet this good person whom I hope to call a friend of mine..)) if you don't mind ;-)
GRAZIE!!!

text: Sergio is very kinde person. Staying at his home was very pleasure. He meet us in airport at night. It was unbelievable! We had 3 wonderful days at his flat.Cooking together and had a lot of conversation about our cultures. Sergio is very polite honest and nice.Wish him all the best and wait his come back in Ukraine.

The moto of this website is: you have friends everywhere, you just don't know them. After meeting Sergio this phrase is more than justified! He is more than a friend, for me and my grandfather he became almost a member of the family! This person is unique, he is nice, outgoing, friendly, interesting to talk hospitable gentelman who helped us with everything we needed! He has nice kinds and nice welcoming atmosphere in his wonderful flat just in 15 minutes walk to the city center! The most wonderful feature of him is that he speaks Russian!!It's incredible, he speaks it so well!We were happy to share breakfasts and italian-ukrainian dinners, just talk and have nice walks. He was so cordial that even took us from the hotel, and after our trip took us to the airport! Thank you for everything you've done for us! This is the best host I can suggest to any person! See you in Ukraine!

Stefano was a pleasant and uncomplicated guest, first and foremost because of his flexible attitude. He is very respectful of other peoples' space. We spent some pretty good days together: eating local food, drinking beer in pubs, going sightseeing, visiting the museums. We had plenty to talk about and got onto many interesting topics (travelling, social science, history, dance and music etc.). Stefano is a truly awesome person to hang out with; we went clubbing and definitely, every woman would have said in Cuba Libre Club that time he‚Äôs a really good salsa dancer! :) He used to live in Cuba so it was delightful to hear his amazing stories about the Cuban way of life. If you get the chance to host him, you should definitely do it! Stefano, good luck with the rest of the trip and hope to meet you again! :)

Stefano is such a generous, helpful and friendly host! His place is amazing and for me the location was perfect to chill after a busy day in Rome. We had good conversations together and he showed me the beach in Ostia which was unforgettable! He did everything to make my stay as comfortable as possible. I even got the chance to taste his delicious pasta! See you next time in Helsinki. :)

Ciao Mondo!

text: Alex is a good person. He is a kind man, ready to solve any doubt. The place where I stayed is wonderful. Every day they offered me breakfast, they were attentive to me. Alex took me to see the most recognized places in Rome and was attentive to my health when I injured my ankle after my marathon. I definitely recommend it, because it is very respectful. Thanks for everything

Alex hosted me for one night. When I arrived he picked me up at the metro station, went with me out for dinner and showed me some hidden places from Rome at night. This was great, because he knows a lot about the city where he grew up! :)
We had a long conversation at night about his passions like history, photography and massage...and of course his cat Speedy üê±
When I was tired and wanted to go to bed, (I thought the couch in the living room is my bed) he said that he booked an own B&B for me some streets away from his apartment because he didn't want me to sleep on the couch. So I changed my location in the middle of the night.
Thanks for hosting me and all the best in future! :)

Alex is the best thing that happened to me in the first days of my Italy trip!!! I could not find a place to spend the night as it was Christmas time, so it was quite tough me strolling around with my backpack and luggage.
Alex accepted me to his incredible place with his incredible cat Speedy even though he had a tight schedule!
He took care of me very well  considering my tiredness. We went to a good restaurant near to his place which is in the middle of the centre of Rome, and we ate a very delicious pasta together.
Afterwards , he surprised much more by asking me if I want to stay in a special suite room in which a model should have stayed, because she did not appear for the photoshoot, the room was available even included a breakfast! It was in the centre as well and I felt myself so lucky having a chance to meet such a generous person in such city that I do not know at all. 
I will never forget this experience!
Thank you Alex for your kindness!
Hope to see you soon:)

Best wishes
Alex picked me up at the bus station perfectly puntual. He was kind and he host me in an excelent room. Also he explained a lot of things about the Roman History. He was a good host.

Alex hosted me for 3 days and he was very kind and thoughtful, we had dinner and he showed me very nice places of Rome. We also told me about his work and unfortunately those days he had to do a lot of things but he tried to spend as much time with me as he can! It was a nice experience

text:
Alessio stayed with me for a couple nights in LA after his trip to Santa Barbara, and I'm so glad he did!
    He shared a lot about himself and his life. He told me about little things he noticed in LA and they were thing's I'd never paid much attention to. The sharing didn't stop with me! He gave me so much parmigiano that I had to share it with several friends.
He is a very tidy and respectful guest. Watching him pack his tiny suitcase so neatly is a fun way to spend an hour and a half :) And he LOVES walking. If it were an Olympic sport, I'm sure he would make Italy proud. 
 Alessio is very engaging and listens with interest. His personality is infectious and I was constantly laughing or smiling. We got Ethiopian food together and went to the Observatory to look through lots of telescopes at the moon and Uranus (which was very small.)  We shared music, movies, comedy and stories. I wish he had more time in LA, but I know whenever I visit Rome I'll see him again! 
       I can't wait to see what he makes in the future and I look forward to sharing my work with him as well.  Thanks for visiting me Alessio!
I really enjoyed my stay with Alessio, he is a interesting and easygoing person. He took me for pizza and for a ride around the city. I felt at home in his place :)

I had a really good time (even if not so much) with Alessio and his friends. He is so polite, smart, funny, easy-going and a very interesting person. I felt at home! We had a lovely dinner together and I appreciated everything, his hospitality and kindness (even if he didn't let me wash the dishes ahaha).

See you soon Alessio :)

Alessio is a very good person who cares about his guests. Even though he had a lot of work, he gave his time to visit Rome together. He made a delicious pasta carbonara and invited to the park. It was a wonderful time for me.
It was a great stay, thank you for hanging out so much with me! It was a pleasure to meet you, you‚Äôre so thoughtful and you showed me so nice places! It‚Äôs was just awesome.

I couldn't have found a better host than Alessio for my first couchsurfing ! Him and his flatmate, Andrea, made me feel really at ease during my stay, they are really positive and funny guys! The appartement is in a really cool neighborhood, and it feels good after a crazy day walking around in all the most touristic places of Rome to arrive in this nice area. 
Alessio is really attentionate, he always made sure I had everything I needed, helped me with all my questions about Rome, and even though he had to work during my stay, found some time each day to make me discover some places I would have never found otherwise, or to talk, or, cherry on the cake, to cook a super nice risotto for my last evening in Rome !  
Thank you again for everything Alessio, I'm really happy I met you and I hope to see you again somewhere in the world üòä

Had the best time with Alessio & his roomie Andreas. He is very funny& thoughtful. Altho he had to work he arranged that I was able to drop my bags& explore the city. That evening he made a delicious dinner& showed me around his neighborhood.which I loved! It's very trendy and in a good location. I felt very comfortable and at home with these guys! Thanks again& I deff hope to come back soon!

I have a good experience with Alessio! He is a very polite and friendly person who always wants to make you feel confortable. He really loves to receive different people with new things to talk about it, and this is the most amazing thing. We had dinner together and he showd me a non turiscal part of Rome!
Definitly, i would stay with him again!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

text:
so, for the coolest guy I have ever met... ;)
Although it was my first couchsurfing experience, I have the feeling that it will be one of the best hosts that I might have!!
Alessio is a really amazing guy with a big heart, full of humor (mostly if you can recognize good humor), a great conversationalist and simply a great company.
Rome was amazing and still one of my best experiences there was the lunch that he cooked for us (the best pasta..) in his cool apartment and the time that we spent together.
We also hung out in the evening in his special neighborhood, which is much better than the crowded places in the city center (but still not far from there, I was walking to the center easily).
Alessio honey, I miss you and your cozy cool place, I wish I could come back to Rome just to spend more time together! Sure i'll meet you some day somewhere...

It was reallyyyyyyy happy to be with Alessio and his flatmate Andrea. They are so outgoing! Even if Im not that talkative person(in english haha) they made me want to talk and talk! They need to go working at day time, but we had so much fun in the evening. It was my 5th couchsurfing and I am sure that it was the best couchsurfing experience for me. I would love to stay with them again. I also hope they will be coming to Korea!!!!

Alessio is a great host (and his flatmate too!) : he is funny, smart and makes you feel at your ease. He's extremely kind as well - he gave my friend and I his bed to let us sleep together! He doesn't force you nor to hang out neither to stay at home: feel free to be yourself, respecting the house rules (a very few but imprescindibile). 
The neighbourhood is fine, discretely connected by buses.

We'll miss our highly intellectual conversations! ;D
Hope to see you soon in Turin!

Where do I start............first thing first. Staying at Alessio was way tooo FUN. At Some point.. I was thinking... It's been a while That I've laugh so much for the little things. His roommates Mercedes & Andrea are soooooo Nice and really funny! ( you will like them) Also he can Cook very good with his 'Magic hands'. Hahaha we hang out in the evening because I went explore Rome in the Morning and alessio had to work. Alessio helped me very Well if I had questions and gave me Some good advice for in the city. He is also really kind and funny! xD. I felt very Comfortable staying at his house and you can trust him. He is very honest and direct. ( thumps up!!) I stayed one day longer then supposed(Thank you again). Final: ALESSIO, thank you so much for everything and thank you for the funny moments. We keep in touch!!

Alessio is very nice, respectful, fun and offer me a way to be introduced at the "romana" life! He lives in a nice neighbourhood like a small village. It was my first coach surfing and I understand how much it's important to do so, it changes your way to travel. And as I am moving to Roma he gave me great advices  ;-)

Very grateful to Alessio for really nice my first experience in the Couchsurfing! He is friendly and always ready to help in all of issues. He is a next door to be a God in the cooking, he cooked awesome risotto and pasta a la carbonara)
And my special thanks for scooter riders, I was really impressed :)
fromPublicAddressDescription: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Staying with Alessio was a great Couchsurfing experience! The area his apartment is located in is very vibrant and fun even though not super central. The apartment was clean and comfortable. Alessio as a host very friendly, open and always helpful. I had a very nice stay in Rome including nightly Vespa Tours and the best Spaghetti alla Carbonara!

It was such a pleasure to meet Alessio! It was beyond a normal meet and greet! He is so incredibly funny and smart! I felt straightaway  comfortable at his home, he is very respectful and caring. We met another couchsurfer of mine and his friend in a bar and later he took me on such a fantastic scooter ride at night through Rome which was full of incredible details;) 
It was simply a wonderful experience! 
Thanks again for everything, Alessio, and see you soon someday, somewhere in the north!

Gionata stayed one night at home, and we spent all the evening together, and it was just great!
Gionata is reaaly easy-going, friendly, talkative, passionnate, knows a lot about philosophy, so that having a discussion with him is more than interesting.
And he's also a great person to host, as he's reliable, polite and respectful of the place he's staying at.
It would be a pleasure to spend time with Gionata again!

text:

Great company, you can talk with Gionata about everything, such an interesting person!

Gionata is above on only host he is really nice friend. He has huge knowledge about other history,living style and everthing so by chatting with him u can learn many things as well.

Even he is super busy person he spent time with me and had dinner together in ever evening during my stay

Gionata took me to a local Italian restaurant near the Vatican and we had enjoyable conversations about everything from politics to religion. I think you could honestly bring up any topic with Gionata, and he could keep the conversation with you. Overall, it was exactly what I was looking for- a relaxed evening and a place to stay more comfortable than Fumicino airport, as I had some extra time in Rome before my flight. Would do it again too!
He is awesome. He made pasta for me twice :) Despite I was really sick we had so much fun in Rome. I fully recommend everyone to stay with him! Hope to see u again someday!

I stayed three days with Gionata while I was looking for a flat In Rome, because he had great references and was situated in the city center, I had such a great time with him that I decided to live next door :) he's awesome and has a good heart, be ready to have deep intellectual conversations, he knows his history, which is very helpful when visiting Rome. But that aside he is very fun to be with and is always ready to hanging out. 

I feel very lucky to have meet Gionata,  I  instantly felt like home and we became friends, If I'm ever in any legal trouble I will definitely seek you out ! 

Beware he cannot cook but he has amazing olive oil ( homemade) that makes any dish taste amazing. 

See you tonight for our documentary time.... Don't be late üëΩ

Gionata was the best host anyone could ever have ;) My time in Rome would never have been as great if it wasn't for him! 

He really made me feel very welcome in his home, and he embodies the true heart of Couchsurfing. He is caring, funny, charming and an Italian gentleman! 

We sat up and talked for hours with his housemate and he is someone that has great intellectual conversation! He lives in a fantastic area, and always gave me great advice about where to go in Rome and also about my upcoming travel. We even ran a 10km race through the city of Rome, which was something I will never ever forget. I was even able to spend New Year's Eve with him and his friends! 

It was really wonderful to spend time in your home and to experience Rome with you Gionata! You are really THE BEST ;) "Time does not exist, it's only a human convention!" And you have allowed me to experience once in a lifetime moments on earth!!! I wish you all the best for your exams and I look forward to hearing about your success in life, including the monuments in your honour :) Please come to Cape Town ;) 

Xxx
Joi

text: My friend and I had the chance to be hosted by Iacopo in Rome for nearly a week and it was amazing! We did some site-seing, bar sitting and Iacopo even came to meet my godmother be the translator between us. We had a great time with Iacopo, his fantastic family and friends and felt super welcomed. I guess you could say it was the true Italian Familia experience! :D
I liked my time with Marco, he is a nice guy, friendly, smart, he always tried to make me feel in home. Cooked for me and showing me his city, this case Roma. I can just say thanks to him.

Marco made me dinner the first night and seems to be a nice yet quiet and introverted person. Maybe it is just because he just does not have a lot of CS experience but various things meant I would not stay with him again. 
All the messages we had sent were in English but when I arrived it appeared that he barely speaks any English and had been writing through Google Translate which meant I had to stumble through my very broken Italian which I had only been learning for 2 days. 
When I arrived at the bus stop we had agreed to meet at he wasn't there and I had to search for Wifi to contact him. 
The 2nd night I invited him to a bar with some friends I had met. He kept trying to dance closely with me and hold my hand and as much I tried to give the impression I didn't want anything more he tried to kiss me once we were sitting down. He didn't try anything more and wasn't pushy once we got back to his house but I still did not feel comfortable at all so I moved to a different CS the next day. 
Also he smokes in the house which wasn't a problem for me but I would expect a host to ask permission beforehand.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: I'm very glad that I got to stay with Marco even though for only two nights. He is very nice and friendly and is also a great cook! The second day it was raining and he picked me up at the bus stop, which was very nice of him. Thank you and you're always welcome in Russia!

text: He is so kind person and nice cook! He cooked different kinds of food and those were even better than restaurant! He let us to go to the park, vatican city and we spend great time in there. I totally recommend to stay with him! Thanks a lot!

Rishabh and his friend were nice people, Rishabh surprised me with a bottle of Italian wine, they were staying at my community space. We had very minimal conversation due to my busy schedule.... hopefully will visit them when I am going to Hyderabad.

text: Haitam was as warm-hearted and open a person as one could wish for. He came with a genuine goodwill towards people and deep respect for others. I was delighted to host him for one night in my apartment in Stockholm and would welcome him back any time in the future. He told me about life (and politics) in Morocco and made me a cup of salvia tea. We hung out together with some of my friends in central Stockholm. I would recommend him as a perfect guest to anyone considering hosting him in the future.
Haitam is a very nice and friendly guy! I enjoyed a lot the time we spent together talking about travels and life; he is always smiling and curious about new cultures. I hope we will meet again soon!

Haitam is a very nice guy and we had good time with him. We were planning a trip in Morocco and we asked him about his country. He gave us good advices about customs and traditions in Morocco, he told us about food, beach and places to visit. We talk about Italy and we recommend him to visit Lucca.
good guy, LOVELY Person, we had amazing time around rome, i would like to host him again

Haitam is a very hospitable, friendly, positive, smart and educated person. Was pleasure to meet him and his friend even for a very short time of my stay in Italy. It was so short but comfortable stay and when you are going to Kazakhstan this will be my pleasure to meet, host and show you around our national parks and lands.

text: Im so happy that Haitam and his flatmate could host me. They shared me Morocco dinner, it was very nice. I hope you guys like the Hong Kong noodles I cooked :) You guys are so helpful and polite:) We played guitar too, hope to see u guys again!

Haitam is an extremely friendly and helpful person. Even though he was super busy studying for exams, he accepted my emergency couch request and did everything he could to make me feel at home. He welcomed me with some typical sweets and tea from his home country, we shared plenty of interesting conversations about everything and he introduced me to his friends whom were all very nice too and I had a great time! Thank you for everything, hope to see you soon!

I was at Haitam's house in Rome just one night. He was very flexible when he received my last minute request, and we were able to share some talks, a walk through Rome during the night and learned something about his culture and his country. I hope we can meet again haitam!

Haitam is a really open minded guy and he is very welcome. You can have a lot of fun with him, because he is so funny and a nice person. Thank you for everything Haitam, i hope i see you soon in my place! :)

Antonia is a nice sweet person...I'm hosting him for 3 days and we do spend a good times together...he is a very good cook and he make me an Italian food which is so yummy...thank you Antonio and if we had a chance to meet again in future It's my turn to cook a good Asian food for u okay hehe...:) Antonio can be a calm and quiet person but in a same time he also can be a really nice and a good sharing story person too...we do talk a lot and sometimes his action is just like a big baby haha...but he definitely a warm person...I hope u enjoy always your life and welcome back to enny home sweet home anytime when u visit Penang again...cheers

text:

He talked about his work and experience in Paris. He is a very good company. We would like to see him again.

I was so glad to surf at Antonio's couch for a few days in Rome. Antonio is so kind, chilled, and supportive. He prepared the couch so comfortable, lent me the Lonely Planet book for Rome (so helpful to have it along), provided great insights about Rome and Italy. Especially, Antonio quickly responded before and during my stay despite his busy schedule at that time. I hope you can meet Antonio in Rome soon.

text: Antonio was my saviour in Rio, well at least he spared me having to sleep under the stars. I was in Rio for the New Year¬¥s eve and started looking for hostels and couches very late. And after another already confirmed host started to ignore me just a few days before my arrival, Antonio actually helped me out and accepted me in his appartment. He is very helpful, laid back and pretty quiet but has interesting stories to tell.

text:
I can't express in words how glad I am to have stayed with Antonio. From the moment I stepped into the house, I've felt very much at peace and probably the happiest I've been in quite some time... and it was all because of a great host! Antonio is a very special person - sweet, intelligent,  very considerate, funny (without even trying!), humble, a good conversationalist - pretty much everything one could ask for in a host and a friend. He may seem like a man of few words at times, but he is always sending off positive, calming energy :) Thank you for being the person that you are. And many more thanks for a splendid end to my six-month vacation! I'll remember all of the strangeness (that we are), the morning coffee, the fast walks and slow talks, the cooking and baking.. and basically just this happy feeling :) 

Know that you'll always have a place in my home, wherever it is in the world. I expect to see you someday, somewhere! Deal?
