text: It was an amazing journey with Mario. We went to the beach and relaxed together. He was a very considerate man and little cute. What I am gonna say is that he is such a good person! He could be my real friend. It is so pity that I have to leave one night early than planned because of my work. Anyhow, Mario made my day and my joys in Rome‚Äî the most romania and historic city I loved so much. Thanks for my dear Mario. Moreover the dinner and breakfast that he took me was fine and Italian ways which I enjoyed a lot. Lovely freedom days with Mario is remarkable.

Unbelievable! Mario is a super great Person, his kindness is just out of this world. We met when I first arrive to Rome, he picked me up from the bus station and then we went to have dinner, such a nice time, thank you! His place has what is needed, is comfortable and in good shape, clean and nice. He is very punctual, and behind that ‚Äúrude boy face‚Äù there is a huge warming heart.  He likes going to church and also helps couples that travel together so they can have the ‚Äúdreamed vacations‚Äù, that is so brave and kind, I would for sure come to visit with my boyfriend one day ;) Definitely I would stay with Mario again, he showed me so much and also did so much to help me! I want to come back soon! 

Mario tante grazie caro! √à stato un vero piacere trovarci e condividere buone vacanze da te, grazie per tutti i posti  √® tutto quello che mi hai mostrato. Sei un ragazzo incredibile, non cambi mai per favore! Aspetto di tornare presto. Bacio abbraccio! Ci vediamo l‚Äôanno prossimo

text: Mario is a nice host! He picked me up at the subway and his home is very clean. I only stayed two nights at his place. We talked a lot on evening because during the day he has to work and he should stay at home due to healing his broken arm and however we still had a good time together! His knowledge about Rome and Italy is fascinating. He also cooked a delicious dish before I left. Even my stay in Rome was short but I was so glad to be hosted by him. So host him or let him host you, if you have the chance! Get to know him it's really worth it!!!

Staying with Mario for 2 days was a wonderful experience. He was very  helpful and hospitable. We talked a lot, he cooked an Italian dinner for me and composed a list of the places to see in Rome in one day ‚Äì even though he fell ill himself and couldn't join the fun. I think he is a wonderful host and a very interesting person to talk to.

Mario is very kind, thoughtful and open minded person and excellent host! He cooked me amazing pasta and chicken. We talked about life experiences, about my country, about Italy especialy about the south, about life in general. It was really nice experience, because he was my first CS host. And I could stay more than 4 nights, because my plans changed, which was great. It's location is quite far from center, but there is a metro station close to his apartment! Mario, thank you so much for your hospitality. Hope to see you again! :)

This is the same reference I already wrote on the personal references, not knowing how leaving references works :D
I stayed with him for 3 nights.
He was really hospitable host, and excited to show the italian culture. He took me to a football match, spa, restaurant and city tour. He cooked well and he even let me sleep in his roon while he took the couch!

Mario is a excellent host! I stayed in his place for three nights. He was a good private tour guide that introduced many secret good paintings in Rome! Also it was very nice for him to bring me to the special local restaurant in Rome, where i tasted very delicious meat! He also cooked dinner for me which was also incredible! He is such a generous person that highly recommended as host! Hope we can meet in the future :)

Mario is an amazing host. He picks me up from termini and took me to his home. It's location is good, in a non-touristic area.
Mario is an amazing cook and every evening he cooked for me and we had some wine together and deep talks. 
I can definitely recommend to stay with him. 
Ciao super mario. See you in Z√ºrich ;)
So we have: broken toilet; a stinky fish; slow TV for the football match (poor me :p ). But probably when you have place on your heart it's enough for everything. Thank you!
Mario is a very nice, peaceful and helpful person. We likes to go out and have some beer together, and watch football!
Mario is a gentile, very nice guy. I was 4 days in Rome at his place. He is a good cook! I recommend him as a host:)

Mario is a good person.
He has a great sense of humour, loves good food and the sea. We went out sometimes by his nostalgic car :) I love his lady! :) He showed me the best places for pizza and gelato and allowed me to enjoy the best Roman dishes!

He is a wonderful host. We experienced a lot. He saved us when we arrived in Rome,he showed us around Rome and let us tried the best food in Italy.
His home is super sweet and comfortable, we have very good time together.We laugh a lot together, you are our super mario forever.
Thank you so much again , i believe we will meet soon !!~~

Katherine and joyce

text:
Thank you Mario!!! :)
He was my second couch place in Rome. Really relaxed easy going good person he is! Made me feel right at home :)
Hope you get the chance to come and visit Finland and we meet again!

He is a great host! He cooks perfect, plays beautiful/relaxing although we couldn't listen much because of the late night.. he made us feel at home, i enjoyed the evening visit and stories;) i wish he had more time, but even the dinner with him was good enough. He was generous enough to take us to the airport at night although he was really tired, thanks for everything Mario, see you in Istanbul!

Mario is a very warm, welcoming, and attentive host. If you want to have the day to yourself, he is the perfect host. In the evenings we cooked together (we had some √ºbergood pulpo, it basicly came out of the sea in his kitchen!) and he showed me some awesome places in the city.
His apartment - although not located in the centre - is close to the metro, so you're in the city in about fifteen minutes. During my stay, i slept in his study, which was very comfortable. 

Overall: See you next time :)

Serkan and I were welcomed to Rome with a great concert through Mario.It was really funny, we are so lucky.
He is not only a really good musician also very kind,friendly, helpful and hospitable person.We really liked him and we know we will see each other again.

Mario is a very interesting host, one can have long conversation on football, music and life:) He is very calm and goodhearted and cooks really well:) He is a real Tuscolana local, so knows all the secret of the neighbourhood including beautiful Aqueduct Park:)Mario is also a great musician (more at: http://www.myspace.com/precharijaromaorkestar/music/songs/ajde-jano-71828855)

Mario is very helpful and friendly person! I've stayed with Mario for only one day and he invited me to meet his friends. We had a nice picnic in the park altogether, and although the weather spoiled we had an interesting conversation at his warm home listening music and trying to make sounds with armenian duduk and arabian flute. Mario knows where to find a proper pizza and he has a lot of friends everywhere! He is a real roman! I highly recommend to meet him, becouse he is an expert in Italian food, music, football and many other things! 
Ka.

Ciao Mario! Friendly, kind, helpful and interesting - this is Mario (and he loves football!). Mario was very nice accepting me and my mum to his cute apartment. All the time he was very friendly and tought us how to cook a delicious pasta ( Mario is a real master in a kitchen:)) We had a great time having dinners together, walking in Rome during the night and speaking about Italy from the inside( This guy have many interesting things to tell what Italy truly is). I would strongly recommend not to miss the opportunity to meet him! Ciao Mario! :)) Best wishes to you!

I spent I wonderful time with Marco, he is a very interesting, intelligent and generous person. We have a great dinner and than we talk about our lives and he shows me his amazing work, we could not spent muyh time together but I really enjoy his company. thank you for everything

text:
I had positive time with Marco, in spite he was not so pleased to host us. 
I cant say that we didn't try to have longer conversations, I was talking of my country but I felt that Marco is not interested in it. Maybe Marco was already disappointed to host as we were giggling, full of fun energy what is common for young people. I think we are too different persons and our living styles are different. Marco has seen lots of things his life..

I had towel but as you asked do we want it, Andreea asked maybe she could have towel, as yes - she didn't have it, but we were ready to share my towel. 
We didn't have sleeping bags as we were on way to football training camp to Malta and we had so many sport clothes and we were traveling with Rynair. I'm volunteer and I don't have big pocket money with me. Before this trip I had all the time sleeping bag with me in my trips. I felt bad of that we didn't take it this time, but luckily Marco was very kind, helpful polite with us.

text:

text: I was lucky to meet Marco. I discovered a wonderful person with a lot of a experiences about life and willing to share some with others. Marco offered me and my BF his place for 3 nights. We've felt better than at our place and also his house is charged with his spirit, with so many memories about places where he has traveled. In spite of all this he is so modest and charismatic and a great cook. He charmed us with his great and sensitive taste for food and wines. Rome is a beautiful place with a rich art and full of history, but without Marco is not so wonderful. He completed the beauty of this town with his sense of humor and his mood. Hope to see you very soon, maybe in autumn when the leaves are falling down:d. And thank you for everything!
inverseReference: {'id': '2395541', 'text': "Elena and her boyfriend Marco came to my house in Rome where I hosted them for three nights, they are outstanding, real couch surfers, there knowledge of couch surfing it's impressive, they almost know everybody in the couch surfing project, they participate to meetings and any other activities that involve couch surfing, they are incredibly respectful, educated, smart, funny, sweet.\r\nThey brought me so much food that the last night they were here we all had a big dinner together with my girlfriend Nadia and it was really a great experience, through them I had the opportunity to get a much better understanding of the couch surfing spirit, even the fact that they prefer to be hosted by new members to give them the opportunity to experience couch surfing is remarkable. The overall experience was more then positive and I do highly recommend them as I really trust them and moreover they are really funny, always happy and smiling and interested in other people and their lives.", 'createdDate': '2009-02-14T12:39:01Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '801105'}, 'from': {'id': '1026865', 'publicName': 'Marco Di Lauro', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3731988', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1026865/537D2157-0DE1-430A-B167-463A7BA37B3B', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
We love Marco! He‚Äôs an amazing host, has a great sense of humour and is a real CSer at heart.

We definitely hit it off right from the start. Marco‚Äôs a straight-to-the-point guy and he can not only adapt to, but enjoy, different cultures and personalities (just listen to his stories about his stays in Middle-East countries). He‚Äôs very organized and keeps his place clean. 

He cooked us this incredible dinner (he‚Äôs a great chef!). His place is cosy, with this great atmosphere that you just can't get enough of (with impressive pictures on the wall and photography awards).

We had some really good laughs with him and his girlfriend. He took us to this great pizza place in Rome, allowing us to meet with our former CS hosts and share different cultures and ideas - living the true CS spirit! It was also thanks to his advice that we had the pizza of our lives in Naples.

It was a pleasure to enjoy Marco's great hospitality and couch. We miss him and hope we can meet again soon!
inverseReference: {'id': '2294652', 'text': 'Linda and Ken, are such an amazing couple, they really brought into my house their lively and smart sense of humor, they are very interesting, curios, smiling, happy, well educated, cool, funny people.\r\nWe had dinner together two nights out of the 3 nights they spent in Rome, once at my house and once at a restaurant, and we had very interesting, engaging conversations, the perfect people with whom I would spend my every day life. Moreover they were so sensitive and respectful of my house and extremely clean, the perfect people to guest. A really super positive experience that has really left me with something inside, I was almost sad when they left. Thanks Linda and Ken.', 'createdDate': '2009-01-22T15:13:23Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '963340'}, 'from': {'id': '1026865', 'publicName': 'Marco Di Lauro', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3731988', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1026865/537D2157-0DE1-430A-B167-463A7BA37B3B', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Stefano was an absolute wonder. He was so kind, friendly, and caring. He was not only so utterly nice to me, but sincerely thoughtful to anyone and everyone he encountered. He thoroughly enjoys showing people his city! I highly recommend Stefano. My couch surfing experience with him was marvelous.

Thanks Stefano:)  Had a really nice time with u and of course Bio.
And I'm sorry for your sun burn. It was so hot and u still showed me around.
Your cooking is just so yummy and it's my pleasure to eat,  drink and talk with you.
All the best to you and I wish your AC  remote works well always :p
Ciao!

Stefano was one of my best hosts! His apartment is in the centre of Rome!He lives there together with his cute cat! Stefano is from Perugia and hence a great chef! He knows a lot about the history of Rome and is glad to tell you everything about the city! He picked me up from the bus station and we spent amazing days together! He is very knowledgeable and we had plenty of great conversations!  I hardly recommend him as a host ! See you in Berlin, caro Stefano :)

I did couch surfing few times but Stefano is no doubt the best host I have ever had! My friend and I originally only requested to stay 1 night , however we got ditched by next hosts and almost became two homeless girls in Rome, and Stefano saved us and offered us two more nights . 
He is not just a kind-hearted person, he is so thoughtful and funny . He has a lot of stories can share with that never bores you and he has a awesome music library! 
Stefano also is a truly master chef! The meal he cooked us was unforgettably tasty, molti buona!
Our Rome journey had a terrible start as it was so freaking hard to find a host who would not send inappropriate message to girls. We were so frustrated and thought maybe we should just go to hostel. 
But million thanks to Stefano, our trip in Rome was totally out of our expectation. He offered his lovely little couch (it is small but comfy !) , awesome Italian dishes , delicious wine , a handsome cat and a gigantic kind heart.  
From miss disaster

text:
Sandro was welcoming from the moment he met me in Frescati. After a long journey, he made me feel at home in his lovely house. A super hot shower awaits! 

Sandro took allot of time out of his schedule during my stay. He took me on a night tour of Rome, showed me his home town of Frescati which included a traditional Frescati restaurant and he also cooked me a lovely dinner ending in a tasting of Italian beverages. He helped so much organising transportation and was a wealth of information regarding what to see in Rome. Also a special thanks to Roberto!

text:
Great place to be not so far from Rome.  Luca is a great guy and his mother so lovely.  

thank you 
Marc and Marj

Stefano is the best couchsurfing that i've done!! He is very kind, very good person and very funny! The house was perfect and he is very attentive. He Knows super well rome and the most special places. 100000%  recommended!! :)

My friend and I stayed at Andreas house for 3 days. He was the best house we could imagine. He picked us up, cooked four us, showed us secret places in Rome and Rome by night. Plus he showed us the best restaurant in Rome - the food was sooo yummy! He‚Äôs a really kind and welcoming person and his apartment is gorgeous!
We hope to see you again soon and thank you so much for everything!:)

Andrea was a wonderful host! His home was really beautiful and clean and also he was really helpfull. He gave us tips and he was really nice and easygoing. Thank you so much Andrea! 
I would definitely recommend him üòä

Andrea was the best host one can hope for! He was simply amazing, took us around, showed us the best restaurants and partied with us:) he explained a lot about Rome, because he practically knows it to the last brick:) thank you so much for hosting us! Let us know if you want to come to Slovenia! Kisses
We stayed 5 days with Andrea, we couldn't find better host for Rome, that's for sure. Very friendly and welcoming, pleasant atmosphere, felt like home

I could not expected to have a better host than Matteo in Rome. I had really nice time at his place. He is very friendly, kind, open minded and talkative person.  He was an awesome guide too - showed me around the city, which was a lot of fun! We rented a scooter and were driving around the city, also he invited me to spend time with his friends which was great! Thank you Matteo for the lovely time!
I would certainly recommend him to other Couchsurfers!

It was so nice to stay at his home :) He was very kind, careful and nice! He welcomed me with his friend and I enjoyed talking. He cared about me a lot, like if I‚Äôm not hungry or if I‚Äôm not cold and about my flight also. AND!! If he didn‚Äôt tell me about summer time, I would‚Äôve missed my flight! If I didn‚Äôt stay at his home, I definitely missed my flight üòÇ I really appreciate it. He‚Äôs so helpful anyway :)) Thank you for offering the nice bed!

Matteo and I had many interests in common so we got to chat long time over diner (which he cooked and was delicious!) with many drinks in between. I spent most of the time alone in his appartment and felt super comfortable. He even drove me to the airport. Thank you so much!!

My friend Kate and I only stayed one night at Matteo's place but we had a great time! He is such a nice guy, really interesting, and he took care of us. He picked us up from the airport at midnight(even that I understood at the last moment that I was at the incorrect airport that is on the other side of Rome from his one and our plane was 40 min late ).His house is very clean and cosy and located close to seaside. He was so kind to make a small excursion for us to show the sea .It's a pity that we couldn't stay longer with Matteo, but If i have opportunities to see you again I will be very happy to do it. 
Thanks for everything, Matteo, you are amazing! üòä

Matteo is the coolest! Stayed at his flat for one night, he picked me up at the airport and right after the first second I felt warmly welcomed. He's such a friendly person, I would definitely come again ;)

Matteo took me kind of in last minute. And my flight was late almost 45min, he was still waiting me outside, even he needed to go to another place. He drop me to centrum, I was there for a while and then pick me again. Had a good time with Matteo! Big big thanks for you!

We just stayes for one night at matteos house, but it was very nice! Matteo is very friendly and is doing this couchsurfing thing because he wants to give some of the hospilality he received on his travels back. Great host!
I think I'll try it another time again. Regards, Thomas

Simon very hospitable person , told me a lot of interesting things about Italian culture, showed places and helped when I had trouble at night with buying tickets)) He lives in a place near Rome - frascati, wich in my taste better then Rome to stay, because of good atmosphere of nature, but for someone may be will far away. Thank you for good time Simon !Transsiberian magistrale is waiting for your trip)

text:
Simon is not just a host anymore, but a beloved person veeery far away! He is soo kind and so gentle...we are gonna be so grateful for his hosting..He was so willing to help us with everything before our arrival, to pick us, to  show us around his town and other towns near and spend time with us and knowing us..Extremenly friendly and generous! Buuut: he keeps on saying that he doesn't really eat chocolate, but HE LOVES IT! You have him with ice cream people! :P :P 
If you have the chance, meet Simon! It is an experience 100%!
*Be gentle with his cat people if you don't want to sleep on the street, he has a  veeery sensitive soul :P

Misss you my neerd!!!

Simon is a very nice guy! Clean home and made me feel welcome. He picked me up and dropped me off at the train soni could go into rome. He also is very interested in science and politcs which was fun to talk wirh him about! Would definitely recommend him as a host or a surfer! Thanks for everything!

Simon was really nice and thoughtful! We had a great time and I would totally stay with him again and he knows he's welcome at my place anytime! He was such a great host, he expected us ( me and my sister) with breakfast and took us to a few beautiful places near by so we would get a sense of what Italy is like in the calm areas as well. Thank you Simon!! Hope we see you again soon!

Marco, Ilaria + Emma are a wonderful family that gifted my friend and I such a lovely night in Rome! They were warm and inclusive and by the end of the night they felt like part of our family. A wonderful experience.

Ilaria, Marco and cute Ema...Friendly and helpfull  a family... we went theys home with my friend and We stayed together for 2 nights... Ilaria; Multicultural, knowledgeable and very smiling.. i liked her..  I hope they come to Turkey someday and I'd like to have them in my house...üòä

What a beautiful family! They made us feel at home from the first moment. Ilaria and Marco are great hosts. Ilaria cooked for us a typical italian meal, which was delicious, and we talked a lot about many things. Marco also shared some moments with us, even being sick! Emma is a very smart girl and very sympathetic. We stayed 2 days in their home and the only bad thing is that we couldn't stay longer and we didn't have more time to spend with them! But, we know we'll see again somewhere... :) Thank you very much family! You're great!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Tres de Febrero, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

text:
Roberto!!! Im afraid you wont remember me. Sorry for taking SOOO LONG to leave you a reference! I just didnt find you before so I asked Karla where to get you.
Anyway, Roberto is the nicest host you will ever meet. He is one in a million, was very nice and kind during our stay and even hosted other two girls on a last-minute hosting and he left his own dept in order for us to be comfortable. Unbelievable. Nicest person ever. Hope your spanish classes are doing well and dont hesitate to contact me in case you need anything! baci, fabiola.

Ciao Roberto!I am so sorry for taking me a long time to leave you a reference! Don‚Äôt think that I have forgotten your kindest approach to me. I highly appreciate everything that you have done for me during my stay in Rome.
On the last minute of my desperate search, Roberto proposed to host me in his hospitable and cozy apartment.He was so easy-going that he came with a car to a hotel to pick me up, let me feel comfortable in his place, drove me around Rome, and even managed to sort out one of my unpredictable adventures in Italy (loss of my mobile). Owing to him, I have met new interesting people among CSs at regular weekly party, which remained in my memory as one of the fabulous evenings in Rome. 
Roberto is a fantastic person!! He is very open and kind, reliable and trustworthy.We had long talks on different subjects,exchanged life views coz he is really nice to talk to and make laugh with. I am greatly pleased that I have known him! Grazie mille, Roberto!U're always welcome in KZ!
inverseReference: {'id': '14319538', 'text': 'I did host Anara for 3 days in my little studio in Rome and I can just write and say nice things about she .....Anara is a very polite and nice girl ...we had long conversation Talking about everything was never boring and always interesting ...she is a very trustable person and absolutely organized ....in the morning she was preparing herself making absolutely no noise to let me sleep ....i really appreciate the days we spent together and i totally reccomend she ...hope to meet again Anara maybe ones visiting Kazakhstan.', 'createdDate': '2013-12-01T18:19:00Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '4113669'}, 'from': {'id': '267718', 'publicName': 'Roberto Ravone', 'publicAddress': {'id': '2973151', 'description': 'Lido di Ostia, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/267718/ee75ed89-5454-4142-8d1b-3d22250f869b', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Roberto offered me last min couch when mine got canceled and I quote him "even if he has just one room flat and he is not in his best mood".Ha,I don't know what I would do if he was,probably wouldn't be able to take all than amount of kindness!I really find it hard to explain with words how amazing this experience was,I would have to jump, sing,dance and shout out loud to express how happy I was he hosted me the first time I traveled alone.During only 3 days(and I feel like I know him much longer!) he was an amazing person to talk to,have fun with,drinking buddy and god knows what not!He showed me best of Rome he could in that little time,met me with his friends,carried my stuff,picked me at an airport,slept on the floor so I can have the bed,washed just one of my dresses so I have stuff to wear,took me to Italian breakfast,snack and dinner and I have no words to thank him enough! Come to Belgrade,u just have to!I trust him 100% and if u ever have the chance to meet him don't miss it!
inverseReference: {'id': '13873705', 'text': 'What to say about Milica ....she is a very strong girl very smart and nice ....she was absolutely a great company and i know my flat is very small but she was organized and very polite ....i talk with she about eveything and was a great experience i remember the last night speaking on my terrace till 5 in moorning ...And probably we could continue !!!!Milica is definetely a great person to spend time with.', 'createdDate': '2013-09-12T20:57:50Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2342507'}, 'from': {'id': '267718', 'publicName': 'Roberto Ravone', 'publicAddress': {'id': '2973151', 'description': 'Lido di Ostia, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/267718/ee75ed89-5454-4142-8d1b-3d22250f869b', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

Alberto is a very interesting person with a good knowledge of English. He was very polite, cooked dinner for us and we talked about everything until late at night. His house is very clean and stylish. I hope that we will meet again)

Alberto was an amazing host!

We only have good things to say about him. Thank you so much for receiving us, we hope to see you again for our trip to Switzerland! Cheers, Rafaela and Victoria.

Alberto is a good host.

text: It was unbelievable! So funny, polite and generous person. I really would like to host to see him in Belarus )

Stay with Alberto was one of the best choice I've ever done. Because he is a super cool person with huge personality, great sense of humor, great taste of music ,movies and everything. Whe have a lot of fun together and these days really were one of the best in my life. 
I stayed with hime three nights. He met me at train station and , cooked for me a delicious pasta and spent whole weekend with me. We  had done a motorbike ride to Como and Bellagio and I never forget that moment. 
Thank you Alberto for amazing days in my live. Hope see you in Georgia.
 With Love Sophie

Alberto is very concerned about making your stay in Milano unforgettable! He picked us up at the station almost midnight the day we arrived. We also had a great time the day after, when he cooked a typical Italian dish for us and we went to a party with him and his best friend.

Alberto is a welcoming guy with a huge personality, a true sense of humour, he made us feel comfortable at his place, cooked for us, spent the evening with us. Wonderful host, wonderful cook, wonderful person ! Thank you Alberto ! :)

I visited Milano with a friend of mine for a weekend, and Alberto kindly agreed to host us. And staying with him was awesome! Alberto is such a nice guy and great host. Staying at his place and hanging out with him was a great pleasure. He's easy going, cheerful, open-minded, respectful person with a lot of cool hobbies and a lot of topics to talk about:)
On the first evening of our stay Alberto cooked a super-mega-tasty dish for us and also invited his friends for dinner, and they were a great company. After that we went to party in a cool rock-metal bar. Next days Alberto went with us to the city and we had a good time sitting in the park listening to some jamming people  and then just walking. Also we had good talks and Alberto is a really interesting person to talk to.
Also his place was cozy and I felt like home.
Thank you Alberto one more time for all your help and for a great time in Milano!

There are so many great things I could say about Alberto that I really don't know where to start ;)
He picked us up from the underground station, cooked delicious Italian food and made espresso in the morning. It was a pleasure to spend time with him talking and playing games. We felt in his house like special guests!
He also let us stay in his flat for one night more when it turned out that a girl that was meant to host us for that night couldn't do it. I'm really grateful for his hospitality and can't even imagine to have a better host.
Thank you a lot, Alberto! :)

Alberto is a fantastic Person and he made our Trip in Milano special. He helped us with everything and hosted us in his beautiful appartement. He cooked for us very delicious Pasta. We had a lot of fun together and nice evenings. Now we have got a New friend with him and we are so pleasure meeting him.

Alberto was absolutely fantastic and amazing host!
He picked us up at metro station, prepared for us traditional Italian dinner and we spent unforgettable evening with him. He is very funny and open-minded person. It was amazing to visit his favourite rock club.  I should appreciate that he was so kind and got up very early to have breakfast with us. Thank you Alberto!
I hope we will have possibility to meet again.

Alberto is very nice, friendly guy and great host!! We were lucky to stay with him, he cooked for us delicious pasta, took us out and was extremly  hospitable. Thanks Alberto again for everything and hope to see you in Brno üòâ

Alberto is a fantastic host! Very friendly and kind. He helped us a lot as we had transfer in Milan for one day. We spoke a lot, he cooked very tasty pasta for us. We slept on the big sofa like on the cloud and he drew us to the airport in the morning. Unbelievable experience, thank you, dear Alberto! All the best to you!
Daniele is a great guy! Funny and very respectful. It was nice to host you and Paolo, you were my first couchsurfers so you can be pretty sure I wont forget you!

text: Tarek is a cute, polite, wonderful person. He first contacted me before his trip to Athens to advise him on his accommodation. We met twice, one sightseeing in the centre of Athens, having dinner and a drink under the lit Acropolis and the second in my suburb, showing him around and me and my friend drinking a traditional Greek drink. We had a great time together, talking about religion, politics, life, travels, flying (I bombarded him with questions on flying as he's a pilot) and he was kind enough not to allow me go back home alone. A really great person and a new good friend! Thanks so much for everything, Tarek and hope to see you soon again!

text: Simone is an ideal host, honestly. His apartment is so cozy, clean and comfy, he provides you with everything you might need, helps you as much as he can, amuses you with planty of interesting stories about the city. Was so nice to spend time with him and staying at his place, I already miss it. Hope to see you again soon, my friend. Salve, grazie mille!

Simone is a nice, friendly and polite person, very reliable. He invited me to stay at his place on the last minute just before my flight to Rome, he also picked me up from the station and drove on scooter to his apartment (thank you for that it was a really cool ride and also I wouldn‚Äôt make it on my own that late at night!). His apartment is clean, small, cozy and comfy, with a lovely view from the balcony. In the morning Simone was kind enough to make a light breakfast for me and we had a little chat before I was off to exploring the must-see city sights which Simone put on the map. He walked me to the subway and gave some safety tips. 
It was also my first Couchsurfing experience and it went great. Thank you Simone! All the best!

I stayed 3 nights and Simone was caring, understanding and helpful. One evening, he showed me around central Rome and he talked about Italian lifestyle. He also showed me an comedy Italian film at my request- and even though I don't understand Italian- I found it very funny. Amazing host, glad to have met you :)
response: {'text': 'Thanks Poornima also I am happy to have met you:) I wish you still a good journey and to discover new interesting cities for you', 'author': {'id': '2006657983', 'publicName': 'Simone Di Capua', 'publicAddress': {'id': '221287133', 'description': 'Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2006657983/304C594B-E5E2-4B13-84AA-70C92A754E98', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2017-11-08T15:32:27Z'}

text: Andrea is a great guy! He's really open, kind, friendly, and lived just like a local! Haha! Really enjoyed learning about Rome and his culture. Great time!

Andrea is a fantastic guest. He arrived with his good humor, his warmth, his respect. He is very educated, knows many things, appreciates the arts, very communicative. It's a real pleasure to discuss everything with him and in addition to that he is funny. Mi casa es su casa, come back when you want my friend !

Andrea is a really considered and polite guy. I really enjoyed catching up with him and the chats about life and experiences we had on the mountain in the sun. Andrea is a aimable guy who I absolutely would love to meet again and maby count to my friends because even if we just spent a few hours together it was a great time.
I wish we could have spent more time together but i had to get on duty in my saisonal job, even to that Andrea was understanding and polite.

Andrea, thank you for your lovely and relaxing style. 
All the best and hopefully we will meet again

Andrea is a friendly guy and a helpful and considerate guest. After a short shock in the beginning when I was too tired to understand his sarcasm (shame on me!) we got along pretty well and found plenty to talk about. He forced me to speak some Italian (thanks!) and I was happy to teach some German in return. I'd consider us very different in many things, but when I think back, all these situations make me laugh (imagine someone guessing your zodiac sign correctly by noting how messy you are, I wasn't sure whether to be impressed or offended ;)). I hope I'll get a chance to visit him in Rome one day.

Andrea is a very smart guy, he knows how to travel and he has a very practical sense of estabilishment. He's always smiling , very polite and 100% the cleanest guest i have had. We had some fun talking about italian politcs. I could host him even for more days. Andrea i hope to see in Rome again.

text:
Andrea is a super guy! Together with another surfer Tina we had 3 great days. He is very easy to host, he has a great humor, make a lot of fun. Even when Italy lost "the worst football final ever" he was very brave:-)
Everybody should host this guy. Looking forward to meet you again!
inverseReference: {'id': '10602692', 'text': 'Niels and his lovely Brita were two wonderful hosts. Niels came to take me to the station of Norrebro , took me to the Tivoli garden, even if his schedule was kind of busy. But the best was the tour of Christiania even if my bicycle was a little uncomfortable and i stii have pain among between my legs;)) We have been a lot of time together thanks to their attitude and to their young soul.They are very relaxed people. text:
Andrea jumped out of the bus and gave me a big and friendly smile. "I'm so excited" were his first words. We went to my place constantly talking in Italian. I'm not that good in this language anymore and I appreciate very much that Andrea spoke slowly and listened with much patience and encouragement. As a guest he was very polite and considerate. He didn't cause any trouble at all and was funny and interesting company. He has some charming particularities such as a very healthy lifestyle, which he doesn't impose on others. 
Andrea got along perfectly with my friends and was liked by all of them. Later they told me what a super nice guest I have brought to the soccer match Germany vs. Italy. I know that he didn't like the smoking and drinking too much but there was not the slightest complain or sign of dislike. That's how well he adjusts to other people and situations without betraying his own ideals. "Be true to yourself and kind to others." Andrea is one of the rare examples.
inverseReference: {'id': '10526623', 'text': 'This has been my first CS experience as a guest, after hundred of hosting( 3 with CS). He came to the station to pick me up and he is very caring. I really appreciate his kindness and of course he can come whenever he likes to my place. He always asks me if i want to have dinner with him,and this is very kind. Thank you Frithjof. text:
Andrea is the best host ever!
He said he didn't want to host anybody no more until he read my couchrequest. That was a pleasure for me. :)
He has what it takes to be a GREAT HOST. Ever since, we remained good friends now. 

He's a real Roman! He knows every details of Rome, besides he's working at the tourism industry. 
We talked a lot from the different topics, and I liked when we both disagree about how we see things. That was a good discussion between us. I really enjoyed staying with him. :)

Eventhough he was busy but he still showed me a little bit of Rome, and explain me everything. Yes! Ask him whatever about Rome and he'll explain to you all the details.

He takes care his guest like a baby.
Thanks for taking care me like your son. Lol :)

I really wish to see you again,
Come visit me in Aceh! :)

text:
Andrea kindly hosted me for three nights at his place.
This true born Roman is a friendly, straightforward person who displays a generous and engaging personality.  He‚Äôs well- educated with deep feelings for art, has clearly defined (not necessarily mainstream) interests and likes to talk about all kinds of society issues. Andrea has clear-cut ideas on a lot of topics, but remains interested in knowing his guest‚Äôs points of view. And he can be quite funny too. Even if he was quite busy, he insisted on sharing his evening meal with me. Last but not least, he‚Äôs an invaluable source of information about Rome. 
Andrea, I had a very pleasant stay with you.  I hope we can stay in touch. I‚Äôd love to host you in Brussels and continue teaching you that French language you ‚Äòre so fond of.

text:
Andrea hosted me for two days in Rome and it was a really nice experience!
Andrea is a genuine, warm hearted and really caring person who I felt comfortable with right away after first meeting. I already felt like I knew him forever and we got to being friends quickly. He was not only my host, but also my friend and he supported me all the time. If I were in a trouble somewhere around, I would call him being sure he would help. Thank you so much Andrea!! I hope to see you when I visit Rome next year^^ keep in touch!!!

{'id': '16222191', 'text': "This has been one of the most impressive experience with Couchesurfing. I've hosted Ainhoa for 4 nights and i regret not to have had time to host her for more. She is without any doubt a very learned person, active in arts and performing, and full of inner richness. She is very open and she wants to share her knowledge with other people: that's the reason why she didn't bother to help me improove my spanish. She let me meet her fantastic friends (Pilar,Maddalena and Ana)during her discovering Rome. I am sure she leraned how to travel thanks to her friend Maddalena. text:
CouchSurfing with Andrea was much much more than I expected !
It was not my first visit to Rome, so after discovering many pieces of art, I was more interested now to know the Roman people. And just for that reason, Andrea is a fantastic host ! He knows lots about history and culture, and above all, he is living a conscious live in great respect towards people and nature.
It was really from the first minute that he made me really feel home. He is very careful, kind, sensitive, knows what you need even before asking. So now, I don‚Äôt just know another host, I know a new friend !
Mille grazie a te, Andrea, benvenuto in Paesi Bassi !!

text:
Andrea is a joker, sarcastic but good-hearted. He has the fatherly instinct even though he is very young too. As a Cancer, he provides shelter inside his "shell" but crabs do have pincers, or maybe that is the Italian pride/temperament. Cancers also being domestic and healthy are therefore protective of their house, so ask about his house rules, although Andrea is more of a night owl. 
(Ps, he has studied the zodiac signs and he loves analyzing/describing a guest so that is why I am going overkill with the horoscope.)

text:
I can say a lot of good things about Andrea. He's a wonderful host, very welcoming, he's very helpful, he's wise and have a lot of deep thoughts about life, and a fun person to have conversations with in general. 
BUT, he likes Alla Pugacheva, the Russian pop star. And that, well, makes no sense at all. 
Also, I changed my mind and I like Rome more than Naples. Thank you Andrea for everything!
inverseReference: {'id': '11477872', 'text': "I have hosted this guy for 4 days. text: Andrea is a great host! This was my very first traveling experience and I dont see it to be any better. He gave me several suggestions on where to go and what to see, having in mind my time limitations, coocked a gerat meal, literally shared everything in his apartment with me, which I greatly appreciate. Moreover, I was very pleased with him caring about me, having my own space and time in his apartment. I got treated very well and I am very thankful for it. Andrea is a very nice person to talk and spend time with and I would strongly suggest anyone to host him or surf if he has a chance to have you around. Thank you again and I hope to meet you and spend more time out in Rome on my way back!

text: Lorenzo was my first CS host and I already feel like it must be hard to meet someone like him. His home and housemates Anais and Jacques the cat were just great. It was a pleasure to talk with him about literature, language and arts in general and I wish I had more time to spend with them. I feel like I will see him again one way or another; in Italy, London or in ƒ∞stanbul or elsewhere and we will continue our chat. I am so grateful for what you've done and so happy to had the chance to meet you.

text: At last, a couch!!! rsrsrs Gratitude!!!! It was my forth time couchsurfing and the first time I really slept in a couch... confortable couch... Gratitude! It was great staying at Lorenzo's place!!! He lives with Fabio (SuperFabietto, in couch surfing), also great person! Great hosts! They cook very well, and on my first night they invited some friends over for dinner, we had great food (not complete vegetarian, but they cared about me, doing a little extra vegeterian risotto, delicious....), I made new friends... all good... SuperFabietto took me one day to visit Rome, with a roman eye... It was great staying at Lorenzo's! Near train station and bus stop. All good!  Gratitude!!!

text:
It was an absolute pleasure staying with Lorenzo. He is easily one of the most kind and caring hosts I have stayed with during my travels. I had sent him a last minute request and he immediately accepted it and hosted me for 3 nights in his lovely, well kept and spacious apartment. On the first day he took me out on a tour of Rome on his scooter (one of the best highlights of my trip) and treated me to the the best gelato in town. He is an extremely gracious and trusting host and treats you to the most amazing homemade Italian meals (Pork chops.delicious pomodero salad and Pasta Amatriciana). He took me specially to buy a memory card at a cheaper price at the Chinese market. And not to forget, he picked me up on his scooter, when it was late at night (and buses/trams less frequent).

All in all an amazing host and an extremely gracious and generous person:)

Lorenzo was one of my best host. He is fun, knows a lot about Rome becouse he loves his city and most important of all, he spent time with me and showed me some of the more interesting places. He and his roomate (his slave üòÇ Favio) are too nice, they helped me all they could. He's also and excelent cooker. 
A really nice experience. I had so much fun.
Thanks for everything!! Also for the stolen lightersüòÇ.

Lorenzo is great! A very gud and interesting guy. My hoster cancelled me at last minute and i asked lorenzo if he would host me and he did, i arrive at rome that day at 23:00 and he picked me at the bus station! He is very compromised with the People he hosts. We didnt spend many time together because it was at last minute but the next day i got dinner in his home with some friends of him and they were awesome! The dinner was very Good and also the talk!! I really would like to see him again! Many many thanks lorenzo it was a pleasure staying with you!!

Oh ! Lorenzo is a special person for me!
He give me his time to show me rome with his scooter and car ,Cooked for me,and care, help me for any little thing I needed , you are my first experience here and I would like to see you again and again , didn't forget too Fabio who helped me to Pack, I had a lot of love and fun,,, I felt like I was in my own home with my brothers , 
God bless you!!!!!!

Honestly I consider Lorenzo as a very good friend of me now, I will always be super grateful with him for the personality that he haves, he is really a great human being with a beautiful sense of helping the others!
You will be always more than welcome in Mexico in mi casa que es tu casa Lorenzo! Jaja ya lo sabes!.. I'm pretty sure that if Rome was amazingly special stop in our trip was in big part of your fault! Grazie mille per tutti!!

Lorenzo (Better known as Larry)  was a kind, generous, hilarious, and spunky host. He took me around Rome on his scooter, and took me to all the best, cheap places to eat! He's very good company. Be prepared for a lot of laughing if you stay with him!

text:
Lorenzo is such an awfull man! He dared to host me 3 days first, then when I had nowhere to go few days later, he told me I could stay at his home one week more... What kind of person do that?! His open-mindedness, his kindness, his crazyness, his humour, his amazing cooking, his benevolence, his love for comics, his help, his interesting discussions, his scooter city tour in this beautiful city of Rome, his big sweet and luminous flat, his kind sicilian roommate, all these things made me sick!
I made a new friend, and I really hate that... So thank you Lorenzo to let me feel in hell with you!

My experience with Lorenzo was very nice. I went to all Rome with him in his motorbike. We went to every corner. He brought me with his friends and we ate delicious pizza. Lorenzo is very kind. I¬¥d like to stay with him again.

text: Lorenzo hosted me for 3 nights. He and his roommate Fabio are the nicest, sweetest, most genuine guys I have met in a long time. I stayed on their couch in the living room. The flat was easy to find and central to everything (there is a train station just down the street for further destinations). Lorenzo had many recommendations of places to go while he was at work and after work he took me on a scooter ride to some sight-seeing it was so fun! He even made dinner at home for us on my last night and it was DELICIOUS. Thank you for accepting my last minute request Lorenzo, you made my stay in Rome a wonderful & stress-free experience! I am so happy for my new found Roman friends, see you next time :)

text:
Maybe couchsurfing was created by Lorenzo! He is regularly hosting people, when I was there we went to couchsurfing meeting, beach party and swimming in a lake out of Rome, he introduced me to his friends so I spent 5 days with locals and travelers discovering places only Romans know like clandestine theater, it was just awesome... 
His knowledge about Rome is incredible so he was telling me every stories and details of this city I love so much! 
As we are both a bit chauvinistic about our own city I maybe have a quote which make peace : "Only Paris is worthy of Rome; only Rome is worthy of Paris." 
Anyway as I wrote on her roomate Karolina's reference : Their home is THE place to be hosted in Rome, what's more you can eat the best pasta! 
Grazie mille per tutti e a prestissimo!

text: Lorenzo (and his friends) took us to Lido di Ostia by his car and that's how we met - we didn't have any place to stay when he offered he could host us. We spent 4 days there and really enjoyed Lorenzo's (and his flatmate - Karolina) company. He's really smart and funny, he cooked for us vegetarian dishes and a lot of pasta (for us Lorenzo is Pasta King:), we were laughing a lot, sunbathing on the beach, listening to Led Zepplin - it was unforgettable time - grazie Lorenzo! :)
Lorenzo and his roomie Karolina where wonderful hosts! Lorenzo is a great cooker, and I learned some recipes :) They made me feel very good!! thank you!!

text: Lorenzo offered his 'couch' to me right after I posted an emergency request which was posted less than one day before I left for Rome. THANK YOU! So I didn't want to cook at all in front of him :P Thanks for everything indeed! Come to HK and by that time I think I can compete with you with my chinese dishes! :D

Lorenzo is the perfect scooter driver and guide. Me and my friend enjoyed the nightly sightseeing tour so much. It was soooo beautiful!
Lorenzo is also the perfect host - generous, hospitable as can be, great great cook (mmhh.. I still remember the taste of your delicious pasta), good sense of humor, warm-hearted, helpful.. with a warm smile that surrounds you and friendly eyes that say: don't worry.
We had a wonderful time in Roma. Grazie mille! It would be a pleasure to host you someday in the Fugger-Town!

text: Lorenzo was my host Karolina's flatmate, which basically made him my host too. I just loved staying at their place. Since the very first day, they took me to lake Martignano, a few kms out of town, to avoid the burning heat of Rome. I have to say, great place to relax! Plus he's an amazing cook and great story teller. We had a lot of fun with him and Karolina, and they also liked listening to the stories of my daily work ;) The out-of-the-city excursions, the nice meals, the interesting conversations and the general atmosphere made this one of my most memorable CS stay. One thing to be careful about though: when he says he might kill you if you stay for too long, he's not joking, he even tried to sell my organs...

Every night, he does something with the local couchsurfers and it is therefore, not surprising, that he is a vital asset in the couchsurfing community in Rome.

He hosted me, and we had a lovely time in Rome. With his generosity, kindness and openness Lorenzo made me feel comfortable right away. Based on our little talks, he's a pretty smart, sharp, sensible guy that likes to read between lines ... perfect person to sit and have interesting conversations & genuine laughs over a wine, coffee, walk or whatever. text:

text:
Lorenzo was my main man in Rome for a couple of days. He's definately funnier than my mother and I sincerely hope to meet this guy again. It was a real pleasure to surf at his place. 

Lorenzo is also my new spiritual couchsurfing guide and reference point to how to be a host. He was super relaxed and basically just let me into his life for a brief moment. That's really how I'd like to be able to host myself!

We didn't have too much time together but hung out at Contestaccio both nights. 

Hanging out with him was another great experience to me of how super cool and fun CS is. Thanks, L-man.

text:
Freeze! Watercolor!
Lorenzo is a really spontaneous and fun guy. As Vanessa said, we were really luck to have him as host from a couch emergency reply. He loves art too, he can make a good pasta in one minute, and I'm sure he is really elegant with any jacket, girls. :)
I was in the middle of a art documentary fight between him and Vanessa with many art history writers names.. It was really fun and I learned a lot.
And we definetly have to go back to see the last church with Caravaggio's work in Rome!
He took us to a carnival party in the streets of a city next to Rome with a full CS bus too... It even had brasilian music mixed! We danced a lot! Well.. till the cold appears again..
He even saved us with a ride to the airport!
And if you go to Rio I ll be really mad at you if you choose another host. (Well, unless if it is Vanessa's place)
We ll miss you!
Abra√ßos!
Ps:I guess I m forgetting something... Yes! "He s nice and easy going person" too (haha CS classic reference) =P

text:
He hosted me and my sister in the last minute and then we were surprised with the luck we had! Lorenzo was like our guide in rome: the three of us are passionate for art so we could spend the whole day visiting different amazing places in rome. Lorenzo showed me the churchs he likes best and I was happy to hear all the art history stories and gossips tha he knows. 
And, he's also a party boy =P we went to a small city carnaval thanks to him and had a fantastic fantastic time.
Lorenzo wanted to help us so much that when we were leaving rome and we were not even staying at his place, he offered himself to take us to the airport.

he's someone that really likes to help people.
rome wouldn't have been as good without him


and he's more them invited to visit us whenever he wants to.

I've spend two days with a friend of mine in Flavio's house, and our time was a very relaxed and just beautiful.

Flavio is very active and doesn't stay still, but he makes time for friends and he's willing to share his place with a smile. It was a pleasure to meet him!

Flavio was an amazing host. Although we only stayed one night in his appartement, he answered quickly to our last minute request, picked us up at the station and brought us (and our heavy backpacks) to his home. He is very easy to speak with, fun and sociable. I didnt get to know him more than that one day but would definitively recomend to stay with! His appartement is very nice and clean. Very pleasant stay.

Flavio is supernice, he helped me a lot! He met me in his car, when I just arrived to Rome, showed me night central Roma, gave me a ride on his scooter to the beautiful lake Gandolfu (a peculiar gratitude for that!) and generally was very kind for 3 days I spent at his place. 

Grazie mille, Flavio! Sorry for a little misunderstanding in the end, I'm happy we fixed it finally:) 
Wish you success in your ideas about Singapore;)

The MOST handsome host ever :D

He showed us all romantic places in Rome, ride me in  his scooter everywhere ,  printed my tickets and met my friends when they were lost at bus station in the middle of night :D

text: It's really a great time to stay with Raoul though it is a little bit distance from central and takes me a while to finally meet him. He is very considerate, cool, fun guy. Time goes fast when he was showing me the place he like the most, and the real local food. The evening and early morning hanging out in amazing Roma city with Raoul's is really an unforgettable experience to me, and even with a breakfast right in front of Pantheon. I hope to get chance to meet you again, in Italy or in China some day. Grazie and take care, Raoul.

Luca was the best host for us! He hosted us for 3 days. He gave us our own room in his beautiful flat. Even more, he gave us 2 towels. He‚Äôs a very nice and talkative person, he helped us to choose right places for visiting. Also on the last day of our staying with him he drove us into the most amazing places of Rome. We had an unreal breakfast and dinner with him, he showed us a real taste of Italian coffee and ice-creams. We‚Äôre really thankful for that time you spent with us! Waiting for our next meeting soon! üòä

It's difficult to find words to describe the amazing personality of Luca - he's such a lovely example of a real italian man :) (at least how we imagine it!) 
Lots of laugh, chats, nice places (thank you for bringing us everywhere!) and interesting stories - he knows Rome very well, I must say, having in mind that it is such a huge city! 
We'll always remember our first GREAT day in Rome and we truly truly hope, that our road soon will lead to Rome once again ;)

text:
Luca is an amazing Host! On my first day he showed me Rome on his scooter and he was a perfect Tour guide, because he know a lot about the history from Rome. 

On my first night I had a lot of pain in my stomach. So he brought me in the hospital at 5 o¬¥clock in the morning. I had to stay there for 2 nights and he helped me a lot. He waited with me there for hours and translated everything for me and talked with the doctor. I¬¥m really afraid about needles - and he hold my hand during this procedure. He visit me a lot in the hospital, because I was alone in Rome. As well he changed his schedule plan for me, to support me in the hospital. 

Thank you so much for everthing Luca!!! I¬¥m really really glad that I met you and I¬¥m so thankful for everything. I would be so lost in the hospital without you! And I¬¥m really sad, that we could enjoy Rome more.
Hopefully we can meet us again!

text: This was my first time using couchsurfing and I am so thankful that Giorgio happened to be my first host! First, I want to say that the location of his home is just great. It is easy reachable from the centre of Rome with a train and it is unbelievably beautiful. The view that it offers is breathtaking and the house looks very historical. And about Giorgio I can only say positive things. He is very friendly, open and polite. Although I had slept only a few hours and at first I thought that I am extremely tired, Giorgio made me forget about it. It was very fun to speak and laugh with him till the early morning hours and the time together went by so fast! Giorgio is a man with great humour and interesting life experiences. Unfortunately, he was my host only for one night, but he made my first experience using couchsurfing unforgettable. I am extremely thankful for the dinner, breakfast, all the kindness and the fact that he let me sleep till the noon :D He is one of the reasons I am coming back to Rome one day!

text: I met Amare in Rome. He picked up me in the city, took me with his scooter on a small tour throw heavy traffic in Rome and showed me most lovely place in Rome on Monte Pincio. Because I was hungry he brough me un panino made by himself! Delicious! We had great time together with taking photos with his smartphone and we laughed a lot ;-) Grazie per bello pomeriggio, Amare!

Amare is really nice and funny guy.We spent just one evening in Roma but it was like my best evening there. Had one of the best pasta,great and funny conversation and he also took me with his scooter to some amazing park(i cant remember the name) :) if you want to feel like girl how can feel in Rome spent times with Amare. (also im looking forward to the best wine in Italy next time haha:)

Massimiliano and his wonderful family welcomed us with open arms our last night in Rome, and really showed us Italian family life. It's a pity that we didn't get to stay longer, or to visit more, as they really are amazing people.

text: We were thrilled to stay at the warm, loving home of Max and family. They are the sort of hosts we really enjoy. Kind, knowledgeable, casual, interesting... people who demonstrate love of family, love of home, love of their country. We really enjoyed every moment. We cooked for each other, ate together, chatted, watched our boys play, explored Rome together and they even kindly dropped us at the airport. The giant pizza was fun! Do surf with these guys if you get a chance. Max and family you are always welcome in our home. We hope to show you around our part of the world one day. Follow your dreams xo

Massimiliano, Francesca and their children welcomed us with a great hospitality and attention for everything we needed. Good and fruendly conversations and a very good place to come with a child. I recommend definitely!

great hospitalety!
great Italian familia!
good vibes!

His wife and both his sons were so kind and welcoming. Francesca, thanks for the Italian dishes that you made me. I will definitely soon make the fish myself :-)
I literally spent the best time with him and his family and learned a lot about how Italian families live.
He took me to so many beautiful places in Rome all in two days and I don't think that I could be able to cover them all on my own.
I strongly recommend him to other surfers and I hope to be able to meet him again in future:-)

text:
The time with Fabrizio and Federica was really confortible and relax. We had a lot of interesting and funny conversations in the evenings and enjoyed the cooking together. 
All the time we never had the feeling that this two guys were strangers. They follow these house rules, helped me in the kitchen and we don't need to deal all the time with them, because they're making their own trips etc.

Fabrizio and Federica are really knowlageable and had lots of interesting stories to tell, everyone will love this two sympatical italians. The time on the wine festival with them was pretty cool :-) 

The time with them passed so fast and we wish, we See them again soon. They are always be welcome at our home. Thank you for this nice time ;-)

I'm so thankful to you,  Biagio for my inforgeatable stay in Roma, for all you did for me: for meeting me at the station at first day, for delicious dinner (oh that incredible mortadella!) and wine (I absolutely loved it), for perfect breakfast in your favorite resto, for heading me to the most beautiful Roma's sightseens, for being a gentleman, for introducing me the Italian culture... Especially for being open and smiling all a long my stay at your place. I hope it's not the last time we met.  By the way, your French is impressive! See you soon‚ò∫

text:
Giusi is a flexible host, as my plans have changed on the dates specified in the calendar and despite that she hosted me and she prepared to me a delicious Italian meal.

 we had a good time  in the big square despite she having work early on the morning .....

all this makes giusi an extraordinary hostüëå

Thank you giusi for all .. see u in morocco soonüòâ
Thank you Giusi for this adventure, I really liked to spend time with you :)

Perfect hoster, friendly, kind and thoughtfull.. We didn t spend much time together because of my lessons, but we enjoyed some funny comversations about almost every topic! Wait for you and your friends in Genova asap!

Giusi is fun, friendly, social, accommodating. I stayed 2 nights at her place and had nice time. She cooked delicious spaghetti on my arrival and told me everything about the places to visit in Rome. She was always willing to help whenever I had any questions. Due to short stay and schedule, we couldn't interact much but I hope to see her again and would be happy to welcome her here in Lausanne.
We enjoyed the company of Fabio very much. He is a nice and sensitive character and easy to handle. We had a nice time together.
Valerio is a very nice person. He cooked amazing pasta and we hang out with his friends. It was a very coool experience. Thanks Valerio!

Valerio was a great host. He picked me from the bus station on his motorbike and we chilled at his house with good italian food ,wine and a movie. He is a physical therapist and was able to pin point exactly where on my back my accident effected me.  His stories if Sardega made me really want to visit one day.  Maybe i will see you there ine August:).

My friend and I stayed with Valerio for seven days. He was such a good host, we waited with the best provolone pasta in the world, even he taught us how to do it. He prepared us a perfect dinner with the best wine every night we were with him. He introduced us to his friends and they were very friendly to us!!! Even he invited us to stay a few more days on our return to Rome. So, if you're thinking about staying with him or not, we'll say yes!!!!! He is a very good person, amazing singer, and a very funny guy. Thank you very much Valerio, and I'll see you in a few days.

Valerio saved my ass, when my first host had to cancel on me on short notice. He graciously offered to take me in and he was such a great host. Cooking for me and not letting me lift a finger to help, he was a real Gentleman. Also his Couch is very comfortable and his flat and the neighbourhood are very nice and easy to reach. Valerio, thanks again for everything

Valerio was great!! My stay in Rome was definitely better because of him. He kept me full of delicious Italian food and wine, and taught me how to make carbonara (thanks best chef in the world!). He showed me Rome at night and took me out to some really fun local spots, introduced me to his friends who were also very friendly. I felt like I was hanging out with an old friend with Valerio, hopefully we meet again!

Everything was funny. He's LOVELYüòäüòä Thanks to him me and my friend were involved into the real Italian atmosphere. We tried delicious pasta and were introduced to his friends who are as friendly as he is. Moreover he cooked us the most tasty pasta (aldante) we've ever tried, so we're happy to meet exactly him. Thank you Valerioüòòüòòüòò

text:
Daniele came to pick us with his car and we went to see an amawing concert in a little town closed to his house. We drunk italian white wine and enjoyed the company of Daniele and his friends. He is a funny and entairtaining guy who is always ready to have fun ‚ò∫ 
The next day he drove us to a beautiful beach where we spend the day with his friend Vanessa. 
We spend all the evenings with him and on our last day Vanessa and him made a pefect dinner that we eated with some really sympatics friends of him! Pasta with claimes and tomatoes , yammy!
Daniele makes you feel really confortavle at his home, he is a perfect host and I really recomand him at the couchsurfing community üòÜ Hope to see you in Urugay Daniele , you are more than welcomed anytime! Besos.

That stay has been incredibly pleasent for me and my collegue. Daniele demonstrated the most extraordinary hospitality and good manners. He made ourselves feel at home as if he had known us for long time... and effectively the sensation was to be with a good old friend! He left us alone in the apartment, free to come and go, then he willingly went out for dinner with us, and had us meet his closest friends with whom we had a very good time:  the nicest possible people!
Dani has been thoughtful in each aspect, providing a lot of post-it and indications. Finally the apart was really cosy and with an exceptional view from the wide terrace.
Absolutely recommendable!
Both my collegue and me hope to see him again! Thank you Dani!

Daniele thank you and your parents Lucia and Maruo for hospitality,tasty breakfast,interesting talks and many more things!You agreed host me when I had not other variant ..You did not have time for me but it was no problem.Your advices help me!You and your girlfriend Sara very kind,interesting,pleasant person.I had some good dinner with you and your family,it was great!I saw Italy and knowed italian culture!I like it.Your rooms where I lived very comfortably and warm)Thank you.I will be glad see your and your family again.

text:
Daniele is my first host through CouchSurfing! I feel very lucky to meet such a nice guy as my first host; it is going to stay definitely a memorable experience... He is a caring, friendly, thoughtful, generous and interesting person. 
He lives with his parents in a beatiful house. His parents are very nice and very hospitable like him. His place is little bit away from Rome, and at the start I hesitated if this would be a right choice for my Rome stay but now, I feel so happy that I met Daniele and stayed with them! 

We hung out in the evenings, I met his friends, enjoyed this Italian way of friendly atmosphere. He is the reason that I got hooked on to drinking Espresso!

Daniele, beyond anything else, if it wasn't for you I would never be at "O Bucio"! ;-)

text: Daniele (and his folks, Mauro and Lucia) were our very first CouchSurfing hosts.  We had a great time staying with them in their home in Velletri.  We honestly felt like family there.  Lucia doted on us as if we were her own, and Daniele took us around to see the sights.  It was our first night there, and we were a bit groggy, but it was still a wonderful time.  The meals Lucia served us kept our bellies full and our energy up for our excursions during the day.  Our highlight was when we got to cook them a traditional new Mexican meal using substitute ingredients.  Daniele was away, so it was just Trina and I with his non-English speaking parents.  There was a little bit of a communication barrier, but we pressed through it and had the time of our lives cooking dinner in the bustling kitchen.  We will always remember Daniele, Lucia, and Mauro and hope to be able to return someday with our children in tow.

text:
Pier Paulo is an ambitious man. He wants to capture the soul of things to show them to the world, he wants to understand capitalism to destroy it. I wish him good luck for both of his "missions" ;)
It was interesting to speak about that strange planet we live on with him. From the wars in the Balkans to the French Suburbs passing by the wars in Italy and the Reunication. He also has a cultivated girlfriend and it was a delight to converse about litterature and painting with her. They were both very nice guest and it was very nice to have them around.I recommend them to any one! Welcome back anytime guys!

text: Mehiel is very humble. He does not speak much about he-self. He likes to ask to others what they do he don't like describe everything he has done or who he is. At first glance it seems like a person who is having fun all day, without any concerns or professional accountability. Then you realize that it's all the contrary. You will have to give him out him mouth words if you really want to know him. 6 days at the end very nice, warm and friendly

Woooow! It was such an awesome thing to meet Pier Paolo. He is super interesting, curious, asking questions, giving answers, sharing thoughts, jokes, food etc.
You know, exactely the kind of Person that you really wanna meet on your way.

Thank you again!
And till next time!

text:
My time with Demetrio in Rome was outstanding! Demi is "One of a Kind" a true gentleman full of interesting stories and impeccable knowledge about Rome. 

His English is almost perfect, so communication was wonderful.  Demi is also a fantastic cook, he cooked for me almost every night and knows the best gelateria in town. 

Bike rides, aperitivos, family time, walks around Rome, lots of coffee, trips to an amazing  beach...and much more!

Did I mentioned he will play piano and sing Italian songs for you? Yes, overall my stay with Demi was heavenly. 

I highly recommend meeting and/or  staying with him. You will gain a great friend and have the best time in Roma üáÆüáπ

Thank you Demi!!! Can't wait to be back !

text:
The first thing that I appreciated was the way we kept in touch regarding my stay at his place. I knew that I could trust him. Demetrio was very very welcoming, and he immediately made me feel like I was at home. I was coming from a long travel and was exhausted. He welcomed me with a glass of wine, and told me that I can have a shower while he was cooking dinner. We discussed in an open way about our vision/ expectation of the stay (share some time together visiting Rome vs doing thing on our own) so we felt comfortable to share how we felt to do during the 3 days I was there. He was funny and we had fun visiting together his city. I recommand him as a host without hesitation. 
Thanks again for all, Demetrio!

Renato is a very kind and hospitable person. His home is really comfortable and cozy, just a 20-minute ride from Termini station. Renato has introduced me to his friends, we went to the cinema and to the bar. Thank you once again!
Very nice person! Showed me all the best places in Rome for visit, food and bars. The location is very good also!! Thank you Renato!!!

Renato is a very friendly and helpful person. He met me at the station, gave the information about the area and city and was always on the connection. It was interesting to talk to him and he cooks well :) Grazie mille! A presto ;)
Renato was very enthusiastic and wanted to show us many places. He was expecting that we will spend a lot of the time together. The communication in english works almost all the time.

Staying with Renato in Rome was really nice! He has a huge passion for cinematics. His collection of the movie characters (dolls) is incredible. We watched some films together and drank a lot of beer. He also took us to the best gelatos you can buy in Rome! He picked us up every day from the center to drive us home! He is a very calm and good guy. If you are ever in Holland just call me! I would totally stay with him again!
Lots of love
Ada and Eli
Renato is so good , he took us to visit the city , the tourist attractions,and of course the best gelato in the city, Renato is a great host and he is very caring .
He is really thoughtful and hospitable person. We spent good time with him. Glad to meet him.

Renato is great , funny and helpfull man:)
He cooked fot us amazing pasta with seefood:)
Unfortunatelly we couln't stay more in his home, but I really recommend Renato, he is great host:)
If you want to go to Rome, definetly go to Renato:)
Thanks for all:)
Renato is realy nice guy. We stayed at his place for 3 nights and we watched some movies, drank a little and he actually cooked dinner for us. We had a great time with him.

Renato is an amazing host, we stayed with him for a few nights and we had great time together, he showed us the city and was really helpful.
Thanks a lot mate:)
Hope to see you one day in Slovakia
Cheers!!

text: I had a great time with Lorenzo, he host me and was a great friend since first moment, he helped me find my dress for my sister's wedding and was so awesome!! Lorenzo is such a charming guy always wiling to help me in whatever I needed ! I meet his friends several times and they were also amazing with me.

I spent a wonderful time in Rome with Lorenzo and his friends! 
We cooked pasta in his house, went to the bars... Lorenzo is very funny guy, we have a lot of talking and laughing. He is very caring. I felt in his house very comfortable, as if I was his close friend. 
I regret only one thing that I spent with him only 4 days. I would like to stay more time with him, so I really liked his friends and his lifestyle.
Without him, Rome was not so bright and not so cool! 
Lorenzo, I'll be glad to see you in my place!

Lorenzo is amazing friendly, open-minded, cool guy! it's even hard to find right words to describe him....  He hosted my sister and me for five nights and we really felt like at home. After 5days he became more than just couchsurfer for us. Lorenzo prepared for us welcome party with friends - it was awesome. We appriciate all the evenings spent with him in Italian way with a lot of good food, wine, laugh and mornings with fresh croissants and orange juices.  Thank you for that and for showing magical places in Rome. 

We really enjoyed all of this days with Lorenzo and his friends. I hope we will be as great host in Lithuania as he was in Rome. 
See you in summer ;)

Lorenzo was an excellent host. He has very nice flat and we could use it

text:
How to define Piercarlo...
I would say a warrior mind in a warrior body with an italian heart.
A very generous guy that has a lot to share and to teach.
He gave us an incredible ride by night trough the best parts of Roma and showed us a place to try one of the best Gelato of my life thanks to a great humble but great artist.
Merci Piercarlo

text:
Piercarlooo..:) He hosted me and my friend Essi for one night and it was my first time to surf someone's couch and it couldn't have been a better start. text: Piercarlo,  thank you for sharing 2 days of your life with Allie and I, it was so positive!  You are many wonderful things... giving, thoughtful, relaxed, intelligent, humorous, mature, kind, adventurous. What I treasure the most, my friend, is our conversations! Precious to me is when another will share something priceless and of great value; one's thoughts, experiences, lessons of life. At your dinner table, the restaurant or walking the streets of Roma, always, I enjoyed our time together. You were VERY thoughtful in making sure Allie and I experienced the best of Roma! Please remember, you are welcome to our home anytime.

text:
Thank you Piercarlo to have hosted us for our last night in Rome.

When you request us at Paris, our answer will be positive of course !!!
So : Benvenuti a casa...
