text:
If i need to describe Piercarlo in one word, this word should be "BEST OF THE BEST".He's a star of CS!
Piercarlo hosted me and 2 my friends in Rome,we were planning to stay 2 nights, but he was so good, that i wanted to stay one more week, it's a pity we couldn't, so we stayed 3 nights.
i can write a book about unbelievible Piercarlo personality, if i will say how wonderful he is, its not enough, i can't find corect words to descibe him, all words seems to small, but i will try:
- he prepaired breakfast for us all the time and wonderful salats for the dinner
- he was our doctor- we were sick and he take care so much about us!Thank u for the best "Bombs"
- he showed us around Rome
- introduce in his wonderful friends team
- bring us presents from Sicily
- drive us to Napoli the last day
and ETC! all the time very cheerful, very very helpful, funny,open-mind,full of positive emotions, which gave for us!
Just because of u, time in Rome was fanastic!100000 times grazie!!grande bacio Pier!

text:
we met each other through a friend of mine , zohre. he's SO energetic and really talkative . we had quiet cool conversation over anything you can imagine ! from traveling , religions to women rights , people and anything you can ever think of ! he knows how to melt the ice and he's got lots of tales to tell. i'd never forget the day we were surfing the sightseeing of shiraz and we were interviewed for a TV program or something ! being a SHY girl , i wanted to refuse but he was UP and told me  that would be ALL RIGHT and we should GO for it ! im never gonna forget even a single moment of that day ... and on top of all would never forget his NICE ITALIAN SMILE !
keep it up PierCarlo :)

text: How do you define the perfect host? What do you expect from him? How do you imagine him? Well, if you meet Pier, you'll now, that you have to boarden your imagination. He knows Rome perfectly, he makes the best salad on this side of the universe, he gives you a blanket if you're cold, he makes you laugh when you're exhausted after a long day of sight-seeing, and basically takes hospitality to a whole new level. I'm so glad I had the chance to meet you, hopefully there will be a "next time", with more time as well. I will miss you, that's for sure. But... when we meet next time we will speak italian (hihihi)
inverseReference: {'id': '4390345', 'text': "WOW WOW! Marika is the most smiling girl I've ever met! If you can hear a laugh ... sure she is there! She very very very happy, smiling and funny! text:
Piercarlo hosted us for 2 nights at his place in Rome. He is a very friendly, open-minded person, always ready to tell you a story. He cooked dinner for us, and in the morning even prepared hot cacao and bought croissants for breakfast! :) We have also spent some time together in the city centre, where he showed us around Trastevere and many other picturesque spots by night, even though he had to get up very early in the morning for work. 
If this nice guy asks your hospitality, don't miss the chance to host him! ;-)

text:
Ahhh, my serial killer friend!!! :) :)  Although a serial killer, Piercarlo is an awesome person!! About as top-notch as it comes.  Great family, great friends --- thank you for your hospitality during the 3 nights my sister and I stayed with you in your beautiful home!  I cannot begin to describe how Piercarlo goes above and beyond the average person to make your trip to Italy special.  I am sorry my sister and I couldn't converse too much on politics, Piercarlo!  But thanks for exposing us to some new ideas nonetheless! You are my favorite serial killer!  Thank you for not killing me! :) :) haha

PS - as for the "planning his life" comment....well, he thought I planned it because I told him he did not have to keep going above and beyond the call of duty by hanging out with us and taking us places! text:
Tommaso is a wonderful person! I am happy to know him and Maddalena, who are very kind, unique people and open to people, cultures and new experiences, I really enjoyed their warmth, kind hospitality and had a wonderful time with them. I was amazed with their small art world - "KINO", which was a great corner of art and people of art. Thanks to them I got great impressions of Italy and Rome, they shared with all the spice, colors and feelings of Italian life and culture. I will always remember them and I am happy to have such friends now! 

Tommaso organized a great tour at night showing me old castles and fortresses of Rome, told me stories about old Rome and much more about its later developments. I learnt so much from him about art and culture of Italy. many, many, many thanks!!!

text: He can be the best one of the couches in couchsurfing:) He is really good and polite ƒ±talian guy! I have stayed in Rome 4 days and after 2nd day he had to leave the home and he gave the key of home to me and left:) He trusted to me and I stayed 2 days alone at his home:) He is really helpful! We had lunch and dinner also. I am really happy to meet with Tommaso and learnt something good about couching.  Always wait you Tommaso to Turkey! In Turkey you have a home also!

This is why I love CS ‚Äî sometimes you can meet people like Tommaso.

Tommaso let me stay at his place even though he had to leave for a day. This kind of trust touches me deeply, and I couldn't be grateful more.

This place is definitely one of the most unusual places I used to stay ‚Äî a minihouse with a minigarden in a middle of ordinary city block. It's incredibly cosy and immediately makes you feel at home. 

Thanks for showing me the market and helping with cheeses. My family is quite happy with them :) And also thanks for taking me to your Kino and showing this side of Rome. I wish you to find a great winter place for it and prosper!

I doubt I could successfully leave the city at night without your help. I reached home at time mostly because of your advices. Thanks!

It's sad a little bit that we didn't have much time to spend together, I really enjoyed your society, sarcastic sence of humour and meals. I'd be glad to meet you again, so let me know if you finally would go to St.-P.

Tommaso was so kind to host me in my first visit in Roma. And also it was my first couchserfing experience. And it was very good. Tomasso is very polite and intelligent man. I felt perfectly comfortable and calmly in their cozy house. Unfortunately we have almost no time for communication. But despite of he was very busy at that time, he've done all for my good impression of Roma and coushserfing. Thank you Tommaso!

Outstandingly, fabulously and marvelously positive -I stayed at Tommaso and Maddalena's beautiful place when i was in Rome to visit MAXXI for an interview, started like this and all of a sudden i was included in their one of a kind universe with a thousand vertigious colours: joy of the moment was surreal as the city itself.
I'm so glad to carry a little piece from that Roman universe, which still enshrines in my heart.

I had a wonderful time at Tommaso's and Maddalena's beautiful apartment. They were both generous to a fault and I thank them for making my Roman experience a special one. They have really nice friends too!

Tommaso is wonderful! He is so fun, smart, open! I had a really great time in rome thanks to him, he showed me the best pizzas, ice cream and partys. And also the fattest cats in town. I also went singing in the choir with Tommaso that was so much fun! I am so extremely grateful that Tommaso and Maddalena opened their home for me with their warm hearts and comfortable sofa, and really hope to return the favor someday!

text:
Tommaso and his partner Maddalena were the highlight of my trip to Italy. I felt so lucky to be staying with them in their beautiful home. They were so attentative to our needs when travelling, and showed us a memorable night out in Rome. It was too short a time and i wish i could have stayed to know them both better.
Tommaso is a great model for the couchsurfing network, it was a beautiful cultural exchange and the communication was excellent leading up to our stay and during.
Thanks so much and i hope i can return the favour one day.
Helena

Tommaso and Maddalena are so GREAT!!!
That's true they are not the typical italian couple, since they live in their own little planet located in the heart of Rome... And they are very different too, like the both sides of the moon :) You need to meet them for an amaro at the kino and then a 1:00 am tiramisu...
Great people, great times! Thank you!!!

text:
Tommaso and Maddalena were SOOOOO nice.
I - Iva -had a great time in Rome. 
If you're lucky and can stay with them, you will enjoy it very much. I went with a good friend of mine to Rome for a weekend. It was my first couch surfing experience - and I was very surprised, how awesome this idea and way of "exchanging culture" and "meeting new people" can be.

Their house pet Debby and her little friends will also be there... maybe :) But don't worry, they are very calm and always stay in the kitchen. Debbys of course. 

...I would also offer them our couch anytime.

text:
Wow! What can I say but wow?! Tommaso and Maddalena were incredible - easily one of the best couch surfing experiences for me thus far. They were both so welcoming even though they were super busy with the opening of their cinema coming up in less than a week. Tommaso showed me all over the city, took me out for fantastic pizza and to a wonderful organic brunch place, we watched football and rugby and he cooked the most amazing meals - I even wrote the recipe down it was so good!
I can not wait to see them both again - hopefully sooner rather than later and they will always have a bed at my home in NZ. I felt so comfortable in their home, I did't want to leave! Thank you both so so much x

text: Pierfrancesco is a gentle person! I really hope to meet him again. And although my English does not help much, we had good conversations! Pity I had little time in Rome ... but for sure knowing him made my stay more interesting! thanks for everything!!! I wait you in Brazil haha üòä

Pierfrancesco was a a lot of fun to spend time with. He taught me lots about Rome and helped me learn some Italian phrases. Especially Li Mortaccitua! I love how passionate he is for playing music and for going out and seeing it around town. I got to see live music a couple nights while I was there because of him.  I absolutely recommend staying with him if you are visiting Rome. I already really want to come back it was too short a visit!

Pierfrancesco, is a great personality :)) Though the time was short, I was really lucky to know him, I  had a lot of fun with him  :))) 
He generously came to the airport to pick me up :) His house is a harmonic dwelling of history, stories, colours, music and instruments :)) I enjoyed staying there :)) He loves his city and knows all the secrets about it, we went together to the Gianicolo hill, from where I enjoyed the amazing view of the eternal city, after we had impressive walk through the Trastevere neighborhood :))) I admired the colorito of the disctrict, which is full of history and life :))) 
   Piero is a very intelligent and knowledgeable person, who knows  a lot about history and the world :) He is an interesting talker, who loves analyzing the details and reality :)))) He is a harmonic, calm and passionate musician, part of the sensitive world of sound, who knows the history and development of music :)) 
 So, just don't hesitate to stay with him or host him in your cities :))) 

P.S.   Piero, I really enjoyed all the conversations, we had :))) thank you for the precious momentum :)))) Looking forward to meeting up very soon :))) 

Un abbraccio,
Lara

PERFECT CS EXPERIENCEEEEE!!!

Pier was a perfect host and a veeeery interesting guy :)
He showed me his studios,introduced me to his friends, took me to see the seaside of rome and showed me the big secret of san pietro basilica!!!!hahahahhahaha
we went out together all the nights that i was in rome to listening a good music and even although a lot of things happened during my stay in rome he was really patiente, funny and espontaneous guy!!!!!!
He gave me my own room, droop me at the train station early in the morning when i had to go.....but the best was that he has the most funny love stories that i have ever heard!!!!One more crazy than the other hahahhahaha

I was looking for somebody interesting to meet in my trip....and he was far away better than what i was expecting!!!defnetely gave me a lot of good reasons to come back to rome!!!

tks for everything pier :)
Good luck ( dont worry, aparently the south america bad luck is still with me hahahhaha) and hope to see you again :)

text:
Guess what,,,,for my first experience bout using couchsurfing, he hosted me for 1 week actually it should be only 5 days but in the middle of the days he said that he can hosted me for a few days more, I'm soooo happyyyy.
He makes me so comfortable, he is so hospitable, patient, always smile, funny n knows a lot about Rome. We went to the hills, restaurant, studio music, bars, enjoyed the coolest concert, walking around on the small streets in Rome aaaand shopping mall.
I'm totally enjoyed every single things that we've done. But it was ashamed cause I couldn't see the live concert of his band when I'm in Rome.

I would like to recommend to hosted by him or maybe just hangout with him.
He makes my first experience using couchsurfing and my first trip to go another country very very awesome n unforgetable.
Hope can meet you again, Pieroooo....
=D

fromPublicAddressDescription: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russian Federation

text:
This was the first time I've used couchsurfing alone and it was amazing. Ermes is a super funny, energetic and smiling guy, with a touch of madness which would surprise and entertain you. He had always good ideas to make my stay special: we hung around the city and discovered pubs, once we went to the sea having the first swim of the season and he tried to teach me how to play guitar. Moreover, he has a pretty flexible schedule, so, when he was studying at home, I could visit Rome following my "touristic schedule" without any pressure. He also introduced me his friends and we spent time all together.
The house is very nice, an appartment in a pretty neighborhood in the north-east of the city, next to the metro and bus stations and near a suggestive neighborhood called Copped√©. 
I hope to see Ermes again and I definitely recommend him if you want to enjoy a special experience in this wonderful city. :)

I am very happy to officially announce that you surfers should definitely stay with Ermes! Meet this gem of a person with warm spirit and fantastic humor. But beware of his big ego and bad English skills (especially listening ) ;)  On the other hand his table soccer skills are great and his sandwiches too! So you decide what‚Äôs more important. Jokes aside: I definitely recommend! Thanks for everything Ermes!

BEWARE OF THIS GUY! 
He stole our hearts!
Despite Ermes is almost a new member, he's so enthusiastic and interesting person ! Spending time with him turned quickly into a pleasure. He spread me with his beautiful spirit, curiosity, happinness, sweetness and point of view. A great person I feel I have to say THANKS! 
We went out, walk around the city, cook together, and a had a lot of interesting chats, as if I knew him from a long time. Your advices and opinions were very appreciated and I'll have them in mind!
Don't hesitate to meet or host him!
Pietro is the best, he is friendly, funny, polite and very good person!

Pietro is a wonderful host!!! He cares about you like if you were a princess (or a prince üòä). He looooves his city and will explain you why Roma is the best city to live in the world!
I had a private room with clean sheets and privacy. The house is outside the city center but Pietro was very flexible and nice to pick me up at the metro station. 
Pietro took me to a Fashion show the first night and then showed me the city in his scooter. Typical Italian experience! It was so nice to see the city by night. Magical!
The second night he invited me to a party with many of his friends and he had a good night. 
I really enjoyed my stay here and I recommend Pietro!

Francesco is a great host!!
He's very simple, flexible and is always smiling.
We shared some beer in differents places around Rome, and the best part he prepared for me a delicious Italian coffee!! =D

Thanks Francesco for the great time!!

Francesco was extremely helpful. Although our plans had changed for both of us, he was kind enough to help us out in staying the night and kickstarting our intense visit to Rome. He was very generous, polite and hopefully next time we will get to know each other better as I'd love to learn more about his passion for art!

Francesco is the italian's guy.. he's "tranquillo" and it's very relaxant for us..! Amateur and art critic, he showed me the city and took me in the most interesting cultural places (which the tourist don't know!!), and he cooked "la pasta"!! Francesco is open- minded, generous and soothing.. Today I live in Rome and he's one of my best friends... Don't hesitate, he is the perfect person for couchsurfing!!!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France

text: Francesco is an interesting, humorous and generous person! On the only evening we had together, he took us to a really nice place in the student-quarter - I can only recommend to stay with him and discover some more sights which are not described in any travel-guide...

Francesco is the best guide in Roma! Especially if you like underground culture, art scene and movies:) He is very kind and open-hearted and I am very grateful for having had the opportunity to meet him.

I hosted Jacopo and his fiancee for one night, and I wish they would have stayed longer, because they were really nice, funny and interesting! I hadn't planned on visiting Rome soon, but they changed my mind! Hope to visit you soon!

I would recommend you to stay with him:D
Thank you for everything Michele, hope to see you again in Rome!!!

text:
Vito is ready for deep conversations - that's what I appreciated mostly. He is also very easy-going and was ready for adventures, which I suggested him. Not very common for three day Moscow tourist, by the way. I recommend Vito for all hosts and can vouch for him.
Vito, I was glad to meet you and do hope to meet you again soon!
inverseReference: {'id': '16146424', 'text': 'I would like to resume with few words: the perfect host I ever met . He contacted me after a post published by a friend of mine, while i was traveling on the transiberian railway, to request if someone had been able to host me. He helped me in everything. He picked up me at the train station at 4:30 a.m., he looked for a taxi, he gave me his room, he showed me the city. Then he invited me to join a party with his crazy friends and the day after to join a football match. We talked and laughed about everything... Definitely he made my time in Moscow unforgettable. Now I consider him a friend like I knew him since long time. Hey man...leave te comfort zone, change your life and then come to Sicily or Rome. Let you choice. text: I decided to host Vito because there was something good I felt about his request (quite rare lately) and I will never regret my decision. Due to my free days at work we could discover Berlin together under rain, sun and wind. I tried to show him as many of my favourite places as possible and enjoyed our dinners and talks. It¬¥s almost scary how fast a stranger can become a good friend because of common views, interests and things we like. My cs year started great just thanks to him! People like him will be always welcome at my place! I will never forget the laughing moments ;-) thank you for everything!

text:
To be Vito's guests was our very cool, we cooked tasty dinner and spoke whole the evening about many funny stories and it was really interesting to hear his experience in many countries:)))
We enjoyed to stay with Vito and wait for him in Krakow or in Lviv:)))

I contacted Vito around 3-4 weeks before my stay and we've been in touch for all that time. We've had lots of interesting discussions and I was eager to meet him. He even picked me up from the airport, which was very kind of him. It was Sunday and we had planned to spend it together exploring the city. However, he forgot that he had other plans and he told me about them after my arrival. So I spend most of the day on my own. Then on Monday my friend Alicia joined us and we both stayed with Vito and his flatmates for two more days, as planned. It turned out that he has 4 female flatmates (not 2 girls and 2 boys as in description), plus me and Alicia - so that makes 6 girls and only one bathroom. His flatmates didn't seem very happy about that situation and we didn't feel welcome as a result. The two girls that live in the room next to "ours" stay up till 4am every night and they're very loud (laughing, watching TV, etc.), so we didn't sleep much during our stay there. Also, in order to take a shower one person needs to wait for 2 hours for the boiler to heat up and there's only enough hot water for 1- max. 2 people. Another thing I didn't like is that the flat is marked as non-smoking and Vito knew how much I'm against smoking because we had that discussion before my arrival. However, it turned out that some of his flatmates smoke inside... 

Although Vito seems like a nice enough person, I don't feel he's in a position to host anybody in his current circumstances... :(
response: {'text': "I would tell the truth about what Beata wrote. I'm a bit surprised and disappointed about some little things. The list would be really long but i don't want to waste my time. Cs means to be really thankful with your host and how he/she behaves with you.", 'author': {'id': '4874757', 'publicName': 'Vito Alfano', 'publicAddress': {'id': '7579878', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/WPRIWDA/24342303_l_45792e74109cd50358461fc6be692c15.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2017-03-15T08:43:40Z'}

text: You definitely have to meet Vito personally. He's reliable, knowledgeable and focused on helping others so it makes him a perfect host for sure. Even if he was busy at the moment, he still managed to spend time with me hanging out in Rome, sharing his stories, adventures and experiences from many trips. I hope that our paths will cross in the future again :)

Vito is like my brother from another mother. He's very funny, caring, positive-minded, and an interesting conversationalist. We walked around many beautiful sights in Rome, cooked pasta, ate gelato at the best place hands-down..and just had such a wonderful time. He told me about a great place to have an amazing canoli and where to go jogging, and I got to teach him what a real martini is :) I highly recommend spending time with Vito to anyone.

Vito hosted me for two days in his appartment in Rome and for me it was a real pleasure. In the first evening he gave me a tour in Rome and showed some awesome places that I wouldn't never find by myself. Thank you for that! He is a such a good person, very friendly and intelligent. Unfortunately he had to work a lot during my stay but we still had some really good time together. On the hole, Vito is very warm,  opened and welcoming person, and I would definitely recommend him as a host. 
OMG and the food!!!! A LOT of food - pasta, pizza, Sicilian desserts, so so good! 

Vito, take care,  have fun and whenever you're in Estonia again,  let me know for sure, my door is always opened for you! Ci vediamo!

Vito was an amazing host. I'm really glad that our roads were crossed :) He is a real gentleman and I feel very safe with him. We were in touch before my arrival and it was very helpful. In the afternoon we hang around in Rome and we were talking about many things. He showed me many beautiful places. During our conversation I discovered many similarity between us. Vito is very clever and interesting guy. During my stay we eat together supper and breakfast.  I have room only for me and generally the flat was very cozy. I hope we will meet him once again :) Grazie, tutto forte ;)

My darling Vito ^.^  We are two pees in a pod!  He took the time to show me around Rome to see the sites and eat some awesome food.  His goofy and relaxed sense of humor made me feel at home.  He is kind, considerate and respectful.  I look forward to seeing you in Palermo!  :-)

I'm lucky that I was hosted by Vito! It was great stay with him in beautiful Rome. Vito is very friendly and relaxed person with good since of humour.  We walked around Rome together, ate delicious Italian gelato, pasta and even tried tradicional Sicilian food for breakfast. He has a true couchsurfing spirit and many interesting stories to say. It was a pleasure for me to listen them! :) 

Vito, thank you for hosting me and my friend and making our stay in Italy even more amazing! I hope to see you soon, you know..Krakow waits for you! :D

text: Vito Vito Vito....what can I say? hahahahaha I had a very lovely experience in Roma in a great part because of this cool guy! I think I ate all that Italy has to offer, starting with day one tiramisu breakfast. He took me out to see cool places at night that I would never have seen on my own, and I got to meet a bunch of great local people and have some really neat convos!! I think you can talk all night with this guy about life and beyond. And as a fellow travel lover, there are some pretty hilarious stories in there too :) I would recommend 100%!! ciao ciao vito! until sooner or later ;)
inverseReference: {'id': '17050983', 'text': "Lisa was the first canadian girl I ever met.  Since the first moment I was very touched by her traveller spirit and photographer soul. But I tried to enjoy every moment we stayed together....eating, talking, drinking. :-) Now...it seems I have to meet her in Canada :-) Hey Lisa...enjoy a night in a desert seeing the mily way :-)", 'createdDate': '2015-01-30T09:03:29Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1523946'}, 'from': {'id': '4874757', 'publicName': 'Vito Alfano', 'publicAddress': {'id': '7579878', 'description': 'Roma, Lazio, Italy'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/WPRIWDA/24342303_l_45792e74109cd50358461fc6be692c15.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: would defo recomend vito as a host. friendly, welcoming, really easy going, interesting and interested. he took me out for beers showed me the sights, told me interesting facts about italy and bought me coffee with a chocolate spoon (reall nice touch). great meeting you Vito, let me know if you ever want to do the belfast thing
inverseReference: {'id': '16838243', 'text': 'Someone wrote : "Even when they have nothing, the Irish emit a kind of happiness, a joy." I think he was right. text:
From very beginig Vito proved to be a nice, polite and friendly guy.
Soon after my arrival,he prepared dinner and then took me to the nearby Sicilian Patisserie. After one day, my friend joined me and Vito gave us his bed, and he slept on a mattress!
We went for a walk in Rome. 
Yeah, we eat a lot! But I had to try Italian specialties!
Thank you for your hospitality :*

text: Vito is AWESOME! He's playful and loves food just as much as I do. He cooked beautiful Italian meals while I was there and we went out for (lots of) deserts! He took the time to take me to touristic spots and places off the heated path. He even put together a map with destinations I should check out while he was at work. He's a phenomenally generous host and a hell of a wonderful guy! Don't ever miss the chance to meet with the hilarious individual...you'll be laughing for daaaays!

text: Vito is a really cool and funny guy! He took me to see pretty much everything in Rome. Although he loves the sunshine a lot, he still considerately found some nice shade for me while appreciating all the squares. He answered my silly questions about almost everything. Really a patient person! Oh, btw, he has the best room I've ever seen...the map, the collection, the unique lamp and even the wall color. Haha~just love them! Wish you all the best for your trip to Russia. May our paths in life could cross again!!!

text:
Vito was not only my host but also my psychoanalyst :) After my unpleasant expereince with the previous host Vito gave me all that confidence and ease which I needed. Also during my stay in his place I was lucky to be invited to a kind of international dinner with other CSers, what was absolutely positive and fun experience for me. 

Very attentive host, always willing to help, to make my staying at his place as comfortable as possible. He has a strong CS spirit and in the future I can see him as organiser of different CS events as he definitely has those leadership skills.

Thank you for everything, especially for that Sicilian caffe near your house where I had such delicious breakfasts :)

Ciao ciao, have fun in Russia and come to Minsk ;)

text:
Vito was absolutely incredible! He cooked delicious pasta for my friend and me, then took us to the best gelato place and the best bar. We spent the entire night walking across Rome and seeing all the sights lit up. Plus, Vito has the best travel stories! He's full of energy, knowledge, and kindness, happy to do everything to help out his guests.

Vito, you're the best tour guide...all you're missing is an umbrella ;-) Thank you SO MUCH for an amazing last night in Rome! Hope you're feet aren't too sore from all the walking, and hope you got some sleep. Come visit us in Krakow, and/or the US for a Boundary Waters trip!!

text:

And now few words about his personality :) Vito is open-minded, kind, caring and really wonderful man with great sense of humour. He is like older brother :) He is very inteligent so we could talk about everything. And also he is splendid chef.
It was a pleasure to meet him.
Ci vediamo a presto!

text: Nicola! Oh Nicola! Perfect time in Rome.  He accepted me almost the last minute, didn't expect much, but was really nice to meet him! He lives in amazing place, super clean and cozy! From the first second you can understand that he loves Africa, a looooot of books! I was very lucky he hosted me. He showed me beautiful Roma at night, we had pizza and etc...thanks for everything!  I really recommend him not only for good space to sleep, but also for intelligent company! I would like to say that you are always welcome to Lithuania, but you have been there already, oh right, just like everywhereüòÇüòÇüòÇ  funny, nice, smart and super friendly Nicola! Thanks again! :))  ciao!

Nicola is great wise friendly kind person. I had very enjoyable time with him. He host me like a professional.  He show me the city and tell me the history about the city. thankfully had a chance to spend time with him. 
Nicola, Welcome to china!

I couldn't have asked for a better experience in Rome! Nicola picked me up from the metro station and made me feel right at home. He was a true gentleman and even gave a little tour of Rome, which was breath taking. He was very knowledgable about the history of the Roman ruins and advised me what places would be great to visit. We had a lot of fun and I will definitely stay with Nicola again!

I spent 5 days at Nicola's awesome apartment in the centre of Rome, what a dude! He was kind enough to pick me up from the train station and even on the days he was working was ready to show me around the city and introduce me to his friends who share the same passion for their city :) Plenty of lively discussions about South Africa, Africa in general and travel stories for days. Recommend! See you in the South! ;)

It's a very red'n'confortable couch Nicala can offer to you, as well as full support when staying in his home, nice company, fascinating travel stories and way more. He is very hospitable and easy going person. Thank you for hosting me and all the nice things. Hope to see you in Africa!

My best friend - Julia - found his profile and told me "IT's very GOOD guy! Let's ask him!" It was good idea! It was my first surfing time! I like him! He is positive and make fun guy!and ? Hi knows a lot about ALL countries in the world! It's really amazing! If you like to share experience,to get fun and find good friend! Just go! Thanks, Nicola!!!

Actually we didn't surf his couch but his friend's, our screw up that we came to Rome earlier than planned, but we had his number and he came to pick us up to Vatican late in the evening)) And we were really grateful for that! Than he gave us an incredible tour around night Rome, showing some very interesting places and nightlife, he knows a LOT about Rome and history in general, so it was really interesting. And of course thanks a lot for his friend's couch)) Maybe see you some day in Rome!)

text: Long story short - I declined his request, because I live alone at the moment, but then I received 2 different requests from other surfers and rearranged everything, informing everyone about the situation:) well, what could possibly go wrong with three strangers?:D I tell you what could go wrong ‚Äì with these three you will have the best laugh ever:D so, be very cautious! You will overdose vitamin C! Mina is a gentleman ‚Äì gives his jacket to ladies he randomly meets in the bus stops:) he is the best in geography, especially in drawing maps!:D I regret I had no pen and paper with me this weekend, because every other sentence he said was worth to put in writing and to keep for memory:D yes, he is one of those people!:)) Mina, do you have an oyster card?:))) see you soon! Rome or London;)))

Mina and Mabrouk are very good persons who love their country and share with passion their traditions, stories, music and cultures.
We had a firsthand story about the egyptian revolution and suggestions about movies.

Hi guys we hope to see you again,

Neri&Giulia

text: with my friend Ana met Mina and his friend Pol in Rome, in a few hours and very little understanding us, we discovered a beautiful person! we laugh as if we knew long ago and as we speak the same language! thanks for sharing this day with us! you are part of the journey of our dreams! stayed at his place, really cool guy gave us lots of tips about rome and italy. All the best!
Thanks Mina, It was a amazing trip to Rome.

Mina is such a fun, generous, open minded, intelligent and well traveled person. He is from Egypt and is studying to be a doctor. He is really outgoing and easy to talk to, has a ton of experiences in travelling and speaks many languages. He was more than generous in helping us out when our host cancelled the day we arrived in Rome and we couldn't find a place to stay. Unfortunately he was tired and had a lot of exams during the day we were there or else we would have chatted with him into the early hours of the morning. You have to meet Mina to understand how infectious his charismatic personality is! I cannot recommend him more as a person you have to meet. I sincerely hope to see him again in Italy or North America or even just as a pen pal online. I really had a great time meeting him and wish we could have hung out more. I do have a souvenir of an Italian tram ticket to remind me of the good times :)

Mina is good host. 
He could host up to 1person, so we couldnt stay his couch. Eventhough there is no one who can host us in Rome. But thanks for him, we can lend good room next to his room from his house lord for really good price
And with him we ate delicious food and drink
and thanks for him we could meet France girls and Greek guys
Thanks mina:)

Mina hosted me and my friend during 4 days in the room he rents. He was really easy going, arrangeant and carefully :) The appartment is a little bit far away the center but well deserved by the transports and the good ambiance in the flat make you forget that ! Mina is really cool and we spent a really good time, discovering great places and having a lot of fun ! 
viva la salsa, gli forteresses e tutto il resto ! grazzie ancora and bienvenutto a pariggi !

Mina is a great guy very positive and nice to chat with and be around. Knows lots about the city, how to get around, and even cooked us a delicious pasta lunch. Due to the very small space that Mina has available for surfers at his new flat (only one guest and we were three) he was not able have us be official free surfers, but was able to offer us one of the rooms his landlord rents out on airbnb for much less than what it was posted for. As rome was the hardest places to find accommodation as travelers that we have experienced in Europe (and we have been traveling 9 months through all the cities small and large), Mina's home was a great option for our stay and we would recommend other larger surfing groups to his flat any time. Thank you very much for hosting us and the wonderful stay.
Mina is a great guy, talkative and funny. He received me and two friends, we shared a few conversations and now that Im staying at Rome, we have met and had some beers. Beggining of a frienship!

text: Mina was a phenomenal host for the two nights I stayed with him. This was my first experience with couch surfing and although he only had room for one in his room, he offered me and my friend a room in his flat through his landlord. He welcomed us joyfully and immediately made us feel at home. It rained most of our time in Rome and rather than let it ruin our trip, Mina offered to personally drive us around and show us the sites. It was amazing, he was very knowledgable and it was like having our own personal tour guide! He also introduced us to his friends and took us out with them to local bars for drinks. They even whipped us up a delicious home made meal and were very generous throughout our stay. Mina is an extremely friendly and intelligent guy; he made us feel comfortable and gave us a great couch surfing experience while showing us the best of Rome. He is a genuinely kind person and easy to get along with, I would definitely stay with him again or host him if he ever makes it

Mina is an awesome host, always there to help you when you need anything and always happy even when there is a hailstorm in Rome in mid-June. We had a very good time in Rome with this generous guy :) Thanks Mina!

Mina is one the most amazing guys i've ever met! so gentle, respectful and warm! He hosted me for 2 nights and i had so much fun! He introduced me his friends, went to dance, he also was my tourist guide and on top of it he invited me to the beach near roma! Wholeheartedly recommended! 
Thanks for everything Mina!!!!!

text: Unfortunately I only can only describe my experience as either "positive," "negative," or "neutral". I just want to say that my experience was more than positive, it was amazing. Mina is one of the sweetest guys I've ever met. He's adventurous, funny, open minded... During the time that he hosted me he was busy with some things, yet he still managed to show me around and even came with me to find my hostile so that I don't get lost! He treated me as thought I was one of his family, not just any random guest. He is a VERY hospitable guy. I felt like I knew Mina for a long time, that he wasn't someone that I just met. I hope that we stay in touch and that we can meet again someday :)

text:
Dear Mina,
It' difficult to find the right words to thank you. 
You helped me to live an amazing experience that i will keep preciously in my memory.
You are a very nice guy, funny and always available. I had a great pleasure to dance Salsa with you.
Also I loved your house and your roomates. During 3 days I lived the exact kind of life I want to live one day, full of people, culture, and laugh.
I trully wish one day our roads cross again. Please tell me if one day you come to Paris.
Thanks you Mina.

Mina hosted us for 5days, he was very nice he cooked for us some pastas in the first evening. 
He is very funny and i'm really sorry about the difficulties of language but we had a lot of fun LIKE THIS too:D
His flatmates were also very kind and they tAught us some italien sentences and how to make the pasta perfecta:D

Mina!:) already miss you! 
we had a wonderful time in Rome surfing his couch! With a big smile on his face he is extremely helpful, cheerful and friendly:) 
We are still under the impression of Rome and time spent with him and his great flatmates! We had the most beautiful weekend this year, hanging out together, laughing, learning both Italian and Arabic, love it:) and of course dancing! Mina will become a salsa star one day, you'll see!

Now we are definitely waiting for u in Krakow!:) this time we will teach each other nice words, instead of those starting with k... haha;) 
thanks a million!

text:
TALK LAUGH TALK LAUGH smoke TALK LAUGH... I think this is quite a good description of Mina:)

text:
I stayed one night at Lorenzo's place and it was a pleasure for me.  
Firstly,  he's very easy-going person and you'll never feel stressed with him.  He's very curious person and always open to listen some information or opinions. 
 
Secondly,  he's very nice host,  because he gives as much freedom as you need and he offers whatever he can offer. Because of his hospitality, I didn't feel that I was stranger at his home.  Lorenzo is very kind person as well. 

You can have great time with this nice guy,  you can talk a lot about sports,  culture,  movies,  food and learn Italian language.  

I can say without any hesitation that he's good host and great person! Definitely I recommend you to meet him if you have that opportunity. I would be always happy to see him again!  üòá

‚òù more tip for free:  if you think that some country has something better than Italian food in its cuisine, just cook and prove.  Otherwise you'll lose all debates about this topic.  üòÑ

I had stayed in his house for 2nights. We spent much time together and it was good chance to experience different culture. He is kind, friendly and talkative as other italian haha. I would like to see him again.

Igor and his family stayed two nights in Turku with us. The whole family was extremely kind. Our children were friends right away and they were funny and open minded. Igors dauhter loved to play with our puppy and the puppy loved her back. Igors son was very brave and funny. Children were well educated and loved. We had great time together: dinners, conversations, laughs. They respected our family and they were open to have lots of tips what to do in Turku and Helsinki. They where a lovely family, that I'd defenitely like to see again. Luckily they invited us to Kiev. If you have a possibilty to host Igors family, don't miss the chance!
He host me one night in Kiev. He is positive person, helpful and open minded. You can really trust him. His father-in-law is really great cook! Thaks for all :)

text:
Ricardo is just a terrific host.
A wonderful conversationalist, and a stunned friend.
Ricardo I felt like a princess.
I had my own room and my own bathroom. The house is very beautiful and cozy. The owner is understanding, cheerful and easy in communication.
He told me everything, told me, helped with all the questions that arise.
Well ........... Ricardo you know that I adore you. You're awesome.
Waiting for you in Kiev))=*

He waited to pick us up at the train station and made us pasta which was better than what I had at restaurant. Also, he advisedme how to get to city center and shared many stuffs in his house. 
He is a very kind person and a good father. Thank you again!

100% recommend Riccardo - he is an amazing host, he will make you feel at home from the moment you enter in his house. He is very caring, smart, very knowledgeable, funny and with a big heart! 

Riccardo: I can't thank you enough for all your hospitality, for coming to pick me up at the airport even though my flight was delay, for finding me a place where to sleep my first night, for show me Rome in your scooter, for the delicious pizza with anchovies, the pasta you made in my last night at your place and in special for show me the real you!  I know that more that an amazing host I gain a friend!!   Grazie mile per tutto!!!

I had wonderful 2 days at Riccardo house. Riccardo is very nice person. He has picked me up and brought to his apartment with his scooter)) also he has adviced me what to visit in Rome and how can I arrive the center of the city with the public transport (but he is going to a city often and he could bring you there with him) . He is also a very good cooker! He made barbecue, pasta and risotto. Riccardo is a singer and write songs by himself, you can ask him to sing for you. I defenitely recommend him like a host!

text:

Riccardo provided me a room and i have my privacy and the things  i needed. He let me experienced the Italian food. I love the spaghetti. For first timer like me i would definitely recommend him as your host. He was very polite, respectful, gentleman. If i will visit rome again im going to stay at riccardo's place. He is 100 percent real couch surfer... Recommended

Riccardo was an amazing host. Although I slept just one night, he helped me on getting to his home and arranged for me a beautiful room and a delicious dinner. He was helpful and very kind. The house and the bathroom were absolutely clean.¬†

Riccardo is a fantastic host! We stayed at his huge flat for a dreamy weekend. 

He is a very good chef, he cooked a BBQ dinner for us, and it was the best meal I've ever had in Italy so far! He has his own understanding about food, and cooking, which is very impressive to me.

Riccardo's house is very clean and tidy, also very artistic. It makes us feeling at home. He also gave us a lot of advices about our trip, they are very helpful for us. 

Thank you for everything, we very appreciate what you did for us. Ciao!

text: Circumstances developed so that I had to move urgently to another place. I wrote to several hosts about my problem and Ricardra was the first who responded, for which I am very grateful to him! Ricardo lives in an amazing picturesque quiet area, in a beautiful house in which it is very cozy and luxurious. I immediately impressed the master's irresistible taste for the beautiful and luxurious things in his apartment. I had my own charming air-conditioned room and my own bathroom with a window, and this created a comfortable living for me. Ricardo always showed concern for me. I felt like a little princess who got to a good wizard in the castle ... Ricardo literally played mine Desire....On the first day I was taken to a magnificent place with a lot of fountains, which reminded me of Pet–µrgoff near Petersburg.In the evening he arranged for me an unforgettable holiday! !!(Continuation see in personal reviews)

text: Stefano is a very good host, he's so generous. We can share a good moment, he shared with us his movies passion. We ate out in very good restaurant ! Thank you again ! It was a very good moment

Stefano and his friend Mirko are really nice and helpful guys. They impressed us by their dance and singing talent and you can be sure you get lots of delicious cheese and vino, when you go there. They always picked us up and invited us for cornettos and cappuccini. The coach was also very comfortable for sleeping. So we really enjoyed our stay there and just can recommend a trip to Nemi

hahaaaa a terrone of first class! together with Martina Barbora Michele Oreste e Luca we had a nice evening in center of Bratislava. hope you enjoyed the loud party at the end of the day and also the trip to Budapest, it was great meeting you guys:))

Fiona is an amazing person, I met her because she was my English teacher (very skilled, I recommend!) and then we became friends. She is very interesting and curious about knowing new things, she brings positive energy. I also hosted her during her stay in Rome and the experience was very nice. Thanks Fio for the time we shared together, hope to meet you soon!!!!!!

Fiona √® una persona incredibile, l'ho conosciuta perch√© lei era la mia insegnante di inglese (molto brava, ve la raccomando!) e poi siamo diventate amiche. Fiona √® una persona interessante, con voglia di conoscere, regala positivit√†. Ho ospitato Fiona durante il suo periodo a Roma ed √® stata una bella esperienza. Fio, grazie per il tempo passato insieme, spero di vederti presto!!!

Pierluigi was my CS-guest for four days in September 2014. He took part in an international conference in Bonn. We had some nice talks, when he came back from his daily work there, and for me it was quite interesting to get an inview in that event. One evening I was glad to take him to a nearby fair, the great "P√ºtzchens Markt", where we just came right for the final fire works. With some bears there we got a really friendship and I hope to meet him again whether here in Bonn or at his home in Rome.

That was one of my best easter vacation. Fabrizio met me when i arrived in Rome. Showed me central part of the city with interesting historical facts and comments. We ate delicious food, got to the heavy rain and hail. Fabrizio provide me full information and recommendations about places to visit and were to go and how to get. We had amazing days full of conversations. And i met his frends with whom was a pleasure to spend time. Fabrizio is a great host, who created very comfortable and friendly environment during my stay.

text: Sometimes words are useless, you should just meet Fabrizio! It's one of the most pleasant and special persons whom I ever met. Talented, intelligent, curious, easy-going, a bit shy deep inside which makes him endlessly cute! I see Fabrizio as a flower child, so rare nowadays, with a young and romantic soul, who having a rich and not very simple inner life, is able to find happiness in simplicity, to be inspired by non-material things and to make other people want to accompany him in this trip towards inspiration. And also he's one of the rarest men who prefer not to see any make-up on a woman's face;) Theater, quarter party, talking, walking, learning 'how to say it in italian', tango (scusami!)) and other things. Whatever you do, it feels so easy to be with this person and it doesn't matter if you are outside or at home, in a big company or tete-√†-tete. I'm happy that we met!
I appreciated Fabrizio's efforts to find another couch for me. Most people wouldn't even bother in this kinda situation. From what I saw he's a nice guy. See you around !

text: Fabrizio! Fabrizio, you are a wonderful human being. He helped me when I needed a last minute host due to a very inconsiderate man who left me high and dry, and within an hour of sending fabrizio a request, he contacted me, picked me up by car, took me out dancing to meet his lovely friends, and gave me a great place to stay. He knew that I'm an actor and a singer so he made sure to show me a popular occupied theatre in Rome. Anyone is fortunate to stay with him. He was patient with my slowly-advancing Italian, and his friends were just as generous as he. Tanti tanti piacere , fabrizio! Mi Sono daverro divertito! text:
He hosted me in Rome and really many thanks for that :) My flight to Rome was in the late evening but he met me in the airport and we went to the beach. It was nice to lie under stars and try to find falling ones. I succeded in that! Next day I was walking alone but we've met in the evening and visited Ferragosto party in the Teatro Valle where we ate some food, listened to the strange music and watched dances.

Fabrizio is very helpful. He gave me a map with marks of the places which I'd better to see. He showed me some districts of the city which I would never see without his help. And I never used public transportation because he always was in the right place at the right time :) Also my last day in Rome he advised me to visit one Ice-cream store but suddenly it was closed in the morning.

text:
Gabriele is a great buddy who arrived at home with a big smile ! üôÇ
I really enjoyed to host Gabriele, share time and food. 
Gabriele cooked for us the best "Spaghetti alla Carbonara" !...
Guys ! don't miss the chance to host Gabriele ‚ò∫ , you won't regret it.
See you next time buddy !

Kini was a lot of fun! He hosted me last minute and he had just moved into his place not too long ago. His place was in a good location and super clean! He was friendly, kind, and really just a nice person to hang out with. I am so glad I met him, and if you're in Rome I would definitely stay with him! He makes you feel like you're at home.

As my first couchsurfing experience Kini was the perfect host.  He was very talkative, guest friendly and flexible. Also he motivated us to make many more experiences with couchsurfing. He took all the doubts away and gave us a really warm welcome. He even lent his own bed and slept at the couch which was really gentleman. I would highly recommend him as a host but also a couchsurfer.
Great guy, great apartment, great location. Wish we could have spent more time in Gen√®ve with him!

It was nice, i was a little worried because I went to sleep at airport, but he answer me in the last minute and waited for me in the night. He gave me his bedroom. He was very nice, be couldn't talk to much because it was too late but he looked like a nice guy and very friendly. If you want to go to El Salvador or Valladolid, you are invited ;)
fromPublicAddressDescription: San Salvador, San Salvador Department, El Salvador

text: Thanks for hosting us. We spent 2 days in Kini's home. It was very clean, what  surprised us much, very tidy and very nice. Kini left us the keys, so we could rest a bit. In the evening  we finally met. Kini is very nice, talkative, easy-going, open-minded and funny person.  Pity that we could spend so little time. But maybe you finally come to Ukraine? Welcome to surf back)

It was my first couchsurfing experience and it was just perfect! More than perfect! I think if somebody can be one of the best hosts ever, that is Kini! This man works a lot but still he found time for me. At his very nice and clean place we drank the best  gin and tonic I've ever tried and than we walked through night streets of Geneva to get us some food at 3 am in the morning. It was incredible! Thank you man! Hope to see you again!

Really nice & friendly person to meet, even though I could only stay one night. He left me the key since I arrived before he'd be home, brought home some awesome dinner & we talked a lot and hung out watching TV. And he even slept on the couch and gave me his room!! Even though it was only one night it felt like we'd been friends for a long time :) I only wish I could've stayed longer!

Kini was friendly and very helpful in my trip to Geneve, he gave me all the information about Geneve and made me feel comfortable. Besides, we had a great dinner and a beer watching soccer! I'm waiting for you in Norway or Brazil :)

He arrived with pork cheeks and a bottle of Amaro. Win! :D
Luca was a pleasure to host. He's a really nice guy, doesn't take himself seriously, laughs off simple things, and is simply very accepting about different cultures (we had a Korean with us too).  
Oh, and  Luca discovered his love for eating frogs. 
See you in Italy! :)
fromPublicAddressDescription: Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

text:
My friend and i stayed with Emanuele for 3 nights, from the very first moment that he opened us the door, he was smiling and friendlyüòähe is such an easygoing and cool person, he gave us beer and stayed awake with us eventhough he had to work the next day. He is smart and u can start any converstion with him. We really enjoyed talking to himüòähis home located in a very very good location of rome i must say.(just 15 20mins far from the center)
 just one thing u have to remember is that, u have to ask him not to silent his cellphone beacuse then he might not hear you when you are in front of the door knockingüòÇ i would recommend him to everyone, thank u soo much again for everything üòä

We had really great time staying with Emanuele, he showed us some nice places in Rome, went out in the evening with us. We really enjoyed talking with him and sharing our stories to each other. We can honestly recommend Emanuele :)

text: Unfortunatelly, I stayed only one day with Filippo. He is realy great host! Caring, hospitable, interesting conversationalist and just wonderful person! Grazie mille, Filippo! Speriamo che altri ci vediamo ! E benvenuti in Russia! :)

Filippo is a super nice, intelligent, responsible and educated person, I felt treated like a princess!! He was so helpful and patient with my still improving italian (I was in Rome for a language course). He cooked a super tasty italian dinner for me, showed me some modern architecture of Rome on his "motorino" even though the weather was bad and he had had a long working day. I feel I couldn't really return all the pleasantries received with only a short yoga lesson...
Anyway, I really hope we'll meet again soon!

text: Filippo came out to meet a group of us visiting Roma from around the world. He was very nice and helped us to find a good restaurant. Thank you. I hope to see you at some more CS events.

Right after my arrival in Rome, Emanuele gave me quite a shock because he left me stranded for a while on my own in the big city of Rome without telling me where to go what to do etc. because he had to work very late. However, he really made up for this by inviting me out for the best sushi I ever had in my life. We went to the coolest & hippest place I've been to in my life (I won't say the name because it is quite an inside tip :P) that is a beautiful beach where we chilled and enjoyed aperitivo with his friends. His home is really clean and neat and he made me a freshly pressed juice in the morning & we went for a quick run together. Thank you very much for your kindness Emanuele & good luck with your travels! :)

Emanuele was a very courteous host. He explained to me many things about Rome and gave me helpful suggestions. He was kind enough to show me around and teach me about Italian cooking. text: Emanuele and Edoardo were really nice hosts, we stayed with them for 2 nights. Emanuele was friendly and nice, he picked us up from the city center after work and cooked tasty pasta for dinner. His apartment is big, light and comfortable. In addition, it is easy to go to the city center by bus. 
Unfortunately, he and his friend Edoardo had to leave the city urgently for a business trip that is why we had only a few hours to find another host :(
But in general, I can recommend Emanuele as a helpful and good host

We had a great time together since the first day. We went to, among other places, an art exhibition, mercado near Trastevere and we had delicious pizza. text: From Arianna's first e-mail to me, I already felt overwhelmed by her generosity & openness of spirit. I made the mistake in asking her for a couch despite clear preferences for a female guest. Although she was quite busy preparing for a personal mission, Ari did not reject my request outright & instead accepted me as a guest even though she was supposed to be busy until mid-May. When we finally did meet, I was struck by her determination & clarity of vision; not being satisfied working professionally to care for the environment, Ari drafted a project to help the poor women of Uzbekistan by staging a fashion show of their fashion designs & then bringing those designs to be marketed in Italy. I appreciate Ari even more knowing she is not Mother Theresa; she is a real & sincere human being, who is not afraid to show her real side, even if it means showing her faults. In her company, I was able to open my eyes & truly enjoy the beauty & joy that is life in Rome!

He cooked diner for me the two nights haha and we shared our taste in movies and music it was really nice. His house is so lovely! Colorful, clean, the perfect combination. Luca's place is easy to get by bus or tram, not so far from the center. Also Luca showed me a book he has of Zapata, a mexican revolutionary and made me feel like home :,) thank you Luca! I recommend him :)

I stayed with Luca for three days during my trip in Rome. He is very kind and fetched me from the bus station to his house and also traveled around the city center and he told me a lot of history of the city. I am amazed by his knowledge and he is definitely book lover. He let me feel like home when I was staying with him and he is best host I have in Italy =)) sincerely let me feel like home and share with me all his music and offering me meals and tell me the Italian food with Italian words. I would like visit him again next time in Turin or lecce. I will miss you Luca! We should catch up in the future.

I definitely recomand Luca :) He is one the best hosts I ever met. I really enjoyed staying at his place for 3 nights. It made my travel in Rome much better. I couldn't make it without his hospitality.   His house is very clean, newly renovated, beautiful and near the center. You will love his taste of music, arts and foods. I can not deacribe how it was good by this letter. When I got there, I was supprised that I could stay such a beautiful place. I was lucky :) He is thoughtful , reliable, inteligent and knows how to enjoy his life with what he loves. I can't forget all of the memories there -the music he played , what we talked about, nice food etc. I learned alot from him :)

Luca was very accommodating since my baggage was delayed, so I had to check in around 10pm.  He has a wonderful renovated apartment which is close to the tram line  for riding into the centro area of Rome.   Luca is very polite and helpful with any information you may need.

Luca is a wonderful person)) It was really last time request and he accepted me to stay with him. He has very nice and beautiful house üè° with beautiful paintings. He is one of the best couchsurfing hosts that I have ever met so far! I stayed with him for a week even though I was supposed to be hosted later on but I couldn't find any hostel with my tight budget so I asked him if it's possible to stay in his place for a week. I was staying with the other guest but it was such a great meeting for all of us. He had a busy week though but tried his best to spend time with me and the other guest as well :) I really appreciate his kindness and hospitality. It would've never been possible if it hadn't been him. I will never forget his host! 

Thank you so much for everything and I learned a lot from you about wine and the way to cook a proper italian pasta :)

Luca is a really friendly man and knows many historical Information about the place we have visited.

Luca is a very polite and kind man. He provides me a tasty italian food, a comfortable couch and relaxing music while we spoke about different topics. You never get bored with him! Thanks for everything Luca and visit us in Chile! Bless.

Luca is so great person! So deep and honest and kind.
We spend one interesting weekend together (with wonderful lunch at the sea, with walk at small cities around Rome, with vespa tour through Rome).

The flat is awesome! So stylish! And it's interesting district, close to the center.

Luca, thank you so much for your tenderness, care, for our relax and funny time together. I wish you to be in harmony with yourself and this world. You are cool!
Hope to see you again! You are always welcome in Munich and St.Petersburg!
Me and my friend stayed with Luca for four days, Luca is very nice and friendly person, we talked a lot about interesting things, he has nice and comfortable home, it was a pleasure to meet him...

I stayed in Luca's flat three nights. I had a great time here, Luca is a nice and funny guy and his flat is really cool. We hang out together in the city, shared a pizza with his friends and Luca told me a lot of great story about Roma. I recommend !

Giuseppe's visit was enjoyable. He was very eager to visit and explore the city, very able to navigats by himself AND going out in a group. It was good to know him and we are considering of visiting him also in the future.

Giuseppe stayed two nights.  As it was the middle of the Fringe festival here, we didn't get to spend much time together. Nonetheless Giuseppe enjoyed his stay in Edinburgh. Giuseppe was very friendly and easy to chat to. Hopefully see you soon in Rome.

text: My friend and I stayed with Andrea for 3 days and Turin, and it was not long enough we loved the city and sweet,kind, funny, Andrea! He was so knowledgeable of his city, giving us a luxurious tour where we ended up at the street market and prepped our own Italian meals together, nom nom, and he introduced us to our very first gelato and Italian pizza, never again with the pineapples..... Haha love you and thank you!!!! Hope to visit Turin soon again and your welcome in Los Angeles wheneverrrr

The stay at Patricks home in Rome was great. We had such a good time together. He was very caring and kind and gave us useful tips about visiting the city. He took us to the sea for one day, which was awesome and he made time for us after work. üòä
Patrick, you have been a great host and thank you so much for everything! üòä

It was an amazing time in Rome, for sure thanks to Patrick! He's super helpful, easy-going and open person who loves to laugh and entertain his guests. text:
PATRICK!! 
"NOpff STOPfff" 
I have never laughed so hard in my entire life than with Patrick. This gem of a human being will make your time in Rome incredible. He picked us up very late from the airport and every morning would give us coffee and more. He had some friends over another night and we all hung out. So wished we could have spent more time with Patrick! Definitely made a lifelong friend who I will visit again. He has some great stories that will leave you rolling on the ground.

"GIRLS, IT'S YOUR HOLIDAY"

The travel to Rome is special for me for three reasons: 1. my dream Rome to see came true 2. my friend and I met in Italy after a long time 3. our host in Rome was Patrick. üòé If you are friendly and honest, planing to see authentic Rome and love surprises, you are for Patrick.

It is not advertising and I don't exaggerate. When you meet a good person and become a new friend straight away, you can't feel like a stranger in new town.

I and Dasha are happy and thank you, Patrick, for our holiday!
Till we meet again.

Patrick is the best of the best! We have fun with him üòä He showed us a secret place with a beautiful view to Rome ‚ù§Ô∏è He made me surprise for my birthday üéâWe went out every night. It was cool. We are friends forever!
Patrick is an amazing host, and made us feel like at home. He was very kind and fun to hang around with :) Also he gave us great advices what to do in Rome!

Patrick was very kind to let us stay in his home. His place was very welcoming  with a cool hangout area to sleep in the living room. To get into Rome it is about a 20-30 minute bus ride. He was flexible as his home was ours. And was kind enough to take us out for pasta and wine in Rome. :) I would recommend Patrick and his flat to Anyone. Cheers,

This was my first couchsurfing expierience and it was even better (much more) than I expected! ü§ó
Patrick is amazing host! I and my friend stayed at his homes for a 3 days and all of them were unforgetable. At first he pick up us from airport and we had a first evening at town. From the first second it was enjoyable and eassy going with him. Thank you for making our trip to Rome unforgetable and amazing! Thanks for every place you showed which wasnt in our plan to see because it was much more! Thanks for a party with your friends and opportunity to feel how you italian guys are living! Thanks for escape away to the seaside - it was amazing, (baby) :D
Still cant stop smiling back at homes! 
You guys are always welcome to Vilnius! Kisses from Lithuania!

Then he told me some  dubious stories: how he got to an accident,but car had old crashes (I have a car and know how looks like new crash) and how he forgot keys from house inside the house and his mother ,that has second keys,lives in 1 hour drive from Roma. Thanks for having me Patrick,it was so much fun. It was like we know each other since years! Right?

Thanks for taking me by the hand and showing me your places @ Roma. Thanks for being honest to me and talking trash. In every language. Thanks for the Pornoshots @ Mr.Brown. Thanks for so much more.

For all Surfers; his house is tidy and clean and his couch is big and cuddly with the white plush tiger <3

Patrick is a very nice person and a good host, in a nutshell i would say a perfect guy. He was a great guide, too. He showed me one part of the city, i have amazing pictures from Rome! We had time to eat dogether amazing food!!! Grazie per tutto! i hope see you soon üòä

What should I say about the best host I've ever had? Patrick was amazing. First of all, he accepted us promptly on the day before the arrival. Then, he picked us up at the airpoirt and took us to have a delicious pasta for the lunch. She gave us a ride to go to the metro station and a delicious breakfast. We went out with his friends, everybody was really nice. It was the 3 better days of my experience on couchsurfing. Patrick is that kind of person that you can feel glad to have met, he is fun and very smart, we shared many stories and had a really great time together. My friend taught him how to dance samba and I cooked the most and delicious Brazilian dessert called Brigadeiro. My stayed in Rome couldn't be better. Thank you so much for everthing, Patrick!  I hope to see you again, in Brazil or in Italy :D

Patrick is amazing.he is kind.caring.funny and friendly.he picked us up at the airport and took up to go out with his friends.besides taking us to his bar and have us some breakfast so we cooked brigadeiro (Brazilian dessert) and thought some samba dancing to him.all these things were funny and we actually had a great time together.i highly recommend him.hope to see you soon friend.

text: I stayed at Patrick's for 3 nights in Rome. I can definitely recommend him as a host as he is kind, flexible and considerate, showed the city and helped with everything during the trip from giving advice to picking me up from the train station. We had interesting conversations and I also got to meet his friends - there's not much more a couchsurfer could ask for! :)

Patrick is the best host, who i have ever had! He is very an attentive, positiv open-minded person. We had a lot of time together walking, talking and enjoying. Also he showed me a lot of attractive places in Rome and adriatic see) Thank you Patrick, i want to see you soon again ! üòÑ

Patrick, he is such a nice guy. As soon as I met him I felt I know him for ages. We went out and met some of his friends. It was an AMAZING and totally funny evening. 
Patrick also showed me some of his hotspots in Rome with a fantastic view over the city and of course we had delicious ice cream. 
We had nice chats about traveling and it's worth to listen to his stories and his experiences. 
Unfortunately the last days of my stay at his place, he was very busy with work so we couldn't do that much together but I was free to hangout at his place and enjoy he sun at the pool. 

It was an unforgettable time and I really recommend to stay with him. 

Love and peace
Lovely guest, very warm person an very happy to both go out with us or stay in and relax! Would 100% host again, and hopefully be hosted if our paths cross again in Rome :)

text: He just gave us all he could. He slept in the sofa and let us his bedroom. He drove us more than once somewhere. He¬¥s a funny, hospital and cheerful guy. Totally worth it being in his house :)

Nicholas was literally our saviour!He hosted me and two of my friends together with other two polish friends..so we invaded his house!! Unfortunately we didn't have the chance to know him well because we ust spent a night at his place, but he was really nice and helpful, and a very interesting guy, so I hope to meet him again sometime!

Nicholas is a great-funny-dynamic-generous-crazy guy! He hosted me and my friend during 5 days, cooked us pasta, took us to the beach, theater, restaurant, night club, learned to dance salsa, even after a hard day of work, he found the energy to spend time with us and make our holidays fun and crazy! He was like a father for us, thanks to him these holidays were unforgettable!

My roommate and I were scheduled to surf three nights with Nicholas, but ended up changing our minds given his flakey, unresponsive demeanor. He was a great guy when we actually hung out, but getting in touch and connected provided a few too many horror stories for our tastes (hours spent waiting outside deserted apartments, searching random bars, and waiting for message responses). He's a great guy, but maybe a little too easy going for travelers on a schedule...

It was the first our experience in CS. Thanks for this guy it was successful! He is very energetic, fun and charismatic person. We cooked for him lithuanian food and he made pasta for us. Also he took us to taste gelato, to have italian dinner and to dance salsa. Nicholas is amazing dancer! We are grateful for his helpfulness and caring :) But be careful - he likes to be late and doesn't like to wait :D By the way, sorry about luggage monters :D

I went to Italy in april and Nicholas host me with my friend ! With his friend Leonardo, were very very great persons; they shared with us his hobbies, they coocked for us and always they have been worried about our weel-being ! They are two man very funny and interesting; i recommand you this pleasant italians !
He is really great guy! I didn't spend a lot time with him but I want to) He showed me Rome through his own eyes, taught me to dance salsa, make pasta) Thanks for amazing weekend,Nick!!

text: Nicholas is a great guy, very interesting and intelligent! He hosted me and my friends and in fact we had so many unexpected incidents during our journey, (terrible bad luck!) that I felt really bad about the whole situation. Nicholas was amazing, he literally saved our lifes, he also took us to the train station (we were almost late), helped our other friends, showed us real italian cuisine. I can't describe in words how grateful I am, because we made him trouble and he was very understanding. Thank you so much Nicholas once again!
Very friendly and hospital. Very comunicative, he made staying (me and my boyfriend) at his place easy and comfortable.

Nicolas was such a great host! He arranged a get together with a group of his friends, and several other couch surfers who were in town, and we all spent a night out on the town. Amazing food, great conversations, and new friends! After a great night out, he made my friend and I feel right at home in his cute flat, and even woke up extra early to drive us to the bus station. Had such a wonderful time with him, I really hope to meet again someday. :)

She and Nina were very kind all the time. They arrived punctual. They were very independent and didn't need much help. We taught them how to play Dominoes and talked for a while about their trip. We gave them some advices about the city and went to discover places for themselves. They liked our food and also they shared a bottle of red wine  they had. Francesca and Nina are very fun and honest so we were very happy having them in the house. Of course we will host them again.

My stay with Valerio was amazing, he is a very caring guy with an enormous heart and a special sense of humour, he is always smiling and making jokes.
He was super patient and kind when I felt sick, when I had to change my tickets and helped me to solve all my problems.
I could discover beautiful places in Rome that are not famous for tourists in a very special way, with lots of adventures and laughs. 
His apartment is in a good location, I sleep in a separate room in a confortable bed. 
Thank you so much for your company and help Valerio, you became a great host and friend!
Hope see you soon in Argentina or Italy (not in December haha) :)
